hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent a week at the Hampton Inn in a family room. Room was clean, beds were comfortable and the room size was good for NYC. Breakfast was ok with a good selection of options, however be sure to avoid between 8-10 as it does get busy. When it is busy, it is painful and we did a couple of times go out and buy breakfast, which is a little bit of false economy as we had paid for it in the hotel price, but the area was too small to be comfortable eating.All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Free coffee and hot chocolate in the room and hotel lobby. The location is right in the middle of midtown so really handy for first time visitors to NYC. We picked this hotel because it's close to major subways and Port Authority. Would definitely visit again.Recommended. I wanted to give it a full 5 stars, but for 2 of the days we were there, one lift was out of service and when you are on the 8th floor, that is a little grinding on how long it takes to get a lift fixed....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location ! Easy to get around ! Rooms are very small so not good for family of 4 with luggage. Ended up getting 2 rooms since we were staying for a week ! Felt safe during the virus ! Breakfast was great each morning and whole staff very friendly! Self serve laundry service ! And great having a concierge and bell man !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms were clean, concierge was extremely helpful in booking tours and shuttle to airport. Great location, was in easy walking distance to the subways and lots of restaurants. Pretty quiet considering it is located right off Times Square. Will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in a great location. Close to Times Square. Close to the metro and the bus station. Rooms are a decent size. Updated bathroom and good quality amenities. Comfortable beds and good pillows for the bed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 4 night and had a lovely time.It was nice to find a New York hotel that included breakfast, the breakfast staff were always friendly and helpful.The reception staff were very helpful, especially when I had a problem and needed to use the courtesy phone in reception a couple of times.The hotel is in an ideal location just minutes walk from Times Square and many other attractions.A couple of days the hotel was very busy with groups, this never detracted from our stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent a week at the Hampton Inn. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the room size (king) was good for NYC. We had a room on 4th floor facing the back so not much of a view, however this didn't bother us as it wasn't our first visit to NYC and it was good to have peace and quiet to sleep. Breakfast was ok with a good selection of options, however be sure to avoid between 8-10 as it does get busy. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Laundry facilities were good and everything was clean. Free coffee and hot chocolate in the room and hotel lobby. The location is right in the middle of midtown so really handy for first time visitors to NYC. We picked this hotel because it's close to major subways and Port Authority. Would definitely visit again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There are hundreds to choose from but I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC. This hotel is convenient to Times Square and across the street from the 42nd street subway station. Our room was larger than other hotels we've stayed at in the vicinity and everything seemed new and was clean. The staff was friendly, polite and helpful (even pulled a band-aid out of a drawer when I asked where to buy some). Will highly recommend this to anyone I know headed to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very convenient to both the Port Authority Terminal and the theater district. Room was fine — not big but perfectly adequate — well laid out and clean. Reasonably priced by NY standards. Breakfast included, which is also a nice convenience, but don’t expect a gourmet experience. Staff at the front desk were friendly and there was no wait to get to them even though the hotel seemed pretty busy. All in all, a good choice in the Times Square area, especially if arriving at the Port Authority with luggage and a desire for a short walk to your hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The HAMPTON Inn Manhattan always has great value in terms of room rate, service, location and amenities . The breakfast is good , the service is excellent the the location is excellent for theater goers .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a friends birthday celebration and it was great. Steps away from Times Square and all the fun. It was cold so we used rideshare or subway when going further out. It’s all steps away from the Path station. Wonderful staff! Only thing is the elevators can get a little backed up during check in time, but you don’t have a long wait. Can’t wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: stayed for 3 nights in February and was pleasantly surprised. A great breakfast that is free but way too crowded so just grab something and take to room. I appreciated the water, tea and coffee in the lobby. I would definitely stay again and loved the location just off times square and away from the times square mad house.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time to NY from AZ. Always afraid when I book a room especially being so far away. This hotel/room/breakfast/staff/LOCATION couldn’t have been better!! Will stay again! Oh and don’t be afraid to take the subway! Best way of commute invented.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just came home from a 3 night stay. We are a family of four. Location is excellent. Breakfast is a huge bonus. We stayed at the Hilton across the street last year. Hilton was a little fancier if that is what you are looking for. Hampton Inn was smaller, but had everything we needed. We loved the breakfast and valet parking was easy. All of the staff were great! Elevator as others posted was a little slow but not too bad. Oh and there is a rooftop terrace, make sure to check that out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were especially happy to not pay typical destination fee other hotels charge for Time Square area -- that made the difference and we were not disappointed. Breakfast was great, rooms were spacious. We were able to check in when we arrived at noon and hotel held our luggage day of check out so we could experience the town. Overall excellent experience!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was overall a good experience. Modern, clean, with a good breakfast and amiable staff. Biggest complaint is with long wait for elevator in the morning - two times I walked down 23 flights of stairs! They should come up with a different system for this. Also they need more seating in breakfast dining area for busy time. Overall though the hotel is a good value in the heart of theater district.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location (close to Time Square and the subway... which is one stop from the Javitz Center), friendly staff and nice clean (and quiet) rooms, and the complimentary breakfast is fresh with a wide variety of tasty offerings (really helps get the day off to a nice start)!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is very comfortable, very clean, amazing location near Times Square, big shops and theaters.Worth price and a nice breakfast . Coffee and fresh water all day in the lobby, mineral water to take out and freshly baked cookies at tea time. Staff very helpful and the most quick checkin and checkout I’ve experienced.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location one block from Times Square and in the heart of the Theatre District. Hotel room was a nice size with walk-in shower. No fridge but we didn’t need one. Most staff were very helpful. The lady at the concierges desk was not particularly friendly and unable to give us directions to the E train because she said she never takes it. Hotel elevators very busy in the morning, we had to wait about fifteen minutes for one that wasn’t full. Don’t plan to eat at the hotel. There was no room in the eating area or the lobby by 8 a.m. Plenty of ways to eat on the cheap in the area, just not in Times Square.Overall, this hotel met our needs well and I would totally stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thanks to all the positive reivews on TA for steering me to book a room at this location a few nights ago. I had tickets to an evening show and wanted to stay over. Based on the reviews I read I decided to try this property although I didn't know anyone personally who had stayed here.Found the hotel to be perfect for what I wanted: comfortable room, adequate free breakfast, easy walk to the theatre district, and a quieter street despite its proximty to Times Square. The staff was friendly and the room, although small, was nicely appointed and in very good condition. Comfortable mattress, good pillows, nice shower, adequate lighting.Breakfast was a nice addition and the food itself was good. The breakfast room , however, as others have stated could use an overhaul. It's very small, in need of a some cosmetic work and the tables need to be cleaned off by staff when vacated.Otherwise was quite pleased with my stay, will absolutely return here and have already recommended it to friends.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this lovely friendly comfortable Hotel!Staff are all amazing and go the extra mile to make your stay as good as it can be! The Jewel in their crown has to be mentioned! She's the Breakfast Supervisor Geraldine!and a treasure to meet!..her own words were..I just want to see everyone having a nice breakfast and a good start to their busy day!.....Hampton? Hold on to this shining star! She had all the dining room staff sing Happy Birthday to my sister and myself!..Amazing!...Thankyou to all the Staff!..X

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. Room was as expected we were on the 22ns floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was lovely, really enjoyed the different waffle batters especially the cinnamon one! But lots to choose from. Eggs, bacon, sausage patties, Omelettes, smoothies, juices, pastries and yogurts. But what we really liked was the free hot chocolate and coffee in reception. Loved the got chocolate here! And the cookies in the evening were a lovely touch. It was only the last day we realised our tv didn’t work but we were to busy. The hotel is a fab location and would def stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I got a double room with 2 full sized bedsPros:-Room is a decent size for NYC, bathroom is a little cramped but shower is a decent size-They allowed us to check out an hour after checkout, granted we are HH members-Close to times square-Bed is comfortable, just didn't like the sheets, bring your own blanket if you can-They have water and coffee at the front desk and water bottles and a little shop-The room had AC/heat-Curtains keep a decent amount of light from coming in but aren't completely blackout in the top and bottom openings-Wifi was decent speedCons: -The sheets you cover yourself with are thin and the top one is heavy so I kept waking up with the top sheet off and being freezing cold.-Water smells heavily of chlorine so it was hard to rinse my mouth when brushing my teeth-I was on one of the higher floors and heard sirens throughout the night-They charge for a mini fridge, our room also didn't have a microwave, maybe it's an electric grid issue to provide that-Found a hair in my bed that wasn't mine, maybe it was someone's from housekeeping but kinda grossed me out

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is not a business person's hotel, it's really more of a staging group for international travelers to visit the sites of NY. Which is completely fine and OK, but just an expectation needed to be reset.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While the location is great, my experience was not. The lobby looks new and beautiful, while the rooms are old and tired-- The toilet paper holders hang down broken, the bedside phone was DISGUSTING and looked like someone spilt coffee on it and never cleaned it up.When I walked into the room, the TV was broken so I called down to the desk. I ultimately got the TV to work, went to call down to tell the front desk and the phone wouldn't work. About half of the time, the phone worked, which from a safety perspective, is very worrisome. The night before departure, I confirmed a 1 PM check out with the front desk. The morning of check out, I was woken up at 8:30 AM by housekeeping knocking on my door. This shows me that either the departments at the hotel do not communicate, or they don't care. In a half-asleep rush to get up to tell the housekeeper about my late check out, I stubbed my toe. This was not the sendoff I was expecting from any Hilton property. Very disappointing overall.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel for the second time.Location is phantastic, allowing us to get to main attractions by food or subway.Complimentary breakfast is very good, and the hotel offers free bottles of water as well as coffee and tea to all guests.I have only one important complaint: the breakfast room is too small for the size of the hotel; so, it is usually crowded with no tables available. It is pretty annoying. Besides, bedrooms should be a little larger.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location, nice and friendly staff always available. The only "minus" was to crowded breakfast where we often had to wait for a table or in the lines.Good rooms, good cleaning and free coffee ;-)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I went with family for a holiday around a week ago for 3 nights in the Hampton inn. It’s an amazing place to stay at with its own breakfast, viewing gallery, business center and shop. We went for breakfast on Tuesday and Thursday and loved it. A highlight was definitely the fresh smoothies and fresh waffles (different flavour choices). However, there are many other things available like cereals, muffins, pastries, omelettes, bacon, fruit and yogurts. The breakfast at Hampton inn is also one of the only in New York you get free. There was a lot more to offer then I was expecting! Throughout the day, the hotel has tea, coffee and ice water machines. There is also “chocolate milk” sachets with something that looks, and tastes, like hot chocolate. At mid-afternoon cookies are put on the reception desk warm and free to take. I would definitely recommend them! Finally, the hotel actually has its own viewing gallery on the roof/ top floor of the building. Unfortunately it was quite foggy when we went up but I’m sure it would look much better on a clearer night. Our room was perfectly sized and had a bath/shower in the bathroom included. Overall, Hampton inn is a lovely place to stay and so close to all the famous landmarks, with some, just less then ten minutes away.We would definitely stay again if we ever come back to New York!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is located just steps from Times Square. Hotel staff was very accommodating. Was able to leave our bags day of checkout so we didn’t have to carry them around. Breakfast was adequate but extremely busy. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Where to start...from the moment we checked in here, we were made so welcome. Got a lovely room high up and my niece who had just turned 18 was greeted with a hamper and balloon which we thought was a lovely touch! Our room was always lovely and clean when we came back at the end of the days.Reception staff can't do enough for you and just so friendly to chat too! Breakfast - this was lovely and had lots of choice, the restaurant could be bigger as this was sometimes a problem getting a table.I have to shout out to Geraldine who was an absolute pleasure !! She helped us out so much with where to go and how to get there, she really is a breathe of fresh air ❤ I would like to also add that this isn't advertised but they have free tea, coffee & hot chocolate in the lobby 24hrs and between 5pm - 8pm free cookies that are unreal - we couldn't wait to come by and take advantage of these before heading up to soak our feet. This also saved us alot of money !We had an awesome time here - me, my mum, sister & niece thank you all so much for the most amazing stay - we will be back one day hopefully!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a find, smack bang in the middle of Times Square and Hells Kitchen. Clean rooms and great service. Free tea/coffee/snack served daily downstairs. Organised transport to Airport upgraded to a stretch limousine, great ending to a NYC stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location near Times Sq but away from craziness. Staff polite and helpful. Reasonable rates. Only 3 elevators, not all in service at all times. Breakfast room too small to accommodate the number of guests.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just stayed at the Hampton Inn, Times Square for three nights and had a wonderful time. The staff were all very helpful and the room was clean and very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect for getting to uptown and downtown New York with sight seeing bus stops on the door step. Only a few steps away is the heart of Times Square, Broadway and Fifth Avenue. The breakfast is fantastic with a good variety on offer to cater for all tastes and the free coffee/tea/hot chocolate in reception is very welcome. We will definitely be booking to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hampton inn times square central.We had two rooms and would stay again.Fantastic location - about 30 metres from the Times Square metro/tube station where you can get the 1 train to Central Park or south ferry for the Statue of Liberty or Staten Island ferry. On the 1 line is also canal street area, the 9/11 memorial and upper west side - all very interesting to visit. The hotel is also right by Times Square of course for a vast variety of restaurants and fun places like Carlos bakery, Ellen’s diner, juniors and Disney store. It’s a 5 min walk max to port authority bus station and also if you walk down 8th Avenue towards Macy’s it’s a very quick walk and way of getting about downtown. The hotel has a great breakfast system in the morning when everyone can just go in and eat. There’s cereals and fruit salad, bagels and smoothies and juice along with toaster, plus the very popular waffle iron. The room was quite small to be honest but would stay there again.The hotel was quite quiet and the lifts quick and reliable. Hate those hotels where the loft takes ages!The hotel has a roof terrace with good views and it’s a fun addition to the hotel. The staff were lovely especially Geraldine who helps with the breakfasts.The hotel provides free lovely cookies in the reception around 5-7pm.If you’re visiting NYC for the first time I would recommend the Staten Island ferry - at night or daytime, the top of the rock, walk through Central Park from west side and start around 92 street, the museum of natural history is also great and take a stroll around Grenwich or the east village.We enjoy food at Ellen’s diner and tick tock diner. The portions are huge so buy a couple and share them.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location and proximity of the hotel to Time Square, Grand Central Station, and the Theaters made this location a great fit for our trip. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful during all aspects of the stay. Each morning the complimentary breakfast provided a broad selection to fit our families eclectic tastes.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It is a great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, amazing breakfast and breakfast staff. I would definitely go back here. Rooms were plenty big enough for family of 4 and quiet considering the location. Always managed to get in the lift and always got a table at breakfast but we did tend to go early about 7/7:30am, so much choice even for the pickiest of eaters. They also provide a takeaway breakfast which was bottle of water,apple,muffin and a cereal bar. Free hot drinks available 24/7 in reception and cookies at 5pm. Free WiFi and access to computer and printer. A selection of food/drink items to buy near reception. And not forgetting the amazing view from the small roof terrace. Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location for everything we wanted to do while on vacation. It was walking distance to the theaters we were going to, and we could get any kind of food within a 3-block radius. The room was very clean, and the bed comfortable. The shower water pressure was excellent! Breakfasts were the usual fare, with pre-made omelets, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, and more. I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone who wants to be close to the theater district!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After getting totally confused when booking our hotel for NYC because of the massive amount of hotels available, i picked here due to price and location and boy was i happy i did. Great location, really central to everything, spacious rooms with storage, large shower, we got a room on the 23rd floor so we had a good view of the skyline, fantastic staff who all were so helpful and happy and very clean everywhere. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting nyc. The concierge was really helpful sorting our transfer back to the airport and all other queries we had.the breakfast is a bit chaotic but thats the guests, not the hotel. good selection of breakfast items available and they have a coffee station thats available 24/7 in the lobby.i would stay here again next time im back in the city for sure.the only slight negative are the lifts as they take a while but again thats the volume of guests not the hotels fault.i forgot a pair of shoes in the bedroom when checking out and when i asked the staff brought them down to me no problems.great hotel and staff are a credit to the hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Went to NYC for a long weekend for my step-daughters 13yr birthday... WHAT A BLAST... PERFECT LOCATION... FRIENDLY SERVICE.. TASTY.. HUGE BREAKFAST.. Front desk attendants are so helpful. They have waters and soda's for guests.. along with coffee, tea and water in the lobby. Cookies (hot from the oven) come out at 5pm-8pm!. SHOUT OUT TO BENISON at the breakfast Buffett. Location was amazing.. we walked everywhere and the subway was across the street. PERFECT for going anywhere on Manhattan. ONLY DOWNFALL- ELEVATORS TOOK FOREVERRRRRR!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything about this hotel was fantastic, from the location to the staff and more. Just around the corner from Times Square and the next street is 42nd street so very handy if going to one of the Broadway shows. The subway entrances are at the end of the street connecting to most lines, and the Empire State, Rockerfeller Centre, 5th Avenue are all within easy walking distance. Complimentary hot drinks and iced water are available at all times in the lobby, along with cookies from 5pm. I didn't expect much from the included breakfast, but it was very good. Juices, smoothies, pastries, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, toast, two hot choices each day (omelet + bacon / scrambled eggs + sausage), and the highlight of our stay - make your own waffles!! This set us up for the day and this plus the lobby drinks saved us a lot of $$. The room was clean, warm and comfortable with a huge bed and we slept well each night, our door was opposite the lift on floor 26 but we didn't hear anyone and the outside road noise was minimal over night. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Sat in the lobby now, waiting to go to the airport. This hotel is excellent, on a reasonably quiet street compared to most that are this close to Times Square. The best thing about this hotel is the staff, they do everything with a smile, nothing is too much trouble. We booked via Virgin and had no extra fees to pay. Breakfast included, which is a real bonus here. If 4 of us had to pay for breakfast nearby for 5 days, I reckon it would be 3/400 dollars minimum. Free WiFi too that is pretty decent. A special mention to Geraldine at breakfast, always happy to chat and offer advice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel!! Comfy beds, free excellent breakfast lots to choose from. The wonderful Geraldine (breakfast supervisor) made our stay!! She was such a lovely helpful lady with a huge smile for us every morning. We would ask her recommendations for how to get about places in NYC and she was always happy to help. The free warm cookies from 5-8pm and hot drinks were a great touch and brilliant service all round. (I probably ate far too many!) Would definitely stay again. Thanks Hayley

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Service was good, rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was excellent. Internet was complimentary but very good. Location was Best. Evening cookies and 24 hours coffee were toppings on the cake. I will surely stay next trip at Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed on the 26 floor near that elevator but were not disturbed by noise . We had a lovely room with 2 double beds quiet big room by New York standards with nice view. The bathroom had a bath /shower very clean and lots of fresh towels. The staff in the hotel from housekeeping to reception were all very friendly and efficient. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent with a good selection of food but be early as it tends to fill up quickly . There is coffee iced water tea facilities 24 hours beside the reception nice touch . It is in a great location close enough to walk to the tourist locations and shopping also just one block from the port authority bus terminal and subway stations are nearby. We had traveled from Ireland for a special significant birthday celebration for my daughter when the hotel staff discovered this they put a balloon and goodies in the room with a birthday card signed by some of the staff a lovely personal touch and was much appreciated . I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel will be staying there on my next visit to New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel, very clean, staff was great. Excellent location right in Times Square. Continental Breakfast was amazing. Staff offered extra water bottles without hesitation. Food was fresh, eating area was clean. Overall a great one night stay and would recommend for anyone on business travel or family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is in the top spot of central Manhattan, one block from the Times square. We stayed at the 15th floor but we have no front view.The hotel was very clean and the people on the front desk are very polite.The breakfast was satisfying but the period that we were there (Christmas) there were too many people that you had no room to sit and of course only 3 elevators to serve all these people...and of course the price it too high but that's the way it is in Manhattan!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was there two weeks ago with my 4 year old daughter to see a play. I asked the lady at the counter to please not to give me a room by the elevators, that is exactly the room we were given. My poor child barely slept all night from people coming in and out of the elevator. The next day I left my belongings so we could go out and do stuff in the city and when I came back they had lost one of my bags. It took me almost 10 minutes to get someone who could help get y stuff while there were three staff members staring at the computers and talking to each other. I was told by one of them that I had to wait. Then it took another 25 minutes to locate my lost bag. I contacted Hilton and the manager was "NO WHERE TO BE FOUND TO DEAL WITH THIS SITUATION" THERE ARE MANY HOTELS that are the same price in the same location that have outstanding costumer service. SAVE YOURSELF THE AGGRAVATION AND LOOK AND STAY ELSEWHERE. SOMEWHERE WHERE THEY ACTUALLY CARE ABOUT THEIR COSTUMERS.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great price , location and staff. Room clean and comfy. The front door man John was awesome. He assisted us with all our needs. Transportation from the airport and transportation back to the airport. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in this hotel at the start of February for 5 nights. I accidentally booked a king assessable room rather than just a king room. I messaged the hotel to let them know but I didn’t hear back. Upon arrival I again told them again (in case anyone required this room) but they confirmed it was ok. Despite this been a mistake it actually worked in our favour, we had one of the biggest rooms in the hotel. The hotel offers hot beverages and water 24/7. The hotel charges you around $130 dollar deposit upon arrival and this is refunded on exit (or you can use this to purchase items from the hotel shop). Fresh cookies are left in reception in the evening which was a nice touch. I can’t comment on the breakfast as we didn’t go but I heard other guests say it was good. The hotel is 5 minute walk away from Times Square which was perfect for us, although things are a lot more pricey around this area.With it been winter we used the subway rather than the open top buses and after a few confusing days, we soon got the hang of it. Wolfgang’s steakhouse which is on the same block as the hotel, was amazing!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of everything. We loved staying here. Before we booked our room here we read a lot of the reviews and how the elevators were slow, I can tell you we did not experience any slow elevators, they have three elevators that are constantly running and were always there within seconds of pushing the button.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed two nights, and were happy with our experience. The hotel is very conveniently located, and we felt very safe. The staff is friendly, and you can have cookies each evening. Our room was small, but clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. We didn't plan to be in the room much anyway. As other people have mentioned, the elevators as slow. Luckily, we were on the 3rd floor so we took the steps when possible. The reason I gave 4 stars is the breakfast situation. It is overwhelming. There were so many people in that breakfast area. There were not enough tables. Some people were standing, and some people (like me) went out and sat at a table in the hotel lobby. I actually liked it better out there because I was away from the activity of the breakfast room. The gentleman working the breakfast area was wonderful! I can't remember his name, but he was very friendly and he worked hard to keep the area clean so that guests could have a place to sit as soon as someone else left. FYI, there is a McDonalds just across the street. Overall it was a good experience, and I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful place to stay. Clean and comfortable. The rooms are not large, but this is NYC. Hotel is in the heart of the theater district with many places to dine. Staff was friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was wonderful, as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was only a 1 night stay for us. But the hotel was quiet, clean, and well located in times square. One block from the port authority bus terminal which is how we arrived into the city. So it was a short walk to the hotel. We will stay there again on our next trip to the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: "Great Hotel, Great staff, Great location. The staff were very friendly and made me feel very welcome. Our room had an amazing view on Emipre State Building. Breakfast was very good with a good variety. Unlimited Coffee was fab, so tasty! It was a just a few meters to Time Square. It was nice and clean and the lady who cleaned was so friendly. I had such a lovely time I would go back there any time and look forward to."

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location--nice hotel experience. The room was small but clean. Had coffee maker and safe. Just off Times Square. Do not get an accessible room unless you really need it-- shower was quite confusing. Staff extremely friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We picked this hotel because we were meeting friends for dinner in the Broadway Theatre district. The location is excellent, plenty to see and do right in the neighborhood. Also the subway is just down the street and I was able to get a train right to SoHo. People who work at the hotel are very friendly, the room was nice, very clean and the bed was comfortable. Excellent shower!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This surpassed our expectations. The room/bathroom were sparkling clean and although the room was small with two queen beds, we still had room for a suitcase stand, two chairs, desk, etc. I especially appreciated the friendliness and genuine helpfulness of all the staff. We found the breakfast a bit crowded at times, but the buffet included both hot and cold foods, eggs, fresh waffles, bacon, etc. Better than your usual free breakfast buffet, and there was always a place to sit. We were there in "off" season, so no idea what it might be like in busier times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel had everything we could possibly ask for. We were a birthday girl from Brooklyn, her mother from Vermont, and her grandmother from South Carolina, all converging at this hotel to celebrate this family birthday.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Comfortable and clean. Could have used a few more towels but not a big deal. No bathtub in my room- but some may have- not sure. Great breakfast! Fantastic location if you want to be near the theatres.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Looking back on this four day experience what an adventure. Staff friend.y, front desk patience, breakfast on time and plenty gor all. The location of the hotel is excellent for plays and tours. It is an experience that Cafol and I sillneverforget

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The stay at your hotel was spectacular. I especially enjoyed interacting with the very friendly staff.. there were several instances (I can recall at least three) where the staff was very polite, respectful and compassionate. In general, I would give your staff a solid A+. The facilities were well maintained as well.. very comfortable room. Breakfast was off the charts. Definitely a fantastic value and I will return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Most subway lines within a few steps. Elevators very busy from 9am. Stayed on the 6th floor and had to walk down during busy morning hours.Complimentary breakfast is good with eggs and breakfast meat. Overall great value for money.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, comfortable rooms in a five-star location. Close to subways, theater, and the Port Authority terminal, this reasonably-priced hotel offers an alternative to more expensive places. Free hot breakfast includes waffles and a range of foods...They also offer a bag breakfast snack.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just come back from a fantastic 5-night stay at the Hampton Inn, Times Sq Central. We were given a room on the 26th floor (think the hotel has 30/31 floors) room big enough, big comfy bed, the view was ok, could see Empire state building from the room (south side), very clean hotel and really friendly staff. Only downsides were breakfast, it could get really busy. Plenty of options to choose from but you need to get down before 7 am / 7.30 am to enjoy as it gets way to busy after 8 am/8.30 am and you'd be lucky to find a table. There was often nowhere to sit and people would overspill to the lobby, the other thing that spoilt it a little was that plastic cutlery, paper plates and cups were supplied.....I think the hotel is better than this. The second downside was in our room - the toilet door (not sure if this was just our room though as we were based by the fire exit and it could have been to save space), it was a sliding door and didn't offer much privacy as there was a gap of about an inch around the door. No one mentioned where to find ice (which can be found on the 11th floor). This would have been useful information during check-in or when purchasing drinks from the lobby shop (which is only small but good enough). Deposit of a $100 was requested but there are no resort fees. Free wifi which is always great. Hairdryer supplied which was excellent for a hotel one, there's no need to bring your own. Neutrogena products supplied daily i.e. shampoo/conditioner/soap etc. Room cleaned daily. Free cakes/cookies, tea/coffee and water at the reception area. Overall I would highly recommend the Hampton Inn. Concierge service downstairs who can help with subway links if needed or reservations, theatre tickets etc. Hotel location is excellent. Times Square subway is at the end of the street and Times Square is only a block away which is about 3 min walk. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I selected the Times Square Central based on location, ratings, and rate. Everything about the stay was excellent - and that's not an easy rating to get from me. To a person, everyone was friendly and helpful. Room size was plenty big - king bed, desk, chair, closet. Location a couple blocks from Times Square, across the street from the Times Square subway station.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great time at the Hampton Inn. It was in the perfect location for taking in a play and dinner. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had purchased a bottle of wine and asked the front desk for glassware . Drinking wine from a paper cup was not desirable. It was late at night and one reception at the front desk over heard me talking with another receptionist who didn’t think that they had glassware. A few minutes after I got back to my room. They brought up glasses to my room. It was much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel to be near the theatre where we were seeing a show. The property is clean and updated. The rooms are small, but we expected that in the city. There was a bit of a wait to check in. I observed many people ahead of me while waiting. I noticed that, unlike other couples, we did not receive two bottles of water though we are Hilton Honors members for years. The staff was not particularly friendly. They explained nothing, did not invite questions, etc. I had to ask about the key cards and breakfast. We did not realize that the room card was required for the elevator but quickly figured it out. Fortunately, we knew where we were going in the city. The breakfast area, though large, was packed with people. There was a good variety of items. I was looking for an empty table. When I found one, I had to wipe it off myself. There was coffee and tea in the lobby as well as the breakfast room. Generally, this is a nice, modern property and a good location. I think a little more effort on the part of desk staff would go a long way in making this an even better location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Couldn't have been more pleased when staying at this hotel with a large group. Staff was very accommodating of our early arrival and offered friendly, timely service during our stay. Located in the Times Square area, this hotel is on a quieter side street. Very convenient without all the lights. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my second trip to New York, and we were offered this hotel as part of our package, or the same we stayed at last time. We choose this hotel, and I’m glad we did. The rooms are nice and modern, the bathroom is huge. They have an observation deck on the roof which offers great views of the city, and it’s in a great location, close enough to walk to the tourist locations and shopping. Free WiFi was included with our room. You also get a complimentary breakfast everyday. The breakfast is a very good value, with either scrambled eggs or omelettes, sausage or bacon as hot food, plus make your own waffles. Also oatmeal and cereal, smoothies, juice, fruit, toast. The coffee is also quite good. I am going to nitpick and say that breakfast is REALLY crowded, and sometimes a wait for a table, plus it’s all paper plates, cups, plastic cutlery, so I’m really hoping the hotel is actively recycling this because the bins were full each and every day. Also every day they have a coffee bar in the lobby which you can help yourself to. My only other complaint is the elevators, which were incredibly busy, always full, and we ended up taking the stairs quite regularly, which is fine on the 6th floor but I’m certain someone on the 31rst floor might disagree. Overall this is a really great location and a really great value.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff is personable and professional. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is great. If your looking for large rooms don’t come to NYC but our room was fine for two people. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the theater district. Not far from the heart of Times Square. Hotel lobby is clean, attractive, nicely decorated. The double room we stayed in was also clean, nice decor, comfortable beds but the pillows....oh my they were FANTASTIC! Most staff were friendly and welcoming, others made it obvious they would rather not be there. The free breakfast was standard but the dining area is very small and crowded given the size of the hotel. If they offer a lower floor vs a higher, I’d recommend lower as the elevators are rather busy at times. The price is great given it’s NYC. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked here for 4 nights as it was our first time visit to NYC and the states we wanted to be somewhere central to get around and see the main sights. The hotel staff were very welcoming, we were on the 22nd floor. Rooms are small but they have everything you need in them. The reception area has water, tea and coffee which you can help yourself to anytime. Breakfast is busy theres a good selection of foods waffles, cereal, hot food etc. We weren't fussed about breakfast and most days we ate elsewhere. It does get busy during peak times 8-10am where there are people waiting to find a table to breakfast area isnt big enough for the amount of people at the hotel! The location is brilliant within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed the location with all the hustle and bustle of Times Square.This hotel is quite modern and updated. The positives - the staff are all friendly and very helpful. The room was very clean, modern and comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate.Now for a few negatives - the room was very small (not unusual for a NYC hotel) but the king size bed was too big for the space making it very difficult to walk around the bed. There was a coffee maker in the room but the one and only outlet available was in the bathroom (ugh!). The wifi was sporadic. The negatives aside, it still was an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel with comfy beds. Staff were great. Easy access to shows, Subway, and all Times Square has to offer. Parking was cheapest we found with any hotel. We will.definitely book here again. Breakfast was the only neutral thing but it was complimentary and served it's it's purpose.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here with my 12-year-old son when we came to NYC to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. I selected this hotel due to the location, the price plus my history in staying at other Hampton Inns, and we were very pleased with our choice. The room was nice; the breakfast was good; and the staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a nice lobby area to hang out and charge phones when we arrived too early to check into our room and had some time to kill. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first New York experience and Hampton Inn was just as we expected...clean, friendly, helpful and a great location. Benson who worked in the breakfast area was the most courteous person we encountered on the trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent a long weekend at this Hampton Inn and enjoyed it immensely. All of the staff are super friendly and greeted us with big smiles from front desk to breakfast staff. Room for four with two double beds was adequate. Elevators are a bit slow during peak periods. Breakfast selections are plentiful. Hotel lobby was cozy and a great place to crash. We had pizza dinner with my family and daughter’s friend. This is our new “to go” place in NYC. Very clean and highly recommended. Location is in the middle of all of the action half a block away. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in December...………… we had 3 adults in a room which could take 4 - however, it felt very small but I was assured by the manager that this was typical of all New York rooms. The beds are doubles (rather than king) pushed to the side so access to both beds is through a narrow channel (the width of the bedside cabinet) between the two beds. We found this to be very close for 3 adults (although we are all family!) and it did impair our stay at this hotel. I asked if we could move but was told all rooms are the same sleeping area size (some entrance halls a little larger when placed next to a lift). Anyway, just so you are aware if you are regular sized adults, it's tight for sharing!!! We booked a Hampton as the breakfast is included - and it was breakfast and the breakfast service that we all enjoyed! Geraldine, the Irish breakfast manager, was amazing. And as much as she ran a tight ship in the restaurant (ie all foods were available, plentiful and the serving areas and tables were very clean and swiftly cleared), her natural warmth and enthusiasm for New York really helped us get the most from our stay. We so enjoyed meeting her - and found her to be the friendliest and most helpful person in the whole of New York City - she is an absolute asset to this hotel. New York itself was a great experience - highlights included a visit to Intrepid aircraft carrier and the Ground Zero museum - both 3 hour visits which flew by!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived after a quick check in at JFK. Check in was quick and easy. The room was plenty big enough for 3 people any more and it would be a squeeze. Beds were very comfy and the air conditioning was very useful. It was 18 degrees whilst we were there so needed it to cool the room down. Geraldine in the breakfast room was fantastic going over and above. She brought us cold water as soon as she saw us. She was fantastic. Loved the location and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at the Hampton Inn in Manhattan-Times Square North. We enjoyed our stay with a nice start to our day with a nice complimentary continental breakfast. The location was close to Broadway and one street away to a Subway station. The room was approximately $155 a night for 4 nights. The room was clean with a comfy bed, but the bathroom is on the small size. We plan on taking a return trip in two months for some more excitement and most likely will stay at the same location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location and the hotel is clean and comfortable. Would stay here again. Breakfast is the standard Hampton Inn breakfast, but with helpful staff and well supplied. Area was clean and not overly crowded

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was perfect, cleanliness, the price has not competition and great attention. This hotel is Highly recommended. Also the Place looks great, and free breakfast was really good, plenty food and space

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a fairly average New York hotel room, but the location is amazing, the staff was very helpful and the free breakfast and wifi are a definite bonus. We were very comfortable and enjoyed our 4 night stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from 5 nights in New York 2 adults and our 2 sons 11 and 13. We picked this hotel becsuse of its location which did not disappoint. Check in was quick and easy, 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate was great. Free WIFI which is a must with children. Breakfast was great, good choice and all fresh with 2 hot options everyday our eldest son loved the waffles. Breakfast can get busy at peaks time but we never had a problem.Geraldine the breakfast superviser is a gem, and looked after us every morning. Our room was great 2 double beds very comfortable, TV, coffee maker and hairdryer.Bathroom was good, shower and bath, plenty of towels for family of 4. Also safe in room. Penn station was just a few blocks away and was great to catch Airtrain back to JFK and alot cheaper than Taxi. Madison Square Gardens also few blocks away from Hotel and if you can catch a Knicks game I recommend it, be warned a beer is 16 dollars!!. We had alot planned for our time In New York and the location of the hotel was ideal , it would of been nice if the hotel had a Bar and a Fridge in the room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff friendly and helpfulBreakfast supervisor wonderful.....my granddaughter has a milk allergy and the staff was very helpful in providing us with substitutions.Conceire John wonderful suggestions of where to dineLocation AmazingSuper close to Times SquareYou MUST see the Lion King. go directly to the ticket office at the theater close to show time to get a good deal on the tickets

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms are very small and don't provide a mini fridge for drinks or medication. Heating system in our room was broken. One of the days we were gone from 10:30 am to 9:30 pm and did not receive housekeeping service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Super nice stay, very good emplacement, clean room, beautiful view. We really enjoyed our stay it was only for night, which we could’ve stay longer. Couldn’t enjoy the breakfast, maybe it would be better if it lasted longer

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were in NYC for the Christmas season and to see the Pittsburgh Steelers play the New York Jets. This hotel was a fantastic place to stay. Front Desk staff and the Breakfast employees were helpful and friendly. Clean and bright hotel. The location is great. Subway a few steps out the door. Walking distance to many attractions. We will be back the next time we are in NYC. Thank you!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family stayed at this hotel for a quick 2 nights gateway to New York City. This hotel was very conveniently located near Times Square, so we could come back any time we wanted a quick rest or change clothes before/after the Broadway show. Elevators were slow to come and the breakfast area was very busy, but that was just a minor inconvenience comparing to the great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family of five stayed in two connecting rooms. The unbeatable feature of this property is its location: on the edge of Times Square, half a block from the subway stop. You can walk into the Square any time day or night and it's active (there's a Walgreens a block away that never closes). The hotel isn't cheap, but given the location it's a great value.Others have complained about the elevators. This could be a concern: There are only three elevators serving 30+ floors. But the elevators are VERY fast, and we never found ourselves waiting for more than a few minutes.Breakfast is adequate---not Club Med, but everyone can find something. (Geraldine was particularly helpful to us.) There's coffee/water available 24/7 and this was a real plus.It was also great to have a laundry facility on-property. Easy to use with soap available for purchase.We were worried about noise but it wasn't really a factor on the 20th floor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was in the perfect location, right in Times Square. It was close to the subway, restaurants and shopping. We easily got around to the sights we wanted to visit. The staff was very friendly even with all the rush of New Year's Eve.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yeah, they made a few mistakes (gave us a room that housekeeping was finishing, forgot to give us hand towels) but the staff were fabulous! Everyone we encountered from front desk personnel to housekeeping to food services made us feel like our comfort was important to them. We’ll be back. Thank you all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights beginning of December. Couldn’t fault the hotel at all. Clean room with comfy beds, fabulous breakfast and in a great position. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. Well done to all the staff

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband, our two 20-something daughters and I stayed here December 25th-29th. We had a great experience. Having stayed at another hotel in June, we were expecting a small room. The room was not much different from a typical Hampton Inn anywhere, We were on the 10th floor directly beside an elevator and pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. The location is perfect. We went everywhere from The MET to The statue of Liberty. Easy walking distance to Broadway shows, restaurants and subway. The breakfast was exactly what you find at other Hamptons: waffles, a few hot breakfast items, fruit and cereal. I was very impressed with the breakfast staff, particularly Benson and David. They greeted us with a smile each morning and hustled to make sure everything was replenished. The only disappointments we had were that a refrigerator is not standard (seems to be a NYC thing) and that the comforters slid off the beds easily during the night. Small things. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: You can't beat this location for the typical tourist activities. Right across from the subway and so many places within walking distance. Walked to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Ave, Bryant Park, Central Park, Macy's, and so many restaurants. Room Location - Since I was bringing my family of 4 there for 5 day over Christmas, I did a lot of research on room location. I had called and asked several questions as well. So I was ready to pick my room the day before through online checkin. I picked a room and called to make sure it met my needs. After being told by 2 different workers that the layout of the "03" rooms is the best I felt great about my choice. I got a confirmation that we were checked in to this room. However, when we physically arrived, they had us in a different room. When I questioned the lady, she made up a lie and said that since we requested a refrigerator, we can't have that room because a refrigerator cannot go in that room. This seemed crazy since the lady that helped me pick that room said that it would be great for a refrigerator. After pressing this a bit she got a manager and he said that the person never checked out of that room, so we couldn't have it. Strange since it usually only lets you do online checkin after there person had checked out. I assume they just gave it to someone else and were making up excuses. This started our stay off on a bad note.We ended up in 2212 (which of course they assured was a superb room. It was facing 41st street, which is not what I wanted for street noise. The good news is that the street noise was not as bad as I expected. We are night-owls so the noise seemed to calm down when we were asleep. You could hear things, but we ran the fan on constant and used a white noise machine. Elevators - As noted on many reviews, you can wait 10-15 minutes at times. I would say either stay super low so you can use stairs, or super high. For getting a down elevator, the elevator always goes to the highest floor first and then stops at every floor requested on the way down. So the poor folks on floors lower than 20 got passed up all of the time because the elevator was always full. I felt really bad for those with full luggage carts who could not take the stairs. We only had issues a few times since we were usually leaving the building after busy checkout time. Breakfast - As noted on many reviews it is a zoo. It is a great perk that they offer this, but you need to have an incredible amount of patience to get your food. People are going in all directions and cut in front of you and bump you. The should re-design this room to have one long buffet bar going down he middle with access from both sides. The pinch points in the corners is awful. The last few days I just grabbed a "To-Go" bag and ate in my room. These bags are a great perk as well (small water bottle, apple, Nutri-grain bar, muffin). The staff that works this are great though. Always there to help. They will get you a banana if you ask for one!Lobby - Busiest lobby I have ever seen. It is small and so many people getting the free water/tea/coffee and waiting for rides or to check in.Front Desk - As mentioned above, we did not have a good checkin experience. Also, they assured us at check in that the refrigerator we requested for medical reasons was already in the room. It was not and never came. We had to call concierge to get it delivered. A few other times during our stay we asked the front desk for extra towels. They never came either, so we had to call concierge. Activities Planner/Helper - They have someone to answer questions and help with planning for a part of the day. They were very helpful! A nice perk!Rooms - Very clean and look to be recently updated. They are NYC small, but clean is so important and I have no complaints with that.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Treated my family to a 4 day trip to see Christmas in New York. The only good thing about the hotel is right in Times Square. Otherwise everything else was not worth the exorbitant price! Very disappointed

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I spent our third trip to New York at this fantastic hotel for six nights..Friendly helpful staff with breakfast included in your price, along with freshly baked cookies, hot tea & coffee in reception. There is also a complimentary newspaper, if your quick enough.Our room was spacious enough for the two of us. There was also complimentary toiletries which were replaced everyday once used as well as fresh towels.The breakfast seating area we found was always busy but people were coming and going all the time so we hardly had to wait to sit down.The breakfast itself was varied with different cooked options everyday.Some of the earlier revues mentioned delays with the three elevators but we didnt have a problem.All in all a very nice stay which we fully recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here over Christmas. The location was excellent- next to Times Square, Broadway and Bryant Park yet on a quiet street. Most other tourist attractions are within a 15 minute walk but with the option of the subway close by. Free breakfast was available and enough to start the day off. Staff were friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay. On our last day they even helped us with getting transportation to the airport. The hotel was overall clean and inviting. The only glitch is the slow elevators during peak time but because we weren't too high up, we took the stairs. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We’ve stayed in New York many times and due to a last-minute getaway this was one of the options available on Christmas then also looked close to the tourist activities. The rooms were great nice size free coffee and hot chocolate at all hours in the lobby as well as a coffee pot in the room. The breakfast was perfect and I will say the location was amazing. Right next to a theaters and there’s a walk through McDonald’s or the Hilton across the street to 42nd St. where more of the action is as well as the red bus. It was literally 3 1/2 blocks straight down to Bryant Park which was incredible and a quick walk to the Macy’s area. Great job from a diamond member

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel for our first visit to NYC! We love Hampton Inn’s, this hotel is in a great location, staff was friendly, clean rooms. Breakfast was wonderful, nice seating areas in the lobby to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city with a complimentary cup of coffee,hot chocolate, tea or water (& warm cookies at certain times!)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stay in hotels around the world. I definitely recommend this Hampton as my very favorite in New York Times Square. Just a couple of blocks from the heart of Times Square. Walking distance to Radio City, Rockefeller, Empire State Bldg, Macy's, shopping, etc. The service is spectacular. Front desk Rachelle would satisfy your every need. I received the highest possible floor, with a very nice view. The front desk provides the clients with complimentary water, snacks and sodas at all times. The breakfast was superb, hot and you could even take food to your room. Geraldine and Benson were on top of all your eating desires. You can tell they love their clients. The doormen were also fabulous, always making sure that if you were in a tour, they would come and get you in the lobby right away. Joseph was checking on us all the time. They made my birthday stay very special. Thanks Rachelle and staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly! I would recommend this particular Hampton Inn over some other ones I have stayed at in NYC. We even had trouble with one of the heaters and they sent someone immediately and it was fixed in 5-10 minutes! Incredible service

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Checking In Person kept asking for my ID.I said please look my room up while i get it , .she kept asking for it. .finally she said would you like someone else to help you?I said yep,im a diamond for life at hilton and know what to expect at Hilton ,Hampton inns,Not that!Then breakfast on Sataurday which was only till 10AM.the hotel was sold out that night so went I went to breakfast at 9:30am There Were 20 People On Line With No Seats! I went to the front desk and the rep said you can sit in the lobby and eat like the others.I said no thank you!It was 20 degrees outside and the and the outside doors kept opening ,also people had to hold their plates on their laps to eat also.So I went to Mcdonalds across the street! Rude staff!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn in Times Square was perfect! Hotel staff were kind and accommodating and made a misunderstanding between booking site and actuality ok. Stored something I needed which was why I booked the hotel to begin with. Complimentary breakfast was amazing. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights on a business trip and was very pleased with the property and the customer service. The lobby is welcoming and the staff is attentive. The full breakfast buffet was good. Plenty of options and open 6-10am. They even make my daughter scrambled eggs at her request (the bar had omelettes and hard boiled). Benson and David were excellent: friendly and on top of cleaning/turning over tables in the very busy dining area. Our first room developed a smell once we turned on the heat, so they graciously moved us to another one. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It's close to everything - walk right out ton Times Square around the block. This is a hotel we will definitely return to for an affordable stay in NYC. Not a luxury property, but the service makes it feel like one.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived in Newark airport and were able to catch the Express Bus for $17 each to the Port Authority Bus Station, one and half block from hotel! Check in was fast and easy even though there were so many people. Kris, at the front desk was so welcoming, was the whole four nights we were there. Great recommendation on where to eat--Tony's on 43rd. Everything is so close to walk or catch subway across the street or halfway down the block. Morning breakfast buffet was great and had variety of everything. Benson was so nice even though he was working the whole place to clean up by himself, great smile! Patrick's just one street over had great food also. Even our housekeeper on the 20th floor was amazing, always a smile and hello plus have a great day. Staff was just so helpful with only one exception and that was the female conceirge with long gray hair---we asked about places to eat and she said "I wouldn't recommend any of the local places, couldn't think of anything around us to go to....????? we caught subway and bus back to LaGardia airport---again so worth the metrocard ticket. Subway took us to 9/11/ Museum of Art and was so quick. Room was good size for NYC and bathroom was great. Everything was VERY clean.Will stay there when we return!!! Best experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Free warm cookies! The room was modern, updated and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to travelers staying in the Times Square / theater district of New York City. You can control the heat or cooling with a digital thermostat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean rooms and friendly staff. Good variety of breakfast items to choose from. I would stay again. Location is great and subway to Chelsea on 41st is 4 mins. There is no view of Times Square at this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent best kept secret. We were very happy from the get go with this property from check in, valet, breakfast and check out. We will continue to use this property for future visits. Easy access to so many places.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn rarely disappoints, and this was no exception. From the moment of our arrival we were completely relieved from the stress and bustle of the streets of NY in the holiday season. Our car was quickly whisked away by a friendly valet, and we our reserved room was ready for check-in earlier than normal. We had a King on a lower floor and the room was exactly as expected, plus it was very quiet. Breakfast was incredible: considering they serve some 700 people each morning this time of year, we had no trouble finding a seat and the buffet was well-managed and clean. We would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel and it is in the best location to see everything. Highly recommend this property. it is near lots of places to eat and very near the subway if you don't want to walk. Loved that it is near the theater section of town. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Amazingly courteous, friendly and professional staff. Hotel is clean and efficient. Very well run. Room was quiet and well appointed. For the price and great location you just can't do any better. We'll be back. Thanks !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I totally recommend this hotel! Everything was top notch! So easy to get around the city from this location. Everyone was kind and courteous! Food good! Service great! Location perfect! Could not have asked for anything more!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not the best value for the money. Rooms are small, price was high. extremely crowded at breakfast and wait times for elevators were long. Rooms and bathroom were clean. Staff was friendly but easily confused.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved your employees and care we received. Breakfast was delicious but crowded. Beds small for us as we had seven adults and teenagers. Location a little far for Grandma but ok for everyone else. Overall, we love New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very close walk to all midtown locations, subway one block away that gets you just about anywhere in the city in 15 minutes or less. Lobby is small but functional, elevators were faster than expected for only 3 servicing 32 floors. Coffee/hot chocolate at all times, cookies in the afternoon/evening. Breakfast was plentiful and good, area does get crowded. Entire staff was great!! Room was small, but no issues. Shower pressure lacks.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was great! WalkableTo Bryant Park, Times Square, and many other sights and restaurants. Rooms are sort of small, but are clean and attractive. We ate the breakfast one morning and it was fair. Large selection though. Service was great. Everyone was super friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central is a great location to all theaters, and next door to Nederlander! Very clean and comfortable. The beds are really nice, and great city views from our room. The staff was very attentive and polite. All together a great experience and I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the hotel with my pre-teen daughter for a long weekend to take in the NYC holiday experience. We stayed on the 30th floor (#3004) and had an issue with wind whistling through the room and light coming in due to short curtains, but the manager has assured me that the issues will be resolved. The hotel is clean and is located close to a lot of attractions and subway stations. The morning breakfast buffet offers plenty of options, even for finicky kids, and all of the staff in the breakfast room was outstanding. I wish we would have selected a room with a bathtub in order to soak my feet after walking so much, but that is on me. Having all-day coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby was a great feature given how cold it was outside.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent property, exceptional staff. They really make you feel welcome at this Hampton Inn in Manhattan. The property is well-kept and spotless. The staff is so nice and very helpful. You can't lose staying here while in NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There is a very warm and welcoming to the hotel and the staff are amazing. Really appreciated complementary cookies, coffee, tea and drinking water that was provided 24/7, Hotel is within walking distance to Macy's, Radio City and Rockefeller centre plus 2min walking distance to Port Authority and all other main city attractions. breakfast was included which offers various options from day to day, Plus Geraldine the breakfast supervisor and all her breakfast team couldn't do enough for you, Only fault was that on the day we were to check out the housekeeping staff kept knocking to early before we had to check-out at 12.00, Over all exceptional experience and wonderfully stay, Myself and Mam would definitely stay again hopefully Thanksgiving 2020

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is great, just 3 mins away from Times Square. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Free breakfast is provided to all though options are limited for vegetarians. Really appreciated that coffee, tea and drinking water was provided 24/7. A refrigerator in the room would be a nice addition.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has everything you want and more. There is a very warm and welcoming feel to this hotel and the staff are amazing. I would like to give Geraldine, the breakfast supervisor a special mention, she went out her way to make sure everyone had everything the needed. The breakfast buffet was amazing, something to suit everyone. The location of this hotel is perfect, everything within walking distance. We have stayed in some of the larger hotels in Times Square but this hotel knocks spots of them. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I enjoyed our stay. Staff were extremely helpful. Rooms were clean and breakfast was a great variety. Valet parking mad it extremely easy to park. Guest were able to warm up with hot chocolate coffee. The fitness center was wonderful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We decided at the last minute to go to NY to see the parade on Thanksgiving Day so we flew up early on Tuesday morning and left New York on Thursday after the parade. It was a pretty hectic schedule with my wife wanting to look at the Christmas displays in all of the store windows but the one constant was the hotel. The room was clean and the staff was very nice throughout our stay. The front desk stored our bags until our room was ready and then stored them after we checked out (they gave us late checkout, too, so ask if you need it) until our shuttle arrived to go to the airport. The free breakfast was very popular and I have included photos of when it was busy and when I caught it during a lull on Thursday after many people had left for the parade (Served from 6:00 to 10:00 a..m.). I generally do not sleep well on my first night in a hotel but the bed was very comfortable and I got a great night's sleep both nights. Many hotels have pillows that are too thick but the Hampton Inn had 4 pillows on our bed - two were thicker than I prefer but the other two were just right! Kudos to them for providing two different sizes instead of taking the easy way out and just have one size fits all. In the shower, there was a nice touch for the ladies -- in the corner there is a bar about 10"-12" off of the floor for you to rest your foot on while you shave your legs. I must also add that the ladies in the breakfast area were also very nice, working continuously to keep everything replenished. One also offered to take a photo of my wife and I when she saw us trying to get a good selfie! Eggs and meat are present every morning but may be different each day -- we had scrambled eggs one morning with sausage patties and the next it was cheese omelets and sliced link sausage. There are also juices, milk, cereal, various breads and rolls, two (2) toasters, smoothies, coffee, boiled eggs, and waffles! There is sure to be something for everyone. It is also convenient, only a short walk to the subway and several restaurants. The hotel also provides coffee and water in the lobby 24 hours a day, as well as 3 computers for your use and a fitness room. If you want a different view than you have from your room, one of the elevators goes to a viewing area on the roof, which I believe is the 32nd floor. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would not hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was excellent. Room was very clean. Front desk super friendly. Breakfast was included and had some hot items. They offered free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby. We only stayed one night but thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Talking with some people on the elevator, they said it was a little noisy by them, but it was very quiet by our room. Good value for the money and would definitely stay again if in town.
