hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved the location in Times Square, perfect walking distance to plays, Radio city music hall, and good restaurants. The breakfast had a nice selection and great coffee. The only complaint was the hallways were extremely warm. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very small common area for when checking in -not an open at all. You feel like the place is closing in on you. Rooms very small and heat wasn’t working right when we were there. Not worth the money in my opinion. Front desk attendant did not greet us nor was she friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A great hotel that is in convenient to walk to most places including Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and the Fashion District. Staff was very attentive, and breakfast staff, always had a smile on their face. We chose an upgrade to a city view and glad we spent the extra money, We were in 3009 - from bed we could see the empire state building and its light shows. We also could walk to the empire state building. For Times Square the room as ok in size small by midwest standards and good sized for New York. The hotel goes up not out so each floor only has about 8 rooms. Never heard any of the other guests. We were their five nights and would return to this hotel again if we choose to come back to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The best thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Convenient and safe. However their customer service is the worst we’ve experienced in NY. Checked in and our room was boiling hot. Turned on the air and left for 5 hours. Came back and it was even hotter. Called the desk and they sent a maintenance guy. He tinkered around and said “it should work now” but it was still blowing warm air (not hot now). Called back down to ask about a new room. Very rude. Had to basically threaten to call the cc company to cancel the payment to get a new room. Breakfast was good but so over crowded you couldn’t get to much of anything and the dining room has so many tables packed in you can barely walk thru. We had originally planned to stay wed-sun but there is a winter storm coming in so we decided to check out on Saturday. We go down to the desk to tell them that on Friday and are being told we will be charged $150 anyway. I would NEVER recommend this hotel just because of crappy customer service. We have found most service oriented people’s we have dealt with in the city to be exceptionally mice but not here. Haven’t dealt with a nice employee yet at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Long waits for elevators. Crowded lobby. No Wi-Fi service on the seventh floor. E key not functioning. Expensive room rate. Breakfast was fair. Room smelled like dirty feet. Not a great value. Would not stay again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel in an excellent location. Had a room on 5th floor and was really quiet for a good night's sleep. Hot breakfast was a bonus. All staff were friendly and really helpful. Would definitely stay again if ever in the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: On the morning of our arrival we received a super nice text message from Lilly saying that the hotel was looking forward to our stay, offering to do whatever it takes to make our stay an enjoyable one, and wishing us safe travels. What an impressive way to start the day and to make us feel that our business is valuable to them.We arrived in the early afternoon and were greeted warmly by none other than Lilly herself. She immediately got us in checked in, made suggestions for where we would like our room (we chose the 25th floor), and got a young man to Valet park our car. She could not have been more gracious and sets the standard by which you would like to be treated upon arriving at a hotel. Well done Lilly!Our room was spacious, very, very clean, and overall very comfortable. Our room had a city view which in itself was amazing. Breakfast in the morning was excellent and had a number of offerings including omelets, waffles,sausage, Danish, cereals, fruit and other assorted breakfast items. It was well stocked and plentiful. The breakfast room is larger than it looks when first entering and it too was ultra clean.Service staff and maintenance people were abundant and every single one of them greeted you in a friendly manner and always with a nice smile and kind words.I have seen other reviews where some people complained about the elevator service. I found the complaints to be completely unfounded as we never, not even once, had any issue with elevator service. We never waited more than a couple of minutes and once in, the elevator was fast. An added feature is that, elevators are not accessible unless you have your room key and swipe it. Once you swipe it, you can then select the floor that your room is located on.The hotel is convenient to everything in Times Square. We walked to Radio City Music Hall, about a 15 minute walk that seemed shorter and to Rock Center which is across the street from RCMH. Those were the longest walks we had. Great restaurants, theatres, and numerous bars for a cocktail are abundant within a 5 or 10 minute stroll, or shorter, from the hotel.Check out was smooth and efficient. The valet service does take a little bit of time as cars are parked at an off-site location.Overall, this was truly an exceptional experience. The front desk service from Lilly, the housekeeping staff, breakfast room attendants, and the valet service combined with a clean, comfortable, and quiet room made for a very, very pleasant experience. We look forward to another stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is perfect location wise, especially if you are visiting for theater. Breakfast every morning was a delight with variety. Benson was very attentive in the breakfast area and always accommodating making breakfast a pleasure. We also enjoyed having warm beverages available in the lobby. The rooms were clean and we had a nice view. We recommend Hampton Inn Times Square, Central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For vacationers it’s the perfect location, a block and a half away from Times Square. Check-in and check-our were easy; the room, though not very large, is pretty comfortable. The water pressure in the shower could be a little higher, for a better showering experience. The hotel provides a very good breakfast on a self- service basis (always crowded the breakfast room, which should be a little larger). Water, tea, coffee and a chocolate drink are always available at the reception and at 5 PM they also provide guests with delicious cookies. A gym for workout is located in the basement, next to the laundry. Wi-fi worked well everywhere in the hotel. All in all we had a very nice stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Check in was quick with friendly and helpful desk clerks. Very convenient to everything we wanted to do around Times Square and beyond. Clean room. Fast elevators. Appreciated the concierge who reserved a shuttle to Newark airport.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I just returned from four nights at this Hampton Inn, and it was a very good experience. While the traffic could sometimes get a little noisy, the hotel is just far enough away from two major intersections to provide a respite from much of the outside hustle and bustle. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and nicely updated, and there were no stains or signs of wear on the furniture and bedding. The employees stood out for their friendliness; every time a member of the maintenance department was on the elevator, they greeted the other passengers, and several times I witnessed the breakfast staff cheerfully helping fulfill an individual request in the midst of very crowded dining room. While I did not use the services of the concierge, it was good to know that this was an option. During my visit it was quite cold outside, but the complimentary coffee/tea/hot water station in the lobby was always amply stocked and free from litter. These fine points can make all the difference to a busy traveler, and I greatly appreciate how well this hotel treated its guests.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is an older building which has been recently modernized and updated very nicely. I was quite happy with the service from the staff, quite happy with the room I was given. The breakfast area was a bit cramped with all the people, but the actual size of the room where breakfast was served was very large. I am sure its normal congestion since Times Square is a popular visit location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was perfectly located in Times Square and we could walk everywhere. The lobby was spacious and the included breakfast was very good. A staff member showed us how to get to the 911 Museum on the subway map which as was appreciated. Each member we had contact with was pleasant & helpful. The coffee, tea & hot chocolate in the lobby was nice to have available anytime. Our room was comfortable and quiet except for the ice machine outside our door. I’d ask for a different room the next time! We’d definitely stay there if we’re in the area again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I found staff at this hotel to be short and unprofessional with guests. I over heard a conversation between a guest and the front desk where an employee spoke aggressive. I had a desk agent bite my head off for where I set my phone at the hotel coffee stand one morning. Who really cares where I set my phone down. Upon check out I asked for a balanced receipt. There was a $2.00 difference in the two nights I was there. Every hotel does this for their elite diamond members. The manager was standing right there and took zero interest in helping. His exact reply was "we don't do that". I can see why the staff is the was they are.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at this hotel when we did a girls’ weekend to see a Broadway show. It has a great location and the staff was awesome. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was really good. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything is great, but skip the breakfast line. It's manic. Rates can get pretty high, in which case, look elsewhere. Rooms are modern, staff is friendly. This is a high-traffic, center of Times Square, hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 2 nights stay and lovely hotel great location staff friendly and helpful. Lovely touch with tea and coffee available in lobby 24/7. Comfy bed. Only thing I would advise is that the TV is mounted on the wall giving more surface space in the rooms as a bit limited.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for five nights in a family room during the October half-term. From check-in onwards staff were consistently excellent, being both polite and helpful. Our room was on the 12th floor and at the front of the building, directly over 41st Street and we had no issues with noise. Even with two double beds the room was a decent enough size for the four of us. The buffet breakfast set us up well each day (my daughter was particularly taken with the waffle station); as we tended to wake up early we missed the busier times, but when the breakfast room did get full staff (Geraldine stood out) were great at helping people find somewhere to sit. Would definitely stay again if in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was great! A Tremenodous THANK YOU TO Andrea for bringing a refrigerator up for me and reprogramming the TV in my room. He was very prompt, courteous and professional. Also I have to acknowledge Mrs. Dellia, Mr. Emmanjuel for the non stop laughs we shared.To Olivia, Rachelle. Katherine, both of the Doormen and the rest of the staff members,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I needed to be near Times Square and chose this hotel for its good rate. Having been in several "surprising" NYC hotels before I was very pleasantly surprised at the opulent lobby and recently renovated rooms - contemporary design, not unlike HOME2, which I really love. Staff was great as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My mom, two girls and I stayed here for 4 nights. The buffet breakfast was great and had lots of options. Geraldine, Andre and Benson worked so hard at breakfast and always had smiles on their faces! The room was clean and had plenty of space. The hotel was close to Broadway musicals (Frozen was awesome!), Times Square, and had lots of places to eat close by. Jeremy at the front desk was helpful each night- My mom fell one day and he got her ice for her knee each night. He also had a smile on his face whenever we saw him. This hotel overall had wonderful customer service!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here with Virgin Holidays for four nights.We were greeted and booked in without any delay. They did swipe our debit card for a room deposit when checking in. But this was refunded when checking out.We were given a choice of Rooms and floors. We choose the 19 floor and the room was clean and spacious. Lifts are busy but not an issue. The room had Two double beds, tv, towels, and toiletries. Really clean and serviced daily.Free tea, coffee, hot chocolate and iced water available in the reception all day and night.Lovely free cookies from 5pm daily.Cooked breakfast daily included which is buffet style.A small shop in hotel reception which has oops forgot products and snacks.A great hotel in a great location where we got a great night sleep and were always made to feel welcome.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a great hotel in a super location for seeing shows! Staff was wonderful and the hotel was quiet even on the second floor. This will now be our favorite place to stay with our family. Absolutely great!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I rarely write a review of a place, but I was so impressed by the staff here that I have to commend them. We stayed here last weekend and the entire kitchen staff was nothing but wonderful to our family and went above and beyond every breakfast to check in with us and make sure we had what we needed. Lily was also perfect at the front desk and texted us immediately to provide early check in as soon as our room was ready. Everyone was so helpful and polite and it is refreshing to see this. It really made our vacation a great experience.Thank you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is a couple blocks from Time Square, the hotel is very clean and neat. I was very pleased with the room size - which for NY was generous. The elevators get busy but it was only a couple minutes wait at the busies times.Overall I recommend the Hampton Inn very highly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my go-to hotel in NYC. It's very central and I have never had an issue until this stay. The front desk and bell continues to be incredibly helpful, polite and kind.Upon entering my room, I shut the bathroom door fro the outside and it locked itself. I tried several methods (again, I was on the outside of the door) to no avail. I called the front desk three times and it just rang and rang. I then tried calling the direct number from my cell and after 5 rings someone picked up then immediately hung up on me. I then used the text service without any response. I eventually got the front desk and someone arrived rather quickly.My bigger issue was with housekeeping. I was only staying for two nights and had my DND sign up and my room was still entered and cleaned. This might seem petty however in hospitality it is a simple and important rule to not enter and clean when service is not requested.One of the elevators was down intermittently which again has been an issue all 6 items I've stayed. Tips - give yourself extra time to get up or down the elevator and plan to stand or take your breakfast to your room. Hopefully these items can be addressed and I can put this one back on my list!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is located on West 41st Street between 7th and 8th Avenues. It is a few blocks from Times Square and in the Theater District. Front desk staff, bellman, concierge and breakfast buffet staff were all very friendly and ready to answer any questions with helpful advice and suggestions. They even secured us excellent car transportation to LaGuardia at a better price than UBER. Rooms are reasonably sized and very clean. Hot breakfast buffet was good and they advised us on best times to eat. 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby was nice to have and always better than coffee brewed in the room. Rooms facing the street at lower levels may experience some street noise if you are there when trash is collected. Rooms facing away from the street were quiet, even if near the elevators. Easy connectivity to subway lines and Grand Central Terminal. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great service and location to transportation - did not like the hectic and dirtiness of the surrounding area - but liked ths location for access to transportation and theatres and food choices. Probably won't stay in the theatre district again, but did like that we got a pretty good deal with airline and hotel package. Breakfast was good but super crowded. There was not enough seating for guests.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay in Time Square NYC. Business trip, this hotel was a great location for all the places I needed to be for business meetings and to see a show, eat nice dinners and enjoy the things NYC has to offer!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Me and my wife went to Manhattan with another couple and booked this hotel for our first 4 nights. Took care of all booking and comminication with the hotel through the Hilton Honors app and it worked very good from things like late arrival notice and also hotel management asked for feedback on our stay even during our stay.Rooms were very nice and since we lived on 30th floor it was as quite as it can get in Manhattan. Othee facilities were also good and the service for getting tickets and other valuable things for our stay was great!The location of the hotel is just brilliant if you want to be in the middle everyrhing, we loved it!Only thing that we think can be improved would be breakfast. It was rather ok if comparing with also other hotels we have stayed at earlier in NY but they could add somw vegatables and the one time plates, forks and knifes would be great to have real once. Also very busy breakfast restaurant during peak hours.Overall again a really great stay and very good value for the money paid. We will definatly consider comming back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just spent 5 days staying at this hotel and I would like to say a big thank you! All members of staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent, with a variety of food and a different cooked breakfast each morning. Yes! It is busy but be patient and a table will soon become available. Cannot thank the catering staff enough!! Geraldine, Benson, Cienah, Francis, Andre and Nordia went out of their way to help, even when they were obviously rushed off their feet, thank you guys Finally, Anna the cleaner left our room clean every day, with new linen and towels. Thank you all, I will be back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. We had a warm welcome. Complimentary cookies and a good selection of hot drinks in reception. Large room with queen size bed, which was very comfortable, hence we enjoyed good nights sleep! The room was very very clean and in good condition. The only thing I would say is there is a lack of hanging space for dresses, so I left used wardrobe for open to hang up my dress. A hook on the wall would help. The reason for not giving 5 stars was because of the use of paper crockery and plastic cutlery, which surprised me. Firstly, everyone is trying to do there bit for the environment, I cannot imagine the amount of waste this is accumulating. Secondly, it is not nice eating with plastic cutlery, sorry Hampton, please look into this. For the price of your rooms, I would not expect this. Otherwise a good, comfortable and conveniently located hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our first choice is always Hampton Inn and this one exceeded our expectations. Great fitness room. Great location, easy access to attractions and transportation and restaurants. Friendly staff. We faced opposite 41st street and it was quiet enough at night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the Theater district. My first trip to New York and I experienced "sticker shock" when looking at hotel prices so I wanted to stay at a hotel I could trust and Hampton did not disappoint. Friendly, clean with a great complimentary breakfast buffet and close to everything we wanted to do. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was - no street noise or sirens that could be heard. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel offers decent value Decent and a great location. Staff was polite and efficient. The hotel has several little personal touches that set it apart from other places in the city. Make you feel very welcome and valued as a customer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I could not have asked for a better location for a hotel in NYC - especially if you want to be right in the heart of the Theatre District. On my way to the city, I received a text from the hotel welcoming me, and that set the tone for my brief stay. The check-in line was short, the room was perfect, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast was incredible. Was it crowded? Sure, but you don't always get a free breakfast in NYC hotels, and this one was superb. If I had any complaint, it was that the elevators were a bit slow, but really, that's not a terrible concern. This is a family-friendly hotel, with wonderful amenities, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location just off Times Square. Room was small but functional and clean. Good size bathroom. Bed very comfortable. Excellent nights sleep every night. We were on 26th floor so no noise during the night either. Added bonus of breakfast every morning which meant that you could leave the hotel and get on with exploring. Good choice of food and drinks available. Free tea, coffee and water available throughout the day in reception. Would definitely stay here again if we come back to NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights in September 2019.This is a really good hotel in an excellent location. Both Times Square and the Port Authority Bus Station subway stations are just a few minutes walk away, making it easy to get to the various sights around the city. Despite the hotel being in a very busy area, it was quiet at night. The rooms are fairly small, but we weren’t in the room a great deal so this wasn’t a problem. We had a king bed, which was very comfortable and we slept well.Breakfast is included in the room rate, and there is a good selection of food available. Although the breakfast area was very busy, we never had to wait more than a minute to find a table. We were well looked after by Geraldine, who came to have a chat with us every morning about our plans for the day, which was a really nice way to start the day.All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and we found the hotel to be a perfect base for sightseeing in New York. This would be our first choice hotel if we were in New York again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very clean and welcoming. Great location! Rooms were nice and ok in size. I had never been to NYC so I had only heard of the rooms there being extremely small. I would definitely stay there again if I’m ever in NYC again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and daily breakfast. Walkable to Times Square, theatre district, subway across the street. Staff was wonderful! Beds super comfy! The only thing missing was a bar during the evening but the Gleaton’s pub is right Nextdoor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cannot understand why anyone would not like this hotel. Great position, just off Times Square. Lovely rooms, quiet and spacious. Great breakfast, lovely staff, would like to Mention Olivia on reception and Geraldine the breakfast supervisor but they were all brilliant. Couldn’t fault them. I have stayed in many hotels in NY over the years but if I come again this is where I am going to stay. Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hotel. Love the security feature in the elevators. Great thought out feature. Room clean and love the thought put into the astethic of the room. So many TV channels first I have ever had that experience. Live layout.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is strictly for tourists. Beds were very hard and not comfortable to sleep in. Morning breakfast was average, and was always crowded. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Location in the middle of times square and surrounded by over-priced restaurants. 31 Floor and about 12 rooms per floor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at this hotel.i cannot rate it highly enough!! The location is perfect-just off Times Square. Our room was immaculate..we requested a high floor and had lovely views. Breakfast is included for everyone and we all thoroughly enjoyed the selection every morning. We particularly really liked Geraldine the breakfast supervisor,she is such a lovely person and very knowledgeable.she made our breakfast a great experience!!!it was such a great start to every day. Also there are no resort fees. I am hoping to return to this hotel next year.wonderful staff and wonderful memories.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great convenient location, the rate was very reasonable and included an excellent breakfast. Nice work out room too. We were warmly welcomed by Ferrel, and he sent a welcome email before our arrival. We really enjoyed Geraldine Meehan, and her smiles and eagerness to help at breakfast. Overall, a great experience and stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Reception was efficient. I liked that the hotel was very close to the subway, and action. The bed was very comfortable, and sound proofing was great, even with the lift outside our door, we hardly heard anything. There’s also a laundry room, with efficient dryers that dried all our laundry in one round. The breakfast had two hot items, eggs of some type and sausages or bacon. You can also make your own waffles. Otherwise there was juice, milk, cereals, bread, yoghurt and fruit. There’s also Geraldine who was a joy to have around. She makes sure the breakfast area is in tip top condition.I was a little conscious that we were using a lot of disposable paper plates, cups and plastic utensils. So guests may want to bring their own reusable utensils and crockery.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I don't think you can find a better overall hotel in this area! It is just a block or two off the craziness of Times Square with a subway stop right across the street from the hotel. It's a close walk to the Theaters and many restaurants. One of the best parts was having a breakfast included before starting our busy day. Yes the breakfast room does get busy as mentioned but we always found a seat and there is additional seating in the lobby if you make a plate and take it out there. Great variety at breakfast - if you don't like the hot options there was always much more - smoothies, bagels, fruit, muffins etc. One day we had to be at Good Morning America at 6:00 am and they had grab and go breakfast ready in a bag at the front desk and we grabbed a coffee and ate breakfast in line for GMA. Not buying breakfast or coffee saved us a lot in NYC! It was also nice that the hotel had water, coffee, tea etc available in the lobby 24/7 and cookies often as well. Everyone we encountered at Hampton was friendly and eager to help in any way needed. Good value for the money - we paid ~$350 per night but remember you are in the heart of Manhattan and breakfast included. We ended up getting Sunday night half price through a Hilton Honors promotion. On a side note - had dinner at the bar next door (Gleason's Tavern) one night when we were tired and food was great and enjoyed talking to bartender and a few locals.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location is great and the price we paid through Agoda was quite reasonable by New York standard. We stayed here for four nights during September 2019 in a two double bed room.Check in and out was fast and efficient. Room and bathroom size was good. Room amenities included tea/coffee facility, room safe and standard bathroom supplies. The entire hotel was very clean and housekeeping did a good job.The staff we came across was helpful and efficient. We organized our car to Newark airport through the hotel and the price was ok and service timely.We could not check out the rooftop view but view from the room was fine.There is a small shop at the lobby for soft drinks and similar items which was helpful for us. The hotel also provides free tea and coffee at the lobby.Considering what I have written so far it should have been five stars but I cannot give that due to problem with elevators and breakfast.As mentioned by others, there are only three elevators and it is not enough for a hotel of this size during the morning rush hours which starts around 8 am. We had to wait for nearly twenty minutes to get into the elevator one day. If you are going to the airport in the morning then make sue you have sufficient time in hand.The hotel provides breakfast which in included in the room rate. The food was ok but the size of the breakfast room is too small with insufficient seating arrangements. Unless you start your breakfast before 7 am getting a table is doubtful. In fact we had to skip the hotel breakfast one day as there were no place to sit and it was way beyond over crowded. Please note there is no other restaurant at the hotel.As a conclusion if you are looking for central location, decent price and a clean hotel and will not mind avoiding the morning rush and skip hotel breakfast then this is highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a 10 days stay and we only have good things to say:- all staff are fantastic helpful. - room had an OK size with a kingsize bed, a big TV with lots of channels and a very nice bathroom with a big shower. Only thing was that the aircon was a bit loud, but it works fine and is easy to adjust.- access to washing machine, dryer and fitness in the basement.I would like to point out that the breakfast (managed by Geraldine) in our opinion was very good. Others have said it was simple and basic but it has all you need for a good start, all is fresh and the service is great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spectacular service and extreme professionalism working with Lily, Farrell, Will, Geraldine, Benson & Johnny. They treated us like family and it absolutely impacted our fun experience! We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. Keep up the great work!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and had a blast.Excellent location close all the theaters, attractions, restaurants that Times Square has to offer. Complementary Full hot breakfast and Wifi throughout the hotel is a plis. Just minutes walk to the Subway, Bryant Park and Wholefoods

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a very nice hotel and the staff was very helpful and personable. This is in a good location near theaters and subway. Close to Bryant Park. It is nice to be able to depend on the Hampton brand.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was so central for everything in Times Square, and easy reach of the subways. The staff were absolutely fantastic and couldn’t do enough for us. Highly recommend this hotel, and we’ll definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Decent value, but nothing special. We've stayed at other Hilton hotels in the area and would probably recommend them. The rooms and bathrooms are very small and crowded- the staff was very friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel for its location at Times Square, close to many attractions, and by its convenient price. The room was comfortable and clean, good beds and ample bathroom. Both the room and the common areas are well kept and feel almost new.The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and it gets crowded at rush hour. But with a little patience we always managed to get a table. There are also snacks sold at the lobby and complimetary coffee.Definitely a good experience and we will be coming back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is ideally placed for sight seeing in New York just seconds from Times Square. The staff are lovely and friendly. The buffet breakfast gets you off to a good start. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights the hotel is in a great location just a minute walk and you are in the heart of Times Square.The hotel was clean with a good selection for breakfast.The staff was helpful and welcoming. Loved the free selection of hot drinks which was available all day and night. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is not worth $312+taxes! The room was clean, but very dated. The shower head fell off while I was in the shower! Breakfast was a chaotic mess that was truly a survival of the fittest! There were few breakfast choices and it was difficult finding a seat. Trash cans were overflowing and in desperate need of attention. We’ve stayed in Hamptons many times and have always found them to be nice, clean hotels and a great value. Hampton should be embarrassed by this Times Square property!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If a central location is important this hotel is a solid choice. Despite being so close to Times Square the hotel rooms are quiet and comfortable. Plenty of restaurants, deli s and food options around, not high quality in this area but good enough after a days sightseeing. Only 5mins from the hoho bus stop. There’s a small selection of snacks, a microwave and free tea and coffee in the foyer and a coffee machine in the room. No fridge though, which is a bit of a shame. Observation deck on 31st floor open until 7pm for good views of the skyline.Breakfast is, as others have said, very basic - plastic cutlery and paper cups and plates. Front desk are a bit laid back - this is not the Hilton! But it’s very clean, comfortable and good value. Oh; should you need it the aircon is quite noisy; but the window does open a few inches!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose the Hampton because of its location on West 41st and we were not disappointed. WE arrived early afternoon and our room 1203 was ready, although it did not have a great view as we were at the rear of the hotel it was clean of a good size and very quite, the beds were some of the best we have slept in and the shower was powerful and hot.But it is all about location you are minutes away from the subway and bus stations and 10 minutes walk from Hells Kitchen and Bryant Park 15 from the Empire State Building, Times Square is literally around the corner.We were up early so no queues for either the lifts or breakfast which was varied and more than adequate to set you up for a day pounding the streets of New York. The all day free tea coffee and hot chocolate was much appreciated.The hotel is busy but reception staff were always available to answer questions, we had an afternoon flight and a late complimentary check out and secure luggage store made our day.Overall an excellent mid range hotel that goes above and beyond. WE would defiantly stay again and would highly recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A very good place. The location is very good to visit the heart of Manhattan. Very close to Time Square, near from Central Park, Madison Square Garden and Penn Station and others places to visit in midtown. The room was very pleasant and very clean. The breakfast was good. I recommand this place.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location for seeing Broadway shows. Easy access to Port Authority and NYC subway. Very impressed with every encounter with staff. Clean & friendly. Very good breakfast. Room was 3006 - and surprisingly quiet.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel for the location and managed to walk everywhere! Hotel spotlessly clean, great staff including cleaning staff and reception but the best was Geraldine who manages the breakfast room, what a lovely lady so friendly and efficient and even remembered guests who had returned after 5 months! Weekends breakfast room is very busy but week days not so much. Good selection available every day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is 5 to 10 minutes walking distance to Times square. I stayed for 6 days. Complimentary breakfast. Friendly staffs at breakfast area and friendly front desk. Clean hotel. Will stay again. Thank you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: this hotel is expensive for regular hotel ,small room , cleanliness is regular not perfect , the free breakfast is only a free line ,but the worst is the time lost waiting for the elevator , never less than 10 minutes

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I disagree with other reviews. Room was very small 2 people barely fit in the room. Bathroom will only accommodate 1 person with a very tight fit. Had an issue with a tub that didn’t drain & needed maintenance. Adequate towels were not stocked, we had to call down daily for more. Carpet was separating. Comforter was piled. Sheets were marked with black streaks. Breakfast food and quality were inconsistent. Beds are very small for 2 people. Hallway has no air flow. Hall noise especially door slamming can be heard inside room. Still waiting on unresolved credit. At $349 per night I didn’t consider it a value. Parking is $58 per night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent the last 4 days of our holiday in New York and the hotel was a perfect location for visiting most of the tourist attractions we visited.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was good although the restaurant could be very busy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were desperate the hotel we had booked cancelled our reservation and being Friday night in Time Square area, we had little choice. I told our situation to the staff , still we were charged prime rate still no extra benefit. Breakfast not worth extra pay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great central location. Updated, very clean, very quiet. Very pleasant, efficient staff. Stayed on 31st floor. No problem with elevators. Great city view. Breakfast was a little crowded but plenty of food. Very nice to stay in NYC. Enjoy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The last hotel I booked was very disappointing- my view was a brick wall, and room was damp and musty. ( won’t mention name). Hampton inn Times Square central was a wonderful surprise ! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like old friends returning home! The hotel and rooms were spotless. My view from 25 floor was awesome ! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. It’s near EVERYTHING - shopping, restaurants, wax museum, ripleys, etc. can’t wait to come back to this hotel for my next “ mini- vacation from Staten Island. We were in NYC celebrating my daughters 15 birthday, and I couldn’t have been happier with the accommodations. THANK YOU HAMPTON INN !!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Last year I was in NYC at a another chain hotel a few blocks more south around 38st and didn’t like the area. But this Hampton Inn on 41st between 7-8th Ave was perfect! Much better area right in the theatre area. My wife felt very safe in this area during the day and evening. I liked the fact that the subway is a half block away as well as the Port Authority bus terminal where the convenient affordable airport buses are coming and going. The theatre district is full of fine restaurants and Hells Kitchen area is only a few blocks away. The Hampton is moderately priced and I like that they have complimentary breakfast each morning. Our two queen room was large and had a refrigerator. One convenience we missed though was a room safe. Service is pretty good by the staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect midtown location.We were in town to see shows and were within 8 blocks of all the theatres.Lovely lobby with unlimited 24/7 cold water & coffee plus refreshments for purchase.Olivia checked us in within 2 minutes.We wanted the option to hop down the stairs quickly, so we requested a low floor and got Room 409, a corner room beside the stairwell. We could've used the elevator but ended up using the stairs over half the time - we're young & fit & don't mind stairs, and it eliminates any issues with waiting for an elevator. Breakfast buffet is a HUGE perk. Super-friendly staff in the breakfast room, big smiles, hard-working- great way to start the day: waffles, eggs, bacon or sausage, fresh fruit, smoothies, cereal, pastries, yogurt, etc. Try to hit the buffet as early as possible to avoid the 9-10 AM chaos. Our room was ultra clean, contemporary. Comfy bed, quiet room. The subway entrances across the street are a huge plus- get the $34 7-day (no 5-day) unlimited metro card and it pays for itself quickly. Port Authority 5 min walk from hotel. We give this Hampton 5 stars and will recommend it often.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very convinient place. Free brekfast, but overcrouded during weekend. Free coffee and tea in the loby and in the room. Nice and freandly personel. Very clean room. It was cleaned in the morning during brekfast. High quallity wifi.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really convenient location . Across the street from the Subway and Port Authority bus station which is the fast way to get to Newark Airport. Complimentary breakfast is a real plus . Lobby has coffee and Water available 24x7 which is another nice perk. Close to Times Square, Penn Station, Bryant Park and 5th Avenue.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was great. . . Might be typical of a big city but service was nothing to shout about. . It wasn’t bad by any means. . Just that you’d expect a bit more for the price paid. The room I booked was advertised as a family room with 2 double beds. . . You’d probably want 2 queen sized beds to be comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a good hotel location-wise, and the staff is great. The breakfast room can get very crowded, so I had to bring breakfast to my room more than once. Waiting for the elevator can be a bit challenging, but they are efficient once you get one. Avoid high traffic times or you will have quite a wait. They provide complimentary water, cookies, and a to-go snack in the morning, which is great. I would recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I really enjoyed this great location between Times Square and Hells Kitchen.We were walking distance like a block to Times Square and 10 Minutes walk from Rockefeller center,Grand Central and 15 minutes walk from Central Park.But We were a 5 minute walk from Hells kitchen for lots of amazing restaurants and shops at local prices.FYI Many items are about 40% lower outside Times square and restaurant prices are about 30%. less.All a 5-10 minute walk away west away from Times Square.Hotel was clean and their hot breakfast buffet was a good budget extender with lots of good hot and cold choicesStaff was amazing with polite and a very helpful attitude.Special kudos to Luis who was amazing with his tips on where to go,shop and eat.He was a porter but acted like a hotel concierge.He was a great source of information Rachel at reception was amazing and because our flight came in early morning.We were dead tired so she arranged an early check in and had us resting earlier then normal.Great location and people.I will be back for sure on my next New York visit

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay. Our family was made to feel like valued guests. Our room was not huge, but it was clean with new furnishings. Housekeeping and front desk were very attentive. And the breakfast was such a terrific benefit—good hot coffee made every day start strong.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Your hotel team were awesomely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with our questions. They went above and beyobd our expectations and are an exception to your company. We Thank You for a wonderful experience...

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location right next to several subway stations nearby. Times square and Broadway are right around the corner. So are most theaters and Bryant Park. Helpful staff and John the concierge is a keeper. Delicious free breakfast. Impeccable service and housekeeping (they actually respect when you display the "Do not disturb" sign on your door). Cheap laundry service.Everyday they provide you with free beverages such as tea, coffee, hot water, fresh water all day long right next to the front desk. They even have a little grocery shop with snacks, ice creams, microwaveable hot dishes, laundry powder, first aid kits, etc. Very handy.Decent bedroom size with very comfortable mattresses. Good bathroom as well. You won't regret it if you opt for the bedroom with a city view, above all at night.We highly recommend this hotel and would go there again without hesitation. Well worth the price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent find with a consistent hotel chain. Outstanding customer service, texts to confirm and answer any questions was a nice new feature. Clean, updated hotel. Right in the middle of everything. Short walk to Wolfgang Restaurant, across from the stage door to Aladin!Easy walk to all Broadway shows and times square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cooling/heating system is probably the worst noisy equipment I have found in an hotel in US. You will have the choice: trying to sleep in presence of this noise or switching off the system and having a warm temperature in summer or a cold one in winter. Secondly, when the system is in function a moldy odor is present, which means that the system needs to be seriously cleaned and the filter if any to be changed. This point is also important : it is related to questions de safety issues.Finally I would suggest to inspect all the duvets because the hidden part of the duvet in my room included brown spots… Disgusting.Maybe I am wrong but I think that this situation is not at the standard of an Hilton hotel and at the level of the price the customer pays for.I hope to the hotel manager to make a good use of my criticisms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location for our stay in NYC - close to subway, Times Square, quiet, clean, helpful staff, good breakfast, good value. Super comfy bed and larger than expected room size for NYC. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just yards from Times Square so very convenient for transport links. - but surprisingly quiet. Good size rooms and breakfast was very good with a very good choice. Yes it gets busy at times but we always found a table. Would definitely use again if we went back to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros:Location, comfort, breakfastCons: No mention about $20 a day incidental fee when we checked in until we questioned the extra amount. A $48 "glitch" was added to our bill in which no one was able to explain how it got there. Not enough elevators for staff and guests. Hard to get an elevator when cleaning staff is doing their work (can't blame the staff).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We experienced our best 48th Anniversary celebration at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central. Lilly was at the desk and was extremely generous with us. She was able to get us a room on the 7th Floor. We had extra time to relax and prepare for our first Off-Broadway Show. The location is fabulous-close to the Subway, restaurants, Times Square and other places of interest. The free breakfast the next morning was out of this world. The variety of foods was phenomenal. Darren was especially helpful in keeping the breakfast selection plentiful. We will be sure to book this hotel again-our experience was priceless. The manager deserves accolades for running the best hotel ever.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the time I arrived, I had fabulous service at the front desk with Tobo & Olivia, greeting us with water bottles & warm welcome! Benson at breakfast was also great! Food was very good, varied each day & staff allowed us to stay a few minutes after end time to relax. Hotel was clean, quiet & in a great location. My friend & I were traveling with our girls & were both very worried about the elevator situation. We had no delays over four days coming in and out at different times. Definitely will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived here after a long journey from the UK. We were allocated our room but were a little disappointed as our Travel Agent had sent in a request for a nice view and also to see if they could do something special as it was my husband's 50th birthday, there wasn't anything special and the view was rubbish. We soon found out there wasn't a shower curtain so every time we showered everywhere got soaked. We mentioned the above points, and so did my travel agent and between Emanuel and Christina we were moved higher up in the hotel with a better view, and to make it special they had put a balloon, card and some cakes from Carlo's bakery, that was amazing as I LOVE cake boss! This room was good but a little noisier than lower down but ok. Breakfast was lovely and we never had to wait for a table, there was everything you could want even different hot options and waffle batter flavours every day. Coffee, hot and cold water available in the lobby every day. Great hotel all in all, the only reason I gave it 4 was purely because of the noise. Would stay again. :-)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My flight was canceled at JFK and I needed a place to stay as early as possible in the morning. The hotel told me to come and they would get me in as soon as they could but it would probably be around 12 PM. When I got there at 6:30 AM, they allowed me to have a free breakfast and the staff were so helpful and so friendly and they hurried as quickly as possible and were able to accommodate me and get me a room by 9:30 AM. A special thank you to Delia snd Emmanuel for making sure I got a room as early as possible and letting me have a nice breakfast while I was waiting. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The location is perfect. It is on the corner of Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to New York. Highly recommended! Patricia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a lovely friendly hotel. Very welcoming and helpful.Rooms alittle on the small side but adequate. Breakfast was good and in the evenings there are muffins/ cookies available on reception desk along with help yourself hot drinks.Great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn is known for their complimentary breakfast, but this hotel offers so much more. From the moment we arrived, to when we checked out 4 days later, the room and staff were incredible. This should be your go to ‘home away from home’ hotel experience in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While not a big hotel, it provides all the things one needs in a chain hotel. It is on a side street a bit of a walk, but not far from both Penn Station and Javits Center. Rooms are not large but work fine for what you need. Don't expect anything too fancy. It is clean and the staff is very friendly

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for a second time. Lovely welcoming staff who always had time to have a word with you. Rooms are not huge but big enough. Clean and great shower room. Free breakfast was a bu us with a good selection of food. Tea abc coffee available all day. Not too far from Times Square and Broadway. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived at 9am in the midst of thunderstorm. When we asked if we could just check our bags, so we could explore nyc, we were offered the free breakfast. After breakfast we saw some sights and returned at 1230pm just to freshen up before yankees game. Our room was ready for us, 3 hours early! Great staff, very friendly and helpful. Great find in the middle of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service is excellent from check in to breakfast and cleaning .We arrived early and they let uscheck in and We also had the breakfast after check in. I went to the concierge she was very helpful . She help me plan out our days to beat the crowds ,with subway trains and sightseeing buses schedules and gave me maps . Our room was on the 30th floor beautiful view of New York,people in other reviews said elevator was slow but we never waited longer than 5 minutes.hotel was walking distance to theaters and time square , top of rock and many other attractions . Love the breakfast smoothies and the cookies in the evening.!photos are views from our room.We will be back!Thank You making us feel welcome

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Just a few blocks from Times Square. Walking distance to many of the sightseeing places and to all broadway shows. Always clean rooms and comfortable beds. Would definitely stay there again. Loved it!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice place to stay and so close to Times Square with great comfortable beds and walk in shower. Very clean. Great breakfast with a lovely breakfast supervisor called Geraldine who is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Rooms comfortable and clean. Water and coffee in lobby were greatly appreciated after long walks around New York City. All staff were very helpful and friendly. Would stay here on next trip to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It is bang in the middle of Times Square: noisy, smelly and gritty. The staff were very good. Hotel is smallish. There is laundry on site. Hampton Inns have quite lousy breakfasts including this one. I would go back, but not soon.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Excellent staff. Quiet rooms. Best complimentary breakfast I have ever had. The cold water every day was very appreciated in the lobby. NYC is HOT in July! Stay on a lower floor. The elevator can take quite a while. Don't miss going up to the rooftop.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton Inn during the NYC heat wave. The hotel was very well appointed, very reasonably priced and the Staff was Outstanding.The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Jeremy and Lily at the front desk were so professional and friendly. Geraldine, the breakfast supervisor was genuinely friendly and her staff were All very friendly and helpful. The hotel was spotless and the decor was very pretty. The rooms were very well appointed, the bathrooms were great. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While the location of the hotel is good with easy access to the subway, theaters, and restaurants, there were a few negatives that kept me from giving the hotel a top rating. First, the housekeeping staff were very inconsistent during our eight night stay. Some days they left no coffee packets, other days they left all decaf, and one day they left coffee but no plastic insert to use the machine. The bottom sheet on the bed was too small for the mattress and kept coming undone at the corners of the bed. Also, we had to ask to have the sheets changed even though we were staying over a week. Second, the wait for the elevator was VERY long in the morning while breakfast was being served. Housekeeping (with supply carts) seemed to use the same elevators as the guests so that complicated the process. The final negative was the crowded breakfast area, lack of sufficient seating and the mediocre quality of the food. After a few days, we ate at places near the hotel. There were other positives in addition to the location. When it rained, the front desk staff loaned us umbrellas. They were both friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, a few hundred feet from Times Square and easy access via subway. Staff is friendly and the free breakfast is a great way to start the day. Coin laundromat in house. Overall a great base for a visit to NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has a great staff. Everyone was friendly, helpful and courteous. The complentary breakfast was always full but the staff kept the tables clean and they made sure the replenished the food fast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thank you for asking. It's a fantastic place to stay here at Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square NY. We are very grateful for the amazing customer service and the great breakfast with the friendly environment and staff!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I expected this to be a typical big city hotel—cramped and dirty with poor AC and bad plumbing. I tried to prep my family for what was in store. We were very pleasantly surprised! The room was recently updated and immaculately clean. It wasn’t huge, but our family of 4 (two in their teens) did just fine. AC and bathroom were flawless.The price might seem high for a Hampton Inn, but keep in mind that you’re in NYC. We have a friend who got us a room rate nearby for more than twice the price. We’ve stayed at that place before and know it’s in nowhere near as nicely kept.A couple of things you have to know, and this is probably a big city issue more than a problem with the hotel—you have to anticipate the crowd/time. Go to breakfast early. Our first morning, we had an early tour so we had the place pretty much to ourselves at 7. The next day at 10 was a different story! (They do have food that you can just grab and go) The hotel has four elevators and maybe 26 floors of about a dozen rooms each. At peak times, you WILL be waiting for the elevator. Anticipate or take the stairs.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We choose this hotel because of the location. It is a typical Hampton Inn. Clean with comfortable beds. The eating area is much too small for the size of hotel. So not a good value if free breakfast is important to traveler.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Next door to time square and broadway shows.Room is spacious.Most front staff were nice and professional but this african american staff who does not have a name tag on his uniform was not up to standard. I tired to exchange some bills to coins for laundry with him and he took my money and just could not finish his chat with his asian female front desk colleage before he passed the coins to me... There was never smile on his face either. It took like 5 min to finish the exchange. Thats way too long and thr attitude is not acceptable for a hotel of this level.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great experience with this hotel. The staff are excellent and really looked after us. The room was a good size and very clean. Breakfast can be a challenge with the amount of people for the size of the room but the breakfast staff are outstanding and are always available to help. We will be back!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a well managed, centrally located hotel convenient to all the Broadway shows and the events around Times Square. It has the convenience of a breakfast buffet like other Hampton Inns. It gets very busy in the mid-morning but the food is stocked and everyone helps keeping tables clear. The three elevators are constantly busy. Be ready for rush hour if you're checking out and need to grab a cab for a plane.There is a concierge who can help with tickets though we didn't use any services.The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For this trip we planned on seeing Hamilton at the Richard Rodgers theatre. This Hamtpon was approximately 5 blocks from the theatre, and right next to the theatre where as of Summer 2019 Pretty Woman is playing and right across the street from the theatre where Aladdin is playing. The New York Port Authority Bus depot is right at the end of the street in case you plan on using public transport out of the city via bus. However, if you are looking for hotel which is a good central location of Broadway plays, Time Square, the Garment District, etc., this hotel is a great central location. Also, the hotel itself is nicely upgraded and modern. As you would expect in New York, the rooms are smaller than the standard Hampton Inn, but they are not uncomfortable and are clean. Also, the complimentary breakfast has a wide assortment of food options. Please note the sign outside the breakfast room which lets you know when the breakfast room is the busiest. Despite this, the staff did a wonderful job of keeping the breakfast items stocked and the area clean. Overall, an excellent Hampton Inn experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Accommodations were exactly as stated. Great location, comfy bed, nice hot breakfast, professional and courteous staff. Location is perfect if you are going to see a Broadway show, shopping or need the subway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I’ve stayed here many times. It’s located right in Times Square. Subway station is literally one minute away. Broadway shows are all within a 10-minute walk of hotel. Everything is updated and clean. Staff are awesome. Continental breakfast does the trick. You can grab a bag to go if you’re in the run. Contains fruit, muffin, water, granola bar kind of goodies. You could save a few bucks elsewhere, but you’ll probably be disappointed. They will hold your bags if you arrive early or if you have to check out, but have touring time before getting to the airport.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is centrally located in Manhattan between 7th and 8th Avenues. It's convenient to both Penn Station and the Port Authority. Our room was clean and comfortable. We were pleased with the front desk's recommendation to stay a corner room on a lower floor. It was quieter, and we could use the stairs instead of the small, crowded elevators. The breakfast buffet was OK (and free!), but became very crowded on weekend mornings.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A 10+ mins telephone call is charged for US$ 300. This is like a robbery. My handphone is not able to make a phone call for unknown reason so I use hotel desk telephone to call a Singapore number. No fee board of telephone charges is in the room.When I checked out the hotel and was informed that this phone call costs around US$ 300. After negotiations, an "offer" of US$150 is still charged. I feel terrible about this.Are we still live in Stone Age when a telephone calls cost you hundreds of dollars? If you want to charge a high fee, at least a fee notice should be put near the telephone to make your customer aware. The staff is nice and friendly. But the telephone charge ruined the experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Farrell, Lilly, and Kevin at the front desk went above and beyond to make our short stay incredible. The housekeeping staff were amazing as well. Thank you for taking such great care of us. This is my go to hotel in NYC because of the great staff and great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel can not be beat. So close to all of the times square attractions, the subway, and the bus terminal if you are arriving in on the Newark Airport Express bus from the EWR airport (just a half of a block walk from the bus terminal to the hotel). We arrived before check in, and the hotel desk stored our bags in a locked room so that we could explore the city until our room was ready. We chose a room on the second floor due to reading reviews about the hassle with the elevators. We are glad we made this choice. The convenience of taking the stairs (4 flights of stairs from the lobby to the second floor) during the breakfast rush made us very happy with our decision. We did not see any problems with elevator wait times at any other point during the day throughout our one week stay in June though. It is really just a concern at breakfast time. On the first day, we lucked out and found one dining table open to eat at during breakfast. The other days, it was so busy, that we just took our food back up to our room and ate there due to lack of seating. Take note of the sign that the hotel posts about breakfast busy times - we found it to be pretty accurate, so to avoid a wait, go early! The room was nice and clean. The beds were okay - not the most comfy, but not the worst. We were worried about street noise being on the second floor, but it was not a problem at all. There is the occasional siren that you hear, but other than that, noise was not that bad because 41st street was not a particularly noisy street. The only problem we had with the room was actually a pretty annoying problem. Mosquitoes! We kept finding mosquitoes in our room and I am highly allergic to mosquito bites - where the bites turn into welts, then bruises, then blisters - not fun. Well, we would kill the ones we would see, but I still would get bit. Then we would leave for the day and come back in the evening and find that the room had more mosquitoes! I don't know how they were getting in. We did notice that the windows to the outside opened slightly, so my guess is that housekeeping either opened the windows while they were cleaning each day which let in the mosquitoes, or they were traveling through the vents. Either way, I have never had a mosquito problem in a hotel room like I did here. No matter how many we would kill, there were more, and they kept biting me so that I would wake up with fresh bites each morning. I did mention the problem upon checkout, so hopefully they can address where the mosquito problem is coming from and treat it. However, even with the mosquitoes, this really was a lovely hotel and a very friendly staff - we really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything was excellent. We arrived to New York and our AirBnb host didn’t answer our phone calls our messages to instruct us on how to enter the property. We called a Hilton hotel for a room they informed us they were fully booked and contacted Hampton in for us which was absolutely perfect for the night and breakfast was amazing. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I just spent four nights here. The location is perfect. The rooms are wonderful, clean, and perfect in every way. Although we would have preferred to have two separate beds, they only had king-size beds available. That wasn't a problem at all. The bathrooms are great - good shower. Kind and friendly service, and good breakfasts. Honestly, the location cannot be beat. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was perfect. Within walking distance to everything. Room was clean, breakfast was busy and completely packed unless you go early but that is to be expected. The breakfast staff worked VERY hard to keep up and keep the area clean. Olyvia at the front desk was wonderful!! She had very helpful advise and was able to answer all my dumb tourist questions with a smile. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel,very intelligent front desk staff ,very nice breakfast persons love my room the first day but I think as someone that travel a lot professionalism is something that I look out for and I didn’t fine that with supervisor and her staff they were talking Spanish which I fine is okay but too loud I was staying on the 7th floor which I taught being low it would be better but it wasn’t a part from that friendly staff but they need to know how to conduct there self

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our family's first trip to NYC and we had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn! All of the staff; Lilly, Hicham, Geraldine, Luis, and Joseph our bellman, were professional, patient with all of our questions, and genuinely kind people! We will be recommending this hotel to all of our friends and family!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything about my recent stay was extraordinary. I rate hotels vs other hotels in the same value/cost. I arrived early and simply wanted to check my bag and return later and check in. The gentleman at the front desk told me my room would be ready in a few minutes and invited me to have a coffee while I wait - my room was ready in 5 minutes! My room was spacious- for midtown NYC and very clean. The complimentary breakfast was equally as excellent. Every time I returned to the hotel I was always greeted with a smile and friendly words, whether it be the front desk, housekeeping or a bellman. special shout out to Kris and Tobore at the front desk - outstanding hospitality!An excellent stay and hotel I have since returned to often and will again and again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a very conveniently located property with a helpful and skilled staff. Just outside the heart of Times Square, this location is walking distance from TS, the subway, the theatre district, and a number of good restaurants.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect place to stay in New York! Perfect staff! I would definitely come again! In the heart of Manhattan, two steps from the main places to visit during your stay (Times Square, 5th avenue, Broadway theaters, Central station etc.) and the most famous landmarks (Flatiron District, Empire State Bld., Chrysler Bld., UN headquarters, Central Park etc.).Many subway stations on the corner to go everywhere (Brooklyn, downtown Manhattan, Harlem etc.), and only 10' walking from/to Penn station. I needed the subway just to visit Brooklyn and Downtown Manhattan (Wall street etc.) but I walk a lot. Anyway, the subway stations are in every corner and as I said they can bring you everywhere. Also there are taxis everywhere (Times Square is a few meters away, so...). There is always, coffee, water, tea etc. at the lobby which is very handy. Also there are usb charging points at the room, so you may not need US adaptors for your phones.I was lucky and got a room with an amazing view, with skyscrapers and the first billboards as we approach the Times Square. The room and the bathroom are quite spacious, and the king size bed is perfect for a couple.The staff make your stay very pleasant. Everyone is very kind and helpful at the lobby (reception), breakfast room, cleaning etc. Also, after check out, they allowed me to leave my luggage at a locker room and I was able to enjoy my last day. I would definitely come again, and I hope they will give me the same room!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great location, few blocks from Times Square,and the Central Park, wonderful staff and very proffesional - speacially the front desk personel - great room 100% clean, amazing breakfast (included in the price you pay for the room), coffee and tea 24/7, friendly, an office center avalable 24/7 (no fee).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was great. Subway station was right across the street. Staff was very courteous and accommodating. Room was clean and beds were very comfortable. Had an issue with a clogged drain in the shower. Someone was at our door within 20 minutes of calling. Lots of selection at the free breakfast. Would stay here again and highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay at this Hampton Inn. At first wasn't happy with room size, it was small, (city view king) and lack of some amenities - no mini fridge or microwave. Don't know if that's a code thing for NYC or not, unlike other Hamptons that offer them. Made our reservation directly, the woman on the phone was wonderful and so helpful. Upon arrival in late afternoon, valet didn't take long and helpful while we were putting things on cart to bring in. Yes it's a bit pricey per day for valet but much rather have my car to get there and go home. You don't take it out other than that. Had city view king size room with great view, especially first day, only day we actually saw any sun, can't blame hotel for weather. When I first saw room, wasn't thrilled. Far smaller than any Hampton Inn room I'd had, felt a bit old, purple carpet needs to go, purple black out drapes don't exactly black out, they'reabout 2 inches too short so the light comes streaming in morning time, night time not too bad but the city lights definitely act like a big night light thru the drapes.Hotel pics show a king size room as having a comfortable looking sitting chair but when we got up there, it was only a work desk and chair. Coming to NYC there's a lot of walking and I wanted a comfortable chair to relax in and was shown as part of the room. Went down to the front desk to ask where said chair was, young woman said she didn't know what rooms had those chairs (?) but a manager was right there and immediately said they would bring a chair up to our room. To their credit, chair arrived in 5 minutes delivered by a nice gentleman from housekeeping. We smooshed it in next to the end corner of the bed as the room wasn't that big. Like to see less workspace size and rigid work chair and more of a nice true comfortable sitting chair to relax and enjoy that view with at the end of the day, especially for the cost of the rooms...yes I know it's NYC, rooms are pricey but for pricey I want it comfy. Not much room to put clothes away, 3 small drawers attached to work space desk and a closet. Kept our things in our suitcases for 4 days, used closet to hang up a couple of things. Bathroom, was spacious enough, housekeeping would just give us more towels when we asked. Was disappointed to start putting things out on the counter and realized there was someone's hair right by the hotel soaps and it wasn't mine. Countertop didn't seem clean rest of bathroom did. Broke out some hand sanitizer and wiped down counter and got rid of hair. The duvet didn't have the usual card on it as other Hamptons that say it's basically fresh and clean, always a nice touch to see but not this go around so far as a note but appeared clean. Elevators, in our 4 days we never waited anytime I would even consider close to being long and we were in and out of the building frequently and close to a top floor. Elevator was quick once we got in and selected our floor. Roof top observation deck bit of a let down, expecting more like a patio type but guess that's not possible up on a 32nd floor and there wasn't really a lot of room up there, but it's worth taking a quick look around.
