Bed, comfortable, shower, always hot water, room, much smaller than I expected a king city view would be. Quiet except for heavy slam sound of neighboring doors. For so many people being there, we had quiet nights. Breakfast was busy but we got in, got our food and we did find seating each day. Waffles are always available and cereals, fruit, muffins, yogurt, juice, coffee, teas, bacon, sausage, etc. It would be nice to offer scrambled eggs every day and then an extra option like the western omelet or plain cheese omelet but that's just personal choice. But still a little hint to the Hampton Inn for breakfast offering. Geraldine works in the breakfast area, she is sweet, happy and hard working. Tea, coffee, cocoa, cold water, etc available all day by registration desk. All in all for a first time stay, we enjoyed it. Hotel staff polite and helpful.With volume of people coming to front desk it can get hectic, but it's a customer service job, for the most part all the staff seemed customer service oriented. Not sure of other Hamptons in area, may check them out but overall this was a good experience, wish room was a bit more comfortable in size but location was fantastic.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Decent enough hotel with atrocious front desk service. The second I checked in, I got nothing but derision from the woman I was speaking to. When I had a problem that was ultimately the hotel's fault, there was no movement from anyone at the front desk or the manager or even an apology for my inconvenience. Yeah, they provide beds, but hospitality is meant to be more than that. I won't be staying here again.(Also, God help you if you have anywhere to be in the morning, because the elevators take ten minutes to arrive, if you're lucky.)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel, location perfect, very helpful, informative staff. Made 5 days in New York a most memorable time. If you want to be in the heart of the action but also want a quiet comfortable nightsleep, this is the hotel for you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn Time Square Central location. Everything was very clean and the staff was super kind and accommodating! We were able to check in early and then on the day we checked out the staff held our bags for us so that we didn't have to carry them around the city with us until we were ready to leave. I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed recently in this hotel and In summary it is a good hotel, but have some issues that must be attended by managent as soon as possible if they want to receive a 4-5 stars review.Issue #1, the curtains are not blacked out 100%, light enters the room from all sides, and as you may understand in times squares there is lights 24/7. Also the noise coming from outside is terrrible, some soundproofing would be much appreciated. I couldn’t sleep well because of this.Issue #2, the elevators take a lot of time and are most of the times full. I think 3 elevators for all the floors and rooms is not enough? All 5 days of my stay it took me between 5 to 15 minutes (the worst day) to go down to first level from 19th floor.Issue #3, on the last day of my stay I left 8 am my room and came back 4Pm, to see my room wasn’t cleaned up. This is unacceptable for so many hours they could have taken care of my room. An apology is not enough, I had to leave my room for a couple of hours to let the hotel to take care of this.Would probably stay back again, but only if the management takes care of these issues, if not I would not come back again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located just steps from time square but is also quiet enough at night to rest well. Decent size room and bathroom; nicely furnished. Breakfast was good and although busy, the tables turn over fast. Enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This property is very convenient to so much in Midtown Manhattan, and feels safe, clean and comfortable, with great staff who are very helpful. This in addition to the free breakfast, the quiet of the rooms, reasonable price point, the warm cookies in the late afternoon - it just brings you back every time. The only thing I'd change is the music in the breakfast area in the morning - when people haven't quite gotten into the day yet, it was a little too caffeinated! We were in town to see a show, and we'd definitely stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is located near Times Square but is in a quieter street which was very welcome as this area is so busy and crowded. All the midtown sights such as Rockefeller Centre, Macy’s, Central Park, Grand Central Terminus are all within easy walking distance. Rooms are big and comfortable. The breakfast is plentiful and sets you for the day. There is coffee, tea and water available all day. Every member of staff is very helpful. Special thanks to Geraldine Meenagh who is the great lady who manages the breakfast room. She has a sunny personality and gave us some great tips regarding shopping and visiting sights. Also John, the concierge who arranged tickets for Jersey Boys at short notice and arranged a shuttle ride for us to the airport. He also gave us great advice re visiting sights and subway use. The Hampton Inn Times Square Central is suitable for couples, families and groups.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good experience with efficient staff and breakfast at a reasonable price for ny city; good location ; would stay there again. Light was out in bathroom when we arrived but it fixed immediately as was table alarm clock.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Comfortable and spacious rooms (rare in NYC hotels), friendly attention from the front desk personnel, great complimentary breakfast and, as a bonus, they offer to the passenger a bag containing a snack, a muffin and a small bottle of water at the front desk when leaving in the morning to explore the city. What else do you need?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice, large, seemingly clean room. But the next morning I woke up and had 3 large, very itchy insect bites on my arm. I have inconclusive results from doctors as to what bit me, but I recommend checking your mattress before committing to your room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Within walking distance to most tourist sites, about a 20 minute walk to Central Park. Subway easy to use. Nice large room, cleaned daily. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast staff, Geraldine Meehan in particular..a credit to the hotel. This hotel should be at least a 4 star. Coffee, tea and cold water available free of charge 24 hours a day in reception which was very helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Valet parking was expensive but seemed necessary and worth it in the long run. and Rooms were on the smaller side but maybe normal for NYC. Beds were double size and not very comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. Good breakfast

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family (2 adults, 2 children below 8 yo) stayed here over a Memorial Day weekend. The room was clean, well appointed, although relatively small. This could be expected due to real estate considerations. There were lots of international visitors, which I don’t have a problem with except that there are some cultural issues with how you are supposed to wait in line. The staff on site are very patient and friendly. Parking should really be called “we’ll just store your car for you until you are ready to leave”. It shouldn’t be an issue if you are ready to use public transportation. Being right off Times Square is AWESOME. Somebody pulled a fire alarm at 4AM, so we got to visit TSq in our PJs in the middle of the night.Exercise some patience, and this is overall a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a travel agent from Israel and i stayed at the hotel last week.Location was excellent.The rooms are nice and clean.Coffee, tea and water at the lobby free of charge.Big breakfast.Hotel should be rated as 4 stars.I would like to thank Kris from front desk for a warm welcome ( i hope i will not need to change a flat tyre in the near future) I will recommend all my clients to stay at the Hampton inn time square central

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice rooms, great lobby, excellent service by all staff members. Having the hot meal each morning was perfect! Every thing was just great with the hotel. The location was awesome, right by times square, and subway entrances on each side. Walking distance to everything.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I’ve been to New York City many times, bit I have never, ever had hotel staff treat me so well. Everyone from the front desk to the guys who help with baggage to maintenance to sweet Geraldine are incredible. They actually treat you as if you are the only guest. We traveled with our high school seniors and it was fabulous. The breakfast is one of the best I’ve experienced at any hotels; the location is superb and the hotel is very, very clean! To your managers, staff p, etc-keep doing what you are you doing because you are doing it RIGHT! We also loved the cookies:)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is the selling point. Overall the hotel is nice and clean. My only complaint is the elevators...they start at the top of the building and work there way down often arriving to your floor completely full! Would recommend staying on the lower levels just in case you have to take the stairs.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is outstanding. Right in the middle of theatre and subway trains. Very nice breakfast included. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Will make this my first choice when in the city. Felt very welcomed and secure location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wow what can I say this hotel and its staff are magnificent, the rooms are beautiful and very comfortable, the breakfast team lead by Geraldine are fantastic and could not do enough.If you want a place to stay in New York this place is top of the list.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is clean. Staff is very friendly. Location is convenient to Times Square and the subway. Hotel street is quiet with less foot traffic. All stores and restaurants start at the corners. Felt safe with no problems.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a perfectly placed hotel to explore New York. There is a subway across the road, so you can be anywhere very quickly! Not scarey & very cheap & easy to use. The staff at the hotel are lovely, especially Geraldine & Darren, who work in the dining room at breakfast time. Our room was perfect & you must go up to the 31st floor viewing point & eat the free cookies in reception!! There are 3 quick lifts, which can feel like they stop at every floor sometimes but you end up having a laugh & a chat with other guests whilst waiting! It wasn't really a problem, just funny. We would definitely stay here again & ❤️ New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great value for the $ fantastic central location. Super staff and very helpful! If you are staying midtown and need a great hotel this is one to consider! Super close to Times Square and the theater district!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a Hilton Diamond member, so maybe I am harder on Hilton properties because some places I go, I am blown away by the customer service. Not here. They didn't even offer the minimum of what they are supposed to offer their Diamond members. It took us over an hour to check in; just so many issues with elevators and breakfast. However, aside from Kris at the desk, most of the employees were amazingly helpful and kind. I've stayed at several other Hilton props in TS; this is my least fav.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was great, able to walk to a lot of different areas. Breakfast was your typical complimentary foods, which worked great for us...Beds are double not queen so be prepared for that upon booking, other then that the rooms are small but clean..

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The employees were super nice, they gave us tips to know the city, help us to check in early. The room was comfortable with a great view. We loved it!!! Excellent Hotel location, close to everything. and excellent costumer service. Thank you, you made our trip very special!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved staying here and will definitely be back! Clean rooms, great variety of breakfast items, even “to go” bags if you were rushed for time! The staff was very helpful and friendly! Oh, and the location was the best...just a few steps out the door and you are right in the heart of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was extremely happy with my hotel stay. After staying in several different hotels in NYC I would not think of staying anywhere else but here again. Great value, friendly staff, exceptionally clean, delicious complimentary breakfast. I greatly appreciated the 24 hour complimentary tea, coffee, hot chocolate, water.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a very convenient location for theatre, near subway, and an easy walk to restaurants. At certain times of the day, build in "wait time" for the elevator. The complimentary breakfast was very nice, but the breakfast room gets very crowded & hard to find a seat during busy times. Special shout out to Farrell (front desk) & our maid, Caroline. Both were super efficient as well as personable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel and rooms must have been updated recently...very clean, staff friendly and efficient, delicious hot breakfast to start the day, coffee and tea available in the lobby and room. Safe location and IN Time Square. Definitely would stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel with great staff. A little more originality in the complimentary breakfast would be nice (I don't think the choices have been changed in years). The rooms are nice but the beds are small and are in need of replacement. The staff are great, very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Such a great hotel. My favorite in NYC. Very clean, great location, very friendly staff. Within walking distance to theaters, Times Square, Central Park, etc. I was so pleasantly surprised. Definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton staff makes this hotel special. Everyone was extra friendly and helpful - front desk, maid staff, the guy busing the tables in the dining room. Front Desk guy (Kris) even stepped outside to direct me to the subway entrance. Rooms are spacious, especially considering the Times Square location; clean and very quiet. I never heard my neighbors. Complimentary breakfast is a bonus in NYC. One thing I would suggest is to perhaps change the service in the breakfast area to cafeteria style - Might move faster Plus, it was sad to watch a handful of greedy folks clean them out; in some cases appropriating enough food to last for the day (or several days). Breakfast area is crowded enough to make one think that people are coming off the street. However, the staff keeps up (with a smile); I rarely saw them run out of anything. Convenient to everything - This will be my go-to hotel on future trips. :-)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: spent a few days in NY with 23yr old daughter so wanted something central - reasonableAll staff polite , helpful, friendlybeds comfortablebreakfast good plus, it is basic but enough to fill you, have it early or becomes over crowded location centralnoise - not too bad but get a high floor. we were lucky no noisy guests on our floor apart from a couple on instances. if you did then you would hear everything- sound proofing not greatLifts, ok if not busy time (7.30 - 9.30) . If it is busy it can take ages. We ended up using stairs as much quicker- we were only on 6th.24 hr tea / coffee in lobby + biscuits in afternoon was great.on the down side , I am not any eco warrior or green fanatic BUT all cups/ plates/ cutlery are paper or plastic (coated like coffee shop cups) all food waste , plates cups get thrown into same bin. - somehow I doubt recycled . all cups in room are individually wrapped in plastic bag. UNNECESSARY, wasteful and bad for planet

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel in Times Square & reasonable priced! Would definitely stay again. John, the concierge, was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, also fun to talk with. Got us great seats at the shows we wanted.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was nice and comfortable stay. Hotel location is very good. Rooms are of decent size and we had city view room.Check in was quick and staff is friendly.Also, free breakfast was an add on. We had no trouble with the lifts and with the breakfast area.Hotel staff arranged an airport taxi at a reasonable price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While it’s true the people who work there are nice, when the hotel is full, it has the atmosphere of a bus station. The three elevators routinely stop on every other floor in the morning so that a trip from a high level can take 10 minutes (assuming you can manage to squeeze in). The other night, there was a big crowd waiting in the lobby for only two working elevators. Mobs of families and tourists pile in for breakfast every morning so there are few free tables and lines of people for the food, which is so-so (example: fresh fruit that doesn’t taste fresh). And the rooms are relatively small.If you can afford it, the Times Square Hilton across the street is 10 times better.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here in late November for five nights. The location makes for a perfect base to explore. Most days we walked everywhere, but the underground station is right at the end of the road. Plenty of places to eat nearby. The breakfast was a great start to the morning with plenty of choice, we never struggled to get a table as people are coming and going all the time. My only issue is the amount of single use plastic that is being used in there each morning. The hot drinks in the foyer are just what you need when you come in from a long day, and if you timed it right there’d be warm cookies on reception too. The room was spacious (for NY) modern and the bathroom great. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great location, if you are good with walking, although we did use lyft and cabs for longer distances. The breakfast that is included is extensive and dining room, though large, can get very crowded. Coffee, tea, hot water are available all day in the lobby and a nice touch are the bags of water, muffins and nutri grain bars that you can grab on the go. Rooms are comfortable and showers are big and have a small step into them. Staff was both friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is wonderful...a bit away from the complete chaos! The staff was very friendly and helpful!! We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! We would consider staying again for sure if we are in the area!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As a coordinator for a small group trip to New York City this hotel suited all the needs for price, location, and facilities. I am a fairly faithful Hilton Honors Guest, so I most often make reservations on line. Shortly before we traveled, I wanted to ensure our rooms were in close proximity, and even, perhaps, adjoining. Although it is possible to do this “in a little box” online, I opted to call the hotel directly. I spoke to Olivia, who was at the Front Desk. I explained the situation and she explained the configurations and possibilities. At that time there was no availability, but Olivia assured me she would note the request and that they would make the appropriate accommodations should there be cancellations and changes. When we arrived, I merely gave my name and confirmation number. The clerk replied with a genuine smile, oh yes, Miss *** your rooms are ready, we were able to make the appropriate changes and you have adjoining rooms. I looked at her name tag, and it was Olivia. She took care of the situation, remembered our conversation, and greeted me in a warm and friendly manner. Throughout our stay she was most helpful, almost thinking one step ahead of our needs. Every hotel should have at least one Olivia. Although the hotel is fairly good size, it is set up in a way as to not be overwhelming. There is a comfortable well-lit lobby area, suited for gathering and snacks. Beverages are always available. I particularly liked that one must use a room key in order to access the buttons in the elevator. This is a good security feature.  The Hampton breakfast buffet was busy, but the staff kept right on top of things. The food was always fresh, and the associates were efficient at clearing tables keeping the area clean; and they did it all with smiles.  The rooms were very clean, and the housekeeping staff very friendly and helpful. They were discreet in not disturbing, yet efficient in offering supplies and doing daily cleaning. One in our party became ill. Olivia and the rest of the front desk team were most helpful in providing things we needed, telling us where the closet urgent care was located, and so forth. The manager allowed us to keep one room through the afternoon until we had to leave for the airport so the patient could rest comfortable. I put this in the category of going above and beyond. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone searching for a place to stay in the Times Square area. The property is wonderful, but the staff totally outstanding.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just checked out from my room. I cant say enough thank you to Tobo, and if I were to rate him only, its be 10 !!!! But I had one weird incident. I checked in And was lacking sleep so I was asleep. Around 5pm, someone started knocking on my door, about 3diff times which woke me up, I looked thru the door hole, and looked like it was a male staff with towels. I told him I dont need any towels several times, then he walked away. That kind of scared me a bit since I didnt ask for anything. I was traveling alone, and I am petite, so made me feel a bit uneasy. But first floor staffs were all amazing. Location is great, would stay here again!!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location center of Manhattan with all needed facilities and nice breakfast to start off the day. The room was clean and comfortable for few days stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for a week in this very good hotel. Staff are great, friendly and efficient. We had a room a ninth floor with two double beds plenty of room for three. Excellent location; close to subway and many attractions. Plenty of choice for breakfast although my one complaint would be the breakfast room is not big enough especially when school groups are in.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is really nice — it’s not a luxury hotel, but it is more than comfortable, and the rooms are well designed and laid out. The breakfast is generous. The one downside: at busy times, it takes forever for the elevator to come. You literally need to budget an extra 5-10 minutes in the morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thanks again to the staff of this hotel. Once again we had a wonderful stay. I would like to recognize Olivia and Ferrell at the front desk and Benson in the breakfast cafe. Thank you for taking such good care of us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is ideal and staff super helpful. Thank you Dennis! They really want you to enjoy your stay. I was amazed by how they can care for so many people so quickly. Set off the main area on a quieter street. Family had an exceptional stay. It was so so easy!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 4 days prior to a cruise over the St Patrick’s Day week-end and although completely booked out the breakfast worked well and lift wait time was acceptable.First night was on the top floor which was a bit noisy due to the air conditioning units on the roof and surrounding buildings. The management were excellent and the room was changed the following day.Concierge was very helpful and bottled water was available from reception on a needs basis.The breakfast was adequate and acceptable with waffle machines and a variety of fruit cereals and hot dishes.The location was fantastic and we had easy access to Times Square and the Theatres. NYC was very busy due to St Pats so it was fantastic to be able to walk to most venues without relying on public transport.The rooms are modern and appear to be recently updated and the room was serviced daily.Fire alarm one evening could have been handled better by the duty staff as communications to guests in the foyer was minimal and most of us relied on second hand information. But in saying that all good and confirmed false alarm by the NYFD.Fantastic stay, reasonable price, great location and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: my husband, myself and 2 kids stayed here while visiting the city for a few days. I don't write reviews often but we were so happy with our stay her and I wanted to take the time to share it. The location was perfect and the staff was very friendly. It was a pleasant surprise when we saw they have a coffee/hot chocolate/ice water bar for guests. We used this on our way in and out every day. they also had a cookie tray at the desk each night. the cookies were fresh and a nice snack on our way back to room. We also were very happy with the continental breakfast. Very nice breakfast! we would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: An absolute gem of a hotel in the heart of Times Square. All attractions are within reach as the Port Authority bus station is a 2 minute walk. I'd definitely recommend staying here. Complimentery breakfast is a great way to start your day off. The staff are always on hand to help out with any queries. We'll defo be back..

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I made a reservation here by mistake. There are many Hampton Inns in the city and I reserved this one when I was supposed to be part of a group at another Hampton Inn. I didn't realize it until I arrived but the mgr was so nice and understanding. I wasn't charged for the stay and was able to change my reservation to the correct hotel. I will def by staying at this one next time I am in nyc - thank you!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cant say enough about how great this hotel was. We got to check in early the staff was fantastic. Its quiet and safe and the location is so close to everything. Its a win for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The fresh cookies in the lobby were nice after a long day out and about. The breakfast was very good as well. It was spring break but the staff kept up with the volume of people.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you need total silence to sleep like me then avoid this hotel.We had a room on the 12th floor with the window facing the street. You can hear the cars and ambulances from 6am. There is also a drummer playing regularly somewhere around the place. There is not only outside noise but also inside noise. The doors of the rooms don’t have any dampening and you hear them slam at night. In addition our room neighbors (rooms are connected by a door) were partying around midnight and we could hear all laughs as if they were in the same room.So one point less for suboptimal soundproofing.The other minus point would be the complimentary breakfast missing any kind of vegetables.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a very nice hotel. Valet parking was super easy. Our room was ready early. We were greeted at the front desk by THE nicest employee, Farrell. Our room was extremely clean and quiet. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and we slept very well after a busy day. The hotel is very close to Times Square and Broadway so you can walk everywhere. I would definitely stay here again. Breakfast and free WiFi was also included.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Walk west to the end of the block and you are kitty-corner from an entrance to Penn Station and the subway.Rooms are small, adequate. When the building was built, in some instances the contractors did a poor job, e.g. the cabinet over the sink is positioned so low that the hot water tap can only be turned half way!The best part is the staff. Helpful and gracious. All you can eat breakfast is decent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very pleased with location. Staff extra friendly. Breakfast was great. Even green waffles for St. Paddy’s day. Room was comfortable and they provided a fridge for my medicine will stay there again. Convenient hit beverages plus afternoon cookies. Provided luggage storage.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Booked this hotel as part of a package via virgin holidays as we have stayed in these hotels in Canada a few times and knew exactly what to expect. Wasn’t disappointed when we arrived. Quick check in from very friendly reception staff. However, when we arrived in our ‘king room’ number 401, we soon realised it was no bigger than a small single at best. The king bed took up nearly all the floor space with Not much left for 2 people and bags. We did ask reception for a room move and was given another on the opposite side of the corridor and up One floor to number 504. Perfect. A much better king room with a lot more floor space. Wasn’t a problem for the staff and were more than happy to accommodate us. Ace. As usual there is a breakfast on until 10am, free coffee all day and night and warm cookies come out around 5pm. Nice. This hotel is a perfect location for Times Square and has a subway about 30 metres away, perfect for getting round the city. Also, the Port Authority Bus Terminal is literally 1 block away for links to the airport. Sweet. Really enjoyed our stay in New York on the whole but really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Many thanks to the staff

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean room and great location..... staff (front desk included) even at a crowded breakfast, one employee, Ciena, was very personable and extremely helpful..... she made me start my day with a Smile ......thx Ciena !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Upon arrival and talking with the lovely young lady we informed her we were in NYC For our 30th Anniversary! We left for dinner and upon our return we found an amazing goodie bag full of treats and a card,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent place to stay in NYC. Within walking distance of Times Square and pretty much everything else we wanted to do. The complimentary breakfast had a great variety of "real food" and was always well stocked.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at the Hampton was very very nice. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and safe. You can't beat the location! It was steps away from Times Square and steps away from some of the amazing Broadway plays in the town. I highly recommend booking here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our second stay in the Hampton Inn.The location is ideal and the staff are very helpful. Special thanks to Geraldine in the dining room. Our room was smallish but it didn't matter as we were out all day. The king size bed was comfy so we had no trouble sleeping. Having a hairdryer in the bathroom meant that I didn't have to pack my own in the suitcase. Good shower and the towels were changed every day. Enjoyable breakfast with lots of choice. We found the hotel to be very clean however the outside area under the canopy looked a bit grubby. If we return to New York, we would certainly go back to the Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We got a great deal with this one. On the 18th floor, breakfast included, Wi-Fi and lots of power outlets in the room. Great connections everywhere, wonderful staff and hot beverages available in lobby at all times. Very clean room, soft sheets and dark curtains on windows. Any necessities you can get from reception as complimentary which is great! Downsides are the breakfast which I would NOT recommend to people with children. Very unhealthy and sugary, causes diarrhea. Also the cleaning service knocked on our door for 4 times in 3 hours although we are checking out the very same day at 12- you would think they’d check the room situation before they try and come in.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My friends & I were celebrating our birthdays and we wanted a clean, safe hotel with a good central location. Like it’s name, this hotel fit the bill! One of my friends flew in on the red eye and the hotel allowed her to check in as early as 9AM, with no hassle. It was a great way to start the trip.The staff was nothing but friendly and helpful. And the location really can’t be beat. You’re just a few blocks from Times Square, the 42nd Street Subway and steps from any number of Broadway shows. I’ve already recommended this hotel to several friends and will be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pricey hotel for the stay. Location was great, room was tiny for a family of four. Only had two full size beds which were tiny. Housekeeping staff was below average. Elevator skipped our floor OFTEN!!! Do NOT stay on the 23rd floor!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hotel in Times Square. We had a clean room. Staff was friendly. Room was nice. Great value. Would recommend this place to stay. We came as a family to see my son’s High School orchestra perform at Carnegie Hall.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were very happy with this hotel. Very friendly staff and always helpful. Big shout out to Benson who was working the breakfast with a smile and just didn't stop working. Room was very clean and the location was awesome. Big thank you to all the friendly staff. Keep it up.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, updated, and roomy.Just steps away from a Subway station (7th Ave.&42nd st). Half block to Port Authority. Walking distance to Penn Station & MSG.Located in the center of the theater district. 3 blocks to Time Square (proper).If you've ever had to purchase breakfast for your family at a NY hotel - then you already know how awesome the Hampton Inn complimentary breakfast is.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was the perfect location if you want to stay in Times Square. And breakfast is included! My daughter and I loved the make your own waffle station. The room was nice and very clean. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn has become one of my favorites. I was really reluctant to stay in Times Square while traveling for work, but because of prices, this was my best option of Hilton properties/central location. This Hampton Inn is located right across from an entrance into the Times Square/42nd St. Subway, which was fantastic for me since I was traveling all over the city and needed a large selection of subway lines at my disposal. The complimentary breakfast had a large variety, great selection of coffee/creamers, but the downside was limited seating in the breakfast area for large crowds. The hallway outside the elevators on my floor was a little small and cramped, but my room was clean, beautiful bathroom, and well maintained. The front desk staff was excellent - they were knowledgable and efficient and did not judge when my dinner was a box of oreos and Haribo gummy bears. Times Square has limited non-cheesy dining options, so you'll feel a little limited there, but my stay was excellent for the hotel and the money. I definitely recommend for anyone needing subway access.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful location in Times Square. Hotel staff were all very friendly and accomodating and the free breakfast was delicious! Also, there was free coffee, hot chocolate and bottled water available any time in the lobby. I would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed one night to be close to the Lyric Theater to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. The location is perfect, just around the corner from the theater (you can enter the Lyric on 42nd). We arrived from our other NYC hotel around noon and they allowed us to check in early which was fantastic. The people at the front desk are super helpful and polite. I heard lots of people asking really basic, almost silly questions to the staff and they were so nice in their replies. We had reservations for dinner at Tony's in between the shows and were able to come back to the hotel to relax before we had to go back to the second part of our show. There is free coffee, hot chocolate and tea in the lobby which is great. The front desk helped us reserve a private car to JFK (so easy - $75) and we ate the free breakfast buffet around 7 am. There were people there at that time but it was not crowded at all. The breakfast opens at 6 am. Rooms are fine, pretty standard but clean. Bed was comfy and it was quiet on our floor. We did see alot of teens in the hotel so I think large groups do come to stay and could get rowdy but we didn't see that. The elevators were readily available to us and we did not have to wait long. There is so much food nearby and the subway is just down the block. I was against staying in Times Square for our entire trip and stayed on E. 40th street for the rest of our stay but I do regret that now. This Hampton Inn would have been a perfect place for the entire stay, so convenient and with a good vibe. Oh and at the front desk they have a treat bag with water, a blueberry muffin and a granola bar which you can take with you if you don't have time for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I called the wrong number (for Times Square Hilton), but their helpful representative (Manuel L) still found our Hampton group reservation and patiently set me (and a co-worker) up. I arrived at 5:00 PM exactly, expecting a quick check in. I was third in line; but after 25 minutes, we had not moved an inch. Finally found out (by asking) that their system was down and nobody could check in. These things happen, but the reason I stayed overnight (rather than commute) was so I could shower and change between a conference and a work dinner. Instead I went directly to the dinner and was in the same outfit for 16 hours. They did check our bags at the front desk, so at least I wasn’t carrying that around.I checked in around 11 PM by a super-friendly staffer (Jeremy N). There were snacks in the lobby (I didn’t get a good look), the room was clean, the bed was comfortable (it seems like a newer location). Pros: Great location (lots of bars/restaurants/transit options) - if you must stay in Times SquareReasonable rateFriendly staffCons:Probably should have a back-up procedure if the system goes downNot many amenities (understandably)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came for the weekend with my daughter and had a fantastic time. I cannot tell you how kind and wonderful the staff at this hotel is. They helped us out with whatever we needed and treated us as if we were family. I would gladly stay here again simply because of the customer service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The reservation rate dropped considerably. Being a Hilton Honors member, I contacted Hilton directly and the hotel manager and was told nothing could be done. I believe there is always something that can be done to make it right for the customer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful location, excellent staff, clean room, amazing breakfast! Great value for the price! Nice quiet room facing an alley but worked perfect for us! Will be staying here again! Walked almost everywhere, restaurants and shows close by ( as well as a Walgreens for cold medicine!!) we had a great time!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for an extra night in NYC so changed hotels and stayed here and it was a really unexpected pleasure. Hotel was clean and our room even though we did have a brief A/C issue that was quickly resolved was very comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Also it is very close to Time Square and many other places to visit. I would definitely stay again maybe even longer if the rate of $140 available for a Friday night again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was great. Busy lobby but quick and efficient check in. We were allowed to check in early (11:30 am). Very close to the subway. 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Easy to get to shows. Internet was good. Breakfast gave hot and cold options. Benson, who works very hard in the breakfast area, was pleasant and very helpful with cleaning the tables. Room was clean and quiet. We stayed in room 1901. They held our luggage for us on the check out day since our train didn't leave until 2:00.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is very good, 1/2 block from Times Square and from subway stations.Room/Bathroom looks like new and very clean.Internet - averageBreakfast included, not an executive breakfast , but it has good options of hot and cold foods.I’d stay there again with no doubts.I recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very clean rooms. They had Koehler bathroom fixtures. There were No bed bugs! The hallways are a bit small when navigating the luggage trolleys out of the elevators but that was it. The location was right in the middle of everything we wanted to experience

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location to Times Square, broadway shows and public transportation. I enjoyed the tea and coffee in the lobb each day. I will definitely stay at this hotel again in the future! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed with my friends, the location is amazing is literally 3 minutes walking from times square, the rooms are spacious and have everything you need, the size of the towels can improve they are too little.Jeremy from Front Desk was very kind and attentive.The breakfast is fine and have options but the best of everything is the 24 hrs coffee and tea.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was not going to expect much but I received more than I expected from this Hampton Inn Times Square Central. The front staff was very congenial and helpful with information and ideas and places to eat ( Farrell, Kriss, Christine, Johnny, Rachelle) The breakfast was hot, filling and clean ... thanks to the service personnel Benson and Darren ! I will definitely come back here for the cleaniness, the modern elevators, and the closeness to walking to Times Square, Port Authority, Bus Stops and Subway entrances! We were not lacking anything ! A small but lovely view from the roof top open from sunrise to sunset (maybe 8pm). If the hotel is available for a similar price I got from Booking dot com (` $172 a night with taxes/fees) I would definitely go back again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was in New York with my wife and daughter for the weekend to see the Harry Potter play. The Hotel was conveniently located around the corner. The play was phenomenal as were the accommodations!The hotel really exceeded our expectations from the time we arrived which was early on Saturday morning. They stored our bags until our room was ready and invited us to join the breakfast that was underway. The buffet was tasty and satisfying after a long flight from Los Angeles. After breakfast we went on a scouting expedition to get the lay of the land and loved how close we were to everything around Times square! This place is well located for the theater district and many great eateries. The hotel staff was excellent and very gracious, always greeting us and asking if there was anything we needed to make our stay more pleasant. The room itself was smaller than I imagined but otherwise very comfortable with beds and pillows that ensured a good night sleep and an incredible city view.We didn't need a car as everything we were interested in was withing walking distance or a short cab ride away. By the time we left on Monday afternoon we were well rested and thoroughly pleased with our mini vacation. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to the big apple!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn was on 41st right off 7th Ave which was very convenient to the Times Square/ Theatre district areas. The 42st subway entrance was right across the street. Since the hotel is on a side street, buildings blocked a lot of the light and noise that came from Times Square.The hotel itself has been refurbished and looked well taken care of. The rooms were very small, but to be expected in the city. We chose to stay on an upper floor, so we had very little traffic noise which was also nice.The breakfast was typical for Hampton Inn's. Some hot eggs, meat of some kind, breads, bagels, muffins, yogurts, fresh whole and cut fruit, oatmeal and make yourself waffles.We used digital check in and digital key, so we walked through the lobby, onto an elevator and up to our room. We did have to stop at the desk to get the wifi code.For convenience, we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was perfect for us. Right in the middle of Times Square and within walking distance to the theaters, shopping, tour pick up locations, restaurants and everything we wanted to do! We highly recommend and would definitely stay there during our next visit to NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a wonderful trip the hotel was awesome we couldn’t have asked for more everyone was friendly and helpful. Everything was so easy and convenient this was a great location, it made our sweet 16 party very rememberable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived at the hotel early in the morning after our red-eye flight. Was greeted by the front desk agent right away and to our amazement they had a room ready for us! The room itself is very small but that was expected and normal for New York hotels. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom a reasonable size. The breakfast was very good, everyday they offered different hot foods which was a nice touch. Breakfast is super chaotic so try to come really early cause once it hits 9AM good luck finding a table to eat. However the breakfast staff was amazing making sure the food was always replaced in a timely manner and that the tables were cleaned for the next guests to eat. Really made the madness of breakfast a lot more tolerable. As for the location it is right around the corner from times square and the subway is right on the corner of the street. Great location for first timers coming to New York. One thing I do have to say is that the elevators are super slow in the mornings due to breakfast so think twice before you request a higher floor. Overall wonderful stay and great value for price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Bellman, Joseph, was extremely helpful every time we needed assistance. He went over and above to make sure we had everything we needed and was so nice! Will definitely return to the this hotel because of the quality service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While our room was a little small and plain, it was quiet and clean. Breakfast was good and less chaotic that some New York hotels that offer free breakfast. Location is perfect -- a relatively quiet street steps from the chaos of 42nd Street and Times Square. Every hotel employee we spoke with was very helpful and pleasant.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location was great. Rooms were comfortable! Location couldn't be better for Times Square. Breakfast staff was the best I have experienced in many years! Geraldine is a huge asset to the Hilton brand.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is lovely and just what we needed it for. Buffet breakfast was brilliant and the hot options varied everyday which was nice. Staff very friendly and helpful. They were amazing with us and let us use the phone as much as we needed too to fix the issues we faced with our luggage with the airline. We would stay here again on our next visit to New York city and would highly recommend it to everyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Your staff was excellent . 5 stars .luis. Nini sales manger they treated our forgein exchange student great your hotel was the standard to compare. You made our trip excellent thank you You guys were great

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We brought in 170 students to march in the St Patrick's Day parade. This staff was unbelievably helpful in getting us into and out of our spotless rooms. Very clean and the best staff in the city. They helped us store all of our gear and even assisted Us in moving in and out of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were allocated this hotel as part of our package holiday. Looking at the reviews pre-booking, we were happy with this. I emailed ahead to request a high floor and we were given floor 30, great views. Take the lift up to floor 31 for the open air terrace views- stunning especially at night.The hotel is clean, well maintained and in a great location. the nearest subway is a few hundred yards, and Times Square is literally around the corner. We walked to most of the attractions, and a walk along the Hudson River is only a few streets away. The inclusive breakfast has plenty of choice, is regularly replenished and tables are cleared quickly. We found it substantial enough so that we didn't need lunch. The unlimited coffee/tea/cold water available in the lobby is a fantastic idea, and was much appreciated whenever we came back in. There was also a regular supply of cookies.Our room was cleaned daily to an excellent standard. The staff at this hotel all go above and beyond their duties.They are without exception, welcoming, helpful, polite and friendly, it really seems that nothing is too much trouble, and they are a credit to Hampton Inns. This is a busy hotel but there is lots of space to relax in the lobby areas, with power points, PC's and access to a printer.We had a great time on our first visit to NYC, and if we visit again, this would be our hotel of choice.NYC was awesome, with the most helpful and friendly people we have met on any city break. Thank you Hampton Inn for helping make our stay so great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Housekeeping was poor. Despite leaving meaningful tips, housekeeper would NOT comply with my requests to change the bed sheets daily and leave extra towels daily. In fact, one day the housekeeper took extra towels that we had personally obtained the day before. Housekeeper also would NOT clean ice bucket or leave new, unused cups. Basically, the housekeeper understood money and taking the tips that I left him or her, but did not understand my simple requests, or more likely, simply ignored them.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were clean and the staff friendly and knowledgeable. The breakfast every day should be taken advantage of. Very good. Coffee maker in every room a plus. Large groups during spring break made elevator travel lengthy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved this hotel. The staff are amazing especially Darren who got me scrambled eggs at Breakfast and was very helpful.The hotel has everything you need for a great stay in New York. Free coffee in lobby and great breakfast. The hotel is close to everything and we will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a great hotel for NYC. The staff was very helpful. Before even I traveled to NYC, the reception staff members were texting my personal cell phone to offer their help and they were very helpful before, during, and after my trip. The rooms are good and the breakfast was great for NYC standards. I would definitely go back to this hotel in my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is so close to all you need as a base in NY. Times Square is a ten minute walk or so, subway nearby, loads of food outlets etc. So, as a base it is perfect. The bedrooms were large and beds very comfortable. Everything clean, bathroom well stocked with shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. Plenty of towels which was great.What was a let down was breakfast - too many people in a too small a space and I don't really expect to dine in a hotel with paper plates, paper cups and paper bowls with plastic cutlery. It was cheap and tacky and to be honest, the food was not brilliant and we chose to eat breakfast out after a couple of days. Apart from that, the hotel was fine as was its location. A small shop next to reception for snacks (there's a microwave oven to heat things) and toiletries.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed there from Wednesday until Sunday. Great service at the hotel. Want to specifically point out Joseph works mostly afternoon the bell hop and just all around employee. He was great answered all my questions asked me if I want water for me and wife every time we stepped in or out of the hotel. Next was another morning bell hop forgot his name maybe Digeo or Louis just saw his name tag once. Great guy as well always helps says hi and bye helped with waving down taxies just great service. The last 2 are a Caucasian male and Andre who work night audit. Great always helped we had an emergency and they made us feel like family. Overall the 4 individuals are people I won’t forget. I will make sure the managers know this. Gurbir (gary) from Toronto Canada.Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the heart of Times Square. We had 2 rooms and they had organised both rooms next door to each other . Breakfast set you up well for the day and the complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby was always welcome after a. Day out in the cold. Great value for money

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good location - Is near Times Square and all atraction. Nice view from our room at 28-th floor.  Nice staff.At breakfast was very crowded. The room was smaller than I expected.Poor internet in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: With expectations based on other reviews: small elevators, elevator wait times, and sometimes crowded breakfast area plus the knowledge that Hampton is moderate, not upscale brand, I consider this hotel perfect for our 3 night / 2 day visit. There was no problem using AMEX points and Kevin was very efficient and polite when I called same day AM to confirm our late arrival. The room was small, but not by NYC standards. We found the bed / linens comfortable. We had simple access ( 3 - 4 minute walks) to Subway stations at Times Square and the Port Authority. We were at a slightly less crowded end of Times Square so Uber pickups were easy. Breakfast was plentiful, with lots of choices, including the popular waffle bar, providing a good value versus searching out breakfast elsewhere. The staff was uniformly helpful, patient and kind.Tiny, tiny quibble: I wish the bathmat were larger!We will return to this Hampton for future visits.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Missed our lay over in New York and quickly jumped online to book a hotel last minute for the one night stay. This was a great location and the breakfast in the morning was a plus! Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Room was on the small side but served our purpose. Comfortable beds and pillows. Breakfast was delicious but very crowded. Elevators were very slow in the morning. Easy check in and out. An overall good experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned after a two night stay and had to write a review, something I seldom do! This place is a must stay. Location is incredible, price is terrific but it is the staff that really made our stay memorable. We were greeted by Johnny, who unpacked our car, put all of our luggage on a trolley and took care of our car. He then brought us in to be registered by Jeremy who was equally great. Our room was ready at 12:30 so that was a bonus. Our room was clean and quiet, despite being in front of the elevator. On our second morning, we had to be somewhere early, so they gave us a quick breakfast on the go. When we came back to check out, Johnny was there again to help us load the car, provide the quickest directions out of the city. What a wonderful young man. I would stayhere again and again! Oh, and fresh cookies, and hot beverages are available all day. This was so appreciated after a long day of walking in the cold.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you're doing the whole Times Square thing, this hotel is perfectly located. A couple of blocks away from the middle of Times Square and a block from the subway station. TIP: skip the taxi and Uber if flying into JFK. You can take the AirTrain to Sutphin Station and jump on the E train to 42nd Port Authority station which is a 3 min walk to the hotel. $8 per person vs $80 on Uber! We were greeted promptly upon entering and were checked-in in minutes! The hotel itself is nice, clean, and comfortable. We'd definitely stay here again if we're in the area. The only con is the walls are thin. We stayed on the 9th floor (room 910) facing 41st and we could hear the garbage trucks every night/morning as well as people yelling in the street. When the guy next door got on a work call, we heard most of what he said too. That said, we are not light sleepers so we only heard these things because we were already awake. However, if you are a light sleeper, you might want to keep looking.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This place is as central as you want to be in Manhattan, close to all you want to see. Staff is so friendly! We loved breakfast, and the smiles in the morning :) Everyone was so friendly! We will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Been back a few weeks after my first visit to New York with my son, we chose The Hampton Inn mainly because of the fantastic reviews and location, we were certainly not disappointed, from the moment we arrived we knew we had picked the right place. All the staff are amazing, very helpful and do all they can to make your stay perfect. I’d emailed beforehand to ask for a room with a shower rather than a bath on a higher floor and got exactly what I requested, the room was fantastic, spotlessly clean with the most comfortable beds that we did not want to get out of! Breakfast has a great choice of cereals, waffles, yoghurts, pastries, omelettes, sausages, fresh fruit, tea/coffee/juice plus there are little bags you can take out from reception with water, a cereal bar & a muffin, hot drinks available 24/7 with a little area where you can purchase other snacks. I really cannot fault this Hotel and have just booked to go back next January with my daughter, cannot wait and I totally recommend this Hotel, you will not be disappointed, I just wish I could remember names of the wonderful staff, next time I will be sure to write them down as they all deserve a mention as nothing was too much trouble for any of them and always had a chat & a smile with us each day. I’d give 10 stars if I could, outstanding! Lisa and James Bishop :-)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After a brief issue (first room was not clean), which the staff handled immediately, our stay was excellent. Special shout-out to Geraldine M. who runs the breakfast room... she went above and beyond in making sure we had everything we needed and even stayed to chat with us about our shared Irish heritage! She really made us feel at home and is a special person.I log dozens of room nights in hotels in a year, and it's this sort of personal attention that makes me want to return again and again. Hampton Inn Times Square Central will be the first place I check when I'm booking future NYC trips. Thanks again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the moment you check in you'll know you picked a great hotel in NYC. Forget what you "know" about NYC hotels: noisy; surly staff; cramped, worn out rooms; overpriced; etc. This will absolutely change your mind about that typical image (true as it is for many hotels in NYC). Hampton Inn/Times Sq. staff is friendly, warm and exudes the "glad to have you here" attitude. Located steps from Broadway yet down a quiet W. 41st St., rooms are decent size, clean and gave us 3 nights of restful sleep. Throw in a good free breakfast and you have the best value anywhere in NYC! Yes the place is busy and with good reason. Stay here and you will not be disappointed. We've stayed in many hotels over the years in NYC and the Hampton Inn tops them all in service, quality and value...hands down. You MUST meet Irish born Geraldine who is "Breakfast Room Supervisor". She gets up at 3:30 a.m. to make her way into the city so you can have a wonderful breakfast experience. Be sure and say hello to her and thank her for all she does for the hotel guests. She is absolutely charming and will make you smile...even at 6:00 a.m.!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this Hampton location from March 1, 2019 through March 4th. The hotel is in a great location and steps from Time Square. The staff is very nice and I would like to give a Special thanks to the front desk clerk Emmanuel for his awesome customer service and another staff member, Kenton for his great customer service. The breakfast was great. I would definitely return to this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed last week, hotel amazing very clean and modern. Our rooms were cleaned every day, beds were made and even folded our PJ's. Plenty of towels and hot water after a long day of walking. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. The breakfast room/restaurant, so much different types of food from porridge to bagels or scrambled eggs to dinner size waffles so much to choose from. Can get busy but like any restaurant go early guests don't want to hang around. Overall should we return to NYC again this is a place that we would recommend. Standard rooms are ideal for 2 adults staying for short time, may not be big enough for family of 4 but otherwise perfect.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We found an excellent rate in this hotel online. Really clean. Friendly staff. Excellent free breakfast. Also quiet considering the location. Room was a little small for 4 people but we weren’t there much anyway. Just at night really. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location, right in the heart of Times Square !! Plenty of options for restaurants, shops, subway lines, it’s so close to all the main NYC attractions!!Cleanness on top every day, plenty of options for breakfast, very good size rooms (massive bed). They have everything you need for ironing, they also have hairdryer, safe, coffee machine, etc.Loved the attention for details from the hotel such as having this “grab & go” system, when every day they had these paper bags prepared with a muffin, cereal bar and a bottle of water for you to take and if you feel hungry you’re not forced to eat junk food on the NYC streets. They also had coffee, tea and water with take away cups. Cookies for free as well :) if you fancy staying in the hotel one day they have a little shop with a variety of foods and snacks with a microwave available for ready meals to heat up. Very nice ! Very pleased with my hotel option, well done Hampton Inn. Thanks for making my holidays so easy and delightful :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is sensational, lobby, location, beds, rooms, view and overal experience are all a massive stand out. I loved the fact this beautiful hotel was only minutes walk away from most theatres on broadway and all the food on Times Square. Not to mention you can see the subway entrance as soon as you walk outside so getting around New York is not a problem at all. The beds are the best I’ve ever slept on and the staff will go above and beyond to make your stay great

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great property with views from upper floors. Very clean and comfortable rooms. I enjoyed their breakfast more than I have at other hotels that provide breakfast. Their staff was extremely helpful with every request, including special eggs at breakfast.I will be back for another special occasion. This was my wife’s birthday and this hotel was a big part of making it a huge successful event.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location to all things Times Square and Broadway, close to subway stations and restaurants! The staff are so polite and helpful and the rooms are above average in size for a NY hotel! Clean rooms, great breakfast area, inviting lobby area! Loved our stay here and will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned to the UK following a short break to New York, staying for the first time at Hampton Inn, Times Square Central.I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, the hotel very clean, the room was perfect and the breakfast delicious, with a great selection. Check-in was quick and easy and reception staff very friendly and helpful.All staff at breakfast were so friendly and polite, including Darren, Benson and Nordia. Unfortunately I didn't get everyone's names but they were wonderful.My husband had contacted the hotel prior to my arrival, to arrange a surprise bottle of Champagne to be in my room on Valentine's Day and he also said how helpful the staff were via email. The champagne in the room was a wonderful surprise and the staff even left a birthday card and gift for my daughter, whose birthday we were celebrating with our visit.I am planning to visit New York again with my family next year and will definitely stay at this hotel again.In all a wonderful hotel with wonderful staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a nice clean hotel that has been up dated recently. it is located on 41 st street which is just one street removed from the craziness of times square but it is dramatically quieter for a good night's sleep. There is free breakfast included as usual at all Hampton Inns. Only warning is to go early before 8am as directed by the front desk staff. Otherwise you will be endlessly waiting for an empty table.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed as a family of four last week and we were impressed with the size of the room plenty of space for us all.Breakfast was plentiful and kept us going until early evening so we could splash out on the evening meal. Staff brilliant and Benson and Darren are a great asset in the breakfast team helping people with seating and clearing away. We enjoyed the complimentary cookies and the 24 hour hot drinks including herbal tea and hot chocolate.Great family holiday we will be back. Room cleaning staff great and roof terrace was lovely too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Have just returned from 4 nights in this amazing City and hotel. The hotel was very welcoming, the room very comfortable with a superb view. Excellent location and we loved the hot drinks in reception when coming back from a day out in the cold. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel with its amenities and excellent staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am currently staying in this hotel and the bellboy whose name is Joseph Tanzosh could not do enough for us. His communication skills were excellent and he was very kind,considerate and hospitable to all our needs. He was very informative when we needed help on where to go as this is our first time in New York. This member of staff definitely needs to promoted as his talents and enthusiasm are wasted as a bellboy. I hopes he receives his promotion very soon.Lu - room 1805

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location for Times Square, everything on your doorstep. Clean rooms, great walk in shower, breakfast ideal to start a busy day of exploring, adequate choice of cereals, pastries, waffle machine, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt, eggs, omelettes and sausages. Free refreshments in the foyer which was very welcome on return to hotel. Coffee machine in room. Complimentary bottles of water readily available on reception. Great customer service throughout, special mention to Darren at breakfast for his kind nature, and John the concierge whose character was infectious whilst booking our theatre tickets. We would not stay anywhere else if we should return to NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff is so kind and accommodating! They went above and beyond to make sure my mom and her cousins had adjoining rooms. Special shout out to Darren who went out of his way to make a piece of toast for my mom when she wasn’t feeling well. Breakfast was over, but he helped us out. Thanks also to Benson and Lilly for the late checkout so Mom could rest and recover!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is perfectly placed for walking to Times Square and Broadway / 5th Avenue shopping. The breakfast was good value and a good way to start a packed day of walking and getting out and about. We have a family of 2 adults and 2 teenage kids. The 2 double room was perfectly adequate for us. Wifi throughout the hotel was good and free coffee/ tea in reception is always great. We used taxis/Uber to get out and about and they were reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is a terrific location if you are going to the theater. It is only about a half a block from the subway at Times Square, and you can get to the east side of town very easily on the shuttle to Grand Central Station. The hotel is busy, but it is quiet, and clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. It's good value for the money.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very clean hotel with great staff. complimentary breakfast is good qualtily and easy to use. overall a very good value for midtown manhattan. I have stayed here on numerous occassions and have always had a positive experience

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were clean and had the amenities we needed. Free internet, complimentary packed breakfast and bottled water were great perks. Reception desk staff, specially Emmanuel, were extremely helpful and efficient.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel met all expectations. Very clean, situated in Times Square, clean, friendly staff and valet parking was convenient and fast. Rooms are a little small and have no refrigerator and microwaves but overall this hotel was great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We found the staff to be just amazing. They did their best all the time to give top notch service. The breakfast area is tight for the size of the hotel with the standard Hampton fare. Rooms are not large but clean and bright. Hotel is minutes walk from Times Square and many other great landmarks in Nee York!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location near Times Square with access to the subway system was great, and the staff was very considerate and professional. The breakfast was excellent as always, and staff made a great recommendation for dinner one evening.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was ideally located in the middle of time square. The staff was awesome from the valet to the staff helping with breakfast like Darren going out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed. Breakfast was fairly decent. Breakfast included waffles, sausage, eggs, and cold options. It was a great experience!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton is located between the 7th and 8th avenue, on the 41st street, hence walking distance to the heart of Manhattan, time square. The staff is professional and very fast in assisting you. The room was not the most modern or new possible, however comfortable and clean. Price-quality ratio was definitely satisfactory.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Darren provided such amazing service to me and all of my group. He was so kind and courteous. Outstanding employee with outstanding service. He offered to take our trash, offfered us water cold or room temperature, and was providing perfect service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In Overall the experience was excellent, great location and service. Excellent and Friendly Staff. They honored the Early Check-in and the Late Check-out. The room was comfortable, clean but, not to big and do not had a great view. Bed was very comfortable. My only complain was the wait for lifts but was not a great problem because we was on the 4th floor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Let me just start by saying that the location of this hotel is absolutely wonderful.It is around the corner from the Alladin Broadway Show Theater, a couple of streets down from Time Square itself and Fashion Ave is only a couple of streets down the road.The hotel offers hot coffee, tea, and cold water free of charge at the front desk 24/7One of the reasons why I stayed at this hotel was the free breakfast and it did not disappointment me. They serve eggs, sausage/bacon, waffles, fruits, cereal, milk, juice, an array of bread and muffins and so much more.My room was very spacious and comfortable and the view was pretty awesome as well.Although, the unit I stayed in did not feature a tub, I was pretty pleased with the bathroom as well.The coolest thing about this Hampton Inn is the roof top, it offers stunning views of the city, you definitely have to check it out.I also took advantage of the gym and it is pretty well equipped.The security this hotel offers is also fantastic! If you do not have a room key you won't be able to use the elevator and won't have access to any floors besides the main one, so be sure that everyone in your party has a room key.The staff was beyond amazing! I asked if I could check out a little later and they were veery accommodating. Upon my departure, they also called a yellow cab for me, I really felt taken care of.Would definitely go back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from new york staying in this hotel, clean and pleasant room, helpful staff and good location. Special mention to Geraldine of the hotel buffet, nothing too much trouble for this lovely lady and made our stay here even more amazing, would definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Scratchy. That’s what it felt like to rest my head on the pillowcase at the Hampton Inn. In addition, the walls are so thin that I could hear conversations in the hall very clearly. So clearly in fact that one woke me at midnight right outside my door. And the doors do not shut, they slam. Never again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
