review_body: Stayed here for location but it was a disappointment. No room to sit for breakfast. Could not fit in one of the two working elevators to get back and forth to room in morning because it was so crowded-had to use stairs. TV only came in on pink and green. The whole experience basically sucked

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location great for all typical sights (Times Square , NBC,Central Park,Empire State etc) you could walk to all ,or use the Subway (ease to use) Staff so very helpful for all your needs..Breakfast is offered ..help yourself Buffet ,great choices and definitely sets you up for the day ! Rooms are a good size (ours was) comfortably,clean.All in All could not fault this hotel ..100% for everything..I would return here ,if or when I come back to the Big Apple !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Myself and a friend stayed at the Hampton Inn for five nights in Feb. We were amazed at the price we paid for the location of this hotel. Our room was on the 17th floor and although many reviews complain about the wait for lifts we didn’t experience anything longer than 5 minutes for one. Our room was spacious with a large bed. The weather was 3 degrees on the best day and the heating was amazing for a hotel.Breakfast was varied, although the reason I have this hotel 4 stars was because it has 34 floors with many guests and not enough room for breakfast! That’s the only downside to the Hampton Inn. Perfect comfy stay - would return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned to UK following a 7 night stay at this hotel.Cannot fault it it.Location is perfect, steps away from Times Square but you would never know it as we never heard a thing whilst in our room. The bed was so comfy we slept like babies!Lovely big room and modern shower, kept clean by daily housekeeping who replenished towels etc daily.Really appreciated the hot drinks available round the clock in the lobby as the weather was so cold while were there.The hotel is great but the staff make it exceptional, they go out of their way to be helpful and friendly it felt like we were staying with family!Farrell the Duty Manager made sure we had everything we needed when we checked in and out and lovely Johnny stored our luggage and even put our cases in the taxi for us.And we can’t not mention Geraldine in the resteraunt( and Benson and Nardia)Geraldine talks to each and every guest and makes you feel as if you are the only guest there, the breakfast is amazing with hot and cold choices as well as cereal, waffles, oatmeal etc and it’s free.I am going back with my husband in August and with my sister next Christmas I can’t wait!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything about my stay was excellent. The staff was friendly, helpful, and just plain nice. The bed was more comfortable than mine at home. The bathroom was spacious for a New York hotel bathroom. The shower was roomy. There was even a nightlight feature in the bathroom, that I wish more hotels had. Also, the windows can be opened just enough to get some fresh air.And, then there's the location. You are right in the middle of Times Square and Theater District (two Broadway theaters are on the block). Yet, despite being in the middle of everything, the rooms are quiet and you can easily forget that Times Square is just feet away.I love this location. I loved the hotel staff. And, the rooms are the best I've seen at this price point. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is fabulous! From check in to check out, we had zero complaints. Every worker we encountered was helpful and genuine. The breakfast is great and Geraldine is a gem. Chat her up at breakfast, she is a sweetheart and does a great job keeping the breakfast area in great shape. They will gladly store your luggage for you if you arrive too early to check in and want to go exploring. At the end of our trip they arranged for an affordable car to the airport for us. We are heading back in a few weeks and cannot wait to stay here again. The location is great, but the people are what make this hotel special. Shout out to all the workers for making our stay extra nice!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and staff. Rooms are clean and room was in back of hotel and was pretty quiet for NYC. Nice free breakfast. Love the complimentary tea and hot chocolate. Stay on a lower floor as elevators can get backed up in morning rush.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel allows for guests to get the most out of their vacation in NYC. It is right around the corner from Times Square and right next to a Broadway Theatre. Also, the complimentary breakfast was excellent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Travelled here just last week with my boyfriend, mam and auntie. We stayed for 7 nights - the rooms must be soundproof because did not hear a thing from what felt like a full hotel! Slept really well despite the time differences from the UK and the fact we were right on times square - was a bit concerned at first it would be too loud but it wasn't. Being near times square also had it's advantages - we were very close to a Walgreen's for any essentials. The room has a good sized bed, spacious shower with a good sized sink and mirror. Very very clean. There is also a safety deposit box, tea/coffee, iron and a hairdryer, and a decent sized television. The lobby was great to see, the staff on the desk were pleasant and very helpful. There is a small shop next to reception desk, it's reasonably priced, it's mainly snacky things like ice creams, crisps, chocolate etc, there are small microwaveable pizzas but the microwave is for everyone, guess it's a good emergency option to have.The best bit by far was breakfast - especially seeing Geraldine every morning, she was very accommodating, lovely to chat to, always full of tips, always looked forward to telling her the next morning what we had done through the day before. I know my auntie is now booking to come back to this hotel, not only for the great experience we had but because she wants to see Geraldine again! Breakfast is very varied, my favourite and morning ritual being a waffle (with everything on top - whipped cream, chocolate sauce, raspberry sauce), fruit loop cereal - sometimes I'd throw a yoghurt, bananas, muffins within the mix - but there was a lot more - sausages, eggs, bagels etc. The area was kept very clean, heavily recommend going as close to 6am as possible as it does get quite hectic. Geraldine also gave us some lunch bags (which are also available form the desk) which included water, a muffin and a cereal bar, i'd also grab some bananas from the breakfast mix to take too. These were a life saver. We always have a good big breakfast so these snacks lasted us well until the evening for our next big meal. My only criticism of the hotel would be 3 elevators is a bit of a nightmare, they do get quite full and sometimes you have to wait a while - but as I was on holiday, was hardly in a rush and quite happy to stand around. Would definitely recommend, would go back tomorrow. Currently missing my morning waffle!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. Location was great for theater. Front desk and entire staff was helpful and positive. Coffee/tea/water (and water bottles) available 24 hours for free. We were warned that the free breakfast would be very crowded, and it was a bit, but the hotel managed the flow and was constantly refilling the food. Bedroom was small, but you get what you pay for. For what we paid, this was an excellent choice!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for one night. Rooms were tight and bathrooms were somewhat small. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Bed was very comfortable. Wifi was not very fast. It is annoying that they charge a security deposit at the time of check in to be refunded 3-5 business days later

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been to this hotel several times over 2018. So I can certainly say, hands down this is the best Hampton Inn in Manhattan. Pros:- Rooms: very clean, modern, nice sized TV with a lot of channels. Modern and spotless bathrooms. -Location: in the heart and middle of everything exciting in Manhattan. Transportation galore (cabs, uber, subway, bikes, etc). You can walk to anything. Too many restaurants to count. Lots of stores. I mean it's perfect for a tourist or a business person. Great also if you are a family with kids. Super safe neighborhood.-Breakfast: that is where they shine. Great service (that guy attending the breakfast room is very polite, helpful, attentive and kind). Great and diverse choice. It tastes really good. Honestly, they rock! Option offered if you are on the go (bag with fruit, water and bars). Enough said!- Free hot chocolate, tea, coffee etc all day long- Great and functional amenities (laundry room). - Front desk: most friendly people. So helpful and try to go above and beyond. Its been consistently my experience with them the many times I went there. You really feel welcome.Cons:- the rooms are small. But expected for a newer hotel in Manhattan.- the cleaning staff should be more careful with making sure the towels are spotless (hair and stains will always be gross, sorry). During several visits, I had to request other towels.I have been to a lot of other Hampton Inns in the city. Despite its minor flaws, this one surpasses them all by far. They are like the Patriots in the NFL: consistently deliver. ;)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The bed was comfy. The room clean. The breakfast was very nice. The cookies were amazing!!! The location was perfect, theater right next door. Restaurants and Times Square all in walking distance. Thanks to Farrell at the front desk checking us in and out. He helped us out with fridge and microwave. We always appreciate great customer service. We will return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My stay at the Hilton Inn Manhattan/Time Square Central. I was treated like a member of the family. It was so nice and pleasant !! The entire staff was so helpful and courteous. I would stay at this property again in a heartbeat !1

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very convenient location in Times Square. Great breakfast. Elevator a bit slow. Wifi great. Staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Room comfortable. Would stay here again. Reasonable for NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Hotel Value - terrific central location, rooms were decent size for NY, beds comfortable, bathrooms clean and again a good size for NY - the hotel's location is fabulous right off Times Square and easy walking distance to theater's and attractions. The staff really make this hotel from auto valet, desk staff, dining and cleaning personnel - everyone was welcoming and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is also a nice perk. Great Trip - we will definitely come to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful location. Room very clean and good size. Breakfast very nice. Gereldine the breakfast supervisor was a lovely women and had great recommendations! Would recommend to anyone wishing handy location

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was very friendly but housekeeping is poor. They did not change soiled bed linen. The beds were very uncomfortable; they were supposed to be queen but were more like full. Very unsatisfied with this stay I would never stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is an excellent hotel for a long weekend in Manhattan. It is conveniently located near Times Square and the theater district. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are modern and spotless. The breakfast buffet is fine although seating can be a small issue depending on the time of the morning. But you do find a place to sit. The elevators can get crowded but that's to be expected in a 31-story hotel. All in all a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the minute we arrived to end of our stay all the staff were very helpful and friendly, nothing was to much for them. Rooms were spacious with a comfy bed and cleaned daily to a high standard, the breakfast varied each day and it was delicious, free tea and coffee in the reception and also free cookies around 5pm each day and they tasted great. The hotel is in a great location just by Times Square and not to far from all other major attractions around New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in the Hampton Inn during a trip to NYC January 2019. The hotel is in a great location with just a short walk to a number of the main attractions.The rooms are fairly spacious and kept well with good facilities. The beds comfortable and the daily maid service was excellent.The breakfast at the hotel was of good quality and a welcome addition to the stay and definitely a cost saving over having to eat out for breakfast every morning.Some of the previous reviews mentioned long waits for the elevator but I never experienced this.Overall a great hotel in a fantastic location in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location to Times Square, Broadway shows, restaurants & public transportation (PATH and subway). Complimentary breakfast, complimentary beverages and yummy evening cookies - makes this Hampton the place to stay - What a deal !!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is located one block from Port Authority which is where we parked. Within a couple blocks walking distance to Times Square and restaurants. The hotel staff was very friendly upon arrival, and while checking in you can help yourself to some homemade (warm) cookies, what a treat! While checking in we were asked if we had a preference of floors, we chose one of the highest floors and we had a great view of the city lights. Breakfast was so much better that I expected. Even though it was crowded, there were no lines and access to a huge variety of foods for all tastes. Very well organized! We will definitely stay here again since it's so close to Port Authority and not far to walk with luggage. They do offer valet parking, but Port Authority was a little bit cheaper.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All, I read the reviews for this hotel and had some thoughts, but I can tell you now this place is amazing and the staff are a credit to Hampton Inns . Service was 5 stars and the location could not be better ! 100% happy and the team there made us feel very welcome. They do have warnings now for the lift times and we went to breakfast before 7am and never had any issues, we stayed for 6 nights and only waited once for the left and that was maybe 2 minutes. Breakfast was very good and will save you money as food in this area is not cheap. Geraldine was amazing and gave us her card if we had any issues or questions. My wife who can be picky didn't have one complaint which also cheered me up lol.. We thought the room was big for NYC and very clean , maids were very helpful . I would like to thank the team for making our holiday amazing well done !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything about my recent stay was extraordinary. I arrived early and simply wanted to check my bag and return later and check in. The gentleman at the front desk told me as soon as my room was ready he would text me - which he did. My room was spacious- for midtown NYC and very clean. The complimentary breakfast was equally as excellent. Every time I returned to the hotel I was always greeted with a smile and friendly words, whether it be the front desk, housekeeping or a bellman.An outstanding visit and a hotel I will return often.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here in December and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.The hotel has a great location very close to Times Square, Bryant Park etc and subway stations. Everything about the hotel was excellent throughout our stay from the moment we checked in until we checked out.We asked for a high floor which was actioned by the hotel and we were allocated a room on floor 29 which was just a couple of floors from the rooftop terrace and our room had a lovely view of the sunset over the skyline in the distance and was very quiet.I read numerous comments about the lack of available lifts and crowded lifts if you were on a high floor but we never had any problems.The hotel was kept very clean and every member of staff we had any contact with was very pleasant and helpful which made the hotel a very happy place to stay. The provision of breakfast was a real bonus, particularly as it opened at 06.00 which was great for those travelling from the UK who were up very early due to the time zone difference. Each morning we were greeted by Geraldine with a warm welcome and she always made sure that everything was to our liking and also gave us some sightseeing tips each morning.Well done to the management for providing what appeared to be a very happy team which always provided excellent customer service.Overall a very enjoyable experience and highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband my son and I stayed for seven nights in the Hampton hotel Times Square New York in November. We had a fabulous experience the hotel was clean and comfortable the staff couldn’t be nicer especially Geraldine the kitchen supervisor. We had 24 hour tea coffee and iced water service in the lobby. After 5pm they came with freshly made cookies and kept it going all evening I so looked forward to them. Breakfast was great you could eat all you wanted which filled you up for the day. The Hotel is walking distance from everything could not be more central. We will certainly be back. Imelda conway Ireland

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First rate hotel for staying in Times Square. Convenient location, only a few blocks from the theater. I brought my daughter for her 10th birthday, the staff placed a balloon, goodie basket, and handwritten card in the room before our arrival. My daughter felt so special, it was a nice extra touch. Complimentary breakfast was good and hearty. Clean rooms. Very nice and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location for touring the City. Subway 300m away. Rooms were clean and a good size for a city break (your not in there much).The breakfast is just what you need to start the day, Benson the breakfast steward was very helpful and got you anything you required, he always had a smile aswell.There is no hidden taxes just a $100 down payment for damages which you get back when you check out.I would defo recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's pretty cramped, which is understandable given the great location which unfortunately leads to the problem I had with the property which is that the lobby and business center are full of people with a fair number of them not being hotel guests but people just killing time on the couches and seats. Other than that, the room is just space enough for a bed, a desk and the bathroom (more than 2 people won't fly). It is however well designed and aesthetically pleasing so would work for a business traveler or a couple.Ultimately though, having stayed at other great Hilton properties in the area, I'd be hard pressed to come back here.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel, the staff is amazing and courteous. You cannot see the ball drop from inside the hotel, but you can from the end of the street. Great location, we had a short trip and we saw everything on our bucket list. Hotel is next Wolfgang's Steak House, Close to Rockefeller Center, Central Park is a mile away. Statue of liberty, Financial District and Brooklyn bridge is a quick subway ride away. Subway is directly across the street. I would definitely stay again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spontaneous trip to NYC as consolation because our trip to Thailand got cancelled due to family illness. This hotel provided a perfect base for a weekend of Broadway shows and museums. Access to transportation is easy. All of the staff is great, and go out of their way to be helpful and friendly. I have to give a shout out to Darren, in the breakfast room. He greeted us each morning with a smile and offered us water and whatever other help we needed. His presence was a special treat. Also, Tobo, at the front desk, was helpful and patient, especially when I got frustrated after our door battery needed replacement, and we were locked out. Tobo efficiently contacted maintenance, and stayed with us until the job was complete, and we were able to get into our room. Hotel was clean, breakfast was generous (all the breakfast staff were awesome!). Overall, we really liked this hotel. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We started coming to this hotel in August when we come to see shows. We've been back 5 times. The rooms are comfortable but it's the staff that makes the experience. The desk people are so helpful. Even the folks who work in the breakfast room (free breakfast!!!) are kind and accommodating. I would recommend this place to anyone!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is location is excellent, close to Times Square - great for shopping and also close to the Theatre District.The staff are amazing - I would like to give Geraldine a big mention she was so helpful and always so happy every morning - an absolute pleasure to deal with. Gave us great advice etc on all the questions we asked - Excellent service.Rooms where spotless clean and reception staff were great too.Will definitely be visiting again - thanks.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First of all the location is ideal- just a few minutes walk to Times square. Still it is quiet being located in a bylane. Theatres are near, Shopping is walking distance. The check in was quick and easy. Full credit goes to the staff. The minute you reach they do all possible to make the guests comfortable. Special thanks to Jeremy at the front desk. Much desired Hot coffee, tea and hot chocolate is available in the reception to beat the cold. Valet parking is available but parking is expensive in NY. Freshly baked cookies are available every evening at the reception. Rooms are clean, well maintained. Bathroom was really clean. With so many stay options in NYC it gets confusing. I strongly suggest this hotel for location near Times Square, friendly staff, clean rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel, fantastic location and very friendly staff- especially Geraldine at breakfast who was so friendly and helpful, she really made us feel at home in the Hampton Inn. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff very helpful and accommodating. Rooms clean and comfy. Great location. The free breakfast is worth its weight in gold. Lilly was very helpful with communicating when our room would be ready to check in.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location, location, location. This is a very busy hotel in a great location. The downside is you may have to wait 5-10 min. for the elevator at peak times. Also, breakfast is included but good luck finding a place to sit. There are always trade offs for being in such a central spot. My other disappointment, for which there is no excuse, was the towels. Seriously, the towel I use for bathing my dog is of better quality. Two skimpy towels were provided and too bad if you washed your hair and wanted a towel for it. Upside, the front desk was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice, very clean. Good extras such as a to-go bag if you are heading to the airport before the breakfast service begins. I would have given them 5 stars but (1) the water was very cold for the shower and never warmed up -- a big problem on a cold January morning, and (2) there was no shower cap. All the Hilton hotels provide these so I was just surprised.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Couldn’t of asked for a better hotel. Location is excellent. Staff was very helpful and super friendly. If I ever go back, this will be the first place I look. Breakfast selection was even good. Maybe the stars aligned on this trip, but I was very pleased with my stay to say the least.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great visit from start to finish. The location is perfect for Times Square and the subways. The staff was excellent and very accomodating. The best recommendation that I could give, was if I was booking a trip today I would stay here again in a second.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here late September. Check in was very easy, Olivia on Reception has excellent customer relations skills. Room was clean, beds comfortable. Breakfast was very good, the range of food was amazing. Yes it was busy but we never had a problem finding a seat. The lifts are slow but it doesn't take away from what is probably the best hotel I have stayed in in NYC. Location is perfect, you can get anywhere from there. All the staff were polite and friendly, nothing was a hassle for them. Thoroughly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was fortunate to be able to find a place that was where everything is accessible. The Subway is steps away. There was no need for a Taxi unless you cannot walk distances. We walked to all venues except for the 9/11 Memorial, took Subway. Exceptional Staff!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We travelled as a family of four, really nice hotel. Reception very helpful nothing was any trouble, especially Olivia who had excellent customer service! Breakfast was nice, we would go down around 6.45,once it got to 7.15 it began to fill up. The supervisor Geraldine was amazing, she would always take time to talk to me and my family, I always enjoyed coming down for breakfast in the morning. Overall a lovely stay L Lee Liverpool

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overrun breakfast bar with limited seating, tiny elevators with LONG wait times (stay on a low floor so you can walk down the stairs) and well used linens and towel. Find somewhere else, the proximity to Times Square doesn't justify the expenditure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was perfect! Great location and a wonderful staff! The close proximity to the central area of Times Square made it easy to take in great Broadway shows, go shopping and experience the fabulous NYC attractions! Upon arrival, were pleasantly greeted (by Rachelle) at the front desk who promptly offered us treats and water, as we checked in. We arrived a little early, so she graciously took time to text us to let me know our room was ready. The room was very spacious and clean and the free breakfast every morning was awesome! There were both hot and cold selections. Also, there was always coffee and tea available in the lobby for hotel guests. The bell staff was very helpful with our luggage and even called for a “black car” transport to get us to airport in time for our flight! Great service, great hotel! I highly recommend this Hampton Inn for your next stay in Manhattan Times Square!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My 14 year-old daughter and I stayed at this location for the second time. This time, we were there to see a few Broadway plays during the weekend leading up to the New Year. The staff was amazing!!!! They were very friendly and accommodated us in every way. They had extra towels and a refrigerator in the room when we arrived as I requested. As a gold member, they provided us with nick knacks and free water, which in New York would have cost at least $40. Be sure to leave the maids a tip! The manager also wrote a nice note and left a few goodies for us so that we would have them upon arrival. The location is just a street or so over from Broadway and there are great restaurants all all around. The hotel was also in walking distance of all of the plays we saw: Mean Girls, To Kill A Mocking Bird, Choir Boy, and Anastasia. This will be our location from here on out! Thanks staff! You were amazing!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in a great location. Staff is really nice. Housekeeping really sucks. But it was adaquit for where we wanted to stay while in New York city. We were on the top floor and could hear the wind blowing(whistling) thru our room vent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Don't think twice - just book this wonderful hotel!! Great location and a well maintained property. We got a room on the 26th floor and couldn't have been happier. Valet is cheaper than nearby garages - when does that ever happen?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I doubt there is a more difficult time for a hotel than the 3 days before New Year's Eve in Times Square! They did a great job. Location is perfect, close to everything! Property is in great shape. Room was adequate and spotless. Staff is helpful. Breakfast is well done.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just come back from our first trip to New York, we couldn’t fault our stay at the Hampton, we had a fantastic view that we did have via an upgrade, it was well worth the extra. The breakfast was great we were early every morning about 6.45 so there was always lots of space and also meant we were out to explore early. The staff were all great especially Geraldine who would make time for us each morning. We also found a great place for dinner just two doors away, the Gleasons Tavern again fantastic food and great staff. I’d also add that if you are new to New York, the city site seeing pass for the hop on hop off bus is one of the best ways to get about.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Family of six stayed in two rooms, impressed with staff throughout our stay...valet, front desk, staff in dining room...all helpful and accommodating, particularly Farrell at the front desk. Hotel texted me morning of our arrival to ask if we were set and if we had any special requests..very nice touch.Breakfast was great, lots of options, and while it was crowded, food was hot and refilled often. Rooms small, but it’s a city hotel, so no issue and room was clean and bathroom updated.Appreciate Hilton hospitality....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked this hotel for four nights using AMEX points. Originally booked an AirBnB but saw that hotel prices had dropped so I changed our plans which worked out great. We traveled with 3 kids; two teens which shared a bed in our double room and then a 4 year old. For the number of people we had, we made it work based on how close we were to Time Square. Breakfast was sufficient each morning. I went down between the 6-7am hour which wasn’t busy at all; maybe a handful of people. My kids would eat between the 9-10am hour which was crowded and seats scarce. If you intend to eat breakfast on-site, plan to eat early. We loved the free hot tea and coffee in the lobby. It was really popular because the hot water was always out but quickly refilled by staff. The hot cookies were easy to miss partly because certain families don’t teach their kids to share. One time, a dad told his son not to take the last THREE cookies and to instead leave one for my daughter who was waiting to grab one. OR, you could tell your entitled son to only grab one cookie because he’s not the only kid in the hotel who wants one; regardless of whether another kid is waiting for a cookie or not. The entire staff was amazing (esp Kris at the front desk) and we’d definitely stay at this hotel again! The location is hard to beat esp with the points we were able to use.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is right by Times Square, perfect location. This hotel is great as it provides breakfast and there is plenty of choice. The room is good, has everything you need. Shower, toiletries, hairdryer, wardrobe, plenty of drawers. Room was cleaned everyday to a good standard. Hotel provides water and hot drinks all day. Reception staff are really friendly. I would use this hotel again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here during the Christmas holidays . Pricing was reasonable. Great location. Our room was very small. Only one chair in the room, so to have a conversation one person needs to stand or sit on the bed. The free breakfast area was over packed, requiring some lodgers to carry their food to their rooms. Aside from encouraging guests to eat and run and not socialize (remember the guest rooms are very small), not sure what hotel can do. Elevators were frustrating. Many times they went past our floor, and when they did stop, they were packed full. After waiting a very long time for an elevator to stop, we carried (dragged) our suitcases down the stairs. Hotel staff go through the motions; their actions do not demonstrate happy employees who look forward to making guests welcomed. Heating system was a challenge to regulate. Again, a great location, a clean hotel, and moderately priced.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Outstanding location and excellent service during a busy time just days before Christmas. The staff was attentive. Breakfast was good with lots of choices. Coffee and hot cocoa available 24/7 which was welcome treat coming in from a cold day of sightseeing! Especially when paired with a warm cookie fresh from the oven! Location is convenient to Broadway shows, Time Square, Rockefeller Center Bryant Park and the Circle Line cruise. We were able to walk everywhere easily. Very satisfied with the accommodations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is good but the check out service is one of the worst. Check out took a long time. The guy doing the check out didn't even advise why it took a while to do the check out and he seemed not accommodating at all. He should not be put in the front desk. Good thing, the guy assisting with the luggage was nice. Room was not cleaned everyday and the elevators are very busy. The other hotels around NYC (the cheaper ones) are a lot better than this hotel and worth the money.This hotel was way better two years ago when I stayed for my Christmas holidays.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I took my mother and daughters to NYC for Christmas! This was the perfect place to stay. It was a central location and extremely safe. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and make our trip amazing!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Front Desk staff is professional and service oriented. Could not have been better.The hotel takes great effort to maintain security. The elevator does not move off of the first floor without you waving your room key and it will only go to that floor or the conference room floor. The housekeeper was excellent and a sweet lady. The breakfast is generous with many options. The staff who serves this area is attentive. The culture of this hotel is kind and service oriented.I stayed there Dec 10-14 on a Road Scholar program.It is only 9 short blocks to Penn Station where you can pick up the train to Newark Airport. Don't bother with the subway, walk. Times Square subway station exits are a block away.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There was no room at the inn, we were told—or more precisely, no room with two beds. No sleep sofa. No cot. It’s Christmas weekend in Manhattan! But I needed two beds! The staff stayed on task, diligently striving to fulfill my request and keeping me posted as I enjoyed Manhattan. Voila! Request met!!! I think they were as happy as my son and I were. When life can have so many bumps, it’s great when things go smoothly. The hotel could not be better located. From valet to bellman to breakfast, service was outstanding and smiles were plentiful. Thank you, Hampton Inn. You will see us again. And to readers out there: Treat yourself. Don’t you deserve it?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay! The staff were very helpful and prompt when we needed more pillows, and also when we had a problem with our room safe opening. Our room was a good size, and it was also clean and quiet. Our bed was very comfortable.We also enjoyed our breakfast each morning. There was a good variety of items. .The hotel is close to many tourist attractions. The only downside was that the elevators were slow.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've always had good experiences with Hampton Inn and i'm sure this hotel is fine, but I have an issue with their ethics. The Hilton Honors website quoted me a rate of $166 plus tax for non refundable room. I had the website open for 10 minutes or so while filling in payment information. When I finally hit submit, the price charged had increased without any notification. My credit card was billed more than I was shown. If Hilton was quick to remedy this, I would not have bothered to give 1 star, however I have called to remedy, and they insist that I am wrong or making up the issue. I'm writing this while on hold (for about 20 minutes now) with a reservation manager.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the Hampton in from 9th to 14th December and honestly couldn’t fault it!! We arrived early and got checked in quickly and were in a room on the 20th floor with a nice little snippet view of the times square lights. Our room was a good size (quite big for New York) and was light and clean. Breakfast the next morning was good, not a huge amount of choice but plenty of things to set you up for the day. We had waffles one days and found they really filled you up. Lots of bread, muffins and bagels for toasting with jams, cream cheese etc. It does get very busy after 8.30am but we were normally down for 7am so always got a place to sit. Obviously like many reviews before me I MUST mention Geraldine, this women is the glue that holds the Hampton together. She’s so chatty, happy and friendly and a pleasure to see every morning! The coffee station in reception was a fab little pick me up in the afternoons after a long day out exploring along with the fresh cookies. The lifts do get a little busy at peak times but we never waited for more than a few minutes. We used the concierge to book a shared shuttle van back to the airport which came to $42 for two of us which was a good deal and nice to know it was sorted. Great stay and would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staying here was honestly the best and most accommodating hotel experience of my life! From the moment we checked in (which was 3 hours early) I knew this place was legit! I even joked with Chris at the front desk because I never thought our room would be ready so early. He was the best and checked us right in which took all of 3 minutes, gave us brownies and welcomed us with open arms which was a breath of fresh air after traveling all night! John at the concierge was amazing! He even worked with my friend to send me a last minute birthday surprise effortlessly. The breakfast was packed to the brim full of choices, fresh baked cookies at 5pm, a 24 hour coffee/tea/hot chocolate bar.... Could you ask for more? They even pack little to go snacks in brown paper bags at the front desk. This place seriously went above and beyond, and thought of every small detail. Thank you so much for giving me the best 40th Birthday weekend in NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really nasty and not undesirable night front desk person name Carl !!! Would never stay there or recommend to any one till the change there attitude goshhhh why people like that get hire in the positions like this

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was such a pleasant stay. I was on vacation with my teen daughter to take in NYC before Christmas. This hotel has a good breakfast with hot and cold items and they also have bagged snacks packed with a water bottle to take out with you on your day adventures. When we got back one night, they were out of cookies, but alas--staff offered us brownies. The staff at this hotel truly make it an over the top experience. They are all so friendly and helpful. A special shout out to Benson (friendly and always smiling and working hard), Johnny (from MN) who gave us tips and helped with our luggage and John the concierge (awesome reservations for dinner). The beds here are comfortable and we found it to be very quiet. Make sure to go to the roof top to take in a great view. The location can not be beat; we were so close to everything. Make sure you get an early jump on breakfast, as the elevators can get busy in late morning. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Thanks for an awesome stay!! We can't wait to come back! :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location to everything we wanted to see for the holidays. The amazing staff made it feel like we have stayed there many times before. The hotel has very clean rooms, and the whole facility was very clean and festive looking. And with three granddaughters, the complementary breakfast was about as good as it gets!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This review is specific to Darren and Benson. These two gentlemen went above and beyond to ensure my friend (who is gluten free) had excellent breakfast choices each day of our stay. They were this kind and wonderful team! Also, Christina at the front desk was also very kind and I love the new text assistance!!!! AMAZINGLY EASY!Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn is on W. 41st St., and is a convenient walk to anything in midtown. The room was a good size, very clean, and seemed to be recently updated. The mattress was comfortable too. The bathroom had a night light. (This is such a small touch, but very welcome. Why don't all hotels have this?)The lobby offers complimentary beverages and chocolate chip cookies all day long, and the free buffet breakfast has a great selection of foods.And finally, the hotel staff is just great - happy to help out in any way.The next time we're in NYC, the Hampton Inn/Times Square Central will be our first choice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First off, Were so glad I followed the advice of others and caught the air train then the subway to this hotel.. such ease and door to door was less than 50 minutes.. Check in was great, we were given a room on the 30th floor out of 31.. this was great as I actually requested a city view, and what an amazing view of the Empire State lit up at night. The whole view was spectacular. Obviously being high up has its drawbacks, mainly being breakfast and waiting for the elevator. I had read time and time again regarding the queue which is why we went down around 7am each morning. If you go between 6 and 7.30 it will probably come straight up to you. One morning we went early, back to the room to collect stuff and went out to explore the city around 9am. It took nearly 10 minutes from waiting for the lift, to then stopping at floor after floor to the bottom. We were like sardines by the ground floor. On the first night I thought I would attempt the stairs to the bottom. It was ok going down but back up was exhausting.. 417 steps each way!! Staff really helpful and nothing was too much trouble. I was told by another guest at breakfast you can go up to the roof top after the 31st floor and we done that on the last day. A lovely balcony with great views. This was a great hotel and offered everything you need.. A safe in room, lovely big bed, great views.. My critisms were the shower was poor, hardly any pressure. The sliding bathroom door was so impersonal. Not a great design which don’t give much privacy when going toilet. And lastly we had the most annoying extractor fan in the bathroom which didn’t seem to turn off, so if you woke at night you struggled to go back to sleep. But thanks for our pleasant stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located right in the middle of the action. Times Square, Broadway shows, and the subway. Rooms spacious and clean. Hotel Staff excellent. Complimentary breakfast is always plentiful. Highly recommend for others looking for a great hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a great experience for my wife and I. This hotel is centrally located and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean and the complementary breakfast had many options to select. We will stay here again on a future trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inns nation wide are my choice because they all have great high requirements of their properties for cleanliness, helpful staff, and great location. This Hampton is a great value when staying in NY, especially when going to the theater district.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After arriving there early afternoon we soon got checked in and got to our rooms without any fuss. The rooms appeared to have been refurbished they were spotless beds extremely comfortable and ensuite shower room was more than adequate. Coming from JFK airport we boarded the air train to the LIRR rail station. Then a journey of about 25 mins got us the Penn station in the centre of Manhattan it's only about 8 mins walk to the hotel from there. Our first morning we woke still in European time but the breakfast room is open at 6 so we headed there without delay! Geraldine made us very welcome and the food was as good as our welcome too. Fresh fruit, cereal yogurts waffles bagels omelettes sausages eggs and much more to get your day off to a good start. All in all a great hotel with many friendly staff who were happy to help and a special thank you to Geraldine who gave me a goody bag on my 60th birthday too!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. It’s close to subways, restaurants, tourist attractions - all within walking distance. The rooms are a decent size and the beds are comfortable. The breakfast area has plenty of seating and lots of choices for your morning meal. Benson will get your morning off to a good start with his friendly smile and efficient service. Kris at the front desk was pleasant and helpful too and made sure we got the early check-in that we requested. Definitely looking forward to another stay here when we come back to NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The joy of the Christmas Season is always delightful in New York City! Staying at Hampton Inn Central in Times Square was the perfect spot. Everything was in walking distance. The business part of my trip to meet a group of alumni for a Broadway play was a nice stroll to 45th street. And my inner child was filled as I stood staring in the Macy's Christmas window after a brisk 10 minute walk. Moreover, the staff was outstanding! I really mean they were so courteous and thoughtful from check-in to departure. Traveling alone can sometimes be uncomfortable, but the kindness extended will forever make the jingle in my heart stay alive. Bonus: The breakfast bar was inclusive and delicious!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very Reasonable and close to everything! Great location, rooms small but nice! Close to theaters and restaurants, central location and within walking distance of Madison Square Garden as well as many other tourist attractions. Nice PUB next door with great food and a discount to Hotel card holders

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is clean, comfortable, and staffed with excellent people! However, it is NYC, so the rooms are somewhat cramped and the elevators going down are quite disturbing. I mean so many people in one elevator is scary and beyond cramped. With that aside, this hotel is a gem in the heart of Times Square and offers a full breakfast with hot items.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton inn what a hotel from start to finish staff could not do enough for us .rooms very clean and the bed was huge .Central to everything we found my wife and I we didn’t need to use any metro or taxi or busses to get anywhere the location is everything you would want directly on Times Square a little side street perfect.Best thing about our stay we thought was how good the breakfast was we honestly didn’t expect much but it saved us so much money and time had a very good range of food and there’s free hot and cold drinks in the foyer which is handy .The reception staff are brilliant seriously keep up the excellent work very informative and friendly giving out free cookies and day bags which had water in and a bagel brilliant.We were on the 3rd floor and didn’t hear a thing outside and we used the stairs for access in and out .Would recommend this to anyone and we’d book there again in the future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location! Hotel was a great value, hotel was very clean and so was my room! The staff at the front desk were very friendly!no issues checking in or out. Great customer service would definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is awesome--just half a block from Times Square. Really good restaurants surrounding this property. The rooms are clean, the views are cool, and the staff was exceptional. Can't wait to visit again!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hampton Inn. Amazing staff, great selections for breakfast, warm cookies ,coffee,hot chocolate in the lobby, newspaper at the front desk,goody bags for you in the lobby all add to your wonderful accommodations. Perfect location for your New York visit. Their car service to the airport is perfect. Great room loved the rooftop photo opportunity and most important to me they Recycle everything and compost food materials. Loved talking to Genevieve supervisor for breakfast. She loves her job and it is obvious. Front desk staff very helpful with restaurant suggestions! Fantastic hotel!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Absolutely had a fantastic stay in this property, on a short, yet sweet layover in NYC. Had no idea there was a H.I. so close to times square. Steps off the 1-2-3 train and a block from Times Square!Staff was so pleasant and efficient. Room was standard NYC size. Great views. Breakfast was tasty. Would absolutely stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cannot say enough about our stay at the Hampton Inn in Times Square Central. The staff is fantastic! The front desk team, valets and breakfast crew are all incredible friendly and made our family's mini-vacation one to remember. Darren and Geraldine and another gentleman work in the continental breakfast (delicious) and they were just amazing. Friendly greetings and eager to help. Geraldine helped my daughter cut her bagel! Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a large party (3 rooms) 4 adults / 4 children. Jessica checked us in and was so accommodating. We were able to check into one room a little early and that helped. She kept in contact with me when the other two rooms were available. Everyone was so pleasant that we came in contact with. We were treated like family. Even the table clearer at breakfast was friendly and helped with the kids to make them comfortable. Such a pleasure to be around kind people. The staff even gave the kids some snacks and water for the road. The location was perfect. Walking distance to the tree and Times Square. We will definitely stay there again next time we are in the city!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is perfect close to all amentities, Subway is at the corner, easily accessing the rest NYC hs to offer. Staff were helpful and always willing to go above and beyond. Plenty of smiling faces to start your day off on the right foot.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Selected this based on location near Times Square for a couples weekend. The hotel was decent, but the cost was high even for New York. During checkout lobby had about 100 people there making moving difficult.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I jetted off for an unscripted first visit to NYC. The location of this hotel was perfect and everything was very nice. Typical Hampton service and standards. Room was smaller than this Texan is accustomed to but what I expect to be typical for NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very positive experience. Hotel staff was helpful and accommodating. Rooms were clean and attentive staff. Breakfast was typical complimentary breakfast-not complaining. Location was perfect close to Times Square. Only negative-wait in am for elevator.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location , would stay again. Service was fantastic and the staff went out of their way to ensure that my family and I were taken care of. The location was good for the value of the rate. Would stay again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been staying here for several years. Love to property and staff. Always clean and staff is so pleasant and helpful. So convenient to broadway shows. They offer lots of items on breakfast bar everything is always fresh and good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you're looking for a comfortable, safe, relatively quiet motel in the middle of NYC this is it. Two blocks from Broadway, Several blocks from Times Square one direction and several blocks from Grand Central Station the other way. Great place to call "home base" while you are visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As this was our first trip to New York, 9 of us in total we looked for hotels that were in a central location. The reviews for Hampton Inn were good consistently so it was booked. The reviews were correct in all their comments. The location is fantastic, 5 minutes walk to Times square, 10 minutes to Macy's, Empire state, Rockerfella centre. The subway station for further destinations a 5 minute walk away. The hotel rooms were spacious enough, kept extremely clean with very comfortable beds. WeI never had a problem waiting for the lift, 2 to 3 minutes being the average. Breakfast times are busy but you don't really wait for a table. The breakfast items were all good, I tried them all, and were replenished frequently. The staff were all friendly and willing to give advice and help. In all a very good hotel and base to stay when visiting New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel in a very convenient location. Staff was very nice and helpful at all times. Coffee and hot chocolate available all day was great considering how cold it was around Thanksgiving. We had a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is steps away from the famous Times Square, souvenir shops, subway access, McDonalds, 99 cent pizza, Broadway, and so much more. Hotel staff is nice, friendly and helpful. The "C" button in the elevator stands for cellar which is where the laundry facility and gym are located. The hotel has roof access you can go out on for some fresh air (which remainds me, the windows in the room open up, but only about 4 inches or so). We had the very top floor which was level 31, King room with city view. The room was a little small but definitely not something to complain about.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Coming from a small town I wasn't sure what to expect. I was so happy that I picked this hotel. We were greeted at the door and made to feel welcome, it just got better from there. These people cared about our experience. I will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is perfectly situated for Times Square, surrounded by bars/restaurants/subways, an ideal spot. The hotel itself is fantastic, spotlessly clean and very well managed, staff could not be more helful, breakfast is excellent and a big bonus when staying in NY, we have already decided we will visit this magical city agaij next year and we will be staying at this hotel, well done Hampton Hilton Times Square Central

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not the fanciest hotel in town. Clean. Neat. Professional staff. Near all the must see places. Respect the staff’s dedication to their visitors. Will stay here again. Highly recommend for those who need a clean, convenient place to rest that doesn’t wipe out your budget. I love them!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have stayed here 3 times now . The staff could not be any nicer. Always friendly when coming in the door day or night. The house keeping staff does a great job cleaning the rooms. The breakfast is awesome. Just cannot rave enough about the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a trip! My wife and two teenage girls had the trip of a lifetime. This hotel is in the perfect location. Great staff, clean rooms, and wonderful breakfast. At checkout, the staff gladly stored our luggage where we could shop one last time before our evening flight. This hotel is located a half block from Times Square and a half block from the port authority where the main subway station is. We never felt unsafe. This trip was incredible. Thanks again Hampton inn.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first trip to New York, and the Hampton Inn Times Square Central was definitely a “gem of a find”. Just a minutes walk to the subway and Times Square. 5th Avenue 5 minute walk and very well placed to get around. Our room was on the 7th floor with 2 comfy beds, clean bathroom with lovely white fluffy towels, and plenty of room to get around. The breakfast was plentiful with fresh fruit/yogurts/porridge/cereals/Boiled eggs/scrambled eggs/ bacon or sausages on alternate days/ bread/bagels/muffins/ and Waffle maker (for you to make your own!!) with all different sauces and syrups. We never had a problem finding a table. BUT the highlight of breakfast was definitely Geraldine the restaurant supervisor what an ASSET to the hotel she is, always friendly, informative and so helpful ( one morning I lost my voice, she was soon at my side with a lemon cut up in a bowl, so I could have a Hot lemon drink) Also John on the concierge desk was very helpful. The only downside to the Hotel is the elevators one was out of action while we were there, and being in the 7th floor was very difficult to get it to stop, always going past, and if did stop was usually packed. Had to use the stairs quite a lot. Saying that I wouldn’t let that stop me from using the hotel again or from recommending it to others. Thank you Hampton Inn Times Square Central for helping to make our stay and time in New York truly amazing!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great time at the Hampton hotel!We got such a good service from so nice people!A special thanks to Darren for helping us and taking such a good care of us!The location of the hotel is great and so close to everything

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 3 elevators. Dense elevator traffic. One elevator out for two days. No hot water one day. No water at all day a second day. The rooms are so small one can barely squeeze between the bed and the wall. Space is scarce in New York but this was like fitting 300 passengers on a 200 passenger plane... TIGHT. Not happy

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our ladies' getaway in the fall. It had a great location right in Times Square, so we were always at the center of the action. The hotel was very clean and well-maintained. The breakfast every morning was very good. We were told that there could be long wait times with breakfast, but we never ran into any issues.The rooms are small, but adequate. Each floor only has a few rooms on them, so it is nice and quiet. The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. Due to there being so many stories, sometimes we waited a few minutes for the elevator but it was not too inconvenient. I would certainly stay here again if I visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was my first time in New York and staying at Hampton Inn made my trip more exciting because of its location. Hotel is just a few steps away from all the Times Square entertainment. It was very convenient to reach the hotel, Stop the car outside at the hotel entrance and take off luggage and kinds of stuff from the car and Very easy to catch public transport and Uber/Lyft.Though the hotel was quite crowded Check-in did not take much time it has a decent lobby and seating. If I remember correctly there were 3 elevators to get to the room so no long waits.Unlike other Hampton-Inn hotels I stayed before, this hotel restaurant where they serve Breakfast is quite spacious and can accommodate a good number of people. Breakfast is just the same as you find in other Hampton -Inn hotels nothing exciting about it. I personally do not like Hampton -Inn hotels breakfast Menu as it is very limited but definitely extra points for their Grap & Go bags. My room was Standard but it was spacious, Very comfortable Bed, Toilet was also spacious and super clean. Everything was perfectly lined up with Hilton Standards.There was no any kind of disturbance at all, it was a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Check in was speedy and very friendly and welcoming, which was much appreciated after a long day of travel from the UK. The warm cookie is always a nice touch, too. Our room was on the 14th floor and the lifts are speedy. The room is of pretty good size by NYC standards and had everything required for a good night's stay including a very nice shower. The bed is comfy and the heating/cooling is very easy to control. The breakfast is excellent but would advise go early. The only downside was that all the "crockery" and cutlery was plastic/cardboard. It was all clearly marked recyclable, but if you wash up there's nothing to recycle. I realise this is part of keeping costs down but at what price to the planet? The lobby area is very pleasant with 24 hour free tea and coffee, a shop for confectionery, crisps, beer, forgotten items etc and an internet access area. Excellent. If you want show tickets, go see the lovely John. He is amazingly helpful and very friendly. The location just off Times Square is perfect and you are no more than a 2 minute walk to the Subway. I expected it to be a little noisy but it was absolutely fine. I would not hesitate to recommend the place and would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We couldn't believe we found a hotel in the middle of Times Square that was so friendly, accommodating and of such good quality! Rooms were not large but big enough and had everything we wanted. We were there for 4 nights and cleaning service was fine and thorough. Biggest surprise was the friendliness of all the employees and how accommodating they were. The breakfast room was more than adequate, clean and refurbished in a timely manner. The supervisor of the breakfast room, Geraldine Meehan, mingled with the customers every morning, asking if anything was needed, and cleaned up along with the other employees. She was from Ireland and a delight to talk with. The only issue we had with anything in the hotel was the elevators. One of the three was always out of service and it slowed things down a bit. But the next time I am in in NYC in Times Square, this will be the hotel I will choose!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was our first time visiting New York and we had the most fantastic trip and the Hampton Inn being so central to everything was a great starting point. Just a stones throw away from the bright lights and hustle and bustle of Times Square and Subways.Each morning there were goodie bags for whoever wanted one and this always proved handy if up and out without time to fill up on breakfast! Breakfast had a good selection, plenty of waffle makers with selections of sauces, eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, muffins, danish pastries, fruits and yoghurts. Geraldine was supervisor in the breakfast area and was so welcoming, she gave us tips on where to go and even gave us some ponchos because it was raining! Big shout out to Geraldine!!!Free tea, coffee and hot chocolate available in the lobby all day went down a treat after a long day of sight seeing!!There is so much to see in New York and this hotel is the perfect base to start! If (when) i visit New York i will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Location and nice clean Hampton Inn with a very friendly staff. BUT..elevators were not working, after a long wait, we had to walk down the stairs in order to make our dinner and show on time. Good thing we were on the fifth floor. Elevators were going up and down but not stopping on our floor. Both mornings we had no hot water (sort of semi warm) but not hot at all. Breakfast was ok if you liked the waffles. Omelets were made at the factory and warmed up (yuk.) Not what we usually expect from a HIlton property. And $1000 for two nights! Expected better, got less..

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful location. Basic, but smart clean rooms with every necessary amenity. This hotel is a stones throw from 7th avenue, barely a 5 minute walk to Times Sq, Maddison Sq Gdns, Macy’s, Broadway and has a Metro station practically across from reception. Staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Breakfast was not vast, but a real bonus / time saver and the choice was more than adequate for our needs. This hotel represents excellent value for money and I would recommend without any hesitation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really great location, good price including breakfast. Very basic but good variety to start the day. The room was a lovely size with a much larger than average bathroom for 2 people. Nice touches like the free coffee, tea and hot chocolate in reception each day when you come in from the cold. About 4pm they then bring out warm cookies.... the white chocolate and macadamia were gorgeous!!The only negative is at times it looks a little dated with scuff marks and poor electric curtains in the room. Would definitely stay again and I didn’t feel that way about The Hilton across the road.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a 4 night stay in New York and the Hampton inn was wonderful. Great rooms, good facilities and breakfast included in the price. This hotel is in a great location near Grand central station. Staff are amazingly helpful, nothing too much trouble. I would highly recommend this to any one staying in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had the most fantastic trip and having a hotel so central to everything (aptly named) was a great starting point. From the moment we arrived, we were made very welcome and the girls (and guys) at the reception desk couldn’t be more helpful, especially Olivia & Christina. Each day there was a goodie bag left out for whoever wanted one and this always proved handy later in the day. At night, the cookies went down a treat!The only downside I saw to the hotel during our 5 day trip to NYC, was that the rooms were a little on the small side. Other than that, they were modern and had everything you would need during your stay.The atmosphere in the hotel was great, especially at breakfast, where Geraldine and the team were always on-hand to help, but most importantly had a smile to offer at the start of every day .The concierge John was always on hand to offer his help & advice on things to do and I would certainly use him if you intend on going to a Broadway show.There is so much to do in NYC and I believe having the right base to work from, is a big help - this hotel does that perfectly! Enjoy

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Whilst the location is perfect within walking distance of Times Square, the hotel itself isn’t the best: the rooms were cold or hot with no inbetween. The walls thin which meant we could hear snoring one side and arguing the other. The room wasn’t overt clean with dust on the sides and lights and stains on the bed covers. No bar which is a downside and no decent seating area in the lobby. Staff were helpful and breakfast was average.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here recently as a family for our first visit to New York. Really pleased with this hotel as it is in a great location,just off Times square and within walking distance to some of the main attractions. A great bonus is the buffet breakfast which is excellent and sets you up for the day. A very special mention for Geraldine the breakfast supervisor who was always very helpful and friendly. When she found out it was my daughters 21st birthday,she went off and shortly returned with a bag of goodies and birthday card for her, which was a lovely gesture. I have to add that all of the staff we encountered couldn`t do enough for us during our stay. Room was a good size and although we were right beside the elevators, we never heard any noise from them. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and if we are lucky enough to visit New York in the future,would have no hesitation in staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay was amazing at Hampton Inn Time Square, the service was superb, with friendly, polite and extremely helpful staff!! The view from our window of the NYC skyline was beautiful at sunset. The rooms were clean. Including breakfast was a bonus. Thank you for exceeding our expectations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for ten days. Was assigned a room on the second floor near the ice machine. I thought "Oh no, this is going to be loud." Well, the rooms must have really good sound proofing. I may have heard the ice machine once. The elevators tend to be crowded so being on the second floor was good since we ended up using the stairs instead of the elevators. The room was small, which I think may just be the case for NYC. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a complimentary breakfast. This is handy, saves you from having to find a breakfast place. There is a wide selection of breakfast items. The breakfast room is crowded so go early or practice being assertive. There is a laundry room. $2 for a wash and $2 for the dryer. The desk has change. No change machine in the laundry room. There is also a fitness room. Didn't use it as we ended up walking 5 miles a day. The hotel is near the subway stops and walking distance to a number of places to see and places to dine. The hotel is also near the bus route, about one or two blocks. So much to see and do in NY so you won't spend much time in the hotel. This hotel is in a great location for base from which to see NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was shocked by the difference in charges rate vs rate quoted when I booked the room. It went up in the range of about $75 for the night I stayed.Otherwise, the hotel was on par with Hampton Inn hotels I stay in regularly. Updated rooms, breakfast, friendly front desk. Room was directly beside and behind the elevators on the 29th floor. The room was not infiltrated with elevator noise as I was expecting which was a pleasant surprise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my second time staying at the hotel. The staff always text me upon arrival and by the time I arrive my room is ready. I am in NYC every other month for business so that is extremely helpful. They tend to forget to acknowledge my Hilton Honors Status it make you feel special for being a loyal member. The elevators are extremely show given the number of rooms and location. The complimentary breakfast is always good no matter how busy and helps to start the day off right. The bed pillows are horrible and you will not sleep well because of the lack of support. There are no chairs in the rooms so the only place to sit is the bed or desk. The odd foot stool have not place in the rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location; close to several different subway lines; close to Broadway theaters; just around the corner from Times Square. Room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast area was crowded and a bit chaotic, and breakfast it what you would expect at a Hampton Inn. We arrived mid-morning and hoped to get a room before we had to leave for a matinee. When we checked back, still no room; but then one of the staff at the front desk went out of her way to locate us a room just in time for us to move our luggage in, freshen up a bit, and head to the theater. I walked back to the hotel by myself around 11PM and felt safe--lots of people still on the streets, and the hotel is near the Times Square area where there are people around until very late. The price is shocking, but that is what it costs to stay in a great Times Square location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is the perfect home base for exploring NYC. It is central to everything- plus the subway is close by to explore beyond walking distance. The beds were A+++++. I do wish there were refrigerators in the rooms. Breakfast was excellent, with much variety, and plenty for everybody. The rooftop view was so beautiful. Of particular interest is that I left my macboook air in the room. When I called the hotel, Tobore Okagbare answered the phone. He insisted on taking my computer to the nearest Fedex packing store, rather than sending it from the hotel. He wanted to be sure that it was handled with care. He did this on his own time. My computer arrived two days later. It was refreshing to see that there are good, honest people everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is all the hotel has going for it. The hotel is old, shabby & worn-out. Rooms smell of mold and mildew, bathrooms are tiny. My clean white socks, were brown and dirty after walking around the room. Save yourself the headache and stay around the corner at the Garden Inn or Hilton proper.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Sort walk to time square and many theaters. The only draw back was the elevaders being small and 30 floors add to full car before getting to the ground floor. Great breackfast if you get up before 8 it is not so crowded and quick to get a bight.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nicely located in the Times Square area. Very helpful and friendly staff and the rooms were well equipped. I was very impressed with their welcoming attitude and the fact that they held my luggage before and after check-in.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All you need Clean room ✔️Excellent location next to subway, times sq, quieter street, felt safe all times ✔️Friendly staff massive shoutout to Geraldine who ran the breakfast she was amazing friendly offering advice and just there to talk to (she was in my view your star employee!) ✔️Breakfast was busy go earlier but the waffles were ace and filled us up nicely for the day and took the hassle out of looking for Somewhere to eat with two children.Nice roof terrace to enjoy a view uptown shame you couldn’t get a view downtown though We had an amazing 6 nights here and were able to feel relaxed and comfortableIn the hotel surroundings (free coffee in reception all day!) ✔️Thank you and we’ll be back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 4 night with 2 friends, great location to explore New York by foot, subway and bus. Breakfast included is a great bonus as literally could fill up before setting off sight seeing for the day, lots to choose from and Geraldine is amazing always willing to go that bit over and beyond to make sure you are ok. We were on the 23rd floor although you could see some of the skyline it’s still very built up around the area so don’t exact the best sight. Lifts are fine don’t know what people complain about we didn’t have an issue. Free tea, coffee and other drinks in r3 epitomises 24/7 is great as well.
