Not enough elevators to accommodate all guest rooms...Plan to wait a while for an elevator or get a room on the 1st or second floor and use stairs. Get to breakfast early to avoid long lines.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our second time staying at this hotel. The location is great. The rooms are big for New York. The staff is always helpful. Thank you Olivia at the check in desk for finding us a good room. Location, Location, Location

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is the perfect location . You are just steps from the heart of time square. Rooms are very clean and average size for New York. The continental breakfast was excellent. Not only do they have baked goods they also have omelettes waffles and sausage patties!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just left. Plus points are near Times Square, maid kept room very clean. Negative points, rooms are small, very but bathroom is good. Double beds in room are small be aware. Free Breakfast is a nightmare, no where to sit at 8am, total chaos! It needs a bigger better area for eating or cancel the free breakfast. People take their food to room as no room downstairs to eat. Would I stay again, no pay the extra 50USD a night and stay at Marriott Marquiswhere rooms are twice the size.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is great. It's only a couple blocks south of Times Square and it was also centrally located to many of the other top tourist attractions. It was also clean and the beds were relatively comfortable. Those are the only good things about this hotel, the rest was unpleasant. We stayed a total of 3 nights...2 of the 3 nights had false fire alarms go off in the middle of the night. Luckily they turned them off before we made it downstairs, but they still went off long enough for us to decide to get up and start getting dressed - I was disappointed that no one from the hotel even apologized for the disruption or inconvenience. After each fire alarm, there began a LOUD vacuum-type noise outside of our room for a long time - must have been some kind of ventilation system, so again we had another disruption. Also on our last night, our AC unit started rattling like crazy during the night, so between that and the alarm, it was not restful. Additionally, I would NOT recommend staying here if you are staying with someone you aren't 100% comfortable with. The bathroom doors were barn-door style, with HUGE gaps on either side of the door. You could hear EVERYTHING - honestly the door could have just not been there and it wouldn't have made a difference. Furthermore, there were 30 floors and only 3 elevators. It was such a long wait time in the lobby to go up, and also on your floor to come down. Thank God we were on the 3rd floor - we just started taking the stairs up and down. Overall disappointed. At least it was a clean hotel with a good location, but we are staying somewhere else on our next visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First of all this hotel is in the perfect location if you like to stay in the Time Square area. It is so easy to get around everywhere. The hotel has a very welcoming lobby and every person that worked there that I spoke with was nothing but nice and helpful. I thought the rooms were really nice too. The breakfast in the morning was plentiful and although it could be a little crowded, there was never that long of a wait to get to what you wanted to. That being said we had three issues with the housekeeping. It was our only area of concern. The first one - my husband left about 3 spoonfuls of yogurt in a container in the room to be thrown away. He didn't want to place it in the garbage can because there was no liner. When we got back to the room after a long day of visiting NYC I sat on the bed and saw a strange sight on the wall next to the bed. There were splatters of the yogurt all over the wall and the picture on the wall too. We went down to tell the front desk - and we were on the way out again - and they sent someone up to clean it. Well, we come back at night - starting to get ready for bed and I find yogurt on my nightshirt! And of course, it was the only one I brought and it was late at night - well you get the picture. I wasn't too happy and was wondering where else the yogurt could have gone. The second occurrence was when my husband came to the room in the afternoon to do some work the next day and the room wasn't made up. He requested that they make up the room and went downstairs to work. An hour and a half later it still wasn't done. The third thing was on our last night. When we got back to the room, the room was cleaned but the cleaning person left their black vinyl cleaning gloves on the dresser. Soooo - if it wasn't for these blunders I would have given this hotel a much higher rating. Also, the elevators are slow so if you are an impatient person you should get a room on a lower floor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at the Hampton Inn was awesome. From the moment we arrived our experiences were great. We are arrived earlier than we thought and the staff, Rachelle and Louis, were able to assist us in getting our luggage stored away so we could grab something to eat. Our room was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and good. Louis met us later in The evening and continued on conversation from a previous chat. Excellent customer interactions and I would not hesitate to recommend you stay here. Perfect location for all Times Square attaractiions and easy short walk to Subway system to get you literally anywhere! We WILL stay here again. A+++

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location in Times Square. You can walk to all attractions and sights of NYC. the rooms are clean and the service at the hotel was great. I would defiantly recommend this hotel and stay here again when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location with excellent service. Rooms are clean. Convenient to lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance. I recommended this hotel to my US sales team and we all stayed there which made it nice for meetings. Everyone had a good experience and we travel a lot

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was a great place to stay on a recent trip to NYC. It includes free Wi-Fi, and big breakfast, a free business center with access to desktops and a printer, and a fitness center. The hotel is a really short walk to Broadway and a reasonable (20 min) walk to Times Square. Even though the hotel is in the middle of it all, our room was super quiet. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was roomy. And the bed linens were extra comfy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Possibly one of the most reasonable hotels in the area without sacrificing the quality of service. Lily at the front desk was accommodating, they didn't have the room I was hoping for, but I am sure they would gladly assign my requested room type if they had it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was awesome! It was recommended by a friend of mine so I booked the stay not realizing this was the same hotel Me and a couple of other girlfriends actually stayed at when we had a girls weekend before. This seems to be our spot. I will definitely stay here again. It’s a great location, the hotel staff is friendly, very helpful and prompt with requests. We requested additional towels at the front desk and by the time we got to our room a hotel staff member was at the door. Special shout out to Stephanie! She sent me a text prior to my arrival regarding my stay. And then I got in town amd had transportation questions so I reached out and she was very prompt with her response and offered several options. This has been a great experience all around. Customer Service is very important to me and the hotel staff exceeded my expectations. Definitely have a Customer for life!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Only two blocks from Times Square the hotel is very well situated. Comfortable and easy it appears to be popular with families. The rooms are clean - but not spotless; and the elevators travel speedily - once you are inside them. Also the hot water is practically instant but it took time for the tap to run water cool enough to brush your teeth. Overall the staff is very friendly and attentive. Nice amenities: abundant coffee, tea, and cookies; free WIFI. The breakfast self-service station includes hot oatmeal, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, eggs, sausage patties, coffee, tea, juices, etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Amazing stay, super nice staff, very clean hotel, excellent location. It was hot the week of July that we stayed but the room had excellent air conditioning. It’s located just two blocks from Grand Central Station, making getting around the city very easy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean hotel with good service and friendly, helpful staff. I recommend a room on a high floor ( like any city center) to minimise traffic noise.room was a good size with very clean bathroom. The included breakfast was ok, nit brilliant, but more than enough to kick the day off well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed inJune 2018.It was a little treat for our daughter 18th birthday.And what a treat it was.Very smooth checking in.Plenty of breakfast.Very clean room.Coffee and cookie in lobby .Excellent air conditioning .Very easy to found :) Sometimes busy in lifts but understandable

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect for the theater crowd. Pick a low floor, there are only 3 elevators and they are shared by staff. Better to take stairs when possible. Breakfast was just ok. Water and coffee always available.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location, friendly staff, very clean hotel that is definitely taken care of. Easy Check in and Check out. Breakfast was great with a great variety and was open for 4 hours. Will stay here everytime!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, walking distance to pretty much anything. Had to walk down 28 floors to breakfast, elevator will bypass you after waiting 20 mins. Room was very clean. Travel help desk service was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location on 41st street, just blocks away to Times Square. Several metro lines at this location, u can easily reach anywhere in New York. Room is clean and comfortable. Free Wi-Fi and breakfast. This hotel has a lot of guest. Breakfast tome is kind of crowded. You may not find a table in the breakfast area. Breakfast is ok

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After a bad experience at a nearby hotel, I booked this one last minute. I literally booked it and 15 minutes later showed up to check in. They were incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were very modern (looks brand new) and clean. The views are amazing and location is spot-on-perfect. Bed is very comfortable, shower and bathroom were great. Just an overall great experience.If I had one minor gripe - their elevators take forever. Well, let me explain. If it's late at night and it's just you...the elevators are quick. But if it's morning and you're on the top floor, it takes a good 10 minutes to get down because you're stopping on every floor. Then the people on the lower floors can't get in because they are packed. I advise the hotel to have one elevator devoted to the top half, one to the bottom half and one serving all floors. This will really help.Otherwise, an awesome stay! For the price and what you get, it's the best deal in NYC in my opinion. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel, the Hilton across the street and the Hampton Soho. This is a typical Hampton Inn. Good value. Clean, decent sized rooms and standard breakfast buffet. The location is perfect for a weekend trip to the city. It is within easy walking distance of the tourist sites in Midtown. We took the subway to the 9/11 Memorial and walked back. I would definitely stay here again. The Hilton across the street is also nice. Nicer lobby and restaurant but basically the same rooms. I’d stay at either one.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the midst of the city centre very close to Times Square itself. Nice staff and good sized rooms. All very clean. Not enough lifts for the hotel at peak times. Breakfast room not big enough to cope with guests at peak times. There is no bar or decent communal area however most visitors will be tourists experiencing the city. Finally although breakfast is complimentary it is basic and choices are limited. I would however use the hotel again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful place to stay- can't beat the location right on Time Square and close to a subway station. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good and there were fresh cookies in the lobby every afternoon. Lobby has water, coffee, tea at all times. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had an amazing experience. Excellent location in NYC to all the shows and sites. The front desk staff were absolutely wonderful. Loved their personalities, extremely helpful and provided waters and snacks. Nice extra touch. The breakfast was excellent. Not many included breakfasts have hot eggs and various meats each day. We will definitely return to this hotel for our next visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Room was clean but small. Pleasant staff who are eager to assist. We stayed on the 29th floor and enjoyed our view. Be prepared to wait for the elevator in the morning and don’t wait until 9 to get breakfast- very busy!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's NYC...you pay a lot for a little. The location is good, in the heart of the theater district and Times Square (this is good for theater going, but bad for food). Subway is a half block away. The check-in experience was great. Irish lady checked us in and was super friendly, giving us an option of rooms and stuffing our goodie bag (Hilton Gold members). Wifi is fast enough for Facetime, but did glitch a few times. Room itself was a good size for NYC and looked like it was remodeled recently. Beds were comfortable, although the bedding seemed a bit old (i.e., not a down comforter). Pillows were very soft and lumpy. Flat screen TV with a plethora of channels. USB and plugs right next to the beds (thank goodness!!).Bathroom was small. Shower/tub combination. Water pressure wasn't great and the hot water needed to be at 100% to really be hot. Amenities include shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, lotion, and body wash. Ask for extras though as the bottles are super tiny and the housekeepers didn't replenish.There are only three elevators for approximately 275 rooms. In the morning there are quite long wait times for the elevators. Breakfast was included and it was a zoo. Hard to find seating, floors are sticky, kids are making a mess everywhere (there are waffle machines....need I say more?). It's your standard US free breakfast....so enough to get a bit of fuel before you can get something a bit more edible. Would we return? Probably not...the shower is a deal breaker for me and there are a ton of hotels in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our family's first trip to the city and I could not have been happier with our hotel choice. The location was perfect, there is a subway stop close by and it is one block from the chaos of Times Square. The room was very spacious and clean. There was an iron and a safe in the room and they came in handy. I also appreciated that there was NYC inspired artwork and photography throughout the premises. We had a room right next to the elevator and noise was never a problem. Our room was on the 19th floor, so we expected that the elevator would be busy in the morning. However, since we were up on a higher floor, the elevator was never full when it reached our floor. It was slow going down though because we were so high up. It was not that big of a deal because we were never in much of a hurry. The breakfast area was always busy during the mornings we were there, but we never had a problem finding a place to sit. There is a large variety of options for breakfast (i.e. waffles, eggs, meat, pastries, fruit, yogurt) and all of the food was good. On the morning we had to go to the airport, since it was before breakfast started at 6am, the hotel offered to-go breakfasts free of charge, which was nice. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, all of our interactions with a staff member were positive. The concierge was also helpful. There was coffee, ice water, and cookies in the lobby as well. There are only a few minor complaints that we had...the pillows were slightly uncomfortable and the beds were quite small, but these weren't deal breakers. We will 100% be staying here the next time we come to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had an amazing experience. The front desk was very helpful in keeping our luggage until our room was ready and again at the end of our trip when we weren’t ready to head to the airport. They provided bottled water whenever needed and cookies in the evening. The continental breakfast had a nice variety. Avoid peak times if you want a relaxed atmosphere. Complaints of others are really unfounded as it is the same anywhere at peak times. Same goes for the elevators. Avoid peak times. Don’t expect to run down and right back up or vice verse. It is a busy hotel in Time Square. Beds were good, not great. Rooms were very well kept. I recommend asking for a higher floor. Less noise and easier elevator access. Location was perfect! Subway entry/exit directly across the street, time Square around the corner, everything you need really. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here as part of a group tour so we didn’t get to select our hotel. However, I am a Hilton Honors member and love the Hampton Brand. This hotel is convenient to everything in Times Square, Broadway shows and the subway. Everything is very nicely done and super clean. I would highly recommend this hotel. Like many NYC hotels there is not a refrigerator/microwave or a pool. Our view from 405 was of a brick wall and the employees were all pretty unexceptional. Overall, great Hampton hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Times Square Central was again our temporary home while visiting NYC. We were among its first guests back in 2015 and we've returned every year since! It's still a well-run operation in a fantastic location. Yes, the breakfast buffet area can be crowded. Yes, sometimes the elevator waits and rides can take a while--but it's a small trade-off for joy of occupying one of the city view rooms. The hotel is still very clean, but some signs of wear are showing, i.e, the duvet on the bed had a ragged hemline. I must say that the young energetic, friendly staff is fantastic. Chances are we'll be back in 2019 if not sooner.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I did an extensive search for good rates and proximity to theaters and this was an excellent choice for both. Good bed, clean room, quiet enough. The breakfast station is exactly what you would expect with very limited hot choices. Coffee available always in the lobby. This hotel has 30 floors and exactly 3 elevators! We were on floor 19 and my husband walks with a cane. Stairs not an option! We sometimes waited 10 minutes for an elevator. Often times when one did stop it was already jam packed. But after you wait 10 minutes you decide you, too, will cram yourself into the next one like a sardine. At off peak times this was not so much of an issue. One night I decided to go get ice two floors down. That was a 30 minute misadventure that included the machine in the process of making ice. I would choose this hotel again if the rates were competitive, but I would request a floor Low enough to make stairs an option. The walk to TKTS was under 15 minutes.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This location is easy walk to Times Square and Broadway Shows. Room rates are Manhattan “affordable” of <$300/night, if you are part of one of the discounted groups like AAA. Check in was easy. Rooms are non-smoking. The décor is contemporary, although the bed was a little soft. The room would be a bit small by normal standards, it is spacious by NYC norms. There is a coffee maker, though no refrigerator or microwave in the room. Ice machines are located on some, but not all floors. The room was fairly quiet, with minor street noise. Our room faced 41st ST and light intrusion at night was an issue. The blackout curtain was about 2” too short. The A/C worked well and was quiet. A complimentary breakfast is offered from 6-10 AM. It offered standard Hampton Inn fare and the food was plentiful and well maintained by the host. As is typical, housekeeping was not aware of the policy to let us reuse towels, if we hung them up. They were replaced, every day. Checkout was easy. Staff at the hotel were friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Whenever possible, we opt for Hampton Inn or Hilton because of their consistent value & quality. And, we are Hilton Members so we can save money by using our points.Good price for being in the heart of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary in NYC and the staff at The Hampton on 41st couldn’t have been anymore helpful or accommodating. From helping to plan our day to day activities and making us feel at home. The staff is top notch and would highly recommend this Hampton Inn which is centrally located to so much. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great location. close to time square, port authority, metro station and shows. clean and comfortable upgraded hotel. between 8th and 9th great staff and very knowledgeable. multiple elevators so no wait during our stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn is located very near to the subway station and within easy walking distance of several of New York's big attractions such as Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central Station and many more! Whilst the hotel is not particularly luxurious it was scrupulously clean and had everything we needed. The staff were most charming and very helpful and made our stay a delight. Complimentary coffee, water and breakfast were an added bonus.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Extremely clean hotel with very friendly and attentive staff, large selection of complimentary breakfast items both hot and cold. Coffee/tea/ice water available 24/7 in lobby. Quiet comfortable rooms for NYC. Very pleased and would recommend/stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here one night and loved the hotel and the location. Very clean and room not as small. Very close to all the action in Times Square! Staff was friendly and recommended a great restaurant - Carmine’s Italian food!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton is close to everything - Broadway shows, the subway, and Rockfeller Center. I stayed here 3 nights with my adult daughter, my sister and her adult daughter. Room size was fine for sleeping and was super clean! The free breakfast was a great start to the day and you may also grab a packed breakfast to go for free which includes a water bottle. The staff is super helpful with directions and recommendations. Coffee, cookies and ice cold water are available in the lobby. Bed and pillows were comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was in a nice, safe area right in Times Square. It was an unassuming entrance, but once inside, the lobby was beautiful and the staff very helpful. The room was typical of NYC, but my family of 3 had enough room to move around. The room was very clean and in good repair. The shower drained very slowly, but I forgot to mention that upon checkout. No big deal. I wouldn't shy away from this hotel based on that because the positives definitely outweighed that minor issue. The breakfast had a great selection, and everything was fresh/hot, but it was very crowded. Again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here even though it was busy, but be aware that if you have more than one child, you will need to plan on visiting the breakfast area

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was nice and the staff exceptional. It was the perfect location to walk to all of the shows we were seeing as well as visiting the Garment District, Central Park and Lincoln Center. There is a Subway station close as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed 1 night very friendly and clean .fast check in.nice modern room .ok size for NYC. Great location for theater and tines square .Free breakfast good selection and nice room for breakfast free wifi

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived in town at 8:30am. They parked our car and held our bags. They texted about 11:00am that they had a room cleaned and ready. They didn’t have to let us check in until 3:00. Very informative and friendly. Hot food for breakfast. Clean lobby and rooms. Great central location. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We took a weekend trip to NYC and this was a great touristy location to stay especially if you want to watch a show. The room was clean. The hotel had cookies in the lobby and free breakfast. The staff at the desk and the concierge were very friendly for New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in good location of NYC just around the corner of Times Square and subway stations. Surounding by theaters and many good restaurants. Room small but comfort to sleep after long day in NYC. Breakfast is very good. Staff is very nice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked this hotel last minute for one night, and they matched an online price. The hotel is clean, has all the amenities you need, and of course, breakfast is always a bonus. And BACON was included for breakfast--I was in heaven. The service is superb and the location can't be beat for the price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just blocks away from Time Square, Broadway and 5th Avenue. In the heart of Manhattan. Quiet and comfortable rooms to relax in after a long day of walking the streets of Manhattan. Couteous and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This trip was a Sweet Sixteen present for my daughter. We had a wonderful experience. I'm so glad we were able to stay in Times Square and chose this Hampton Inn. It was just off the main strip giving it the Perfect location! The accommodations were excellent in every way. Comfortable and clean. Close to Everything!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This new hotel is an exceptional value for a Manhattan stay near times square. Nearly equidistant from Times Square/42nd St. and NY Port Authority metro stations, it is very easy to get around NYC and to/from LaGuardia airport (the 7 day unlimited ride pass is your friend). Hotel staff were outstanding, and the room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. Hot coffee and tea are always available in the lobby, and the breakfast was excellent. I will stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central whenever I am in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was great value considering it was in a great location. The staff was so friendly and took care of us. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again if i'm in New York again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect position just off Times Square, theatres. Breakfast poor. Very crowded, lots of student type guests all scavenging for something to eat for the rest of the day. Quiet room. Be sure to get your Hilton Rewards card, which allows for early occupation of your room. Instead of a taxi to the airport, arrange for a shuttle pick up. Good price. Very helpful and on time. Irish pub next door good food and a good vibe. 34th Street - Visit the Shoe Warehouse - four floors of shoes! And across the road K Mart.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed our stay, for a couple of nights, at this location. The staff was helpful and friendly. We used the valet parking, which was easier to use than I expected. The elevators moved pretty quickly. I would recommend staying at this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just got back after 4 nights at this hotel, cant fault it, staff amazing, so friendly and helpful, Pharrell fabolous personality , on front desk when we checked in made us feel so welcome, upgraded us to higher floor with no extra charge, Geraldine and her staff in the restaurant at breakfast all happy and friendly, breakfast was delicious with a lovely choice, cereal, toast, bagels, pancakes, yogurts, fruit, muffins, also a hot choice, which is included in the price as you dont get many hotels in New York that u get a free breakfast,room and bathrooms spotless,beds so comfortable, housekeeping do a great job, overall one the best hotels ive stayed in New York, great location just on side street on Times Square, close to Subways and hop hop off bus stops , cant fault the place would definetly reccomend and stay there again....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited NYC for the first time with my mum for 5 nights and arrived home on wednesday. This hotel was fab and had everything we needed. Lovely friendly staff, easy breakfast, free drink facilities and my ultimate favourite was the warm cookies on an evening. Oh my god....so yummy!!! Beds were super comfy and the hotel was quiet, we were on floor 29. I cant recomend this place highly enough. The location was brilliant!!! Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable. I will be back. :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great quiet room, breakfast included was above my expectation, superb services (including pre-checking messages to check how I was by text messages), would strongly recommend for either bussiness or leisure trips

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Beautiful new hotel with terrific location a hundred yards from major subway station. Excellent and cordial desk service, free breakfast -- at times a bit crowded -- and a large (especially for NY) room that offered terrific views of the NY skyline. Great choice for NY visit on either business or vacation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn was an excellent location. Right in heart of Times Square. Hotel was super clean and quiet. Staff was warm and friendly. Would stay here again for sure. Best part of our stay was ride to airport on way home. The Hampton Inn set up our ride. It was on time and the driver was amazing!!! His name was Jonathan. We had heavy traffic...took 2 hours to get to LaGuardia. He helped us change our flights and was so fun to be with. Great overall experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location for shows, beautiful and new facility. Large bathroom for an NYC hotel. But, I made requests through the app prior to arriving and was messaged from the hotel that all would be set when we arrived. The extra pillows and towels were not there and I asked again. The front desk apologized and promised them in 15 minutes - they never arrived. These issues, while not deal breakers, made me feel less than valued, particularly as a Gold member. I never received my welcome amenity, nor was I acknowledged as one. Would I stay again? Absolutely. The management did try to remedy the situation and did award me some additional honors points for the inconvenience. Mistakes can happen - so I'll try them again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had 6 nights at the Hampton and had an excellent trip. Rooms clean and a good size. Suprisingly quiet considering its proximity to Time Square. Excellent location near to all the major sites. Breakfast great though a bit busy so have to time it right. Added bonus of free bottled water, tea coffees and freshly cooked biscuits on an evening. A special mention for Olivia at the front desk she was friendly and helpful and a credit to the Hampton as were the rest of the staff. Will definately recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is ideally located to the theatre district & Times Square. We were within walking distance of many locations. The staff is wonderful and the complimentary breakfast outstanding. Only complaint is the elevators area little slow when it’s busy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Lovely hotel in a wonderful location. Service was very good. Breakfast items were great, but sometimes very busy and congested. Sometimes hard to find an empty table. Rooms are small but thats New York, and bathroom were quite large with nice night lights. Everyone we encountered were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was perfect for access to the theatre district and subway. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were nicely soundproofed so you couldn't really hear much noise from Times Square. Having a complimentary breakfast (even with the typical microwave eggs and meats) is helpful to lower costs. Although small, the lobby was outfitted with many areas to connect to the Internet to get some work done or just recharge. The rooms were small when traveling with more than one person. There was barely enough room in the bathrooms for toiletries for one person. There wasn't enough room for a chair, so you had to sit on the beds or an uncomfortable office chair, which was a little hard on the back. The complimentary wi-fi was very sketchy. In the mornings, it was pretty much non-existent. The 3 elevators were horrible for 30 floors. After pressing the button, they frequently skipped you as they went up and down. It could take 10 minutes just to get up and down. It would have been nice to have ice on each floor, but you had to go up 2 flights to get to the nearest ice machine.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from this hotel, myself and my two daughters had a 5 night stay, prior to arriving I had requested a high room to try and get a ‘city view’ we were on the 21st floor facing onto 40th street, no significant view of the city but really quiet so slept really well.Rooms were spacious, two large double beds, large TV, wardrobe, draws and spacious bathroom with a great selection of free toiletries. Excellent air con that we needed whilst there! Coffee making, safe, iron and board available free of charge.The hotel is very clean, excellent staff, Kevin was wonderful both before and during our stay, many thanks! The rest of the staff were also very good. Breakfast was very good with a good selection, we arrived around 6/7am and it was quiet, any later and it did get very busy, but that wasn’t an issue we simply took the food to our room.Location was perfect for all the normal sightseeing, bus tours etc. Would highly recommend this hotel to all travellersThank you for a great stay!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is a great choice for your stay in NYC!!! The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and courteous and make sure you feel welcome!!! They help with directions and tickets and cabs and even held an umbrella for us to walk across the street to our waiting car when it was raining!!! The location is perfect for walking north, south, east or west and the subway is very close. Plus the port authority is right there also!! Breakfast was wonderful with helpful friendly staff and our room was very clean and comfortable!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Lovely location at the heart of the city. Great value. Complementary breakfast is a bonus and free wifi is good to have. Size of rooms is very good for Manhattan. Highly recommended. Just a few steps from the metro. In the heart of theater district.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Booked this hotel as part of a package through Virgin Holidays. I travelled with my teenage son.The hotel location on West 41st street is excellent. Close to Time square. Easy to get to from the E line subway from JFK airport.The room was very clean. Being a Brit, I missed having a kettle in the room, and there was no mini fridge. However tea, coffee and hot chocolate are available in the lobby 24 hours per day.Breakfast is good, lots of choice. Can be manically busy if you don’t get there early. Very helpful staff.I would recommend and would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Convenient Clean. Would stay here again. Hard to find the words to reach a 200 word minimum. Close enough to Times Square but not too close. COmpares favorably with other hilton proprerties in this area

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Center during our visit to New York City. When selecting the hotel, I initially chose it because of it proximity to Times Square, It is literally 2 blocks away. When researching I read reviews and most were very positive. We drove into the city from Boston and while this was my first experience driving in New York City, the hotel was pretty easy to navigate to. Upon check in, we were met by Luis, one of the Hotel's staff. He took care of our car and gave us a lot of helpful information on where to go and how to get around. We mentioned it was our 30th anniversary and to our surprise after returning from a days adventure, there was a bottle of wine, some goodies and a card signed by the staff members. This really made our day. The hotel was very clean and the lobby was always alive with people. The concierge helped us with show information. We were able to walk from the hotel to Times Square, the Empire State Building, Central Park. The only time we needed transportation was to Battery Park and One World and again the hotel was located a block from the Port Authority Bus Terminal where we could catch the train to One World. Our room on the 29th floor while small was very well laid out which can't be said of other hotels we stayed at during this trip. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was provided and we enjoyed it everyday. Each day the hot items were a little different but they always had the waffles. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to NYC and say hi to Luis. Thanks Hampton!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was amazing! Really close to Times Square so we could stay late in the city and come back easily to the hotel.The room was very clean and the breakfast was very good.The staff was very helpful and their service was excellent.I am very picky when it comes to hotels and I was extremely pleased with the Hampton Inn Times Square.We would go back anytime!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed four nights at this hotel on the Memorial Day weekend. First, the staff. They were wonderful--friendly and helpful--including at the desk, in the breakfast room and the room attendants. The breakfast included in the room rate was very good and served until 10:00 am, which was nice for late night lifers. Every morning there were different offerings and the selection was quite wide. My only complaint was that sometimes there were not enough tables to seat all who were queued up, but with patience, even this problem resolved fairly quickly. That's the good, and nothing really bad, BUT be prepared for very small rooms. Ours just contained a king bed, a console with a desk and bureau, a desk chair and a padded stool. We were there with our family, and my daughter's room was somewhat larger with a small fridge and second seating bench. Still nothing to write home about regarding space. Like most hotels there was only one luggage rack. I will never understand why hotels don't provide two racks for a "double" room. Finally, the hotel is quite close to Times Square, but far enough away to avoid the dreadful press of humanity, and close to many of the theaters which for us was great because we were doing a theater orgy! We used points to get the room and I note on the TripAdvisor website the rate is $359 without tax. One might do better away from Times Square and using Uber or Lyft to get around.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: "Lilly" texted us while still on the train to anticipate things. And then we came face-to-face with here. Lilly is delightful and professional. At breakfast the first morning, Geraldine couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating with my daughter. A very nice young man - wore really nice dreads - kindly handed me a yogurt with a smile. The woman cleaning on 11th floor asked another group how their stay as so far. Just a really great experience overall. Central location with a subway stop at the corner but tucked down a bit. The dining staff stayed hopping and on top of everything.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel during our last two visits to NYC. Honestly, we wouldn’t want to stay anywhere else. The location is fantastic, the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the staff makes you feel welcome and at home. Special kudos to Rachelle, front desk, and Geraldine, breakfast supervisor, for outstanding customer service. Kevin Giblin, front office supervisor, does a fantastic job managing this hotel and is a pleasure to know. I highly recommend this hotel for your next stay; you won’t be disappointed!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great prices, amazing location, EXCELLENT staff, hands down the best customer service I've ever had. If you're not a Honors member you need to be. They make it easy to continue coming back. 10/10 highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great property! Perfect location steps from Times Square! Hotel property is prime location, rooms are clean and modern! Breakfast in the morning is a plus also in New York! Staff was very kind! Also had coffee and tea available in the lobby for guests all day long. We really enjoyed our down time we were able to step out the door and be in Times Square to enjoy the sights and food and all New York has to offer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is great, but rooms are tinyAlso, For some reason they bought super tiny towels (??)..And even worse, bad quality breakfast without sufficient seatings: id guess they can host 50 people... vs25 floors, 10 rooms per floor.Just nonsenseAlso, 3 elevators clearly were not enough for so many people

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located near Times Square, this hotel offers very clean and comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. The staff was friendly and efficient. I would definately choose this hotel again when staying in the area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just back from a 4 day trip to NYC and am very happy with our stay at Hampton Inn Times Square Central. After a day of enjoying the sights & sound of NYC, the hotel is a welcome oasis of quiet, peace away from the hustle & bustle of Times Square which is only minutes away. The all-day free coffee, tea & water provides a nice touch to the overall experience & the hotel staff diligently refills the supply. Our party of 3 stayed in a relatively comfortable room which was spacious & well-equipped. The only complaint was that housekeeping forgot to clean our room on the 1st night, I suspect that they may have been overwhelmed. This was mentioned to the front desk & minutes later, housekeeping turned up to clean the room. Fast response. The best thing about the hotel is the location, 2 blocks from centre of Times Square yet located on quiet W 41st. Food choices are plentiful with Hell's Kitchen a few blocks away, entrance to the subway is less than 100m away too. We took about 20 minutes to walk to the southwest entrance of Central Park. Breakfast can be a busy with shortage of seats but the suggestion is to avoid the peak hours between 8 to 9am.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed there for 4 nights to celebrate by birthday and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly, efficient and accomodating. The room was clean. The complimentary breakfast was good and the location is VERY convenient. It’s a block or so from Times Square and to all the Action. My brother is wheelchair bound and the staff was very accomodating to his needs. Also, it’s near to many subway stations and the Port Authority bus station. Not all subway stations are handicap accessible but there are a few of them near by this hotel. My family and I were very happy with our stay and experience in general. We definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, friendly & helpful staff, clean room, good breakfast, delicious cookies, etc., etc.Usually efficient elevators. 30 floors, so you may have to wait a minute or two.Handy market to get snacks.Stay here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not a bad little hotel. very small foyer area which can get alittle congested at peak times, as do the lifts. But in general a nice clean hotel with good location and proximity to Times square and other midtown amenities. complimentary breakfast is abit average by NZ standards. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Concierge can also provide an excellent service by obtaining tickets to broadway show and Yankees game for example.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is very close to Port Authority bus station and subway. Rooms were a good size and very clean. Complimentary breakfast was very adequate, did not mind that disposable crockery and cutlery were used. Staff very friendly and efficient. Building work was carried out during night at the theatre next door, not the hotels fault, so was quite noisy if you wanted window open. On check out, it did take over 30mins before we could get a lift to the lobby from the 5th floor. It was a Friday and it felt like people were ching in and out at the same time. However, I would stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here April 2018 it’s so close to Times Square such a great hotel with very helpful staff in all areas ,the hotel lifts are time consuming at peak times with 30+ floors and only 3 lifts ,this hotel is such a great base for exploring New York City

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location! CLEAN hotel. VERY ACCOMODATING! A lovely experience. We really enjoyed staying here. Very close to Times Square. Very closet to the subway entrance. Lots of restaurants to enjoy. A great experience. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My friend & I recently stayed here (May 17-19) in a double room on the 6th floor. The hotel is nice, and the staff was quite friendly & helpful. We arrived around 10 am on the 17th and they held our luggage until check-in time. The hotel's location is perfect: we were close enough to everything we wanted and needed to do in Times Square, but felt as if our hotel was NOT in Times Square. Our room was clean and comfortable and had plenty towels in the bathroom; however, because this IS New York, the room wasn't very big. What I loved most about my room was the PILLOWS!! I have stayed in quite a few Hampton Inns and have always complained that the pillows were too soft. Well these were on point. They were firm enough to support my neck while I slept, but not so hard that I felt like I was on a brick. Thank You SOOOO MUCH for that. The area where the free breakfast was served was crowded when I went down on Friday, but the food was hot and very tasty, which was the most important thing. I LOVED the fresh-out-the-oven chocolate chip cookies located at the front desk each evening, and the fact that the front desk staff gave me a bottle of water whenever I asked . Overall I think this is one gem of a hotel and whenever I go back to NYC, I hope they have a vacancy so I can stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A great hotel, perfect and quiet location. The staff was outstanding, friendly and helpful. We especially loved the housekeeping staff and front desk — always smiley and kind. Our room was super clean and comfortable. As well the daily breakfast, and evening coffee, tea and cookies were just simply a nice touch. We ordered the airport car service and absolutely loved our driver and his professionalism. Highly recommended. We will return. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Fabulous hotel, spacious rooms, clean, super friendly staff. Great city viewsSuper location walking distance to Times Square, subway and all the shows on BroadwayHighly recommend this hotel will definately stay here on my return to New York in the future

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and ten year old granddaughter were in NYC for 2 nights. The Hampton Inn Manhattan was extremely convenient to all the sites. We loved being right in the middle of glorious Times Square, and also appreciated returning to our clean, comfortable, quiet room-with a spectacular view!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very clean, room was on the small side but only used it to sleep anyways so who cares! Really good complimentary breakfast with lots of choices. Would definitely stay again! Farther from the cruise port than I thought .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wow. What an amazing staff! Always willing to help you. One person that deserves a special mention is Darren! He cleaned a table off for us and brought us an extra chair. He went above and beyond to make us happy! Great job Hampton!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I spent 4 nights in this hotel with my two children and from the moment we stepped into this hotel we felt welcomed! All the staff are polite and helpful, I would like to make a special mention about Darren who works in the breakfast area, I am not a morning person but Darren's charm makes everyone's day start well. The hotel was perfectly located for Times Square, great size rooms and spotlessly clean! I would recommend this hotel and we will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel midweek. The location is great - one block from the Times Square Subway and in the midst of the Theater District. This hotel is like most in NYC - rooms are small with the bare minimum but clean and with the essentials. The breakfast was the typical hotel continental breakfast. We were there very early in the morning so it wasn't crowded but I'm sure it could be quite congested later. What made this hotel special were the "extras" - bottles of water given at check-in, warm cookies in the evening, and hot coffee, tea, and ice water during the day. Don't expect luxury - this hotel isn't that. It's the details that make this a unique stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hotel close to theaters and restaurants. Good for families. Convenient to the subway and bus lines. Korea town, China town, Macy's just a subway ride away. Museums are just a few blocks away. ABC studio around the corner.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First things great is the location. IT is near The bus station, Times square, Broadway, restaurants and theaters. The rooms are big by NY standard and The place is clean. The Beds and pillows are comfortable. The staff at The Front desk are accommodating with a,special mention to The concierge, Mr. John Mauro, WHO arranged everything for US from tickets to transportation with ease and sincerity. There was a time he had a day OFW and a certain Lady to ok over for her but was very rude and our needs were not certainly entertained. Bottled Water is free is just ask The Front desk or drink from The small bar at The side. The only downside OF The hotel is The small breakfast area, busy elevator traffic and limited variety in The breakfast. But for The price, this hotel is a bargain. Will Go back in The future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, comfortable hotel with great customer service. Bed was comfortable and room was spacious for New York City hotel. Soon after we got to our room, manager sent us a text to make sure everything was ok. Free breakfast was also good. Elevators were a bit slow but ok. Lobby well maintained and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked one night to take in a show and dinner. We arrived to a super friendly front desk staff who gave us a room plus a bag of goodies b/c we are gold members. Our room 2608 was large and clean and quiet. We really couldn't ask for more. Free breakfast and within walking distance to all the shows and restaurants. We would definitely return. Our only concern was that no matter now we tried, we could not get into the WiFi and had to use our own data.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location midtown, a short walk from Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and Grand Central Station.The staff were very friendly, the room was big enough and kept very clean. The only reason it's not 5 stars is because the breakfast buffet is limiting for special diets and there is absolutely no logic in how the lifts decide where to stop. Whilst this does give you every opportunity to meet people waiting to go somewhere it was frustrating.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I cruised to Bermuda on the Norwegian Escape leaving from the Manhattan Cruise Terminal. We've done this before and decided that this time we'd book a hotel room for the night before to eliminate the stress and rush of a 280 mile drive the day of departure. We like Hampton Inn as a chain and decided to try to the Hampton Inn Times Square Central. The hotel is located less than 2 miles from the Cruise Terminal and convenient to Times Square.The lobby staff was great, from the desk clerks to the parking valet. Check-in was a breeze. I suggest taking advantage of valet parking - it's worth the price. Our room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and well laid out.A short walk from the hotel took us to Times Square where we took in the sights and sounds of the evening activities. We stopped for drinks and a bit of dinner then wandered Times Square some more. When we finally returned to the hotel the friendly staff greeted us and wished us a pleasant night. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. You would hardly know that outside the window was the traffic and 24-hour-a-day bustle of New York City.We plan to return to New York for a couples of nights of Broadway shows and night life. We'll be sure to reserve a room at Hampton Inn Times Square Central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I thought the staff at the hotel was about the best I've ever seen. Front desk clerk very friendly, a bell hop took our bags to hold them for the day until we could check in- he was friendly too. I had a minor tv problem and they fixed that right away even though it was after 10pm. The breakfast staff worked hard to keep everything filled up, which wasn't easy since it was always very crowded. The rooms are fairly new and the bed was comfortable. I have no complaints. And the Subway stop is on the corner - what more could you ask for?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I use the 3 B's score to review a hotel: Bed, Bath, Breakfast.Lets start with the decent things in the hotel: Bed was reasonably comfort. Not amazing -but comfortable.Bath - it was probably renovated not so long ago - but water pressure is low and it takes to much time for the hot water to come - at least in the upper floors. And last but not least- the breakfast- absolutely awful. Very little healthy options, no greens, very little fruits. The dining room is packed so people actually take their breakfast (paper plates..) to the hotel lobby. I decided to step outside to a cafe and by myself a descent breakfast. I also want to mention the elevator issue: there are 3 elevators in the hotel - and the algorithm for those is terrible so as a resident in the high floors you would be stopped in at least 6-7 floors before getting to the lobby. People are waiting so much time for the elevator they wouldn't miss the one that came for the world- so they get in. No meter what. By the time you get to the lobby - the elevator is packed that badly that you need a breath of fresh air before thinking about anything else. There's also a road work in the street currently (may 2018) so ask for a room in the higher floors and to the opposite direction from the 41st. street.One advantage to finish nicely: location is great if you are into the whole times square vibe. A 2 minute walk to the subway and Broadway.and also- front desk service is good - I got an awful room at the 4th floor and asked to move to a different room. I was moved the same afternoon to a higher floor with a descent view. Good luck :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel compared to many in the area. Centrally located, close to many great restaurants and theaters. Everything was lovely, the hotel staff was super helpful. Our stay was enjoyable although we only had a few hours there due to our late arrival and early checkout. The breakfast was very good and plenty for everyone. I highly recommend staying there the next time you are in the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, newly renovated and friendly service. What more can you ask for ( besides slightly bigger rooms?) I particularly enjoyed the bathroom, which, for New York, was spacious...with a large shower stall. Ask for extra towels though, because theirs are kinda thin. The bed was comfortable and the room had decent lighting. We were on the 23 floor I think, so only sirens came through the window, not regular street allowed us to check in a couple of hours early, which was very helpful. The staff was friendly. We didn’t have their breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked this hotel very last minute for our 3 night trip to New York, the hotel is very well located one block from the hustle of Times Square and close to a number of subway stations, good restaurants and bars.Very helpful front desk staff and also Jonny and Darren in the breakfast room, our room on the 17th floor had two double beds a good size bathroom, safe and coffee maker and was adequate for the 3 of us, need to time your visit to the breakfast room right as it can get busy but the selection was good and the staff did a great job.Free drinks all day available in the reception area and cookies late afternoon.All in all would highly recommend this hotel and would have know hesitation in returning if we are ever back in New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located just off Broadway and Times Square. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are clean. Wouldn’t recommend the breakfast. But all in all what you would expect from a city hotel by Times Square as the cost is expensive but that is just what it is!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you used Hampton Inn before you know what to expect. The breakfast was better than on the west coast. Bed was clean. There was some noise on the street at night but this was close to the Times Square so that is normal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton is a very good location. Walking distance to broadway plays, and many restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. Access to computers in the lobby was nice, complementary beverages and cookies was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel overall.ProsValet was quick and honest about services to include expected cost and time for vehicle arrival when requested. Front desk was quick and allowed for early check-in.Hotel room was clean and accommodating.ConsRoom needs mini fridge...Elevators can be a bit busy in the morning, but that’s New York.OtherClose to Broadway, Wolfgang Puck Steakhouse, and Grays Papaya.Will revisit for another musical when the wifey wants to see Pretty Woman.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel. Fantastic locations, very clean, very accommodating. Staff was very nice, and thorough. Rooms are basic but extremely clean. location , you could not ask for anything better. Value actually pretty good. When we go back to the city, will definitely stay there again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We travel to NYC about once a year, but this is our first time trying the Hampton and we will be back. Rooms are updated and the included breakfast is busy, but decent to get you started early. Elevators can be slow during check-out, valet parking was included in our rate and was great. The one thing that made this hotel stand out for us was the Customer Service from the front desk. Especially from, Tobo, Kris, and Jonny. Our room was ready when we arrived and was perfect for our needs. My daughter was celebrating her 18th birthday and we found a birthday card and snacks in our room for her. We really enjoyed our stay. It's a great location if in town to take in a play. We saw Frozen, which was great except too many little kids that didn't stay in their seats and were allowed to be disruptive (beware for Sunday matinee), dined at Carmines (always fun), and shopped in Times Square and walked everywhere.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great customer service from front desk staff person Kevin, who was able to check us in early so we could freshen up after a long flight in order to catch our matinee at 2 pm. Our room was small but comfortable & we had a great city view from our room. The complimentary brkfst was decent — make your own Belgian waffle, egg selection, brkfst meat selection, hot & cold cereals, fruit, yogurt & bread items. Hotel is situated close to all the activity in Times Square. Wi-Fi was kind of slow but not that big of a deal for us. Will definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for my daughter's 18th bday. She's been asking for years for a trip to NYC. Since it was going to be just mom/daughter trip I was a little apprehensive about being in the "big city" on our own (we are from small town MS). From the minute we walked in the door we felt welcome and safe. Front desk offered us water, told us when and where breakfast was served, told us about the rooftop observation area. There was an unexpected snow while there, staff told me several places I could go to get boots. This hotel is in a safe area close to Times Square and lots and lots of places to eat. We were greeted warmly every time we returned. Breakfast was good and plentiful, but seating was limited. We made plates and took them back to our room to eat. There is a microwave by the desk in the lobby along with a little area that offers sundries, drinks. Snacks, ice cream, beer, frozen pizzas, popcorn etc for any late night cravings and you can just charge it to your room. The room was very very small. 2 beds. We got the city view and could see the top of the Empire State Building. Our room was also not cleaned one day. We ended up going down and getting towels. We were not in the room very much so I'm not sure why we didn't get the service that one day. On the day of check out, a young man took our bags and even hauled a taxi for us to get back to Penn station. Overall, we had an amazing trip. In a great, friendly hotel. With comfy beds, and a great view. I've included 2 pics of the view from our room. 1 pic of the room. And 1 pic from the roof observation deck.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is central to Times Square. Good sized room for NewYork. Clean and very comfortable bed and shower facilities. Free tea and coffee in lobby.The staff were excellent and extremely helpful, very willing to assist with questions and services, checked in our cases and organised transport to airport for a late flight home. Good IT facilities. Breakfast is including but it is self service and not very relaxing. Ok if you want a quick early start with paper plates, plastic cutlery and cardboard cups. Just not for me. The only thing missing is a lounge / bar which we would have liked to relax in after a great day shopping and sightseeing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Easy walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center...metro is only 1/2 block away with a straight shot to Central Park or Statue of Liberty and 911 Memorial. Clean comfortable modern rooms. Breakfast service was very good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here last July and loved the location. It's also one of the few places in the Times Square area where you can book a room with two beds, which my friend and I prefer.I was aware that the 3 elevators are often quite packed and that at times, you'll have to wait for quite a while before one stops that has room for you to get on. For this reason, I requested a lower floor so that I could use the stairs to go to and from the room. I'm glad that I did. What I was disappointed with this visit was the housekeeping. We were there for four nights, and left the room very early each morning, and were out and about for the majority of the day. Despite this, we had to request housekeeping service late in the afternoon (3-4 ish) the first couple of days so that we could take showers and clean up before going out in the evening. I have stayed in many hotels that have the "Make up the room" electronic request feature. Perhaps this location could make door hangers like the DND signs that ask for housekeeping service?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel and in a very good location to see all the sights. We were able to walk to most of them. Most of the staff are very friendly and welcoming. The room we stayed in was a good size and there was no rowdiness from other guests considering how big the hotel was.The free tea,coffee and water in the lobby was a bonus. Many thanks to John the concierge for his help with booking theatre tickets (we went to see Kinky Boots which was excellent) and his straight forward directions to various places that we wanted to see. The only downside was the breakfast. The food was okay and plentiful but the problem we had was finding a seat as it got very busy at certain times. Also I don't like plastic cutlery and paper plates. But I would gladly stay in this hotel again. It was excellent!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The best thing about the hotel is the location, its just off Times Square and we could walk to many of the sights in New York.I was disappointed with the Customer Service. When we checked in all the receptionist wanted to do was take our payment, nothing was explained to us about breakfast, the gym, laundry or any other services the hotel could offer us while we stayed here. The only saving grace was the Concierge who I spoke to daily about places to visit and she was always really helpful and informative.The breakfast was good (although my pet hate is paper plates and plastic cutlery) and whatever time we came down we would be able to find a table within a few minutes.We were on the 23rd floor and could see the signs for Times Square out of a side window. The room was fairly compact for a family of 4, and I originally couldn't find a wardrobe, but it was the cupboard I had seen a safe and ironing board in, which was around 2ft wide, so it was a good job we were only staying for 4 days, any more than that and we would have struggled with our clothes.We were able to leave our suitcases on the day we were leaving which was great as our flight was not until 11pm, so that was brilliantI'm not sure I would stay again, as there are plenty of other hotels in the area

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just back from staying here 3 nights and seriously doubt I will ever book anywhere but here in future NYC visits. The location was awesome, easy access to Times Square and Port Authority subways. I checked in and picked my room prior to arrival and when we arrived we were greeted by a smile from Kevin, warm cookies and bottles of water. All the staff here were exceptional and friendly and I wish I got all their names but a shout out to Kevin and Farrell. Our room was spotless and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh, and wow, so the staff here work hard....they never stop and they are just smiling and friendly, clearing tables and pulling trash. I was just so impressed by their professionalism despite the busy, busy room. Thank you!We will tell all our friends to consider staying with you in NYC and we hope to stay with you again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the moment you step into the lobby of this hotel you feel welcomed. The staff is very accommodating. In fact, prior to your arrival you receive a text message welcoming you, and already asking if there is anything which they can help you with. Very professional. Always greeting you with a smile and

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had a great experience staying at this property. The staff were friendly and helpful, even checking us in around 11:00AM (way early) as our room was ready for us-a wonderful surprise. The property itself is great. We even enjoyed the surprise little rooftop viewing area, a fun extra. It's a well-kept property-very nicely decorated, modern, and clean. Our room was typical NYC size but with a lovely modern bathroom and very comfortable bed.Breakfast was fine-busy but not overwhelmed and good options.The location was fantastic for us. Very walkable to Penn Station and Times Square but not in the midst of total chaos either-really perfect.We got a great Travelzoo deal for this hotel and that was the icing on the cake. I'd highly recommend this hotel to others!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Price and location were perfect! This was not my first time in NYC, but it was my first solo trip. They were very accommodating. Checking in and out was super easy. I arrived early without having had coffee and saw they had 24/7 coffee available. Upon checkout, I went to do some exploring and they made sure to send me on my way with some snacks. It was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent two nights here. Rooms were clean, shower was hot, and it was very close to a subway stop and all the theatres. We really appreciated Daren, who worked the breakfast room. That room got very busy and he was always patient, helpful and kind dealing with hungry, tired people. The desk staff were all pleasant and efficient. The hallways here are narrow and rooms are a bit small, but would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was fantastic!! The front desk staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. The room was very spacious for a downtown hotel and the location was perfect! It's right in the middle of the hustle and bustle and walkable to pretty much everything in Midtown but pleasantly calm and quiet inside. We took advantage of the free breakfast on our last morning. It was crowded but the staff did a fantastic job of keeping things stocked, clean and organized. The front desk staff gave us a nice tip to walk through the McDonald's across the street from the hotel as a short cut to getting to 42nd to the Starbucks we were looking for. I don't know that I've found a better value in Times Square than this Hampton Inn and would highly recommend it for any type of traveler.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here for a solo trip to New York for seven nights. For ease, I have divided my review into sections.LocationThe location for NYC could not be better. It is a two minute walk from the hotel to Times Square, Broadway and a subway station. The hotel itself is on a 'quieter' (for NYC!) street but minutes in either direction offer a host of restaurants and places to buy snacks, as well as the key attractions such as theatres. I found that I could walk to many of the key sites from the hotel without any problems.Hotel facilitiesCheck in was quick, easy and friendly and staff were always on hand to help with questions or concerns. The lobby area is spacious with seating which is useful if waiting for taxis etc. There is also water and hot drinks available here which is a nice touch.The hotel is large with 31 floors and is serviced by three elevators. These were honestly the most irritating part of the stay - they seemed to have a mind of their own when it came to stopping for you when called, they were constantly packed at busy times and the keycard swipe system to select your floor was irritating. My advice would be to ask for a low floor and take the stairs at peak times!The roomMy room was large enough for me and easily big enough for two people. The bed was huge, very comfortable and the pillows were some of the most comfortable I have ever encountered in a hotel. A spacious wardrobe and drawers meant plenty of room for all my stuff. The bathroom was also large with a shower. The room had all the basics - toiletries, air conditioning and a coffee machine. My only complaint was while the coffee machine was great, powdered creamer was provided which wasn't to my taste.BreakfastBreakfast was provided during my stay. I chose this option because while I knew NYC offered hundreds of breakfast options I knew it would be good for me to be able to grab something before heading out for the day. The breakfast options were varied, offering cereal, pastries, yogurt and fruit as well as a few limited hot options including mini omelettes and 'make your own' waffles. I had breakfast several times during my stay and found the food options varied and of a good quality. I would recommend every Brit try Fruit Loops if you have never done so before! However... The area for breakfast was relatively small compared to the size of the hotel and it was often incredibly busy so there was nowhere to sit. This was frustrating at times. Also, all of the plates and cutlery was disposable paper and plastic which I felt was a complete waste and not very eco-friendly, as well as being irritating when on one occasion my plastic cup leaked everywhere!Value for moneyWhen looking at hotels for NYC, I noticed some included the city tax whereas some charged this as an additional extra on arrival. I chose Hampton Inn because it was an all included price. I think for the standard of the room and the superb location it was definitely good value for money.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Location perfect, staff super friendly and helpful. Never had a problem with the lifts or breakfast ( which was good) as we avoided the busy times. Perfect all round. Hope to stay again, soon.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hampton good breakfast nice clean rooms Located very close to Times Square. Fitness center located in basement. Microwave located in lobby close to business center. Free cookies in evening . Elevator is only drawbavk

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location helpful staff.I stayed there for one night. Simply one of the best hotels in the area. The rooms are modern design. They offer a great variety of breakfast. Very cosy and you feel home. Thank you for a memorable stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just .got back from a 8 day 7 night stay at the Hampton Inn/Times Square Central. The staff was wonderful and made our experience better than expected. We were a family of 4 that only reserved one room. That was a mistake. The rooms at The Hampton Inn are very small.
