Bathroom has 1 small sink and a shower The rooms only had 2 double beds which I was aware of, but no sitting area for tv and barely any clothes storage space. When we were tired of going sight seeing and walking Times Square the only place we could sit and relax was up in our room on our beds to watch Tv. . Most of the rooms were right next to the elevators. They had a decent free breakfast. Sometimes it got very crowded but that is to be expected. Again the staff was very helpful. Put us in a bigger room than we started out with but it was still really too small for 4 people.The staff did what they could with what they had. I think it is a good hotel to stay in for a quick stop for a couple of days but next time I think I will book a hotel that is more resort like, that has a restaurant and a lobby to kick back in . I picked the Hampton for a better price which included breakfast but we could've stayed in a more comfortable place without breakfast included for just a little more money. Next time Breakfast included will not be the deciding factor on which hotel I wind up at. This time it unfortunately was. This hotel is great for business travelers for an overnight stay. . ,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was just a block away from Times Square. It was quiet, clean, and an extremely helpful staff. I figured the noise would be a problem, but it was never an issue. The internet was good. The breakfast was crowded, but McD was right across the street. I would stay here again with the family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 1 night to attend a NY Yankees game. This hotel is in a great location close to Times Square and easy subway access. Check in was a breeze, the staff friendly and the room was well cleaned and modern. While the breakfast are is small we had no trouble finding a table and the selection was very good. We stayed on the 26th floor so there was no problem with street noise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, clean rooms, and complimentary breakfast was a plus. I would have given 5 stars if the staff could have explained why I wasn't given the rooms I reserved on the on-line website. Other than that I would recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place to stay. Location was very convenient. Loved the complimentary afternoon cookies and the breakfast to go bags. Rooms were cleaned and comfortable. Staff was very helpful with suggestions for our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My friend and I recently stayed at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central. I was very nervous and honestly a little (okay, a LOT) intimidated by New Yorkers. I was expecting rude people and judgement. I couldn't have been more wrong!! Our first contact was with a very nice man, Luis, that helped us out of our cab and even took our bags in for us. Then we went to the check in desk and the man checking us in was probably the NICEST person I have ever met! His name was Kris, and he was absolutely wonderful. We told him we were seeing Aladdin, and he gave us a tip that if you walk straight through the McDonald's across the street, the theater is right next door. That's another thing, this hotel is in the PERFECT location. It's right in the heart of Times Square without being on a main street, and it's about a 2 minute (if that) walk from the hotel to the New Amsterdam theater and Madame Tussaud's. And believe me, I am not a fast walker. When we checked out, we tentatively asked if they could hold our bags after we did so we could go to Madame Tussaud's, and they were more than happy to do it! When we left, Luis carried our bags out and even waved down a cab for us while dancing in the street to Michael Bublé (He's a great dancer). I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The elevators can get crowded quickly during busy times, but if you're patient enough you'll get one that isn't. The breakfast was a little disappointing, but all in all this hotel was great. I would absolutely stay here again!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is centrally located half a block from Port Authority bus Terminal and 10 blocks from Penn Station and 2 blocks from the Tourist trap called Times Square. Due to size and location time your elevator ride and complimentary breakfast accordingly. 8:00 to 10:00 AM or 5:00 to 8:00 PM you will have to skip a few elevators before you get on one.Bathrooms and Room are small as expected but very clean. Good complimentary Internet and Breakfast again time your Breakfast to avoid searching for a place to sit

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We try to get to NYC every 2/3 years and your location and services met all our desires. You are in the middle of everything and also maintain an excellent hotel. Your staff could not do enough for us. Front desk was very helpful and answered all concerns we had. Your breakfast staff were one of the best trained and most friendly group of people that my wife and I have encountered in many years of traveling.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Got in a little early and the front desk staff set us up with an early check in. That was awesome! Breakfast staff were very polite and kept the trays filled. Rooms were clean and updated. Hotel is close to subway entrances. The only down side was the the elevator wait times during peak usage around 8-10 am and 5-7 pm. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here from the 16th April for 5 nights with my husband and 15yr old sonSo pleased I chose this hotel, it was perfect for our trip Great location, staff are fabulous, room was very good even though it was a little small it was comfortable, spotlessly cleaned , very comfortable bed which is great when you’ve had a busy day in the city . Breakfast had everything you need , can get busy but it’s a busy hotel ! No problem with the lifts and the complementary hot drinks are a lovely touch Would definitely return to this hotel I booked this holiday as a surprise for my hubbys 50th and it didn’t disappoint

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed one night for a show.LIKES:Great location for theatersQuick elevatorsProfessional and friendly staffDecent free breakfastQuietCleanDISLIKES:Very small room and bathroomSmall lobby gets quite crowdedUnderstaffed breakfast area ran out of coffee, cream and spoonsSUMMARY:This is an excellent place to stay short-term, for a trip to Times Square and the theater district. Not recommended if you plan to stay for a long time, as the room is tiny, the computer desk area small, and the bathroom counter is really only suitable for one person to use at a time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I always tend to look at reviews when it comes to doing anything!!! And during this trip I did the same . I looked up hotels in time square with valet parking and less then 2 min walk to time square. As I looked to book at a previous hotel I saw the reviews for Hampton Inn to match that of other very popular hotels. After looking at the reviews and looking at pictures we decided to book. And I have to say WOW!!! I loved it.. everything from the hotel texting me about my check in to the front desk being sooo friendly and approachable. The gentlemen Jeremy check us in with a beautiful smile. Explained everything! I mean who doesn’t like the following:Valet parkingFree breakfast from 6am - 10amComplementary coffee and tea (helps with cold weather)Check out at 12pmSign me up!!!!Room was spacious and clean. Bed was comftable (didn’t wake up one)Breakfast was great, love how you can make your own Waffles which led me to discover how great I am at making them :-)But the one of the main reasons I like the hotel is he fact that they can watch your bags while you explore the city even AFTER you check out!!! We took full advantage. After eating breakfast at 9am we went shopping and came back at 11am, checked out and told valet to get our car since you should request it 30-45 min before leaving. And we went to grab a quick bite and some gifts for the kids.We came back 45 min later and our car was ready to go and once we came back to the hotel found out that our bags were already in the car!! I will write that again... OUR bags were already on the car.. ready to go!!! Seriously how convenient... I didn’t get the gentleman’s name. He had amazing long hair do :-)We really enjoyed our stay and I am currently looking into booking to come back with the kids in June. The hotel is very family friendly but also very nice for couples (it was out mini get away)Soo Hampton Inn!!! Thank you for a amazing stay!! We will be back (Arnold’s voice)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It’s a nice warm comfortable hotel. The location is great 2 minutes walk from port Authority bus/train station and from main Times Square. Everything is nearby. The breakfast is included/ free with the room, which was delicious with waffles everyday. The room was nice and cozy. The staff is nice too

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed overnight Sunday into Monday. We arrived a little bit earlier and the room wasn't ready. They had it ready very quickly. Front desk staff was friendly, breakfast was good, location was great. We will definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was clean, very friendly staff, good complimentary breakfast, comfortable beds...in walking distance to everything, in Times Square central, what more could you want for such a great price! Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed Hampton Inn Times Square on 41st Street...had a Great stay. John the concierge was extremely knowledgeable and helpful and provided us some great suggestions. He suggested the musical Kinky Boots with Wayne Brady and we really enjoyed it. The free breakfast provided a nice variety of hot and cold breakfast items...fresh omelettes daily. The breakfast attendants kept the area very clean. Darren was very friendly! Highly recommend this Hampton Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I travel to NYC for business four to five times a year (for the last 10 years.) I usually stay at a Hilton family property but also have a few boutique hotels I love. This was my first stay at this Hampton Inn and it is by far my best and most pleasant stay in the city ever. I arrived at 7:30am prepared to leave my bags with the bellman but Kris at registration was able to get me in to a room right away. He was so friendly and welcoming so after my 3am wake up call for the flight in to NYC, I was grateful for the smiles and the room being ready. Besides the great welcome, what I noticed immediately was the feel in the lobby. It is bright, open, and arranged in such a way that it did not have that crowded NYC lobby feel. The breakfast room did get crowded but it was easy enough to move out in to the lobby where I always saw empty seats. The second thing I was over joyed with was the speed of the elevators. I was on the 23rd floor and I never had to wait long. By the way, on my first entry to the elevator, a very helpful employee, Tobo, was quick to hold the door open and explain the process of using the card. (I think it was Tobo, may have been Jonny, either way - at various times they were BOTH incredibly helpful.) Okay, on to the room. The hallway from elevator to room was wide, bright, and clean. The room was big by NY standards and the view of the city amazing. The bathroom likewise was big and laid out in a very user friendly way. The shower was the largest I have ever had in the city and the water pressure amazing. (I was a little sad when I returned home missing that strong spray.) There was always plenty of hot water too, which can sometimes be an issue in a large hotel. I read other reviews about the outlet not being near the desk... in my room it was true that the outlet was on the wall to the left and not right under the desk but my power cord reached it with room to spare. No problem there at all. The bed was comfy of course, it's a Hilton. Plenty of hangers in the closet, all the other amenities I need in a room were there. The location for me was perfect; a five block walk to my work and just a little farther to my favorite restaurants. It was heavenly to leave and return to this hotel each day without being jostled by hoards of tourists and be so warmly received. As long as the price stays within my budget, this will be my go to hotel for all of my stays. Thank you, Kris, Tobo, Jonny, and Rachelle!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent a quick night in NYC and wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a prime location. The Hampton Inn fit the bill perfectly. The room was small, but comfortable. And we had a great view from the 27th floor. We liked that it wasn't one of the big mega hotels. And, the location was perfect, close enough to Times Square but not right in the middle of it. Have already recommended to friends and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I had a great stay at this hotel on this short trip to see a Broadway show. Prices were very high (mid $300s, as I recall) for the night we needed, so I traded in a bunch of credit card points for a free night here. The location was just about perfect. It was a quick walk up from Penn Station, just 8 short blocks, and the hotel signage was easy to spot from all the way down at 8th Avenue (the hotel is about 200 ft off 7th Ave.).We were warmly welcomed and expertly checked in by the thoroughly professional Rachelle. That check-in experience is so important in establishing trust in the hospitality experience, and she aced it! Even though it's a big-city hotel, the lobby space felt reachable and knowable: there was a business center behind and to the left of the front desk, a 24-hr coffee/tea station just in front and to the left of the front desk, a sitting area with comfortable couches and a big TV screen opposite the front desk, a booking agent just to the left of that (for tours and Broadway tickets), and to the right, a large table with plenty of seats and power ports for laptop and tablet users. The breakfast area was set off just to the left beyond the elevators. I mean, it was all right there, making even a one-night stay easily navigable and very comfortable.The hotel was filled with all kinds of folks: families, both domestic and international; business travelers, both solo and in groups; lots of 20- and 30-somethings on city breaks; and retirees like us just doing their thing. And language galore! People everywhere seemed to be in a good mood, which I think says a lot about the hotel.The room was comfortable. It was one of the recent remodels among Hampton Inns, with the large, sliding door to the bathroom, with entry directly from the bedroom rather than the entry hallway. Everything was fresh and clean, with bathroom and coffee station supplies fully stocked and everything in perfect working order. Beds and bedding comfortable.Breakfast was equally well run, and fully stocked with just about every option in the Hampton Inn "menu." There is a sign in the lobby alerting guests to the typical quiet and busy hours in the breakfast room, which is great for setting expectations and allowing guests to plan accordingly--much better than the surprise about crowds when you're in a rush, and another sign that management is keyed in to customer satisfaction.That's enough. Don't want to give them big heads! Oh, soundproofing in the room was excellent!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in April 2018 as a family of four (two children aged 13 and 15). Very central location and great access to subway. We had a room on 18th floor facing 41st street and didn't really notice any noise during the night - and floor overall was very quiet. Beds / pillows extremely comfortable. Only 'niggle' with the room was that bathroom door opened onto the sleeping area - not the most private.While breakfast room was crowded every morning, we found a table within a couple of minutes each day. Breakfast room staff were fantastic - friendly and efficient. Olivia especially wonderful.Free coffee, tea, water, hot chocolate (and occasional cookies!) in the lobby were a real treat at the end of the day, and before bed. Great value, clean, very friendly staff. Our 2nd stay in a Hampton Inn (1st was in Toronto) and will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, few steps away from Times square. We had a room on the 16th floor with a view on 41st street and didn’t hear much noise. We had a room with 2 double beds (2 adults and 2 kids). Beds and pillow were confortable, housekeeping did a great job and overall personnel was really nice. The bathroom was really tiny and breakfast is horrible but I would still recommend as all the rest was great and prices are correct.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I travel to Times Square for business every couple of months. I just tried this hotel for the first time. I have stayed in at least 5 different hotels in the TS area. This one was, by far, the quietest. I had a room that faced the back but not very high up. Even when I was awake and trying to listen for traffic, sirens, horns, I could not hear anything. I got my best NYC sleep. I will be booking this for my business travel to the area now.As others have said, the breakfast room can be crowded so plan accordingly. The staff were very attentive to making sure all the food stations were full or replenished.Sometimes I had to wait for elevators. But that is my only minor issue. With 30+ floors they were sometimes all busy for a while with only 3 elevators.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stay here to be literally steps from the heart of the action in Times Square. Staff is very nice. Rooms are small by Hampton standards but this is 32 stories of prime real estate in Manhattan. Breakfast buffet is very crowded so allow extra time to eat if you are on a tight schedule. Skyline is visible from the roof observatory. Check at the desk to see what hours it is open for viewing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Comfortable hotel. Size appropriate for NYC. McDonalds opposite the hotel. Broadway theater one block away at 42nd Street. Lots of restaurants and cafes around. Breakfast can get very busy, so plan ahead. Closer to 8th Avenue than 7th., if you are driving.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have stayed in a lot of Hamptons and this might be my favorite. Very nice staff and well designed rooms. Breakfast was busy, but great. The location couldn't have been better - you could see time square from the windows and get to all of the subways with ease. Just a 10 minute walk to Grand Central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I went on a cruise from New York City in the middle of March ( not the best idea as far as weather goes ). After the cruise we stayed at this hotel for three nights ( it became 4 nights because of the nor'easter and we couldn't fly out as scheduled). The location was great, very close to Times Square and many other major sites. The hotel room had a king bed and a good size bathroom and it appeared that the room had recently been renovated. The breakfast was offered every morning from 6am till 10am. The breakfast room was very larger, and we never had a problem finding a seat. The selection was very good, from juices, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit (3), waffles that you made yourself, muffins, mini danish, donuts, yogurt, and every day a different egg selection and meat selection. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate were offered 24 hours, and in the early evening they offered fresh baked cookies. The staff was very helpful and friendly in every way possible. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that when we couldn't fly home on Wednesday, and we had to stay the extra night our room rate went way up and with the various taxes our room cost $360.00 US,but we were told that if it had been the following night the rate would only have been $120.00 plus tax. Not much we could do but we weren't all that happy. If we ever go back in the nicer weather we would certainly stay at this hotel. It had a lot going for it and as I said earlier it was a great hotel and a fantastic location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything about this hotel is great, fantastic staff, location, comfortable and spotlessly clean rooms. Had no problems with the lifts and yes though breakfast can get busy later on in the morning, you can still easily get a seat. I can honestly say the best thing about this hotel is its friendly and very very helpful staff who are genuinely nice people. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when I go back to NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I traveled with two grandchildren, 16 and 18. We arrived at the hotel After an early morning flight into LaGuardia, we were immediately checked into our room. This hotel is centrally located for Broadway plays. The Greyline hop on and off bus stop was at the corner of 41st and 7th. Also, a subway station was near the hotel. This hotel and its location created a perfect stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay was amazing!! The rooms were clean (VERY important to me), the staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and welcomed, and the breakfast staff was on point-they managed high volumes of people with ease and expertise. Luis made sure our ride to the airport was smoke-free and that was great! The elevators (hard to get and too small) were probably the only drawback of the whole stay. The location was excellent too! Overall, we will definitely be back to the Hampton Inn Times Square Central in the future and we will recommend to our family and friends too!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from staying 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Square. The hotel is situated in a great spot for Times Square & Broadway.On arrival we had a very warm welcome from reception and everything was explained thoroughly to us especially about how busy the breakfast room becomes (there is also a clear board on display showing the best times visit/ avoid the breakfast room!) and how to quickly arrive in Times Square via crossing through McDonalds directly opposite the front entrance of the hotel. Our bedroom on 15th floor was of an adaquet size with a decent sized shower room too. It was comfortable, clean and tidy but we felt that the bed covers were a little too shabby! The room was cleaned daily and re-stocked with toiletries. The buffet breakfast was suitable with plenty of choice of hot & cold food, including juices,fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, waffles, eggs (scrambled, boiled & omlettes), Turkey sausages, bread, muffins and pastries. All members of reception staff, concierge, dining staff and house keeping were all very friendly and competent in their roles making our stay a pleasure. A special mention goes to Louis who looked after us and organised our departure. Top tip: If possible take an early breakfast if you want to sit quietly and enjoy breakfast in the dining room, we didn't appreciate other guests telling us we couldn't sit at a table that they were saving for their family who didn't arrive for 20 minutes and in which time we would have finished eating!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We became Hilton Honors members because of the quality of the service we receive at Hilton hotels. The location of this hotel is impossible to bit. It’s right at the Time Square corner but at the same time it’s on a quite street. Also I want to point out the comfort of the bed and pillows and the size of rooms. They are so big and spacious unlike other hotels in NY. Great customer service!! We arrived early at 6 am, and Rachelle who registered us in went above and beyond to accommodate us. She texted us when room became available. Great customer service!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Well located. Nearby Bus Terminal and subway. Room was decent. Breakfast daily with limited choice but its good. Tried two days breakfast and its different menu Limited seating during breakfast timing. Be sure to go for breakfast early.Complimentary drinks at lobby 24 hour daily is a plus point

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is located right in Times Sq., clean rooms, full breakfast included, hot coffee and tea in Lobby, most importantly....the staff was very cordial! That is the big difference between hotels. Staff makes or breaks a stay....just as important as rooms themselves.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights. Hotel has a great location close to many landmarks, shows, restaurants and subway station.What made our visit so memorable was act of kindness. I have son with Autism who loves bacon. On our first breakfast, bacon made him super happy, but it was not served everyday. For him not knowing the schedule is extremely difficult. We asked the super nice breakfast supervisor Geraldine for the schedule. When she find out what was the issue, she made him bacon everyday.You can google the hotel and find all things about it but what made this hotel especial and excellent for us was KINDNESS!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here in February for 2 weeks with my husband and 2 teenage girls. Amazing hotel, perfect location, view from our room on the 26 floor was stunning. It was my birthday while we stayed and the staff all signed a card and left a goodie bag in the room for me, which I was very grateful. Yes the breakfast times were busy but we always found somewhere to sit ,even in reception area was fine with us. Geraldine in the dining room was a star and always found time to come and say good morning. Darren in the dining room was also extremely nice and always greeted us with a good morning. We had an amazing time, an amazing stay and if I ever go. Back to New York this is the hotel for me.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I went to meet my HS senior's trip in NY. The hotel is conveniently located close to Penn Station. I walked- it was lovely day. My room was clean and neat. Great people!! They were so very nice, Johnny outside helping me get a cabs, Geraldine Meehan in the breakfast area was so nice and also after I had checked out I needed to use the lavatory and I went downstairs. OMG the area smelled so CLEAN!!! Incredible!! My compliements to the attendant Kerry Ann Smith!!! Cons: elevators were slow and my shower was only barely luke-warm. Maybe because I was on the 23rd floor. Next time I will ask for lower floor. Definitely will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent 3 nights here & really enjoyed our stay. Staff was friendly & helpful - rooms were clean & as large as a recent Hampton we stayed in which is impressive for NY! (And we are a bit larger family & were fine!) As other have said - breakfast room gets a tad busy but there is a decent size seating area and seating spills into the lobby area as well. (Just get down early if you don’t like crowds but we didn’t think it was that bad). We drove to the city this time and felt this was fairly easy to get to. Valet parking @ front was a little busy when we got there so we just circled the block one time and came back around. Super close to subway stop & if you like time square you are right there. (We try to avoid it because it’s just too touristy but lots of people like to go down there & if you don’t - no worries just hop on the subway and go somewhere else without all the chaos! ) Yes some of the street noise can be heard from your window but we didn’t find it all that bad! Overall nice!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff is always courteous and professional. Property is located in Times Square area and accessible to all the popular attractions. Rooms are clean and fresh. Love the security of the elevator system - need to have room key to access.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A perfect stay for my family. The valet greeted us with a smile and the front desk was great too. The lobby and our room was spotless. Warm cookies were delicious. A room for $200 including breakfast in New York in the heart of the city is an incredible deal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great service. Loved the Hilton Honors complimentary early check-in (especially, after a red-eye flight from the West Coast) and the daily free water and snacks. The front desk also went the extra mile to refrigerate leftovers from a dinner at a nearby restaurant -- which I finished late the next evening -- after a long work day and a night at the theatre, thereby saving me $35 for another dinner.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very friendly, efficient, professional check-in despite a hotel lobby full of guests. Valet was also efficient and friendly. A clean albeit small room (but hey, it's NYC where most hotel rooms are "tight" on space). Centrally located, 2 min walk to Times Square. We were on the 12th floor and could still hear the sporadic shouts of people at street level but nothing too inconvenient - it lasted till about midnight on a Saturday night. Overall, a good stay that exceeded our expectations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had visited New York to see the Broadway play “Come From Away”. We stayed at this hotel to be in walking distance of all the main attractions. The hotel was very clean and the service was excellent. The concierge in the lobby was a fountain of information and extraordinarily friendly. The breakfast, which was included in the nightly rate, offered a great variety and was of excellent quality. The food was hot and constantly replenished. If you want a great hotel in the middle of Manhattan, you won’t go wrong at the Hampton!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very impressed with this facility and loved the location. Have stayed at other locations in Times Square through the years at a higher price point. This by far was our favorite. Quiet location in the hub of things just a few steps off of Broadway. Thanks to all at the property as this was a flawless stay. Also Loved the HHonors acknowledgment goodies!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay was a great experience. From the moment we walked in the door, the staff made us feel at home and always went out of their way to help us with anything we needed- store our luggage, snacks, cabs, etc... The room was clean and perfect for our trip. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to so many sites and wonderful restaurants. I highly recommend this location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is close to Times Square, Subway/Buses, Broadway, Restaurant District and the double decker bus tours. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Even though we had a room that backed up to the elevators, we never heard it. Highly recommend this hotel. Family is already talking about going back for another visit to the city that never sleeps.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great time at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central! Our room was clean & comfortable & we appreciated the closet & dresser storage as well as the abundance of outlets & USB ports. We had no problems with the complimentary internet & found the speed to be sufficient. My son appreciated the workout facilities & we were both grateful for the availability of beverages in the lobby 24/7. With so many great places to eat in NYC, we really didn’t take advantage of the complimentary breakfast but my son walked through one day & said the selection looked good. It’s a good location, just outside the bright lights & chaos of the heart of Times Square but still walking distance to theatres, shopping, plenty of restaurants & the subway. The elevators got bogged down around check-in & check-out times, but you will find that anywhere. What put our stay over the top, however, was the exceptional customer service. I wish I could recall the names of all the helpful & friendly people we encountered during our stay to recognize them here. Kris & Luis greeted us each time we came & went, asked about our stay & assisted with some personal business I needed to complete during my stay. We really felt welcomed by each and every staff person we interacted with. Thanks for making our stay so memorable!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The experience was excellent, the room was super clean and nice. The breakfast was really good. Definitely we love it . Very nice location. No complains very satisfied with the staff . I rate it as 5 stars.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I had an awesome trip to the city. Hampton Inn helped make it possible! The room was very clean and updated. This location is a good find. Looking forward to coming back for another stay here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I find myself staying here more often due to the fabulous location for my trips as a playwright. This time, the staff were all exceptionally friendly. The folks in the breakfast room were wonderful. The housekeeper was sweet. The bellman was helpful and social. The front desk staff were efficient and handled a couple of questions happily. I left my phone in a taxi and the front desk staff were great about relaying messages from the driver to let me know he was bringing it to me.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central for 4 nights in late February 2018 with my daughter and granddaughter and had a truly wonderful trip. The location of the hotel is perfect, in walking distance of the subway (our stop was the red line 42nd Street), Broadway, Times Square and so much more. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and were always cheerful.Our room, on the 24th floor, was spacious with a great view. It was a large family room, very comfortable with two double beds and the housekeeping staff kept it spotlessly clean. The room also had free wifi. There are three lifts from reception to access the rooms and we rarely had to wait long for a lift to arrive. The lifts are operated by your room card which is a nice security feature. We all really enjoyed the complimentary buffet breakfast and the waffle makers were a big hit! Every morning there was a different hot egg and meat choice, cold hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, toast, pastries and three waffle makes so you could make your own waffles, plus fruit juice and hot drinks. We also loved the complimentary 24 hour tea, coffee, hot chocolate and iced water in reception. The Hampton Inn also provided complimentary warm freshly baked cookies in the afternoons and "breakfast to go" bags for days when you are in a hurry containing a small bottle of water, a muffin and a healthy bar. I would all love to visit New York again as we had such an amazing trip, with glorious weather, and if I do visit again, I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere other than the Hampton Inn Times Square Central, it really is a fabulous hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from a short trip to NYCTreated by a wonderful receptionist that got us checked in and in our rooms quickly - we was only staying 1 night so wanted to get out as soon as possible Jam packed day - the location is spot on 20 minutes walk to Central Patk 10 minutes to Macy's We had a city view on the 30th Floor room - 3003 perfect views shame we wasn't there longer Beds Amazing we literally fell asleep and didn't wake til amour alarm Went for a shower first thing on the Tuesday morning and this was where we mark the hotel down - the bath had not been cleaned fully Thick black hairs laid at the bottom of the bath Now I'm blonde and my mates ginger so these were definitely not ours Dont see any reason the complain - it didn't reuin our stay or make me ill Just wasn't nice seeing it We went down checked out and left our bags locked away Also I love the fact that u have to scan ur room key in order to go to your floor in the lift Decided to head to the breakfast room - absolute chaos No tables to sit at Asked the waitress if it was ok for us to eat in reception - which she said was okAs we had a trip booked at Central Park for 9 and it was a rush for us so needed to eat and go Was a bit awkward eating in reception but again we didn't have time to worry about this The hotel overall is 5/5 on here but with the attention taken away from our bath being dirty that's why I dropped them to a 4/5

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Was in the city for three nights for a conference at a hotel a few blocks away. Found my 11th floor room to be clean, comfortable and most of all quiet despite the location near Broadway shows and Times Square. The free breakfast buffet adds value to the already reasonable price. My only complaint/suggestion is the breakfast area is too tight for the traffic each morning. It is difficult to navigate both the buffet and the dining area because of the design. There has to be better flow and an easier way in out of of much of the seating.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed four nights and loved this hotel. Excellent customer service, perfect location. Rooms are super clean, complementary coffee . There is also free breakfast and it is a great one!Will definitively recommend this hotel and will stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for my birthday trip to New York at beginning March. Great room on third floor, big shower and bed. The staff here are fantastic , so helpful. I arrived hobbling caused by new shoe blisters and four band aids appeared! Location is excellent. Free coffee and breakfast a plus. It's the best hotel I have stayed in New York after about 8 different visits. Will return, wouldn't consider going anywhere else now.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great friendly staff. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway theater, and subway. Would definitely return. Affordable rooms including buffet breakfast. Complimentary Hot drinks available 24/7 at the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Location for Times Square, Fair buffet style breakfast, Friendly & helpfull staff. Fair size room with comfy bed. Would stay here again when going to Times Square. Stayed in Hampton Innes in past & pretty much the same standards. 3 lifts but not all go to rooftop can be a wait to get one that going in the right direction.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here last year and enjoyed it so I returned. Everything was top notch. It's in a good location and people flock here. The only negative is the breakfast area unless you go early. It really fills up but that's a testament to how many people stay here and the quality/value of the meal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for three nights before crossing USA by rail from Penn Station. It was,therefore, in an ideal position within walking distance of the station. It is also on a relatively quiet street but close to Times Square and the Subway. Our room was a decent size and in a quiet part of the hotel on the third floor. The lifts do get very busy and they are not particularly large so you can wait for some time to use them. We chose to use the stairway for easier access to and from our room. Breakfast was adequate although everything was a bit cramped so it was not a great experience overall. Staff were always friendly. Two issues detracted from an otherwise pleasant stay. Firstly, we had no room service on the first day there. This was eventually offered to us at 7 pm but we had already come back to the room so had to decline this offer. There was also a problem getting hot water from the basin tap so this had to be directly filled from the shower!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Centric location, really close to times square. Room and bathroom were nice, nothing negative to mention. Breakfast is served on the first floor, very small place to accommodate large number of guests, that would be the only downside of our stay, a little bit messy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My son and I flew in Friday morning to spend the weekend attending the Big Ten Basketball Tournament at Madison Square Garden (a 10 minute walk south). I was greeted with my first text message from the hotel as we were cabbing to the hotel from LGA.With just a few text messages, we arranged to get early check-in into our room and changed the room style - all before we arrived. The hotel continued to text me periodically (but not too often). We were also able to store our gear as the final tournament game was well after checkout. Location in west mid-town close to Theaters, MSG, Times Square, etc.Excellent staff, good Hampton-style breakfast and spotless rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Large rooms and great location. The check in staff was very friendly and as a Hilton Gold I appreciated the upgrade to a higher floor. The only negative is that there can be a long wait for the elevator in the morning. I look forward to returning in October.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: a QUARTER block off Broadway... Yea I'll take it... Room was clean we checked in early no charge, staff super nice. Free breakfast was tasty. But its really the location that makes this a smart choice not to mention was reasonably priced. Walked to the theater and times square in minutes. TWO thumbs up for a good deal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good- If you want to be right in the middle of Times Square.- Small safe in room.-Price less than other hotels in general so pricing is good if that is key component for you.-Complimentary breakfast. Last many hours. Food variety is good including hard-boiled eggs. Great for a grab and go. Coffee and tea available in lobby all day.-Staff is super friendly and helpful.-Room very clean, bed comfy as were pillows. I need firm bed for back and I was comfortable.-Bathroom clean- not huge but typical NY size. Water never got very hot. Was hot/warm.Bad-Elevators slow, slow, slow.-Bath door is a sliding close (does lock) but not a lot of privacy as not really sealed well and no bath fan-NOT good if you have business or work to do. Work desk small. NO outlets. The one behind the desk was full of other plugs (tv/lamps) and not one open. No outlets off of lamp so NOT prepared for business travellers.-They do not call cabs for you and if you want to catch one, you have to go out of hotel and walk to a busier cross street. Most cabs were full nearby so couldn't catch one. Alternatives are Uber - they are all around but very high priced or take subway/bus if you dare.Ugly- Construction on streets happen AT NIGHT with no curfew and stops right before rush hour in morning so if you can sleep through that, then go for it. Times Square area is loud in general but if construction nearby (like when I stayed), you will hear it loud and all night long.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I usually stay at the Hilton across the street but booked last minute do tried the Hampton.I thought the reviews about the elevators were overreacting...however we were on the 26th floor and it was a long wait. Which is ok, I’m fine with that. It was the stopping 12 times on the way down with no room in the elevator that got me. That plus the people freaking out because of the number of people on the elevator. Room was small but clean. Bathroom tiny. Comforter showing signs of wear. Very loud all night, even for Times Square. Staff very nice. Really liked the texting prior and messaging feature on the app. Responded immediately and took care of things.Not my first choice but would stay again if necessary.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located near time sq good sized rooms double the size of the new yorker wyhdamIf we had only know how good the hampton inn was we would've cut our losses and moved here earlier.We highly recommend this hotel for price location and conveniently located.Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We wanted to spend a night in the city so we could take advantage of two days worth of activities. We found this hotel because we wanted to use points to pay for the room(which we did). The room is very reasonably priced if we had decided to pay cash. The hotel's location was perfect, so close to all the action of Times Square. It is a nice walk to Rockefeller Center. We were greeted by friendly staff and given bottles of water. We enjoyed a good breakfast, which is included in your stay. Our room was clean and comfortable for two adults and two children. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel on our check out day, while we spent the afternoon enjoying the city. We will definitely return for future trips to the Big Apple. We will highly recommend to family and friends. A great bargain!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very well positioned, close to Times Square, underground at 2 minutes walking. Nice and wide room, very confortable bed, good services, buffet breakfast very interesting, wifi ok, friendly staff. Very appreciated the complimentary coffee 24x7

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just returned from a 4 night trip to NYC. This hotel was the perfect choice. I used points for my stay, but the cost would have been under $200/night if I hadn't. It is in a great location. Very clean and updated. We did hear some street noise at night, it is New York after all, but the hotel itself was very quiet. ALL of the employees were friendly and willing to be assist you if something was needed. We went to the breakfast buffet at 6:00 every morning so we could start exploring the city early. It was getting busy even at that time, but I love the fact that they provide trays for you to take the food back to your room. It's a typical Hampton Inn buffet breakfast - no better and no worse than others. If you want a sit-down breakfast with real plates and silver ware, than you should probably stay somewhere else. We didn't experience too much trouble with the elevators being crowded and slow, in fact I thought they were pretty fast considering the number of people staying there. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visit NY City many times a year and I usually have a hard time trying to balance finding a hotel that is in a good location at a reasonable rate.This was my first time staying here and it checked off everything on my list!This is a recently renovated hotel that is situated in great location - I could easily walk to most places that I wanted to go from here (eg., Times Square area, Grand Central Station, 34th Street) plus there was a subway station located literally across the street.The price was reasonable, there was free WiFi and a buffet breakfast was included in the price. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection of offerings and staff who worked in the dining room were quite pleasant.The bedroom and bathroom were good sizes (not tiny like a lot of hotels in the mid town area)My only quip about this hotel was the wait time for the elevators, which other guests had also mentioned. There are 3 elevators but they don’t seem adequate to handle the amount of guests that the facility caters, to particularly at busy times (e.g. towards the end of the time allocated for the breakfast buffet). The elevators would fill up at the higher floors leaving the people on the lower floors stuck waiting and waiting for an empty car to arrive. Thus you had people squeezing themselves into elevators in order to get down to the lobby

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In my opinion this hotel is a real mixed bag of good and not so good.Good points:Location in Times SquarePrice is good for NYRooms are new and well keptBathroom/showers are excellentStaff provided birthday card/balloon and chocolates for my wifeBreakfast is complimentaryNot so good:I have eaten breakfast in many hotels but NEVER from paper plates/bowls and with plastic cutlery!Totally inadequate space for breakfast - guests were standing in the lobby eating out of paper bowls!Lifts unable to cope with volume of guests - 10mins to get from floor 26 for breakfast - only to find no seats for breakfast!The only hot items for breakfast were different eggs each day and a variation of sausage. It would have been far more appealing to have different pastries, whole bagels etc and to forget the hot food.We stayed for 5 nights and were happy with the room and location. The service we received was fine but nothing exceptional. The breakfast situation is poor and it is not acceptable for the manager to keep replying to the comments on this site with the same cut and pasted response 'our breakfast room can cope the majority of the time.' It didn't when we were there and was quite a talking point with guests in the lift - as we were often in them for a while stopping at most floors!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from the Hampton inn. Check in was smooth we had emailed ahead and asked for a high room with a city view we were given room 1908 which was amazing. There was no hassle at breakfast we always had a seat and the food was great and the staff very friendly and welcoming. The room was very comfortable and cleaned to a high standard. Front desk staff very helpful especially Louis. Great that coffee, tea hot chocolate and cookies were free in the reception especially after a busy day sightseeing. Overall the location and hotel were great and wouldn't hesitate to stay again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed in the hotel for five days .Good place to stay near main area restaurants and theatres.Improve the elevators please or use one for some floors and other for others .Laundry machines don’t work well We asked for a hotel big van to carry us to train penn station to be paid of course 6 am and never came after checking three times the night and day before that it was fine so we walked with our luggage /Don’t offer what you can’t assure to give .Personnel in morning shift did nothing to mend it .Breakfast can be better going 9:20 is almost empty .You are in the right way but can improve it .I will be back hopefully .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had 4 nights here, it was great everything I’ve come to expect of Hampton Inn. It was clean, well maintained and all the staff were lovely.The beds were comfortable, the rooms really warm it was cold when we arrived, the windows open slightly for a bit of fresh air. It was smaller than we thought, with only a few rooms per floor.The rooms are equipped, iron, board, hair dryer, TV, coffee maker and safe. There is complimentary hot coffee, tea and hot chocolate 24 hours a day in the lobby, which was great after a cold day in New York.Breakfast was great we had loads to eat and the waffle machines were very popular with my nephew.On our last day we experienced a long wait for the lift but that was the only time. They held our bags for us so we could squeeze the last few hours out of New York.We were worried when we were given the room opposite the lift but we heard nothing other than a few noisy guests one night. Street noise can be heard but it’s not loud enough to disturb your rest.I’ve been to New York twice before and stayed in better class of hotels that were awful, this place was cheaper but so much better value, I would strongly recommend it for good value.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary and really liked the hotel. The welcome and staff in general were first class, everyone was really friendly and couldn’t do enough for you. The hotel was very clean and had plenty of space, cleaned daily and towels replaced daily as you used. The location of the hotel is perfect literally 1 minute walk either way to 2 subway stations and time square and also the hop on/off tourist bus. The lifts can get busy and breakfast is a bit crazy. Lots of people so getting a table might involve a short wait but the food is all fresh and a good selection as well. Overall a really good hotel and if we do return to New York we would definitely stay here again. Thank you Hampton Inn

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Haven’t stayed here in a while. The front desk staff was both friendly and efficient. My room had a king bed and was smallish but comfortable. After all, you are not in New York to stay in your room. The room and bathroom were spotless. The only complaint was the clock which was set one hour fast. That bothers me. The clock had a locking device on it so I couldn’t do it myself. I mentioned that to the housekeeper but it wasn’t corrected. The breakfast was good...the usual array of items. Certainly adequate but nothing exceptional. The location is EXCELLENT. Close to mostly everything. Plus the room rate was very good. I stayed for two days.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean Rooms, Both Family and Business Friendly.Reasonable Price. Convenient to all the attractions and restaurants the area has to offer. Friendly and courteous staff. Special Thanks to Luis and Johnny.We took our grand kids to their first Broadway Musical and the staff contributed to a very memorable event for us all.We will certainly make this our primary hotel on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for two nights in February, 2018. The customer service, Front Desk and valet were all excellent. Clean, comfortable. Highly recommended.We had a minor issue which went Luis at the front desk out of his way to help resolve which was very much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed 2 nights at the Hampton Inn. Although our room was small, it was clean and neat. The breakfast buffet was very enjoyable and you can't beat the convenience. The staff were all pleasant, polite and professional. I would stay there again and highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We reserved a double room for the three people in our party for our 5 night stay while vacationing in NYC. We arrived around 2:00 P.M. and was advised that a room to meet our needs was ready, so we were able to check in right away which was very seamless and people behind counter very pleasant and accommodating. We arrived at our room and it was a bit small (which is not uncommon for NYC), but space was very well utilized. We really appreciated many things about the room including, water pressure in shower, plenty of hot water, mattress comfort, and ability to actually control room temp. We only ate breakfast a couple of the days, but it was absolutely fantastic. It was very busy but staff handled the crowd very well. I did use the gym every morning and it was really spacious and well equipped. It is a great location close enough to the action on Times Square, but not too close. It was extremely busy which was understandable due to it being holiday weekend and handled very well by the staff who were always friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had tickets to see "Wicked" on Saturday and the Rangers on Sunday, so we spent Saturday night at the Hampton Inn. We arrived early as the show was at 2 PM, and they were happy to hold our bags for us. Justine at the front desk went above and beyond for us, and was very helpful and polite. We self-parked across the street and walked to the show. The location is perfect, about 2 blocks from the Garden, and just a short walk to Broadway and Time Square. We walked everywhere, and found the hotel to be in a perfect location for sightseeing and getting around the city.The hotel was busy, but we had excellent service. We stayed on the 10th floor, and the room was small, but it was perfect for one night in the city. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The front desk at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. Love the to very clean great shower . The location was so convenient to all. We loved the morning breakfast . We stayed here to take our Grandaughter to American doll and catch a play. Felt safe and very friendly staff

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Room cleaned every day, and was amazing to come back to clean room. Breakfast is free, but so many people in tight quarters trying to grab a bite. Friendly staff. In a great area. Good price. Walked to Madison Square Garden, restaurants, to see Hamilton, piers for Westminster dog show..,Had a great time, very happy we stayed in this hotel. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Convenient location to Times Square, staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and in good condition. They are small but adequate. If you are noise sensitive you might want some earplugs. Since the rooms are small, and the city is noisy sound does tend to travel. The breakfast is very good. Cereal, eggs sausage, waffles, fruit, oatmeal, bagels etc...only downside is it does get crowded. So plan to be patient. Overall a good experience. The small scale of the room, communal breakfast area, and guests from USA and abroad gave the hotel an international feel. I would stay there again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel. Location was just perfect 2 mins walk to times square. 10 min walk to empire state building. Breakfast was great not busy just right. Staff couldn't do enough for you. Would recommend staying here and we will be back. Thank you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location, customer service, room size, plenty of linen, prompt Housekeeping, clean room, all a pleasant surprise. Breakfast was great! Wifi was a little slow but the computers in the lobby seemed to have no problem. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose the Hampton Inn primarily for its location, just a block from the Port Authority Terminal and half a block from the nearest Times Square Subway station. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the price is typical for Manhattan. Our only complaint is that the breakfast, which is good, is very crowded, with some guests not being able to find a place to sit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been to NYC a few times in the past, but decided to try this hotel this time around. Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of January. Our room had the 2 double beds in a standard room. It was clean, quiet, warm and comfortable. Our room window faced away from the busy streets (we weren't fussed on views), so the outside street noise was not an issue. This hotel is very close to the Times Square vicinity and all the amenities that come with it. The breakfast buffet was always full and hard to find a table after 8am, but we were ok with taking some food back to our room to eat. Hotel has coin laundry facilities on site which is handy when you need to get some laundry done. Would recommend this hotel for those wanting to stay in the Times Square area or for those first timers to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was in NY for a workshop located next to Bryant Park and the hotel was within a short walk. It was steps away from Times Square for some quick shopping. I pulled up with my car and was in my room in less than fifteen minutes. The service was efficient, courteous and friendly. AND, the cost was very reasonable for the location. I'll be recommending this hotel to my network.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was the perfect location for a visit to Time Square and a great Hampton experience as well. Our room on the 23rd floor was perfect. Great view and quiet. I had read reviews that the elevators were slow but I didn't find that problem at all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: lovely spotless hotel central to Time Square and bus stops and plenty of bars and restaurant's near by. Staff at the hotel are really friendly and couldn't do enough for you from Kevin who made our trip special and Lewis and Jonny who helped us with our luggage and queries that arose, and Geraldine made us so welcome at breakfast time and was friendly and advising us when we asked her advice on the sights. Breakfast was fab with a lovely variety of choice, rooms were large with a lovely Queen Ann bed which was comfy. would highly recommend this hotel and would return

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and subway transportation. It is not far from the bus station as well. There are NO queen beds, only doubles...this was a surprise and different than most Hampton Inns. The rooms are small but typical for NYC. The eating area for breakfast was crowded whether at 7am, 8 am or 9 am. I might stay here again but would probably get 2 rooms for 4 people traveling. There was no special treatment as an honors member.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel for its location, just steps away from Broadway/Times Square and the subway. Our room was clean and spacious with a very comfy bed, adequate wardrobe/drawer space and a coffee maker. The bathroom was excellent with a large walk in shower and plenty of shelf space for toiletries. We were on the 16th floor at the front of the hotel, there was quite a lot of noise in the early hours on a couple of days from a loading bay opposite, but it is the very centre of New York so we didn't expect peace and quiet or super posh triple glazed windows that you might find in a more expensive hotel. The staff here were all friendly and helpful. A buffet breakfast is included, there is a reasonable choice of food with a couple of hot dishes, fresh fruit, yogurt, waffles and pastries plus juice, tea and coffee. There are paper plates and plastic cutlery and a large bin by the door to encourage you to clear your own table, but there were also staff around to do this and wipe tables. Yes it was hectic but we always found a table, if you go before 8.00am it's a lot quieter. There is coffee, tea and hot water available in reception which was very welcome coming in from the cold.The lifts were busy, but we never had to wait for more than a few minutes for one.Overall we were delighted with this hotel, it exceeded our expectations. One word of warning though, on departure reception offered us a private transfer to JFK for 65 dollars which we accepted. It was very comfortable with a pleasant driver, but on arrival at the airport we were told it was 75 dollars and she didn't have any change. I only had 50 dollar bills and no way was I giving her 100, but we scraped around for change and gave her 70.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was more convenient than I realized. We wanted a hotel that would be close to the theater district for the three days that we were in town for a girls trip. But would make this even more attractive was the subway stop which is just down the block and the port Authority bus terminal. By far the easiest way to get from your hotel to JFK is to walk maybe a quarter of a mile to the port Authority bus terminal you can actually see it from the hotel. Hop on an NYC AirPorter it’ll take you direct to either LaGuardia or JFK airport. And it will drop you off your specific terminals. Wish I had known this on the way in.I’ve stayed at more luxurious hotels but this hotel was clean safe friendly and everything you could possibly need. Including comfy beds. The bathroom is also a nice size. I would definitely stay here again. For business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Four ladies gathered at this hotel for a wonderful long weekend in NYC. The location of this hotel makes it very convenient to Times Square, the subway, bus stops and Broadway shows. Everything is just a few blocks away. The subway station was about a 2 minute walk. The Port Authority Bus Station was about a 10 minute walk. This made it easy for us to take the NYC Airporter bus shuttle from JFK and just walk to the hotel.The nice location of this hotel was surpassed, however, by the friendliness of the hotel staff. The front desk, the cleaning staff, the staff in the breakfast area and the concierge were all engaging and helpful. Be sure to talk to John , the concierge, if you really want to hear an authentic NY accent. He was very funny and very knowledgeable. Don't worry when you step off the elevator and see the narrow hallways. The rooms are well equipped, comfortable and clean.We felt very safe and secure at this hotel.There is no one at the complimentary breakfast at 6 am but it gets busier as the morning wears on. Seats at 8:30 were a little more challenging.There was always plenty of good food with a wide variety no matter what the hour, though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It’s so easy to spend a lot of money on a hotel in NYC, but there’s no need to when you have this as an option. Great location with easy access to Times Square and subway, very friendly staff, clean and quiet room, and included breakfast. We will certainly stay here again in another visit!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is great! Most of the staffs were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was not very satisfying but it was free. You can hear people walk outside the room, but it wasn't a big deal for us. Our overall sleeping quality was great. The only thing that bothered us was the elevator. We stayed from Saturday through Monday, and we had a room at 21 floor. On the Sunday morning, because lots of people needed to check out, and the elevators were all full for like 10 mins. There were only three elevators and there were small. It wasn't very convenient for us, but that was the only problem that we had during our stay. Overall great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton inn Times Square Central is an amazing hotel with an even better price point. The location is a 2 minute walk to the heart of Times Square and the subway. The staff is amazing, they even held our bags for us after check the day we left so we could explore the city before our train left. Walking distance to many major attractions including Empire State Building, penn station, grand central, port authority, rockefeller center, St Pats cathedral, Broadway theaters, Central Park and of course, Times Square. The Times Square subway is 2 minute walk away with service to almost everywhere in the city. Complimentary Breakfast is a great added benefit. This has become our “go to” hotel when in the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would have rated this hotel as five stars in its medium price category if it had a double-door to prevent the cold air from invading the breakfast room and turning the hot breakfast into lukewarm food. Otherwise it has several plus points which make it attractive: unbeatable location in the theatre district, in the heart of Times Square yet protected from the din. I had a good view of Manhattan in the moonlight from my room which was on the 26th floor.The room was spacious for such a prime location and the staff most helpful. The goodies also add to the enjoyment: coffee, tea or hot chocolate all day, biscuits and cookies. Great value for money. Suggestion to management: find ways to prevent cold air invading the breakfast room -- install double door or thick curtains at entrance.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the moment we stepped into this hotel we had fantastic service, Kevin was so helpful and accommodating with all our questions as this was our 1st trip to New York . Nothing was too much trouble for him. Chris on reception was great when we needed help to print our boarding passes. The hotel it’s self is situated in a great place , just off time square and central to visit so many places . Nice touch with the free tea , coffee and water in reception. Breakfast was good too plenty of choice and Geraldine and Olivia were so kind and helpful. Our rooms were great fantastic views over the city ,beds were really comfortable , bed linen and towels were of excellent quality and our rooms were cleaned really well for the six days we were there by Kerry Ann . Couldn’t fault this hotel , all the staff seemed like one big happy family. Johnny and Lewis were brilliant when we were leaving , carrying all our cases to our transport . Would definately return to this hotel . Thanks so much for making our stay in NY fantastic

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel staff were very friendly. The room was great. It is in prime location for getting around. Walking distance to many places and easy access to the subway. I would definitely return here. Try it out!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel and great location. Friendly staff and very accomodating. I recommend this hotel if you travel to Times Square.Great breakfast choices and the times offered were convenient. We had a great stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent stay. It’s our family first time in New York and this hotel exceeds our expectation. Great location, excellent amenities and good breakfast. I would definitely stay here again when we come back to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay, would recommend Breakfast is extremely crowded.Great staff. Very good location.Great helpful, friendly staff.Free coffee in the lobby is wonderful .Fast elevators, clean rooms. Only problem was fitting sheet would not stay on the mattress. Good value for the money.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Marvelous hotel near Times Square, theaters, shopping access to the subway. Nice breakfast with good variety, helpful, friendly staff, clean rooms with comfortable beds. Rooms are very small, elevator access can be frustrating, and music track playing everywhere is very annoying.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We liked our room because it had a modern, renovated bathroom and a convenient fridge! The free breakfast is a huge help and a convenience since food is pricey in NYC. Valet was nice and quick. Concierge and front desk were friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat since it's one block from 42nd street and Times Sq. Our only complaint is that it gets so crowded in the morning at breakfast (no place to sit and it's a mob scene) and checkout time that the elevator is ALWAYS full. Our record was passing up 4 elevators and ended up walking down 12 flights of stairs. So our advise is just be patient or take the stairs if you don't have luggage!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: used hilton points to redeem one night. Very good value even if paid with price. Excellent location. Steps away from the Times Square. Room is clean and spacious in NYC standard. If I have to pick up one thing that is not perfect, I hope they can increase the variety of the items in the breakfast. Hope they can include scrambled eggs and potatoes in the future. But it's already free so I am not complaining. Overall great experience. Staff are very friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights, was a great find. Literally just round the corner from Times Square. We were in a family room on one of the higher floors next to the lift with a city view, good sized room with 2 big beds and plenty of storage space. Bathroom was spotless. Never heard any lift noise and though the hotel was busy we only had to wait more than a couple of minutes for lifts on two occasions. The free breakfasts had plenty of choice, 2 hot options plus porridge, various cereals, different breads, jams, muffins etc. There was also a waffle maker. I wasn't overly keen on the egg choices but that was just personal preference. The breakfast room could be very busy but we never had trouble getting a table. Reception staff were helpful with any queries that we had. All in all this was a brilliant base for our stay, if I am ever lucky enough to return to New York I'd definitely stay here

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here in late Jan with my sister and our Mum, two bed room on the 24th floor.Room was immaculate, bathroom a great size and good shower. We were right behind the lifts but never heard them in our 4 night stay, the room was remarkably quiet from both street noise and the corridor. A small coffee machine is provided in the rooms but there is a full selection of coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby all day.The free breakfast had a decent amount of choice, hot food, cereals, fruit etc and we always found a table (arrived at various times between 8.30 and 9.30). Items were refilled quickly and Farrell was always very helpful. The location cannot be beaten for Hampton Inn; half a block to the Port Authority bus terminal and subway in one direction, half a block to 42nd St subway in the other. From here we went all over Manhattan from within 20 minutes. The hotel is walking distance from Times Square, Broadway theatres, Bryant Park and Grand Central to name a few. We were really pleased with our stay, and will look to stay here again if we return to NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Upon check-in, the GM, Beverly, kindly and immediately switched us to a more spacious room for this 5 day stay. Will, the bellman, not only took the trains with us to eliminate our obvious fear of train transfers, he walked us to my aunt's gate, which was 3 full blocks in the opposite direction of his home. Who does that in this day and hour? Finally, Lilly's evening, freshly baked cookies made for sweet night's rest. THANK YOU Beverly and staff for taking the sting out of our family loss and fear of being away from the Carolina's, by providing EXCELLENT hospitality!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I only stayed one night with friends, but the stay was great! The beds were comfy, which was good since I came down with a fever :( but they also have free breakfast which is great since breakfast in NYC can be expensive.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights on a trip away with my girlfriend. The hotel is in no way a super fancy place to stay but the rooms are really nice, relatively spacious and have a good sized bath/shower room too! Location is perfect, 30 seconds walk to Times Square, 15 minutes to Central Park, 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. Staff are really friendly and helpful, you're always greeted with a "good morning/evening" and if you ever needed anything they are more than happy to help. The hotel also served breakfast in the morning which not all hotels in NYC do. This was really nice and there were even waffle makers (which I may have used a few too many times!!). Only pain point, a very small one at that, you sometimes have to wait a while for the lifts. In no way a major issue but became a little frustrating towards the end of our stay.All in all I can not recommend this place enough!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the hotel 6 nightsWe can say Only good things about the hotel Most important are the hotel stuff, very kind, helpful and smiley, our one request was addressed quick and with good manor.The room was very comfortable and with space to walk comfortably.Good bathroom with hair dryer, but, the electrical wire was too short.Location – great!! Sooo close to times square, Bryant park subway just across the streetGood breakfast was included in the price

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Amazing location right in Times Square and walking distance to a lot of main attractions. Staff were friendly, tea and coffee served throughout the day. Breakfast and the waffle maker were amazing!! Bedroom was large and so was the bathroom with a lovely walk in powerful shower. Ask for a high room due to noise of constant building work and traffic etc. Very happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, Great location, breakfast had plenty choices, fun self making waffle section. Rooms are updated modern design. Tea/coffee all day being served. Plus evening cookies was a great touch! Morning complimentary bags are great for people who need to run!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
