Hampton Inn was extremely clean, very friendly people, very polite staff, amazing breakfast, fast elevator but the room.... OMG the beds... the sheets, the pillows... the quilts... I just didn't want to leave that room! We had everything in there.. coffee, tv, internet connection, a/c, a bathroom with all necessary things.The view was just superb!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is centrally located. The value was great. Room size is typical for a NY room. The staff was friendly and breakfast was decent. They even shipped our items we left behind to our home! Great location for NYC marathon

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I chose this hotel because I needed a place within walking distance of Manhattan's Theatre District. The hotel was not only convenient, the level of customer service was, I believe, extraordinary - especially for a busy midtown hotel. Every customer service rep I dealt with, from the front desk personnel to the hostess in the breakfast buffet, was cheerful, polite and efficient. I was also surprised by how quiet the rooms were. There was one evening when a party in a nearby building was audible, but otherwise my room was peaceful and pleasant. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was clean and convenient. Easy check in and out. Easy to grab a Cab or Uber. Close to attractions and subway. There are plenty of places to eat and breakfast was served from 6 until 10. Less than 2 miles to the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, very close to all the activities in time square. Very helpful staff. Free breakfast is always a plus especially when in New York City. The quality was good, Hotel is only a couple years old and very clean

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Good - great location in Times Square. Room is well (nicely) appointed - nice tile shower, good bed. Facility is updated and fresh - well done. Breakfast is standard Hampton Inn - which being included in the room fee is very good, especially in NYC (expensive city). Gym is large with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 2 bikes, dumbells, multi machine - good for Hampton Inn.The reality - this is a big hotel and it is busy. The breakfast is busy. Times Square is busy but you are in the heart of it - so that is what you are signing up for. The room is small but well appointed and more than adequate. Bathroom is tight, closet is small - but this is typical for NYC, so should be expected. We loved our stay here - staff, facility were terrific. If you want a slower pace, pick a different location or perhaps a smaller property.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean and friendly hotel. Breakfast and snacks saves us an absolute fortune over the holiday. No issues with lifts for us on the 5th floor. Staff where very helpful and really went above and beyond. Only thing that could of made it better would of been a honeymoon upgrade. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else on our next visit! Close to everything

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central is an exceptional hotel.From the moment of our arrival, we were so impressed with the facilities and excellent staff.Breakfast was fabulous each day, and I particularly want to mention Geraldine who was so friendly and helpful.The choice of food for breakfast was great.There was free wifi at the hotel and printing was free too for guests, amazing!Free tea, coffee and cookies were available all day at reception.All the staff were courteous and helpful.It was a fantastic experience and should we visit New York in the future, it will definitely be our hotel of choice.Well done to all concerned and thanks so much for making our stay so enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent 8 nights here and we are very pleased. Lobby is modern and has comfortable seats, there are coffee, tea and water 24 hs, they also offer cookies in the afternoon, all free. Breakfast is very good: fruits, juices, omelettes, waffles, yoghurt, etc. In case you don’t have time you can pick one of the happy kits at the front desk. Rooms are super clean, comfy, everything is new. Big led TV in the room, bed and bathroom were always super clean and linens and towels were always clean and new. Location is very convenient, 1 block from Port of Authority and main 42nd St Subway station from where you can go everywhere. Even it is located in Time Square you wouldn’t notice noise, I think it is the only quiet block in this area. Separate word for the Staff that is GREAT, always smiling, always helpful, always nice. Special mention to Tobo at the front desk and the girl at the breakfast room. You rock! I have been in NYC for several times and never found such a fantastic staff at a hotel. Congratulations for that!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central ticks all the boxes I travelled with my family two adults and two teenagers.(October 2017)The location is superb right in the middle of Times Square. The room was a good size and the housekeeping was excellent. The complimentary breakfast is a great bonus something to suit every taste. The Hampton go out of their way to make your stay perfect nothing was a problem .From the guys on the front desk to Geraldine the breakfast room supervisor who went out of her way to support any requests from her guests. She is a great asset to the Hampton from running a very busy breakfast room to answering all sorts of queries from the guests. The hotel is spotless and managed to a very high standard. The hotel is situated a couple of minutes’ walk from the Subway and the Port authority bus terminal station where you can catch the number 111 bus to Jersey Gardens. I have stayed in several hotels in the area and none can compare to the service and welcome we received. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel close to Time Square. Went on a “girls weekend” with friends and had a blast. The hotel was perfect. It was within walking distance of many of the major attractions. Due to the central location, even when we cabbed it somewhere it was inexpensive. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The last day we were there it was raining and the front desk staff loaned me an umbrella for the evening. Price was a bit higher than I’m used to for a Hampton Inn but it was reasonable for the location. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was the perfect location and close by to times square. We could see the lights from times square from our floor (25th). Breakfast was great and room was clean and looked brand new! Staff was extremely friendly.The only thing i was disappointed in was that on the last day we found out we needed to stay one more night. I asked the front desk about availability and the only room available was a double bed room for 400+dollars. I asked about the hilton weekend offer online for buy 2 nights get 1 half off, and the lady at the front desk simply told me i could call the hilton main number to ask them. So we had to stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a perfect location in Times Square and the complimentary breakfast was great! The staff was very helpful with the subway lines, directions and restaurant recommendations. I can't wait to visit New York again and I would certainly book with this hotel next time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here 2 nights prior to a cruise leaving from Pier 88. We arrived at Newark airport and took the "Newark Airport Express Bus" to the Port Authority stop on West 41st - Cost $16 per person and tickets available on internet, in airport or on the bus (half price for seniors). From there we walked the approx 2 blocks to the hotel. From the hotel to Times Square is about 3 blocks. Wolfgang's restaurant is 200 feet from the hotel with great food & service but a bit pricey. The second night we ate at Jack's at 140 West 40th Street which is 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. The food & service were equal to Wolfgang's but price was more economical. On a future trip wed eat only at Jack's. The included breakfast at the hotel was excellent. The staff were flying, keeping the buffet topped up, tables cleaned and garbage pails emptied. One of the staff, Teddy, was like a robot - everywhere and doing everything with an extremely friendly attitude.On a future trip we'd definitely stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Fantastic hotel in a prime location. Times Square and the Subway is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. All the staff were courteous and very helpful and the hotel is very clean and the rooms are well equipped with super comfy beds. We had a room on the 30th floor with city views which was divine. The complimentary water at reception and coffee and tea in the lobby is an added bonus. The included breakfast is fantastic but get there early as it can get very busy with guests. The reception staff always greeted guests with a smile and the check in/check out process is a breeze. I have only positive comments to say about this awesome hotel and I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Choose the hotel because of the location. Small rooms as expected in NYC but clean and comfortable enough. Shower was maybe worst Ive seen anywhere in the world. No water pressure or volume, suspect they’ve installed a flow restrictor, other than that a reasonably good hotel. Elevators are slow and very small so they’re often jam packed and unusable - be prepared for a long wait. Staff were friendly. No issues.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location which is right downtown and a few minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms and common areas were clean and well maintained and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Not to mention warm cookies every afternoon/evening and free buffet breakfast. Only thing is our room was very small. Fantastic stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights with my Mum to celebrate her birthday. We had the best time and the hotel was the PERFECT location. We arrived at about 12:30 in the afternoon, I had contacted the hotel beforehand to see if we could check in early due to having a long day of travelling, they stated that they could not guarantee it, however we were able to check in as soon as we arrived. We had booked a room with two double beds and we were not expecting much due to previous reviews. We staying in room 612 and there wasn’t much of a view but you go out for that anyway. The room was more than adequate, the beds were super comfortable. They were plenty of places to charge devices, including USB ports only which were ideal if you forget your plugs. There was a TV with a wide array of channels. A writing desk and chair. A separate chair and a full length mirror. There was also a closet which contained a safe which was free of charge to use and an iron and ironing board. The only downside would be that it was difficult to store cases in the room but we put them down the side of the bed and didn’t have a problem.The bathroom was great. It contained a bath with an overhead shower, a toilet, a sink with lots of storage space and a mirror with a light behind it which was great to get your make up done. House keeping were great as well, very friendly and attentive to the room. It was like stepping into a new hotel room every time you came back to your room. The beds were always made, the bins were emptied, toiletries were restocked and a general tidy was completed every day. The breakfast was great as well. Yes, it is somewhat basic but it’s included in the price. It stops you having to go out into the city and eat before you start the day. What more can you ask for. There were always two hot breakfast items on everyday which varied in contents. Some days there would be omelettes and maple sausages, other days there would be sausage patties. There was always waffles, toast, bagels, cereals, fruits, hard boiled eggs and yogurt available. There was also an endless supply of tea, coffee, water and fruit juices. There was something there for even the fussiest of eaters. It was a great way to start the day. There was also the option of a grab and go breakfast which contained a cereal bar, a bottle of water and a piece of fruit. We never used it but we thought it was a nice touch. At times the breakfast room can be busy but it’s to be expected when breakfast is complimentary for each and every guest staying in the hotel. We didn’t ever have an issue finding somewhere to sit down and eat. We would arrive between 8am - 9am. The lifts I have seen are a draw back for some guests, yes at times you have to wait a while because there are only 3 lifts. But again if you are finding criticism in hotel of this size because you have to wait a while for a lift then you’ve obviously got no patience whatsoever. The lobby was light, bright and colourful. It was a very welcoming and comfortable place to be. There was always complimentary tea, coffee and water available so you can just grab and go. At around 5pm they would put cookies out for the guests. Some guests would be really greedy and take way more than they needed, so get in there fast if you want a free cookie. The staff we’re very friendly and accommodating. There is also a food pantry within the lobby containing toiletries, drinks and snacks which is open 24 hours.The WiFi worked great, we didn’t upgrade and stuck to the free one. It worked well, I was able to upload, download and stream films without any issues. One downside would be having to log in every 24 hours to gain the WiFi but it took a matter of seconds to do. The location was literally perfect - you are down the road from Times Square and I mean that literally. You are close enough that you are a stones throw away without all the noise and hustle bustle constantly. You can walk to most major attractions as well which can help to save money and the hop on hop off bus is based around the corner as well and to the right. There are numerous subway stops close by as well. There are plenty of places to eat, drink, party, shop, buy snacks and there are endless photo opportunities. Would I return to this hotel? Yes, in a heartbeat!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very clean rooms,everyone seems to take an interest in your NYC experience.They help with all directions and give printouts of directions. The breakfast is more than satisfying. All of the employees have been kind to us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is perfectly located for Times Square, literally a minutes walk and you're in the action. The hotel is well located as you don't get any of the Times Square noise. This hotel has everything you will need for your stay. The beds are extremely comfortable, the room has air conditioning, a safe, lots of charging points for phones etc, hairdryer, iron & ironing board, coffee making facilities and even an ice bucket for champers! If you happen to forget anything such as toiletries, comb, toothbrush, shaving foam etc the hotel will provide it complimentary for you, really, they cant do enough for you. We felt totally confident leaving our personal items in our room. The room was cleaned to a high spec every day, you can choose if you would like fresh towels or to re-use them. The hotel provides free tea, coffee & chilled water 24hrs a day, which is most appreciated when you've been out walking all day. My only slight criticism would be that at peak times for breakfast you probably wont get a table, we found 6.30-7.30 you could get a table but any later is a struggle, although on the plus side they provide a grab bag if you're not planning to stay for breakfast.Our flight home wasn't until 9.30pm, check out was 12pm. The hotel happily stowed our luggage (securely in a separate room where they where tagged & we were given a receipt) Lewis at reception couldnt have been more helpful, he ordered us a Lincoln town car to take us to the airport which arrived on time, he also provided us with bottles of water & brownies to take away with us, which came in very handy!!I would highly recommend a stay at this very comfortable & clean hotel if you are planning a visit to Times square. Well done Hampton Inn, Manhattan, we loved our stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stay at a lot of Hampton Inns across the country and this one did not disappoint. Good location, really nice room, smaller than most Hampton Inns but more than adequate space. Pretty quiet for staying in such a busy location and super close to all the activities there are in NYC, theaters, Circle Line, bus tours, Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is perfectly located, very closed to Time square while benefiting from a quiet street. The welcome at the reception was fantastic and we could check in earlier than planned. The room is small like any room in New York, but newly decorated and refurbished. The rooms are very clean and designed to welcome a family. The breakfast room is undersized and expect to wait for a table to free up in the morning unless you are a very early bird.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our first hotel on our vacation and a great start, the lobby is nice and welcoming, coffee juice tea etc. 24hrs free , so whether you're coming or going you can grab a cup of joe, breakfast is on the go early in the morning and they also provide go bags with a juice and bars if you're in a hurry.(the breakfast area does get busy).Nothing was to much trouble like locking yourself out of the room twice or them getting your case open when you forget the number,lolThe staff on the front always have a smile and are helpful and polite there are also soft seats and table and chairs in the lobby if you wish to eat a slice or something when you come back.in the evening or a good place to wait.Lifts can get busy at times you need door pass to operate the lift which is nice .I found the rooms nice tidy and having everything you need .Good location very close to Time Square but didn't notice above average noise in our room .They can also provide transport back to the airport or they will get a cab, we used uber from this location as well no problem.Happily stay here again and recommend it .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is perfectly located for Times Square as well as subway. Center of NYC so you can go downtown to Statue of Liberty or Uptown for museums. Hotel is beautiful and comfortable, the complimentary breakfast is a nice perk. Always have water and coffee ready in lobby. All Staff is helpful with questions, and concierge was so very knowlegable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a perfect stay at this hotel located at the very heart of Mahnhattan. By subway and the Central Bus Terminal nearby you can reach any place in decent time. Our 29th floor room was friendly, always kept well and clean and offered an extraordinary view over downtown Mahattan. Special thanks to the staff, especially to Ms. Teddy of the breakfast room who kindly welcomed us in the morning so that we always had a great start into the day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent in all areas this hotel is great , next to theaters, transportation and free breakfast to get you going. Small, very busy, lots going on. Would absolutely stay there again. Very comfortable beds and great view

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel primarily because of location and affordability (considering location). The friendliness of the front desk staff was notable. We left our cruise ship early in the day but check in was not until 3 pm. They stored our luggage and only about an hour later we received a text that our room was ready. It was a service that was very much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived in NYC for our first visit and Tobore at the front desk welcomed us like family! Friendly staff, clean & comfortable room. And great location. We are planning a return trip next year and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the Hampton Inn for a three night stay in NYC. The hotel is a few blocks from central Times Square, less than a block to the subway station with access to most trains and within walking distance to most Broadway Theaters and a variety of restaurants and shopping. When we checked in as Elite members of Hilton, we were given complimentary bottled water and a snack. The key card is needed to go up to your floor but not to come down. However in the morning from about 8:30 am until about 10:00 am the "UP" elevator buttons do not function and it can be very busy trying to get an elevator going down especially if you are on a lower floor. It took us several tries to finally get a down elevator at 9:00 am in the morning.They serve a complimentary breakfast every morning from 6:30 am - 10:00 am (suggested timing 6-7 no waiting; 7:30-8:30 short lines and some delays; 8:30-10:00 heavier traffic with delays and waits for tables). The breakfast consists of some type of egg each morning and sausage or bacon, self serve waffles, oatmeal, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, dry cereal, yogurt, milk, coffee, tea, juices. If you don't have time for breakfast, during the week, they provide a breakfast bag at the from desk that has a piece of fresh fruit, a muffin or breakfast bar and water that you can pick up on your way out of the hotel. There are 3 computer terminals and 1 printer that are in the "business center" of to the left of the front desk. You can get the password at the front desk. There is coffee, tea and water 24 hours a day just to the left of the front desk. There is a fitness center in the lower level (you need your key to get to the basement as well as to get in the fitness center. There are 4 treadmills, 2 Ellipticals, 2 bikes (1 upright, 1 recumbent), a weight bench, free weights, a weight machine, water, towels and headsets for the televisions. Bathrooms are outside the fitness room. There is also a guest laundry in the basement with washers and dryers ($2.00 per machine) but no change machines. The washers and dryers use quarters only, no credit cards. You can buy detergent from the pantry next to the front desk. The pantry also has sundries, snacks, beverages and frozen meals. There is a microwave in the pantry to heat up your meals.The rooms are average size with either a king or two queens. Our room was updated and had a walk-in shower, no bath tub. They only leave two sets of towels so if you need more be sure to ask the night before. There are plenty of outlets around the room and by the bedside as well as dedicated USB outlets. There is an iron and ironing board in the closet. In the evening they put out warm cookies for a snack at the front desk. The wi-fi is free but you have to log-in every 24 hours.The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful and the concierge service is very good. We used the services of both "Cool Maureen" and John and found both to be very knowledgable, helpful and patient. We took a cab in from the airport (La Guardia) but found out the hotel has a private car service for a flat $55.00 plus tip (up to 4 passengers) or a commuter bus for $21.00 per person with pick-ups at several area hotels. They will also flag a taxi for you in front of the hotel.We were very happy with this hotel and if coming to the Times Square area again, will definite think about staying here again. We definitely would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is very clean and the staff are all extremely pleasant and eager to make your stay more enjoyable. We were able to pre-check into the room we wanted before we even left Arizona! We chose an upper floor for the view and the noise factor. We were next to the elevator, but never heard a thing. The room was very small with 2 full sized beds. It was a little cramped for three of us (my husband, granddaughter and me), but we got through it. They have the usual complimentary breakfast that we've had at every Hampton Inn we've ever stayed at. It is within walking distance of all of the theatre district and subways are close by. The only problem was the elevator situation. They are very small elevators and when we got there, only two of the three were operating. I would recommend staying on an upper floor because the elevator fills up fast, and those on lower floors (10 and under) sometimes had to wait until an elevator would show up with enough space left to get on. All in all, I would stay there again. Good value for the price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay, we were visiting for Ferrari 70th Anniversary Event. Amazing view of the new World Trade Center. It was wonderful to teach the kids about the area. Found a great restaurant nearby, and came back for fun in the pool. Wonderful location, very nice accommodations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My 7 year old daughter and I stayed for one evening to see a broadway show and were treated absolutely wonderfully. Staff were friendly and carding. They treated my daughter like a Star, she will never forget her first time in the city :) The rooms were clean, comfy and the Hotel over all was classy and fun. Thank you so much for the wonderful experience. Nikki

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My dad and I stayed here during a vacation for 5 nights. On first arrival, we were greeted by friendly and funny staff. The guy checking us in was really friendly and helpful. We had booked a room with a city view and was given a room on the 29th floor. The room had a great view - you could even see some of the big lit up signs that were near the end of Times Square. The room itself was a decent size, especially for it being NYC. We had two queen size beds that were comfy and clean. The room also had a small desk with a chair and a big screen tv. The television got a lot of tv channels; a lot more than you normally get in a hotel room. The bathroom was a good size with a bathtub type shower. The room had it's own heating and cooling system separate from the hallway. However, we found it hard to regulate the temperature of the room. 68 degrees Fahrenheit was too cold; whereas, 70 degrees was almost too warm. But it wasn't a huge deal. The only real complaint we had about the room was that there wasn't really anywhere to put the suitcases. The way the room was set up it was hard to put your suitcase down without blocking a door. So maybe if there was a way you could put the suitcase under the bed, that would solve that problem. For the hotel itself, we liked that it offered a complimentary breakfast every morning. However, some mornings it was really hard to find a seat. Therefore, come early to beat the rush! Another important thing to note is that they only had three elevators servicing all 31 floors. At times, it took a while to get down or up - stopping at multiple floors.When it comes to the location of the hotel, it was amazing - one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. It was within walking distance to all of the Broadway theatres. We could easily walk to and from all of the shows in a matter of 15 minutes, and that was to the farthest theatre on 51st Street. Times Square was about a two minute walk. The hotel was also located right next to the subway station, so we could take that when going to other points of interest. We only had to take a taxi to and from the airport - it was nice to be able to walk everywhere! Lastly, the hotel had free wifi but you had to keep reconnecting after 24 hours which was kind of annoying. But the wifi was fast for the size of the hotel. With all that said, my dad and I already said that we would stay here again when we come back to the city!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel near Times Square and a good place to make your base to get to the rest of the attractions. Room was clean staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a good variety of fresh food but could get really busy the later you get up. We booked a city view but although there was a view it was limited. The only negative I found was the air con was very noisy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location couldn’t be better for a stay in the happening Manhattan!!! Walkable from Times Square, Hampton Inn is perfect for the tourist. Rooms are small as expected so hopefully one doesn’t have the big tourist bags as otherwise there might not be space to move around. But that doesn’t matter as one would be outside most of the day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel perfectly fit our needs. 2 blocks from Time Square, but away from the noise. Easy access to subway and eating options. Hotel was very clean, staff were friendly and breakfast was a great start to our day. I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton could do better. The rooms are small compared to other Hampton Inns - including others in NYC. The towels and blankets were thin and threadbare - one blanket actually had holes in it. There is no fan in the bathroom so you can't put on makeup at the sink - no mirror at the desk so you can't put it on there either. Difficult to get cleaning crew to clean your room. The elevators are slow and always full. Part of the problem is that the cleaning crew take up multiple elevators and hold them on floors they are working on - leaving guests with one elevator to use.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was courteous! The rooms were incredible! The breakfast was delicious! The beds were comfortable! It was a really great stay at the hotel. All staff members were very helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed the rooftop patio.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is close to Times Square but not too close. Easy access to Broadway Shows, restaurants and shopping. Complimentary breakfast was perfect although space is limited in the common areas. Coffee and water always available in hotel lobby. Rooms were clean. Lots of space compared to most NYC hotels. Would definitely stay again on my future trips.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great experience. Good customer service, reasonable price for a clean room and good breakfast (included in the price). The only thing we missed was the minibar in the room to keep our "daily" fruits/snacks or drinks cold (you have to buy provisions to walk that great city!)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my favorite place to stay in NYC. Try to come 2-3 times a year to catch up on newest plays and this hotel is so convenient. The staff always goes above and beyond. Such a clean and up to date furnishings. Have stayed hear last 6+ times I’ve been to the city and wouldn’t go anywhere else. They have a breakfast buffet every morning includes almost everything you could think of.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved the services, close proximity to the subway, and walking distance location of the West 41st St Hampton Inn to Times Square. All of the employees were so attentive and always wanted to make sure that the comfort and needs of the guests were met. We loved the AM daily breakfasts and nap sacks the hotel provided for the guests as we ventured out upon our excursions for the day. Teddy, an employee with breakfast was so kind and attentive to our breakfast service.We felt safe and secure within this clean and well-kept hotel. We recommend Hampton Inn Manhattan

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All the staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge was a gem. Not really sure what Johnny's title is but this young man answered all our questions and seemed to be everywhere. The breakfast was better than expected. Loved having water and coffee available to you all day. Would definitely stay there again when in NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Steps away from Times Square! Within walking distance of all the broadway shows! Nice, clean accommodations. Friendly staff, great free breakfast buffet! Dining staff work very hard to please and ensure you're taken care of!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: So we stayed here for 3 nights. On the positive side, it’s very close to Times Square and the subway. The property has a good appearance and the staff was friendly. The breakfasts were standard Hampton Inn food - not great but not bad. The room size was okay but there isn’t much closet space or bathroom counter space. When we arrived we had four VERY small and flat pillows and asked for additional pillows. We also only had two bath towels. These towels were THE smallest and most worn out towels I have ever seen in a hotel; they should have been tossed a long time ago. We called and asked for more towels as well. It took another call but we eventually got the pillows and towels. I didn’t think it possible, but these towels were even worse than the two we had; the were frayed and literally had holes in them! The handle to the shower/faucet came off in my hand and water was spraying onto the floor. We eventually got it stopped - the handle never was fixed but we learned how to use it. Overall, not a bad place but not great either. It’s clear that this Hampton Inn was not using brand standard towels or bath mats. The room was quiet although the ‘blackout’curtain was coming off the rod. The room did have plenty of electrical and USB outlets.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We brought our adult Children to stay at the Hampton Inn last week for 5 nights. The hotel it's self was clean and well kept as you would expect for a new hotel.Most of the reception staff were helpful and acomadating,with the exception of one Male receptionist who was extremely ignorant and very unhelpful to both me and my Husband on a few occasions.The breakfasts were very good there was lots of food choices. We were lucky enough to be looked after by Geraldine she was an absolute star and went the extra mile, she certainly is an asset to the hotel .The location was great for getting about on foot .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After having to move hotels because the last one was such a disgrace this hotel took us in late at night with no problems. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They turned an awful night into a blessing in disguise and made us feel at ease. The rooms were lovely, more than enough space even with two queen size beds and a great bathroom. Iron, ironing board, coffee machine, TV and wifi all included in each room. Breakfast is also provided although as you can imagine this gets very busy at peak times but you are able to take food up to your room. There are computers in the lobby and a small shop to buy anything you may need. I will definitely be recommending this hotel and using as my first choice when I return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived tired and hungry, as our flight was delayed. Teddy made our chaos calm. She helped us get a little breakfast then offered assistance with getting around time and was cheerful and patient with our many questions. What a great start to our vacation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Some of my family and I made a short trip to New York City the end of September. We stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan-Times Square Central. Great location in a very busy part of the city. Yes, it is a tourist area, but we were tourists. It was very clean with a very nice breakfast buffet. The selection was varied enough so that everyone in our group of four was able to find something they liked. The wait staff was very efficient and friendly. Our rooms were clean with enough space that two to a room were not in each other's way.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The place was in a great location close to Times Square, theaters, food locations, Hop on hop off bus with in walking distance also Central Park is in walking. Fitness center was very nice! We ate breakfast before 8:00 am and never had a crowd or problem with elevators. Wish you could go to the roof after 6:00 pm. Seeing the lights maybe nice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location very comfortable bed , everything you needed the only thing short was bar fridge. Stayed on the 23rd floor and good view over New York city. Bfast was good just did not like the fact that you have to make your own waffles !! 200 meters from subway in broadway !! easy to find and in walking distance from all the night life. Right by the bus stop for the hop on hop off !!! Will stay definitely again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had heard that traffic in New York was challenging but nothing can prepare you for the 'experience'. Do not, I repeat, do not rent car. The wear and tear on your nerves not to mention the cost to park in down town New York City is ridiculous. Transit is excellent and if you are staying near Times Square you can walk to the majority of the attractions. Taxis are a standard mode of transportation but, be prepared for a bumper to bumper experience and most important of all, be patient! We found everyone to be very courteous and if you have questions, strangers were there to help without hesitation. A word to the wise, befriend the concierge at your hotel. They are an invaluable resource and well worth the tips you give them! Take the Gray Line 'Hop On Hop Off' tours and use the coupons that are an integral part of the package you purchase. Worth every penny. If you like your food and a great atmosphere try Carbone on West 38th St. for Italian and Benjamin Steakhouse Prime on 40th St. for steaks and no trip to NYC would be complete unless you eat at Kats'z Deli. This is where 'Harry Met Sally'. Take the table service option vs. self serve and ask for David to be your waiter. He can insult you and make you laugh at the same time. Most important, the food (Reuben and Pastrami sandwiches) is nothing short of awesome. For a quick lunch on the go, the street vendors offer a great cross section of culinary delights. Quite honestly we were a little nervous about trying this type of eating experience but, when in New York do what the new Yorkers do. Go for the Halal and any vendor that sells the famous New York hot dog. Grays Papaya sells the best hot dogs and don't ask how papaya and hot dogs are related! Stay away from Dallas BBQ on 42nd St. Enough said. A trip to NYC wouldn't be complete without seeing a Broadway show or two and buy your tickets before you go to get the best seats and prices. We saw Come From Away the story of the flights that were forced to land at the town of Gander, Newfoundland on 9/11 and how the 7000+ stranded passengers were hosted by the towns residents. If you are Canadian you will leave the theatre feeling very proud. We also saw School of Rock. Words cannot describe the awesome talent of the young people that perform in this musical. You will be on your feet more than you are in your seat, I can guarantee it. No trip to New York would be complete without visiting the 9/11 ground zero memorial. It is emotional and I will leave it at that. Do not miss Central Park and a horse drawn carriage or pedi-cab ride/tour. The Empire State building and Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) are also must see attractions as is the harbor tour where you get up close to the Statue of Liberty. Anything short of a week in the Big Apple in my opinion does not give you enough time to see the major attractions. We stayed at the Hampton Inn on W 41st and our decision to do was based in part on breakfast being included with our room rate and the excellent location of the hotel to Times Square. The concierges (John and Maureen) at the hotel were an invaluable resource and made our stay that much more enjoyable. Enjoy your visit to one of the most interesting and vibrant cities ion the world.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in Times Square. Friendly Staff. Very Clean. Brand new. The rooftop viewing area was great. The rooms were very Modern and the beds were comfortable. It was a very short walk to many of the major attractions in New York City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Chose this hotel because of the location and the great hotel reviews. It did not disappoint. I was concerned because we were not checking in until 11 on the first night, but I contacted the hotel and was reassured everything would be in order. It was. The room was clean and I thought quite spacious for New York City (I have stayed in much closer quarters). I loved the water in the hotel lobby, and was pleasantly surprised to see chocolate chip cookies in the late afternoon/early evening. I was expecting a continental breakfast and was very happy to find all the other food choices -- waffles, oatmeal every day, some kind of meat and egg dish. Teddy was fantastic. So friendly and helpful. She is a great ambassador for the hotel. Loved the grab bags in the morning -- the bottled water was nice as we were on the town all day. My only "issue" was that we usually had to wait for an elevator in the morning. They were usually full by the time they got to the 16th floor. That is a very small issue, though, and I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I return to NYC. It is so close to Times Square and Broadway. Definitely a great experience and I only have good things to say. Oh, great beds and pillows, too!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, can't say enough about this hotel. Helpful employees, easy check in, close to attractions, the Port Authority and a restaurant for every palate. Rooms are NYC sized, but spotless and the beds are comfy. Breakfast is typical Hampton fare but plentiful. Elevators are crowded at peak hours, allow yourself enough time to get downstairs!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is our first time to stay in New York and we could not have picked a better hotel. The hotel is spotless and customer service was outstanding. From check-in to check-out we could not have asked for better service. The staff is outstanding and extremely helpful. Breakfast was amazing and the food was top notch. You will not find a better hotel with this location close to all the excitement and attractions.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staying at Times Square Hampton Inn this weekend was the perfect choice. We were right 'there' in the middle of the electric that is Times Square. We were on the 11th floor and never had to wait for an elevator! They had three running and they were fast! Breakfast was varied everyday and could always find the fuel you needed to start your busy day. The associates were very helpful. One took a lot of time to help us with the transportation system known as the Subway! And we went with confidence and succeeded!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We picked the hotel base on the location to all the sights we wanted to see while in the city. Arrived right after check-in time and all of our reservations were in order, staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was a tad small but it is New York. Free wifi and breakfast so that was a big plus. It is in a great location to walk to all the big sites and subway stations are everywhere. In the heart of the city but still quiet enough to get some rest at night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay!! Clean, modern, centrally located and fantastic staff, who always brought their A game. Maria and Tobo were especially helpful. Maria even texted me before our arrival asking if we had any special needs. What more can be said or wanted. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Service in this hotel is amazing.Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Bathroom comfortable.Asked for a small refrigerator and they brought it to the room.Great noise level . And flat TV.The breakfast was great! I could not believe how organized the breakfast place was. You are talking about 100+ people eating in the free breakfast room and the ladies kept everything clean and replenished. Had great choices for breakfast .Teddy, the main host at the breakfast room was amazing. Great attitude, friendly and so professional. She truly is the perfect example of excellent customer service.Keda, was helping today. Wonderful lady also.Fresh coffee! And hot. I was just so impressed with the breakfast place.The lobby very nice and very clean.The people in the front desk very professional and friendly.The theater for Aladdin was literary across the street. Time square is only 2 minutes away. And the subway is 3 minutes away.The location was just perfect!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a one night stay and found everything to be good- as we always do at the Hampton. However, at breakfast, I encountered something I rarely see in a big city or chain hotel; a super friendly staff member assisting and cheerfully chatting with EVERYONE at breakfast. The place we as busy and hopping and I overheard Teddy chatting with several guests while I had my breakfast. Then she greeted me warmly as she was clearing tables. I was so impressed with her demeanor that I wrote down her name. This lady should be on the the front desk as an amazing ambassador on the Hampton chain. I've been in customer service for a long and I can tell you she is a gem needs to be promoted!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service is wonderful and the rooms is clean. The location of the hotel is superb. We requested late check out and it was greatness with a smile, thank you! The water and cookies and breakfast are a nice treat!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of the subway, excellent restaurants, theaters, and Times Square. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We felt very safe as you need a key to go to any floor. We had a wonderful experience and would definitely return to the Hampton Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel while accompanying my daughter to New York to catch an international flight. We arrived at the hotel at about 10am, exhausted from an early morning flight, and they found us a lovely room so we could check in immediately (I have never had a hotel make such an effort to accomodate their guests!). The hotel staff went way above and beyond to make our stay comfortable, and get us whatever we needed. After we checked out of this Hampton, we were going to JFK, the bellboys (I don't know if that's the right job title or not) spent so much time and effort to get us an inexpensive, private town car so we wouldn't have to fight the crowd riding the trains at 5 on a Friday night with all of our giant, heavy luggage. We originally picked this hotel over the hotel we usually stay at in New York because the rates were a little cheaper, but it will now be my go to hotel, and the one I recommend to everyone I know!! Their customer service is top of the line!! And, our room was very nice, too! We were booked in a king room, but the front desk staff easily moved us to two double beds. We had a fabulous view out the window of New York City. This Hampton is within walking distance to all the times square and theater district attractions, which is really nice if you like going to the Broadway shows in the evening, it's just a quick walk back to the hotel when your show is over (or a quick walk to several fabulous restaurants/bars). And, something that is very important to me, it was VERY clean!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed there for three days.. great location, clean room, nice decor. Looked like a recently renovated hotel. Excellent service in all areas! A lot of options for breakfast fast replenishment. Front desk personnel was very helpful and friendly at all times. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from the UK after 8 wonderful nights in The Hampton Inn Central. From the moment we arrived we were looked after so well. We were quickly booked in and were given all the necessary info from Kevin. Our room was huge and was spotlessly clean. Plenty of towels and toiletries and you could have a bath or shower. The beds were SO comfy. Breakfast was great with plenty choice for all and they do advise of peak times so you cannot complain. Geraldine and Teddy do a fantastic job making sure everybody is well fed and they do cater for any particular needs. The hotel is in an ideal location for any area that you are going to with Times Square only minutes away. The housekeeping staff are so friendly and nothing is a problem. There is an endless supply of tea and coffee in the lobby and the cookies are delicious. When you come back in at night there are plenty bottles of water available. Nothing is a bother for the staff and the concierge staff are so knowledgable. When we checked out the staff arranged transportation to the airport and it was a fabulous, comfortable car. In summary hotel is fabulous and would absolutely recommend to all. As I said to Kevin this morning "we will be back". Thanks again. Maria, Stephen and Gillian. Xx

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the Times Square Central Hampton Inn this past weekend. Everything about the hotel was great---- location, quality of room, price, convenience of breakfast. The front desk staff was fantastic and helped us to get cabs since my mother is 94 and can't walk far. They went beyond what was necessary to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. This will be my hotel of choice on future NY trips.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Recently stayed here for three nights with my wife and daughter in one room. Location was good for Time Square. Hotel lacked space, room was small and the breakfast seating was nearly always full. Staff were consistently helpful and friendly.All in all, it just felt as if they had too many guests without sufficient space. Maybe that's New York, but being a regular Hilton guest I hoped for better.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed a four-day get-away in New York City, visiting with our daughter who lives in Brooklyn. She "know the ropes" and was very helpful in getting us on and off the subways, eating at some neat places, and enjoying touristy things, along with seeing a couple of Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location was great! Honestly wasn't expecting room to be as clean and nice as they were. Breakfast was the usual tasted fine to us. Front desk staff, while not overly friendly, were quick with answers.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, but I've had better experiences at other Hampton Inns close by. The reception staff wasn't very friendly and the rooms were small, even by Manhattan standards. I probably wouldn't stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: You are in the heart of Times Square when staying at this hotel. When we travel to NYC via train arriving at Grand Central I like to stay in a hotel that is not too far from Grand Central so we can walk. I do not want to be pulling my luggage all over the city. So definitely a great location for Times Square and convenient to walk to Grand Central. Our room was clean and small but that is typical for NYC. Also within walking distance from Madison Square Garden. They offer free breakfast. My husband went for breakfast but there were so many people he got coffee and pastries and brought them to the room. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you wish to stay in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is the first time TripAdvisor has let me down with a rating on a hotel. We checked in and had no one to help with the luggage. The room we were given on the 20th floor was so small it was claustrophobic. We could barely find room for our two large suitcases and two carryons. There was a king bed, a desk with one chair, a tiny closet that wouldn't hold a suitcase and a tiny bathroom. We asked for a larger room and got one slightly bigger but not much on the 25th floor. Housekeeping was not the best as I found hair stuck to the drain in the shower the first night and the room had a stale odor. The curtains didn't do a very good job of keeping the neon lights of Times Square out during the night. The bed was comfortable enough but the pillows flattened too easily. The bathe towels we ent very thick either and some of the towels we got were frayed. Breakfast was the typical Hampton Inn fare that you get at most other Hamptons. The front desk staff were friendly enough and there was a concierge there during the day. There were three computers for guests to use and one printer. The elevators were quick and didn't have to wait too long for one to arrive. You needed your key card for the room to access the elevator to get to your floor. I thought it was overpriced for what we got.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good just did not like the mini ironing board. When people travel they always need to iron especially when on business. This hotel only supplied a mini ironing board with no place other than the desk.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed but one night. Saturday sept 16. $415 is way out of our comfort zone, but most hotels required a 2 night minimum. Just a few minutes from Grand Central, it was a short cab ride. We pre checked in on the website and only had to swipe and pick up our keys. The room was ready and so were we. A quick lunch at Carmine's and off to sleep for a couple of hours. Room 304, very quiet, very comfy. Elevators a a bit of a challenge in the morning as the whole hotel empties into the continental breakfast. From the lower floors use the stairs. We are partial to Hamptons and are seldom disappointed. Although it was a budget buster we very much enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed two nights here and found the hotel to be ideally positioned close to theatres and Times Square. It is quite pricey for an ordinary hotel but the room was fine and the place was clean. Breakfast was ok but paper cups and plates with plastic knives was a bit naff. Whilst we would be happy to stay here again, we would probably look around first

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A great visit to this centrally located moderately price hotel. Right from the check in, we knew we were going to enjoy our stay. We arrived early via Amtrak from Boston and our room was not ready, but Rachelle found us a comperable room just 2 floors up. The room was clean and comfortable and had a great view from the 23rd floor. After settling in, we went downstairs and met John, the concierge. We told him what we wanted to do and that we only had a short time to do it in. He proceeded to help us plan the whole 3 days and was there every step of the way for us! He was awesome!! Another great feature of this hotel is a free breakfast each morning...which is rare in NYC! That is where we met Teddy the breakfast hostess. She was there each morning asking us how every thing was and if she could clear away plates etc. Teddy was courteous, efficient, and very friendly! All in all, with the help of these folks, my wife and I made great memories at The Hampton Inn-Times Square on 41st Street!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were a group of four couples for a two night stay before a 7-day Canada/New England cruise. We were all on different floors and everyone remarked how nice the rooms were. I was pleased at how efficient the front desk was and how yummy after 5 pm, they brought out the warm cookies. One person was very helpful in attaching some gift cards on my account. His name was Kris Sewnaraine and he just mastered this task!!! On Saturday morning 9/2/17 the early morning Bell Captain arranged for a large SUV to take all 8 of us and 9 bags in one vehicle to the Cruise Terminal Pier 92! A Comp Breakfast is served every morning, starting early and lots of variety and different every day for the main courses. This hotel has great access to the subway system and Times Square. Looking forward to another visit in the future! Thanks to all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was staying at this hotel for two and a half weeks during a busy rehearsal schedule and the wonderful humans working at this hotel made this a wonderful to come back to at the end of a long day. I want to give a special shoutout to the hardworking men and women who make that place run smoothly. Especially Teddy, Mia, Olivia, Keda, and Gisela who work in the kitchen and dining area during breakfast time! I was shocked to find out these women were not regularly tipped. The dining area is pretty accessible if it were not busy and a stool was there but those were only provided in my room. (Two stools were set up in my room when I arrived! So cool.) The dining area is crowded every day with lots of people and if you need to take the elevator just make sure you leave 10-20 min early (especially if you're in a wheelchair because no one is giving up their spot on the elevator trying to get downstairs in the morning. Every single day I stayed at this hotel these compassionate women helped me get breakfast and served me and I observed them not only helping people who needed help getting to a table, but cleaning up every table in between and wiping them down, on top of getting people gluten free bread, asking people if they needed anything, and remembered my name. At one point they knew what I wanted to eat, how they could help me on a day when I needed to take my food and run to an early call... they were so nurturing and not just to me but to others as well. The people at the front desk are hardworking and were always ready to help and the guy who sells the tickets is a riot!!! There are 3 elevators inside the lobby which is not far at all from the entrance. I would say though that they do get very busy during certain times of the day when everyone is trying to leave at once. The front desk is tall but there's a wide open space on one side to get someone's attention. I sent a lot of mail home to Los Angeles and they were very accommodating with receiving packages and letters as well. Loved my stay! I'll never forget seeing a view of the Empire State from my window during a lightning and thunder storm....Miss it already....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent a few days during the summer at this hotel and it was a very pleasant stay with a good service. Certainly the reception officers are very helpful and have a very welcoming and service oriented attitude helping out if they can, which makes a little bit of a difference. Rooms are spacious and clean. Good quality mattress and nice shower. We had a room on a silent side which is good being in the Times Square area. Elevators can be busy at times, as the breakfast room in the morning and we sometimes had to wait a little bit to get a table and queue up at the buffet. I would rate breakfast buffet quality average/medium. We also appreciated the position which is excellent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had a nice stay at the Hampton Inn. It is right near Times Square. The rooms and the linens were top notch. The breakfast was good except for how crowded it was. I was there the week before the kids went back to school so the hotel was at full capacity with families. One downside is that since the hallways are narrow, it is easy to hear your neighbors if they are watching TV with the volume on high or if they are talking on the phone. I bought ear plugs at the Walgreens around the corner.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location for walking to Times Square, Broadway shows, restaurants or picking up double decker buses to view sites (definetely do). Rooms are small as they are everywhere in NYC but they were very clean, bed and pillows (feather not foam) were very comfortable, Continental breakfast had a variety of options, warm cookies at night and endless coffee and tea 24/7. Teddy, in the breakfast area and David F. in the evenings responsible for the cookies and coffee station gave excellent service and went out of there way to please, they had a great positive attitude. Overall we had a good experience at this hotel and would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was in a great location with easy walking to just about everything. Rooms were a good size and the staff was very helpful when asked questions. I would consider staying at this hotel again next time visiting the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good value hotel for price... complimentary breakfast adequate.Rooms small but sufficient, little bit datedRooms quite dark due to surrounding buildings.Great location for all attractions and eateries Perfect for theatre shows on broadway

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In my opinion, this is the best Hampton Inn in NYC. Especially for first timers visiting NYC as long as you don't mind the very crowded Time Square areas. This Hampton Inn's rooms are probably more spacious than quite a few others. Like their complimentary breakfast and the 24/7 beverage station. After trying a few other hotels, this is the hotel I'd return to in the future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 8 nights in this hotel in the last couple of weeks and overall the experience was not up to the level we expected. This is more of a glorified bed and breakfast kind of place where in the mornings you fight to get a place at the breakfast table (and before that to get a lift to go down) to start the day with a limited choice. The room is pretty average and did not even have a refrigerator. The bathroom was tiny and not enough space to keep your things. In spite of being a Hilton member, no upgrade given or late checkouts allowed, so we had to walk around the city to kill time before the evening flight. The positive was of course the amazing location in Times Square but does not live upto Hilton standard.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I needed an NYC hotel for a couple of nights as a jumping off point to hit the city's highlights and to see Eric Clapton's shows at the garden. This being a leisure trip I wanted a comfortable and enjoyable experience, something more than just clean and functional. Surprisingly this Hampton Inn hit a home run and the price was lower than just about everywhere save for the seedy ultra budget hotels. Highlights: Beautiful view from my room on the 26th floor Fresh coffee, water, and warm cookies in the lobby Free breakfast. Yes it's crowded. So what? It still only takes a quick minute to grab your food and the selection is solid. Stylish and comfortable lobby that isn't too small The staff is friendly and helpful Location is as good as anywhere in the vicinity. My king room had more than ample space and I appreciated the contemporary bathroom with glass stand up shower. This isn't your typical mid-town laugh out loud small room. It is just right! Hilton Honors members (free) can select their own room and get a digital key. No need to even stop at the front desk when checking in- go straight to your room. HD television with directv. Best hotel TV experience I've had. Lowlights: I don't like the purple carpet and curtains and black headboard. Too drab! Furniture has taken a good beating. Good luck finding a hotel in manhattan with a desk or closet without some scuffs This isn't a luxury hotel. You won't feel like a high roller or an aspiring millionaire here. It isn't "special"- I got over that really fast when I realized those "special" hotels often have worse service, no free breakfast, and are in smaller buildings with tiny windows and often views of a brick wall. I obsessed like an OCD crazy person and spent a dozen hours looking for a hotel for this trip because it was fashion week and prices were at a premium. I thought I would be missing out if I didn't stay at a more premium hotel like the hyatt centric (been there- it's great- but not worth the extra cost), the Westin, the W Times Square, or the much more expensive Hilton time square across the street. Or the boutique hotels all over midtown east. Well guess what? This hotel is absolutely all anyone could reasonably hope for. If you aren't going to stay at a $500+ per night 5 star luxury hotel, then just stay here. It's basically as good as anywhere else- all you are missing is the "I am so rich!" feeling. Instead you get the "I am so smart for staying here and saving money!" Feeling!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 1 block from Times Square subway station. The hotel staff let me checked in at 9am. Price is high $250.00/night due to Labor day weekend. Elevator is slow from 8am-10am ( breakfast time). Front Desk provided water botttes and cookies, which is great! Hotel also has a table in the lobby to provide ice water, tea, and hot chocolate. I like this idea!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Exceptionally great staff. Excellent service. Convenient location - steps away from time square. Definitely recommended for a value-for-money experience in New York city for business or with family. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Birthday present from my girlfriend (yes i'm Very lucky) stayed here for 6 nights staying on the 6th floor no view as at rear of hotel so looked out onto offices but didn't go for hotel view went to explore/enjoy NYC.They have 3 lifts which are always busy so being on 6th floor meant we could walk down (handy at breakfast time) Breakfast is included and is great but does get busy and has limited seating but you can take it to your room if you want. Hot selection changes daily plus fresh fruit, yogurts, pastries but best is make your own waffles fresh you may have to wait for waffle machine but they are worth it especially with breakfast syrup maybe cream yum yum.The hotel is right round the corner from Times Square so you are right in the thick of it all.Didn't find a decent pub for a drink and a dance in the evening but lots of places to eat and lots to see.We don't mind walking and you see so much more, so central park is easy to get to and well worth a visit we even got to go there at night and watch Saturday night fever for free so check to see whats going on in the park as they have lots going on even a free concert by Paramore on Good Morning america but it was at 8-8:30am so also listen to whats said in the morning (Jason Darulo following week).Book a bus tour maybe 48 hour pass just to see the sights plus if you like an area you can hop off then hop back on later, also gets a boat tour thrown in with ours and can have a night tour as well.If your there for a while get a subway week ticket (approx $24) then you can travel all over the place some people we met went to Coney Island which has a beach (something different) or go to a shopping outlet as its much cheaper than a bus trip which costs maybe $40 each.Go to the Harbor and take the Staten Island ferry its FREE so its a free boat trip not much the other side but we sat over looking NYC having a beer in the sun (also cheaper beer as its out of the city).Very hot in August upper 80s but lovely air con that really works in the hotel bedroom.Empire state is about $55 each to go to the very top or about $20 cheaper if you only go to the 86th floor the views are spectacular we had a hot sunny day so great.we had a partial (70%) solar eclipse which you cant just order up as the last one was over 100 years before so watching it under the Brooklyn bridge just amazing, If like us you want to walk the Brooklyn bridge do it as its free but take a drink as you cant get one on the bridge but you can get fresh melon fruit etc but at a price.its only a mile but it is very busy watch out for cyclists as they just go for it.As city breaks go New York lives up to the city that never sleeps it was amazing.Also if you get hungry in the night right opposite the hotel is a huge McDonald's.The hotel location is right in the heart of the action so if you want an action filled break go for it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was helpful they gave us directions and help us experience the best of NYC, the rooms were clean and accomodating. The breakfast was delicious, they offered many choices. I highly recommend this Hampton!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel has a very good fares, considering the location and the amenities it is one of the best options in manhattan. Big rooms and very clean. Team at the front desk are very kind. You have a lot of things to do nearby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We traveled to NYC after NYE for a star-studded Broadway extravaganza. Naturally, we wanted to stay close to Broadway's theatre district, but we figured it was a long shot as we wanted to save a bit of money. Our bank (PNC) was offered a deal where we got additional rewards for staying so many nights at this hotel. With our Hilton Honors, we basically got one-and-a-half nights free for four days. The service was great, the location was absolutely perfect and our room was spectacular. We didn't care about a good view, we just wanted a warm spot. The bathroom mirror is our favorite mirror in the whole world, and the continental breakfast, though always overcrowded was exactly what we were looking for.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel near Times square and close to Penn station with great service and nice rooms. New and nice bathrooms garantee high degree of perfect sanitary. Breakfast a bit a disaster - many people in small place but correct food quality. Might be a bit extended. However, I d love to return

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent due to its proximity to times square. We had an amazing experience and the hotel staff and service were awesome. The front desk was very helpful and answered all of our questions in a timely manner. Special mention to Teddy who was in charge of the breakfast room and service. She was very friendly, customer oriented and very helpful. She even went to the extent of showing the nutrition charts of the breakfast items to some of the customers upon request. She also ensured that the area was very well managed and clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Times Square Theatre District. This location is perfect for all the Broadway shows as well as being in the heart of Times Square. Within walking distance to Penn Station, Subway, Union Station and Bus Terminal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I can sum up my experience there in one word-EXCEPTIONAL-enough said! Was able to check in early, place was spotless, free hot breakfast was amazing. Location of this hotel is great, near subway, Times Square. I cannot say a bad word about my experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After living in NY for 20 yrs. then leaving for another 10 yrs. We finally came back a tourist! Staying in the heart of Manhattans tourist area 41st. Street. The hotel is small but renovated. All the renovations gave lobby and rooms a more modern look. Rooms are small but manageable. Bathrooms aren't as small as people have stated. HaHa, I've stayed in hotels that you couldn't even open the door if you were on the toilet. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. House keeping was daily. We stayed on the 24th floor with a semi view. Advantage to this Hotel is location location location, not to mention Breakfast is included. The staff were very nice. Maria even texted us to check that everything was OK.My only comment and it's NOT the hotel's fault: the lobby and elevators seem to be hard to be kept clean especially after all the breakfast hoarders spill their containers of food and drinks on the lobby carpet and elevator floors. Unfortunately for all of you and you know who you are that have to take 4 plastic containers FILLED with food along with Yogurts and fruit shoved in your pockets, YOU ALL will ruin it for the rest of the customers because the hotel will soon start charging for breakfast. We are coffee, hard-boiled egg and toast breakfast people, so the breakfast was perfect for us.Other than that, I would definitely recommend and stay at this hotel again. Rooms are updated, clean and breakfast is included. The area is busy busy busy, but the subways and all transportation to get to all over the city is right there.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: One of the newest hotels in NY. Very clean. Good location. Great access to subway. Good breakfast. They had to go breakfast bags if you had to leave early. Staff very friendly. Good experience and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed only for one night, but found that all of the staff was absolutely super friendly. From the young man who helped us with the luggage to the reassuring and friendly front desk managers, the lady who oversaw the breakfast room and the manager who escorted us up to the roof top terrace as we had already returned the room keys. Thank you everyone - you really do care. This was service at it's best! The location is, of course, great and the room and breakfast were as you would expect from a well run hotel. Perfect experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I loved my stay at this hotel. Stayed 3 nights. Not only did they look after me and my family but also some guests we had who travelled from Baltimore to pick us up from the airport. The staff were very good, all were very pleasant and easy to talk to. The rooms are very clean and modern, beds very comfortable. Only the wardrobe was a little small but we just used our suitcases. The hotel has complimentary toiletries should you forget something and 24hr free tea and coffee, and I must say the coffee was excellent. The breakfast was ok, yes its busy but they also provide grab bags if you're on the go. They even provide lovely fresh cookies with the hot drinks during the day.Location was perfect. It was quiet at night and everything we wanted to see was in easy walking distance. I found the yellow cabs, surprisingly very reasonable. There are loads of places to eat and drink in easy nearby. It's the little touches that make this place special, please don't change. And thank you to all the staff. I would gladly stay there again and again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Teddy was such a sweetheart as she greeted us in the morning. She made sure we were doing well and taken care of as we ate breakfast. Teddy was a pleasure to be around. She definitely deserves a raise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located near Times Square & public transportation. The hotel was clean and the room was larger than we expected. The breakfast was great with a wide variety of food. We would recommend going early because it can get crowded at times. That's to be expected when you're located in Times Square. The staff was very friendly & always willing to help. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: GREAT Customer Service! Convenient location! Provides fantastic breakfast! Need i say more??? We really enjoyed our stay, had a nice quiet room. Loved the quick access to Times Square. We were able to walk to a lot of our activutes and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location near Times Square, theaters, public transportation (Grand Central Station and Penn Station). Excellent breakfast selection, but breakfast room was crowded. Concierge service (John) was outstanding, providing Broadway show ticket options and deals.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff were excellent and always welcoming. Location is very near to times square. Breakfast is the usual continental one, the staff who served breakfast were very good and always helpful. The breakfast area get bit crowded around 9am so would recommend to get breakfast before 8:30am.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location - easy access to all the main sites. Free breakfast was very good although busy every morning.
