review_body: Stayed on 26th floor for six nights. I used the app to select a room and check-in was fast and easy. The room was a good size for Manhattan. I requested a mini-fridge in advance and it was in the room upon arrival ($20 fee). Great sleep quality - Hampton beds are always good. Given the hotel is in noisiest part of the city, the room was really quiet. You can still hear sirens on this floor, but no other street noise. The A/C system has a constant fan option that's a good source of white noise. Enjoyed and appreciated free coffee/tea/water 24/7 in the lobby. Especially given I was there during a heat wave. Nice to get back to home base when it's 1,000 degrees out and grab some refreshment right away. I did not try the free breakfast - I was up too late or running out too early. I usually love my Hampton Inn stays, but this stay had several issues. I should note that I hate midtown, which is not the hotel's fault. I stayed here because I got a good deal, I'm a Hampton fan, and the reviews were good. The elevators are awful. On my last day, a group of us actually got stuck in a car that would not stop at the lobby and kept going up and down. I had luggage so could not take stairs. A nice man working on the problem rescued me from the 21st floor. It took 20 minutes to get from room to lobby. One evening, after a long day, I came back and all the hallways were dark, except for emergency lights. There was no hot water, internet or TV for a few hours. Not sure if the heat wave affected systems. The shower water pressure is very weak. The TV remote requires an engineering degree to figure out. I thought I'd seen every hotel remote on several continents, but this one stumped me. The towels are prison-issue scratchy. Wi-fi was OK and I was able to watch Netflix with a few hiccups. Plugs on the nightstands would be helpful. I reached out to Maria with my issues and she was lovely. Given her fast response, I will be staying with Hampton again - but not this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is fantastic and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were also new and very clean. My only complaint was that I could hear quite a bit of outside noise, but I don't think you can expect total quiet near Times Square! I ended up turning on the fan all night and that drowned most of the outside sirens and honking cars. If I were staying in this area again, I'd select this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a lovely hotel. The staff (every single one of them) were wonderful and accommodating. They bent over backwards to meet every single one of our needs. We needed a refrigerator for medication and before we could barely make it to the room, the staff arrived with a small refrigerator for us. Rooms were quiet and wifi was good. The hotel is in a great location. Lots to do right around the hotel. Just a fantastic experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel's location was convenient, easy access to subways, restaurants, and tour buses. The staff were super helpful. I needed help getting to places and they printed out directions for me. I also enjoyed hearing Teddy sing/humming during the morning breakfast. She also gave my mom and I a snack bag to go, since we had an early flight and wouldn't make it to the breakfast. The room was clean, neat, and quiet. I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn is a more than reliable brand for cleanliness & convenience. This particular location met our expectations in every usual category and went far beyond for its easy access to subway and theater district.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very honest staff in finding and returning a camera battery charger and battery that I accidently left behind.Room was very clean and excellent housekeeping.Best Hampton Inn complimentary breakfast that I have experienced.Check in and out was very efficient.Far better experience than I expected for New York City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was surprised at the size of the room (and bathroom) for a hotel so close to Times Square. Every staff member we encountered were friendly and helpful. Also, the free breakfast saved us a bundle on food. This experience helped make our first family trip to NYC a success!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location right next to Times Square. The hotel is modern, clean and staff are friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again when in New York, it has everything you could need.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay at the Hampton Inn would definitely recommend and go back. Really helpful staff and some great extras i.e. Drinks, Cookies and breakfast bags to help yourself to at reception. Perfect location thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location! Location! Location! Hotel is close to subway stations, the Port Authority Bus Terminal, Times Square and many of the attractions in NYC. Staff was patient and friendly. Our room was on the small side but it's Manhattan after all. Clean and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch, as were the cookies in the evening. Elevators got busy during peak hours but it was not a huge deal. Loved our stay. We will return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful eye-catching hotel in NYC, just a block from Times Square. We have stayed in many NYC hotels. On this trip back across the pond, we stayed for two nights. Definitely, look for Geraldine in the mornings when you have breakfast, you'll never forget this Irish lass.Check-in was fast, efficient and the staff was delightful. We requested and received a king bed and this room had a view. Our room was perfectly clean, comfortable with a very fresh design.When starting a day in NYC, breakfast is important! We have our favorite breakfast diners; however, the no-cost Hampton breakfast kept us here. A large comfortable dining room, with tables and booths, was available for guests. Breakfast offered varied selections, including cereals, oatmeal, eggs, sausage or bacon, yogurts, fresh fruit, bakery items...the list is long. Of course, juices, soda, coffee, and tea were available. Coffee cups for take-out were available. The lobby is not large, but well-planned. The lobby has different areas for relaxing, reading, watching TV, internet/computer access for guests, who may be waiting for a taxi, an event, a delayed plane or those needing a break..I loved the rooftop terrace. Open to guests, a different perspective of NYC is so cool from the top! You'll want to go up to the terrace and at least take some photos. The view to the north toward Central Park is great and a block away...a little bit of Times Square can be seen! When we were ready to leave, an SUV was made available (at a cost) for our trip to the airport. We have stayed at many other very nice and pricey NYC hotels. For first-time NYC/Manhattan visitors or those wanting a central NYC location, this Hampton would be my choice. We had a bad experience two weeks earlier before our trip overseas, so we cancelled a second reservation there and came here. (See review.) This hotel exceeded our expectations and it was the best decision we ever made. Our stay capped off a two week 20th anniversary trip and left us with wonderful memories. Cheers to the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central! We'll be back. Very highly recommended. Don't forget Geraldine!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for a week while we saw 6 shows. The location was excellent. Breakfast was standard, but a great way to save money and get a good start to your day. Happy hour was a nice break. Coffee, tea and water available all day. Nice business area. Fully stocked mini convenience store for snacks and lite meals. Received a text from the front desk after we arrived to check on us and our rooms. Loved being able to text the hotel when I had questions about shipping a package later in the week. King room was clean and well designed. The room is tight, the space is used wisely and surprisingly quiet. Very pleasant and helpful front desk and housekeeping staff. Subway stop across the street. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location great! Accommodations great, value great, breakfast great! Staff friendly and helpful! Felt very secure, very clean! Would stay there again! This is a very good place to take your family! It was a very friendly family atmosphere!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Two friends and I chose New York City as our destination for our annual "girlfriends getaway" last week. Hampton Inn on W 41st in Times Square proved to be the perfect location for us. The room was comfortable and breakfast offerings each morning were excellent. I have stayed in Hampton Inns in the past and this New York property met my expectations. The staff were very friendly and accommodating from the door man to the breakfast hostess and everyone in between. The hotel was affordable for New York standards. We would definitely select this hotel if we were to visit again and will recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We took our daughter on a graduation vacation.The motel was close to the theatre district.The staff from the front desk to the breakfast staff were pleasant and helpful.There was a wide variety of local and national restaurants to choose from.The wait staff at all of the eateries were polite, helpful, and personable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not a great value. Small rooms and very expensive. Stay at the Hilton across the street. It did have a free breakfast that was good, but rooms are small and there is not a refrigerator. Staff is friendly. Location is good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was close to EVERYTHING! Right in the middle of Midtown. Less than a block, and you are in the middle of time square. Pretty much everything was within walking distance (up to 20-30 minute walk), but the metro station was also very near by if you didn't feel like walking anymore. Beautiful views from the room (on the 28th floor). I also loved the rooftop. Breakfast quarters are a little cramped, but we didn't have to wait for a table more than 5 minutes. There was no refrigerator in the room, but you can request one.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this Hampton because of its location and the complimentary breakfast. It was very convenient to Times Square, Bryant Park, Shopping, the Theatre, and great Restaurants!!!! I would suggest, upon arriving, to go out and explore at least 2 blocks in each direction from the Hotel. There were several restaurants that we discovered our last day there that we wish we would have known about earlier. The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. The beds are wonderful and, staying on the 24th floor, street noise was not a problem at all. The elevators are slightly slow- but you get used to it and its definitely not be a deal breaker!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed a stay this past wkend, attentive front desk staff, small elevators and tight hall ways ( on the 18th floor anyway) no fridge in the room, A/C worked but not consistently still the room was comfortable, normally stay at the Hilton but it's a great location for Theater, TSquare and a great jumping off point to adventure around the city, anything and more if availa in the area from dining to dancing, drinking, shopping. I slept very well also which was a plus. I'd come back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Graduation trip. First time to NYC for two of us. Hampton Inn Times Square Central was an excellent location for us to travel to all of the sites we came to see. Hotel was clean and overall very quiet. Room size was adequate for what we needed. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Had read previous concerns about having to wait for elevators, but we did not experience any problems. Breakfast was what you can expect for complimentary breakfast. Breakfast staff kept items refilled. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room was ok, but the service was great. Pros: free breakfast included- the breakfast had several options from hot and cold foods. Every single staff member I interacted with, from the check in person, the cafe, the maintenance guy at the elevator, the cleaning lady in the hallway, everyone was very friendly and it came across as sincere every time. The location is great! Within 3 short blocks of the show we went to see, walking distance to everything. Free wifi included. Cons: You could tell that like most hotels, they don't change the outer bed sheets (the comforter had minor makeup on it) but the inner sheets were clean (I checked all the way to the mattress). I didn't like that the bathroom door is a sliding door that leaves a small crack. I was sharing the room with my sister and we had to make sure not to stand where we could look into the crack to ensure privacy. The hotel building seems old, and there were only 3 elevators for 30 floors. This made for long elevator wait times when it was time to check out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms are clean and staff friendly. I liked the idea of cookies and breakfast packs kept on the front counter, water/tea and coffee as you enter and a small store next to reception. Hampton Inn is conveniently located - couple of blocks from Times Square and a block away from Hop On-Hop Off bus service. Central Park in one direction and Empire State Building in the other are 15 minutes comfortable walk. For shoppers Macy's largest store is next to Empire State Building. I would recommend a stay at Hampton.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pleasant staff, nice lobby, warm cookies in the afternoon, all day coffee and tea. Room and washroom a little small but adequate. Reasonable price. Good location. Nice computer station. You may want to ask for an extra towel as they are small.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Slow check-in (not enough staff), and room was TINY. Complained but they didn't care. They are all smiles and want to help, but they can't do anything about it. And no mention of refund or anything like that. Won't stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This new hotel is in a great location near Times Square. It's far enough off of the Square that noise is not a problem- yet it's very conveniently located. Rooms are nice- bathrooms are nice. The complimentary breakfast is not anything special- and it's very crowded, but it's nice to have that option if you want it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is right in the center of Times Square. Excellent location! Close to the theaters, subway, restaurants! Could not be more perfect. The rooms look brand new and we're exceptionally clean. The city view from our room was not spectacular so I would not pay extra for that again and elevators take awhile so I would stay on a lower floor next time but I would highly recommend this hotel!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We found this hotel to be a treasure. It is on a quiet street,just one street away from the major action. Not plush, but exceptionally clean (the best you could possibly get for this price point). 30th floor has amazing views. Small lobby, with good energy.Customer service was excellent. Check-in/out was easy and accommodating. A shout out to the breakfast buffet crew members (maybe manager named Teddy?) who set us up with some generous to-go items when we arrived at breakfast after it closed, due to getting lost on our morning walk. I love it when people go above and beyond to exceed expectations; they do.Front desk helped us find a taxi when we had to leave before sunrise. Free wifi for Honors members (free sign-up).Taxi drivers seemed unfamiliar with the hotel, so make sure you have the specific address. No pool, but nobody has time for that anyway. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my fourth trip to Hampton Inn Times Square Central and my husband and I love it. Clean, comfortable and the staff is very accommodating. It is centrally located on 41st Street between 7th and 8th Avenues and we can walk to almost anywhere in Mid-Town. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for four nights. Traveling with family and very pleased with the hotel and staff. The room was small which is to be expected in New York. But the room was clean! Everyone from the front desk, the housekeeping staff and the breakfast servers were all very helpful and friendly. We got texts everyday asking how our stay was. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The position on Times Square on relatively quiet 41st street was convenient and close to all the action. the hotel was clean and efficient -- free water was appreciated. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. On-site booking opportunity was great, not expensive and we got excellent tickets for a broadway show

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms are small, overpriced for the quality of the hotel. I guess it's the price you pay to be in Times Square because overall the hotel is not worth the money charged. Breakfast is not that great. The hotel takes no consideration for people who do not eat meat or pork. The only meat available was that of pork. The hotel served cold unpeeled boiled eggs. I have never seen that. I will begin sticking with Marriott where there are more accommodating standards.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good hotel, very nice and helpful staff Delicious breakfast Special thanks for Rachelle sanon and Teddy very help full and professional. Hotel is near to Time Square, Bryant Park, Empire State Building, Rockafeller Center, Subway right up there. Hotel we not say is very luxury but nice. If considering to stay you will enjoy the location and your convenience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place to stay when visiting New York. We loved the location for theater, dining, shopping and subway access. We had reservations for Cats and Wicked, both theaters were within easy walking distance from the hotel. The folks at the desk were very knowledgeable and were always available for questions and advice. They helped with subway navigation and transportation to the Cruise Pier as well as other general area questions. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. We liked being close to Time Square but yet out of the crowds.We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here on any return visits.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not a single flaw. This hotel is in a great location, the rooms are modern and super clean, the staff is friendly and caring, and the breakfast items are vast enough for both meat eaters and non-meat eater.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service and facility was top notch!!! I was extremely pleased with the comfort of my room and all of the staff was friendly and helpful!! The location is awesome, very walkable to many restaurants and theaters as well as close to the subway !!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent accommodations at this hotel. The location was great. Staff very helpful. The rooms were clean. Steps to Times Square. This hotel is all updated and we really enjoyed our stay there. Definately recommend it

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed staying in a clean, well decorated room, right in the theater district in North Times Square! Staff were very friendly. Full breakfast was tasty, although area was a bit crowded on the weekend. I loved being able to get a cup of tea, coffee or water in the lobby at all times of the day or night. Great location for seeing a show, walking through Times Square, or catching a subway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very pleasant and enjoyable hotel. Great location, major metro lines nearby. Large and comfortable bed, new bathroom, free Wi Fi coffee and cold water. The stuff is very friendly and helpful. The lobby is inviting with everything you need. Very good breakfast with a large selection of warm and cold food. Only comment is on dining room size (small) if you don't come early enough you may wait for free table. Other than that a perfect hotel with great potential. We'll be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Not much to add to the other fabulous reviews of this location except to give a shout out to Geraldine in the breakfast room. Sure the room gets crowded - who doesn't want to enjoy coffee plus in the a.m. - but Geraldine's bright, happy and upbeat demeanor makes up for any momentary inconvenience. If and when you are lucky enough to encounter her, you will know what I mean.We stayed six nights and each and every staff member was exemplary.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is perfect - heart of the theater district. Convenient to everything, obviously times square and Broadway, but also only about a 20 minute walk to Central Park. A number of tour groups were staying, so lobby was generally bustling. Great Hampton breakfast, (love those waffles) in a contemporary setting. Friendly staff, and room on 10th floor was clean, comfortable and quiet. Good value - I'll stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would like to say this was a very enjoyable stay. Booked far enough in advance, year to be exact, so the price was very reasonable. Breakfast a great experience with huge variety. Staff friendly. Pillows, well let's just say why use.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: So far, the best hotel we've stayed at in Manhattan. The people at the front desk were outstanding. My special thanks to Chris who was always friendly and accommodating. The concierge was knowledgeable and patient. Everything about the hotel was welcoming. There is citrus infused water in the lobby as well as coffee, tea and hot chocolate. One night there were freshly baked cookies.The modern decor of our room was very appealing.The room and bathroom were clean. The bed was firm and comfortable. The bathroom door was hung in the barnyard fashion that is popular today. It was also a space saver since it opened and closed from side to side. The shower was large and all glass with modern fixtures. I also like the fact that there was no tub. The only negative is that the towels were thin and on the small side.There is an outstanding selection of foods and drinks for breakfast. Although there is plenty of seating, it can be a challenge to find a place to sit after 9.The location is perfect with easy and quick access to the subway. There are tons of restaurants nearby. Theater shows, Times Square, Bryant Park, and Whole Foods are a short walk away. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Newer hotel very close to Times Square. Beds were very comfortable. Great amenities; breakfast included, coffee/tea in lobby, concierge, cookies in afternoon. Free Wifi for Hilton Honors members. We were able to choose our room prior to arrival and we chose a lower floor knowing we could walk down and not wait for the elevators. We arrived around noon and our room was ready. We would stay here again but they need to work on two things to be excellent. They need more room for breakfast and the towels need to be fluffier; I don't remember staying anywhere where the towels were this bad.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located in Times Square. The staff is fantastic - so helpful and courteous, eager to help, advise, direct. Spotless, quiet, comfortable rooms. Ours had a great city view. Breakfasts were good. Highly recommend this Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a clean and reasonably priced hotel only a block from 42nd street and 4 or 5 blocks from most broadway theaters and the heart of Times Square. It is also close to the Port Authority. Easy access to the subway if you want to go to other parts of New York , like Ground Zero, Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty, etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited with two teens to check out a school and see a play, etc. We were very pleased with our room and the service. The location right in the Times Square Area was handy and we could walk to everything. We are not seasoned New York visitors and were not sure what to expect...it was a nice hotel and we would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed there over the weekend. Price was great! Actually canceled a reseevation to switch to this hotel. Glad i did. I really enjoyed my stay..very nice staff and super clean room. I was in the 31 floor nice view roof top view was amazing. I loved the location. The elevators take a while but that's minor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was awesome and super friendly.The hotel was great, except that didn't honor a third parties promise of free parking. Three blocks from Times Square. The room was very clean and nice and neat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are much more comfortable than some of the other hotels where we've stated. With that said, the breakfast wasn't that great and while other hotels where we've stayed at would arrange a taxi for us, the hotel staff here did not. I have a bad back and could not walk to the train station with the amount of luggage that we had. I explained this to the staff and all they did was point me in the direction of where I would have "the best chance" of finding a taxi. This is the only hotel where I've encountered this, so for that reason, they only get 3 stars.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location with easy access to anything you'd want to do in NYC. It was an easy walk to attractions in Times Square and near several subway lines to get you to other New York cities/boroughs. Breakfast included in hotel stay helps with food costs while staying in NYC. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay tremendously!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for one night, because the price was good and it's right by times square, and had a really good experience. The room is comfy, clean and very inviting, a little on the small side, but was nit an issue at all. It also comes with a complimentary breakfast .Most importantly though is How genuinely nice and helpful the staff is, especially Gifston and David, who helped with any odd and random request and did so with a smile!Also try the freshly baked cookies, literally the best ive had!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights before travelling on to Boston. Had a very comfortable stay. Hotel is in a great location. Rooms were a good size and very clean. Good facilities and a great to have breakfast included. All the staff were fantastic and very friendly, special mention for Geraldine Meehan for making sure everyone was well looked after at breakfast time and Kris on reception who welcomed us on arrival.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I recently went to NYC to visit our daughter who lives there. We decided to stay in the city to take advantage of the great access to all the sights and sounds of this great city. This Hampton Inn had a great rate for Hilton Honors members so we took advantage of it. We were not disappointed.The hotel location was excellent since it is blocks from Times Square. The hotel is new. (built two years ago) Kris was very helpful on the phone in answering all our questions about the accommodations prior to our trip. He also greeted us at the front desk. He was very friendly and courteous. He made sure that we knew everything about our room and where all the hotel major service areas were located. (breakfast area, fitness room, business area, etc.) He told us to contact him if we had any questions. The room was great. It had a good view of the east side of the city. It was moderate in size. The bed was very comfortable. We did have to get used to the slider door to the bathroom due to privacy concerns but it did save on space. The room overall was very comfortable. The breakfast area was large and very busy. We chose to go during the less busy times. The food selection and variety were very good. There were plenty of healthy foods to choose from. Geraldine and Teddy were very friendly and helpful in assisting us in locating a table and in making sure we were happy with the breakfast. Raymar and Ninoska were also helpful when we decided to stay any additional night. They made sure we got a really good room on the 31st floor – western view of the city. It was a beautiful view. As we checked out, Johnny helped us in getting our Uber driver. We appreciated his help. We thought this was a great additional service of the hotel. This is a great hotel whose management and staff are committed to outstanding customer service. They lived up to the Hampton Brand. We highly recommend this hotel for a superior stay in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What I enjoyed most about this hotel was the effective communications between the hotel and me throughout my stay. The morning of my arrival I received a text developing a relationship before I even stepped foot on the property. I thanked them for the welcome and immediately received a reply, evidence this wasn't a hollow hello. Clean room, Hip Lobby, location in the heart of it all. As I headed back to the train station another text that led to another communication, that left me feeling valued for my stay. It's the little things that drive loyalty. This property earned mine and you should feel comfortable picking this hotel for your stay. I trust you will be in as good hands as my wife and I.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent service, especially the breakfast staff! Everyone was friendly and accommodating. The food was good and the area was kept neat & clean. The establishment was amazing. We really had a good experience at the Inn and enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice employees very helpfulgreat breakfast is very nice buffet. perfect location with easy access to different interesting places like theaters, Restaurante .I would go back to this hotel without doubt. The room was clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square. It is right around the corner from Times Square. The rooms were nice. The service was very good. I walked from the train station to the hotel, it was about 10 blocks. I also walked to the theater district to see a play. The location is great. I recommend this hotel for the location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean hotel, with central location... what more would you want? The staff is very accommodating plus decent free breakfast with THREE WAFFLE MAKERS!!! O, and they bake cookies in the evening!!! ‍♂️‍♂️‍♂️‍♂️‍♂️‍♂️

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Super busy during my stay but well worth it. The staff was always polite and professional. Rooms are cozy and remodeled. As Hilton owners we felt the same great customer service we receive at Hilton clubs and it was awesome! Subway station right across the street to get you anywhere. Port authority bus station around the corner to connect you to JFK / LGA easily. Very safe and comfortable place to stay in the city and breakfast was great everyday!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night. The front desk staff were great and had lots of helpful suggestions on getting around NYC and where to go eat. Not sure if we were there on a particularly busy weekend, but there always seemed to be a wait for the elevator. They have a rooftop deck - be aware that not all of the elevators go to the rooftop deck though! The breakfast was a typical Hampton Inn breakfast, they were good at keeping everything well-stocked during breakfast time, but if you go during the busy period, it's hard to find somewhere to sit. Also there is a McDonalds across the street, but the counter faces the next street over, so you have to walk the entire length of the building to get to the counter to order your food.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I travel a lot and stay at Hilton properties across the nation. I have found that my favorite properties, those that I return to again and again, are those that have workers who are kind and thoughtful. This hotel has that kind of work in Gifston Wignal! After having a terrible experience with transportation from the airport, I was running very late to the theater. Giftson went out of his way to encourage, welcome, and provided a snack to take away the fact that I hadn't eaten since breakfast on Mother's Day! THANK YOU, Giftson, for being a bright light in a rough afternoon and making me smile and feel welcomed. The personal touch this hotel provides far exceeds any that I have stayed at in the Times Square area. I have stayed at this hotel once before, and I will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's our family vacation and first time to visit New York. We are very pleased and happy with the hotel we stayed here in Hapton Inn Manhattan Time Square. Free breakfast is a plus. Great customer service. Clean room every day. Free cookies for snacks. There's nothing I can complain. This place is great with excellent service. We are so content and happy customers. Sure we will chose this hotel in our future trip. The elevator is little slow during rush hour other than that all is great. Walking distance to broadway, time square and subway. Love this hotel and we love New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is located in a great place. 1 minute away from Times square, 2-3 minutes from port authority and walking distance from a huge part of manhattan.it also have free beverages and cold water at the lobby, at the front desk you can find from time to time some cookies and small mineral bottle.The rooms are comfortable, spacious (at least the rooms i've been at - i had 3 reservations and some days out of nyc between) and clean.We received a thoughtful attitude especially from Kevin at the front desk who also managed to find a room for me in an higher floor at one time.Breakfast was rich and tasty.The only weak at the hotel is the fact that there is no luggage storage if you wish to leave your luggage for more than a day and you must hand them over to CBH for storage (which isn't cheap), according to the hotel that's due to security reasons.Overall we enjoyed that hotel very much and we'll surely will stay there the next time we'll be in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There's no location in NYC better than close to Times Square, and this hotel is at the heart of this area and the Broadway theatres. It has complimentary breakfast (Although i will never understand the paper cups & plates and plastic cutlery...), which is quite good. The room is large and equipped with amenities like safe, minibar, iron and coffee maker. The air-condition in the room is quite noisy, and when it starts on during the night, it can wake you up. There are 3 lifts, which are insufficient for this hotel- in the busy time in the morning, you can wait even 10 minutes for a lift which you can enter, especially if you live in a lower floor, as all the downward lifts are full. The concierge is very helpful, and I bought theatre tickers through him. But as said- location beats all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I spent two nights in the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square. It is conveniently located for theater district & Times Square activities. The hotel has a friendly and attentive staff, very good breakfast, and responded promptly to a small issue with our room. This will be our first choice when going to NYC!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall experience was very good. Called ahead as arrival would be before checkin...staff informed me that I would be able to store luggage or be checked in if rooms were available... Welcomed to eat breakfast when we got in too! Room a little tight for 4 people. Beds comfortable. Was expecting a refrigerator and would've been helpful, but I guess there was no room for it. Washers/dryers, small gym onsite. Awesome location... Few steps from a theatre, close to other theaters, restaurants, shops, etc. Staff pleasant and helpful in hailing transportation, pointers with the metro card/subway and general suggestions to first time visitors to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 1. I stay here often and extended during long Manhattan business trips.2. I had an emergency during my last visit and needed so much help on so many levels. 3. Everywhere I turned, friendly faces helped me in amazing above-and-beyond ways:- From Jonny and Luis getting everyone and everything moved around, to Chevelle taping/addressing boxes in the fitness center, then Maria & Nini & Rachelle & Kevin taking care of all my front desk needs, the folks working at this hotel are amazing!!!4. If a higher rating exists, I give them the highest possible rating!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a very nice stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan. It's steps away from Times Square, yet just far enough away for the noise from Times Square to not bother you at all. It was nice to have a rooftop deck. Breakfast was a very nice convenience -- bagels, fruit, yogurts, waffle station and other hot selections. Breakfast does get busy, but we always were able to get a good plate full and found a place to sit. Our rooms were nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downside was the elevators do take awhile, but it really wasn't that big of a deal. We always started up conversations with other travelers who were also waiting. We had a great time and would definitely stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Chose this hotel for a one night stay based on its location and price. Those really are its best features. The rooms are small, even by New York standards, and if you valet park, the price of $53 per day is high for that area. One irritating feature was the noise on the floors. The doors are very heavy and shut with a loud bang. You will hear all the late arrivals and early departures. Another negative was being awakened before 9:00 on a Sunday morning by housekeeping knocking on our door despite the fact that we had arranged for a later check out with front desk. Apparently, they don't have a system to communicate to their housekeeping staff I was checking out earlier and who is checking out late. Front desk had problems with check out as well. All in all, an adequate stay but not one I would want to repeat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed for 4 nights with my parents in this hotel just two blocks from Times Square. The hotel was excellent - service from start to finish was very good. The room was large and comfortable for 3 people and although you are in the middle of all the action of Times Square, the hotel is very relaxing and welcoming after a day exploring the city. The 24/7 tea and coffee as well as the free cookies weré nice touches. Breakfast was very good and has a wide choice of foods ( you can indulge or be healthy). All the staff was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Special word for Geraldine who always made breakfast an enjoyable time. She was so friendly and would go out of her way to greet and check up on all guests. Her smile and genuine personality was a huge change from staff in other hotels I had stayed. Although hundreds of people pass through the busy breakfast área she always gave a personal touch. Highly recommend the Hilton for a stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our couple had a Sunday - Tuesday stay at the Hampton Inn. Great service from the start. We arrived at 1PM, anticipating a luggage drop-off until the standard 3PM check-in time. We were immediately offered our room without an ask, and given details on the hotel (rooftop viewing deck, workout facilities, breakfast area, etc.). The location is great if you're looking to experience Times Square or the Theater District. Since it's not directly on Broadway, you have a a small escape from walking into the middle of traffic every time that you exit the hotel. From a McDonald's across the street to several other sit-down restaurants nearby, it's easy to grab food or other necessities nearby. We booked through HotelTonight and got an incredible deal. We'd definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right where we wanted to be in the heart of everything. As expected, Hampton quality rooms and service. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. If you see negatives on breakfast crowds, they tell you up front when it is most crowded. Since I had no intention of spending my New York adventure sleeping in, I experienced no issues. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From start to finish the best helpfull staff they always checking on us the breakfast staff were the best I have ever experienced. The concierge John was very knowledgeable and so much fun and friendly he even tracked down rare Rangers tickets for us. The beds were very very comfortable

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rude employees esp front desk "maria" checked in & she was rude never explained a thing about hotel, elevator or breakfast shoyld have guessed then it would be bad. Housekeeping was poor. When i left my keys in room they redused to go look for them stating to me housekeeping waa gone for day call back in morning by then the laundry waa sent out to ne cleaned with my keys wrapped up in them, maria refused for me to speak to a manager & i am still waiting for gerry hughes to call me nack, & so i never got my keys back. Dont bother to go to concierge he is an awfully rude & doesnt help. Food horrible. The 1 good thing i can say is location is good but is it worth staying in a gross place. The women in breakfast room was wonderful the free wifi didnt work had to pay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location, breakfast and beds were spot on. Checking in and out was easy. They had one of the best beverage service bars we have ever seen (coffee, hot tea, lemon water) and every day at 5:00 they had warm cookies at the ck in desk. Highly recommend this hotel and will stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of Manhattan. It is just near the main times square. It offers good deals for stay with a complimentary breakfast. Our room was nice with a lovely bathroom. The guest service is also appreciable. The only drawback is that they do not have microwaves in their rooms. Rest everything was perfect!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The person that works at the hotel that we were most impressed with Teddy in the food service area. Both mornings we were there she was very attentive to each person that was there for breakfast. It was a extremely busy place but she cleaned tables of quickly with a happy smile and help anyone that needed extra help. On the second day that were there, I was not feeling well at all and I ask if it would be possible to get an order of scrambled eggs. She was right on it. She went in the back and cooked the eggs especially for me since I wasn't able to eat the eggs and cheese that was served. That action alone made true believers in this Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location in Manhattan. Very clean rooms and excellent bathroom layout. Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful as we navigated around Manhattan. Would definately consider this property again on our next visit to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were very clean, the staff was efficient and kind. Check in and out was efficient. Great location near the theater district. They offer valet parking which is worth its weight in gold! I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a fantastic trip to New York last week, booked through Virgin Holidays. Hotel was very clean, all staff very friendly but very professional and so helpful at all times.Located within a few minutes walking distance to Times Square so not in the heart of all the action.Rooms very clean, daily maid service.Buffet breakfast- excellent choice of foods provided all freshly cooked - restaurant staff were really good especially Geraldine- she was so professional and friendly, nothing was a bother to her and she gave us some great tips for our stay in New York- seeing her in the morning at breakfast time made our day as we had some good laughs also.Located great for everything really- all within walking distance- move away from Times Square for meals/drinks as very experience in the heart of it- but its something you have to experienceA huge thanks for making out trip so enjoyable - highly recommend this hotel :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect place in the heart of Times Square. Clean, upscale, not too pricey. Great staff and a full breakfast included. I will be staying here again!! Thanks so much for the great service and location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a conveniently located hotel in the theater district of Manhattan. The rooms are comfortable and affordable (for New York) with pleasant and efficient service from the staff. A complimentary breakfast is included as well as coffee and tea throughout the day in the lobby. At the end of your stay, you can print your own boarding pass (no charge).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was surprise, the hotel was clean, the staff was helpful and kind, the staff in the lobby I expect to be rude but to my surprise all of them were super. The hotel is few feet from my favored restaurant Red Lobster. Could not ask for more. I will be back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights. Location is convenient to Time Square and Subway. Room had no signs of wear. Comfortable Bed. Great service by staff. Room is slightly small--to be expected in NYC. Will choose this hotel for my next visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Bed was comfortable, room was clean, and hotel is convenient for all of the attractions. Staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was ample and tasty. We had jet lag and so was down for breakfast early, it was very quiet first thing but I understand it can get busier throughout the morning. Fantastic view of the New York skyline. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel in an excellent location. Breakfast was very busy so get there early but it was free! Concierge recommended a great restaurant for us and everyone was very friendly. Rooms were clean and quiet and just a short walk to everything. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is close to attractions, clean with friendly staff. Only objections overcrowded breakfast area and difficult to get an elevator during prime times. Did enjoy a cookie during happy hour one day but gone too soon on other days.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After I made reservations at this hotel, I received a welcome email asking how they could make our stay a great one. The manager put me in touch with John, who answered all of my questions promptly and is a wealth of information. Everyone welcomed my family with smiles and took very good care of us. The room was small, but we were comfortable, and it was exceptionally clean. The breakfast was well done and the cookies in the evening were a special treat. The hotel is conveniently located for everything and we were able to walk to Times Square, the theaters, on Broadway, etc. My daughter said it was fun as some of the staff at the front desk had a good sense of humor. It was a joy to stay there.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at Hampton Inn Times Square Central for 5 nights and it was an excellent experience. The Location, Customer Service, Breakfast, Snack Packs and In House WiFi were all top class. We want to specifically say a big thank you to Geraldine for her excellent customer service and for looking after us when dining for breakfast. Her service was second to none, and it's people like this that make your stay even more memorable, so thank you Geraldine.Overall this was an excellent Hotel for not just families with small kids but to anyone who is wanting a great stay in Times Square. We would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to other travellers for all those reasons mentioned above.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: John is a great asset to this Hotel....friendly.....nothing is too much troubleMimi on the front desk was great even printed out maps for us for thrift shopsGeraline in the dinning room was wonderful offering service beyondour room was on the 6th floor. small but clean and well appointed....the breakfast is a zoo with so many people but that is to be expected..everything one could wish for to start the day.....as for all day tea and coffee that is a huge plus...congratulations on being a 5 star hotel but at 3 star rates well done

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel in the heart of Times Square. Everything is new and very clean. The staff were amazing. Couldn't be more helpful. The location is perfect. So much to see and do within walking distance and the subway is just down the street making it easy to go anywhere. I plan on staying here again. Only complaint was that you have to pay for a refrigerator in your room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square on 4/18/17 for one night.The hotel is very convenient to Times Square. The rooms are small but clean. We stayed on the 7th floor (#708) and for being in NYC, it was pretty quiet. The room did not have a view. We did not have any problems with waiting for elevators from the 7th floor. Elevators came quick and were not full. We were able to pick our room a few days before traveling and we were able to check in upon arrival. There is valet parking at the hotel for $64-65.The staff was friendly. There is a free breakfast with a decent amount of choices. Although the breakfast seating area was packed when we went down for breakfast, we were able to find a spot to sit (3 people) pretty quickly. Staff walked around the tables asking if customers needed anything and were quick to assist when asked.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After reading some fantastic reviews on here. We stayed in this hotel for 8 days, and were in NYC for my partners 40th. I had emailed the hotel previouly months before our trip numerous times ,asking for a higher floor and a welcome basket etc as a special treat for him on our holiday with our small daughter and to celebrate this special occasion. When we arrived we never got a high floor or a welcome basket. I even asked numerous times throughout our holiday ! And still never received either. They didn't seem bothered. Throughout our stay breakfast room was ok for first few days and we were able to get a seat, however after that we was often waiting up to 10 minutes to get a seat. Which was a nightmare with a small child. When you do get a seat, other people are then waiting right behind you throughout your entire breakfast meal to make sure they then get your seats which is very off putting ! The free tea and coffee was a nice touch in the evenings but never saw the free cookies.We did also tell the manger Kevin about our smelly soiled mattress on arrival and still 3 days later this was never sorted, I then spoke to other staff as well Kevin again and I have to say yet again they did not sort this the entire stay and was not bothered. I also asked why I had not ever received the welcome basket , high room and New York Times on his birthday and the manger just said " ooh I don't know" Very poor service from this hotel and I would not stay here again, despite the fantastic location. Anyone wanting a stress free breakfast and a welcoming helpful hotel DO NOT GO HERE.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have stayed here the last 3 times we have been in New York to see Broadway shows. It is so centrally located It is a great hotel. Very clean and the decor is amazing. The staff is all very attentive and friendly and always concerned that everything is the best. I don't think I would stay anywhere else. Always meets and goes beyond expectations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in NYC for 3 nights to see some shows and eat at great restaurants. The location of this hotel is excellent and the complimentary breakfast is convenient and pretty good!The only downside is that the rooms are small and the wait for the elevator can be annoying.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The problem with this hotel is that there is totally inadequate elevators in this property. There are 3 elevators servicing 29 floors and the staff and cleaning crew use the same elevators. It took 20 minutes to get down stairs this morning. In the event you want to get out of the hotel in a timely manner when the hotel is full you are in bad luck. The staff is aware of the situation and there is nothing they can do to make it better. The cleaning crew due to the weight of the cleaning carts causes the elevators to bypass floors when the cleaning equipment is on the elevators. When an elevator finally came after twenty minutes it stopped at nearly every floor on the way down so it took about 25 minutes for me to get down. People were actually walking down stairs from different floors. There are plenty of other similar options in the Times Square area that are competitively priced without this problem. AVOID THIS HOTEL!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place to stay if you want to experience all of the unique things about NYC. Close and accessible to Times Square, theaters, subway and all. Friendly and helpful staff that takes time to explain and give directions to different locations. Perfect location to everything.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really great location, comfortable room and an excellent included breakfast which really sets you up for the day. Staff friendly and helpful. Special mention for Geraldine who went out of her way to look after us at breakfast every morning and was our unofficial New York tour guide with very useful local tips!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent attention to detail at terrific property in a very good location to get to all parts of Manhattan. The small lounge area with computer access in front of lobby is great as is the coffee and tea avail. Staff is very friendly and so courteous and works hard to keep the place up. Its a very nice place and so CLEAN which is so important to us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have never experienced a staff so accommodating as the staff of this hotel. What a pleasant surprise and it made such a difference in our visit to NYC. We arrived before noon on our check in day and wanted to start our sightseeing asap. The staff texted us before arrival to see if we needed anything and welcome us to the hotel. Working with the staff via text, we were able to check in to our room early and didn't waste a minute of time getting busy with sight seeing! What a great service and increased value for the stay. Clean hotel, great staff and wonderful breakfast. What could possibly be better?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's a basic hotel in a fantastic location. Pros:-Great location, just a block away from Times Square.-15 minute walk from Penn Station -Clean-Beds were comfortable enough (not the best, not the worst)-Breakfast includedStay here only if you can get it for under $200, otherwise it's too expensive.-Our view was pretty coolCons:Crowded lobbyElevators took forever and they were tiny.Extremely narrow hallways. My 7 year old was able to touch both sides of walls at the same time. It felt a little claustrophobic.I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless I got a really good rate.But it's comfortable and clean enough.No frills.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed a brief stay in the NY Theater District and received exceptional support from Hampton Inn / Times Square Central staff, Took care of my car, in and out and got the luggage right up to our room. And when I discovered I left something in my room, it was found and sent on its way home as I am writing this review.Good job Kevin! Laura (Smith) and Beverly (Washington) - your team works very well. Good job!P.S. and a special thanks to Johnnie at the front door.Coffee was good too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a wonderful stay. It is the best location of any hotel we have ever stayed - near Times Square, Penn Station, subway, theater, and only a fun mile walk to Central Park. The rooms were clean, and efficient (small); but ok for a place to sleep and shower. Internet was spotty, and going to breakfast each day was the initial wake up call that we were in New York. It was crazy busy! Need to go to breakfast early, or plan on taking the stairs, and eating in the lobby or back in your room. As busy as it was, the staff, especially the breakfast staff, were always helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thank goodness for the valet! We were more than ready to give him our car. We chose here because of the location. We were attending The Lion King and Wicked. We walked to both and Carlos Bakery. We paid for the upgraded room and were on the 31st floor. Don't waste your money. Walking around the city gave us plenty of views that by the time you were back in your room you're exhausted! The front desk crew were very nice and accommodating. We were able to check in at 1:00 in time to see our play!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in the middle of Times Square and very convenient. The staff is super accommodating and the hotel is very clean. Great value and I would certainly stay at this location again. This is the hotel for you if you go to see Aladdin.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location for Times Square, Hells Kitchen is a good alternative for eating amd drinking and is only a few blocks walk away or one subway stop, subway stop at end of street. Complimentry water and wifi is helpful. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We are Hampton Inn fans. This one located right by Times Square provided great location and lots of standard comfort you expect from Hampton Inn.Although this facility has smaller rooms in comparison to the one's we've previously experienced..and there is notice of some aging/wear and tear with carpeting....It is the marvelous staff here that made our stay very enjoyable. Very professional and courteous; from front desk, room service, and dining staff. Breakfast was crowded... but still convenient and quite good. Much previous reviews noted here focus on "Location"...and rightfully so.We want to also give notice and praise to the terrific service we received from everyone of the staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just stayed for 3 nights here and the hotel is very well kept and staff are VERY friendly! Breakfast is very busy, so going earlier is better - but they do a great job of managing your expectations for that and have staff constantly clearing tables and restocking food. Word to the wise: request a room on a lower floor, solely because the wait for the elevator to come get you from your floor is 5-10 mins each time. We stayed on the 17th floor and the wait was making us late for something we'd booked so we finally just walked down 17 flights of stairs. If you can't get a room on a low floor, just build in extra time to travel where you're going. Again, other than that, great hotel and location and we'd stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a fantastic hotel to stay in. The staff and hotel were outstanding and the complimentary buffet breakfast was excellent. The room was to a high standard and the maid service was also excellent. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overnight trip to the city for dinner and a show, busy spring break week but since this night was a comp only had to pay an extra $25 for early check in. Complimentary cookies and bottled water was great. We were on the second floor so when it was busy the one flight climb was convenient and our room (202) was right by the stair door. Fresh coffee in the lobby all day was great. Free breakfast was your standard Hilton fare but hard boiled eggs were a plus!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We picked this hotel to be close to the theaters. It was a hike to central park (30 minutes), but a pleasant walk to the Rockefeller Center / St Patrick's Cathedral, and Bryant Park / NYC Public Library. The room was clean. Staff was nice, but the check-in took extra long as the guy was having computer issue and two more senior staff were giving him conflicting instructions. Check hotel website for the current cost to park your car.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn in Times Square is a good place to stay in the heart of New York and walking distance to most of the main attractions. Breakfast is geared to the Americans with waffles with everything but we cant complain about that as we were in the heart of the Big Apple

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If this is your first time in NYC and plan to hit the tourist spots, this is a great hotel to stay in due to its location. The subway is just a few steps away, to take you to the different spots like 9/11 memorial, battery park to statue of liberty, central park etc. It's also in the middle so you can go to Central Park, then if you remember that you forgot something at the hotel, just quickly hop on the subway, go back to the hotel, then hop back on the subway to maybe go to St Patrick's Cathedral... It is also just a block away from Times Square so you can easily walk to Times Square, look around, shop a little, watch a play, go back to the hotel to use the bathroom, then go back out (my point is it's so close that it's easy enough to just go back to the hotel). In the event you need to get something from the store, Walgreens is just around the corner too. The only thing we didn't discover is a place to eat at before a show. After a full day to being tourist, we went back to the hotel to rest a bit. Wanted to get a quick bite to eat, but couldn't find a good sit down place - but that also maybe bec we didn't try hard enough.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great property for those seeking out a Broadway show or the convenience of being near Times Square. Beware of valet parking if you have to use this service! Valet parking attendant tampered with our radio and thermostat controls upon our return to our vehicle.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent place to stay, close to subway, restaurants, time Square, Brodaway... very clean, chocolate and cookies to warm our day, every day available in the front desk. Good breakfast and they have "Geraldine"she is amazing, Lovely and always ready to help. For sure I will return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My first impression was the valet outside, Luis. He was the best! He made us feel very welcome. Great guy with great advice! He should be promoted or paid more.After that, I thought that the front desk people were not that friendly and acted like they didn't want to be bothered.The hotel is small; really small. This can be a blessing though. We got a corner room which we requested. The rooms are small. The photos don't represent the size well. It was quiet except for one night. I heard some noise. If the place was crowded, it would have been bad. The bathroom was clean and nice. The bed duvets need replaced. They're old and worn. It takes a long time to get an elevator. There's only three for 30 floors. The breakfast want bad.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is just right not too close but not too far from time square. Subway station is only seconds away. There is tea being served around the clock if you need beverage. Breakfast selection is decent with 2-3 hot food options always.Room may be a bit tight but decent for NY standard. Good amenities and room finished.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The breakfast buffet was brilliant and so was Geraldine ! The hot drinks available in the reception were an added bonus, as well as the cookies when we returned after a hectic day exploring this wonderful City. All staff were accommodating and nothing was too much trouble, would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Looked for good sushi and found it! WOW. Lots of great restaurants around on 7th and 8th Ave and this sushi is only 5 minutes away from the Hampton Inn on 41st st.Nothing else left to say - it is GOOD

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a moderately-priced hotel per New York City rates. It is close to theatres and restaurants. Since it's a bit off Times Square, it was quiet at night. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. The small, but stylish lobby can get crowded, so elevators get packed quickly. The included breakfast offered a fairly decent amount of average choices, and the wait staff replenished items quickly - except within 30 minutes of closing time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights .The hotel crew done everything so we feel comfortable . Breakfast was great . The room are great , clean and well equipped . The location is fantastic just walk distance from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is definitely one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The people made the difference! From Geraldine and Teddy in breakfast to Luis who scheduled our car, every employee we encountered was friendly and ready to help! Every employee spoke to us in the hallway, in the elevator, and even on the sidewalk. Maria and Tobo at the desk were helpful and gave us some advice for navigating the city! The room was clean and fresh! We very much looked forward to the friendly hotel staff after being in the city all day!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I really enjoyed my first visit. The hotel is located very conveniently to theaters, restaurants, and other points of interest. The staff was extremely helpful with all questions. The breakfast was available at 6 and there were many options. Coffee and tea were also in the lobby. I was pleased with my room( nice beds and bathrooms). Getting the elevator took time so be sure to plan your time if ina rush. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again if needed

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a great room. Great staff. Would definitely stay here again. Located in a great spot, not too close, not too far. Not noisy at all. Clean room. Good view. Super soft bed. Clean room. Breakfast was busy, but good. Lots of room to sit down

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Three generations came to NY for the first time (ages 15-70) and had an excellent time. The hotel staff was great, the location was fabulous, and the accommodations were cozy, but nice. We stayed on 2nd floor tucked away next to the stairwell. It was quiet and very convenient bypassing the elevator. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I stayed for Spring Break. This was her first trip to NYC and she loved it! This hotel was close to diners, theaters, bus stops, and the subway. The room could have had better insulation. I could hear too much from our neighbor's room...alarm clocks, sneezes, shower running, etc. It may have been because it had a connecting door, but still, way too much noise. We were on the second floor and that was nice since the elevators are a bit slow. We enjoyed the observation deck on the 32nd floor, but waited for the elevator a long time to get back to the lobby. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning and Teddy was the first truly pleasant person we met in NYC. She was very helpful and nice. I appreciated the tray so we could take breakfast back to the room since there was nowhere to sit and eat. The room was clean and we loved the refreshments in the lobby. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for spring break (first week in April) for four nights with our family of four. Room smallish, as expected in NYC, but manageable. Had city-view room on 28th floor, looking to the south and able to see a smidge of the Empire State Building. Pros: on-site breakfast (included in room rate); location - walkable to Times Square, Fifth Ave, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Center, Broadway shows, etc; helpful staff; clean room; very close to subway station for further adventures. Con: elevator service can seem slow in "peak" times, esp AM. Definitely would stay here when we visit again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This staff is impeccable in service to please the customers is outstanding. The stay need to be commended.Rooms are very comfortable with a great Times Square view of the Empire State Building (+(9)Which was great. Breakfast was good but there can be some improvement. Excellent staff and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed at the Hampton Inn over spring break. It was my husband, myself, and daughters (12 and 9). I was expecting the room to be very cramped, but I felt the space was just fine for us and our luggage. The decor was modern and nice, and the entire hotel felt clean and well-kept. One weird thing was the bathroom door was closed with a barn-door style closure. So at times the privacy was awkward as you could hear everything in the bathroom. Also at night it did get loud (as I'm sure any hotel in the city would), but we just ran the fan and it was fine.The location was amazing, as we were in the hard of times square. We walked or took the subway everywhere as there were 2 subway stations within a block or 2. I felt this was a perfect location to do activities both uptown and downtown. The breakfast was great - made our stay so much easier, as food in NYC can get expensive. We started out each day with waffles, oatmeal, toast, eggs - they really had a great selection of food. The seating area did get crowded, but if we were patient a table would tend to open within a few minutes. The front desk folks were really nice and even offered us a room on a higher floor. Other posters complained about the elevators. I doubt we ever waited more than 5 minutes and we were on the 14th floor. If I was in NYC again, I would definitely go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I normally prefer the Hilton Times Square when in the area, but this property can be a viable alternative.At times their pricing is so similar to the Hilton (which is across the street) that you may as well just stay there. However if the Hampton Inn is cheaper this hotel works just fine. The rooms are decently furnished. A bit smaller than what I prefer but doable. I found the front desk staff to be very accommodating. Like most hotels check in time is 3pm but they will permit earlier check in if the rooms is available. Travelers Note: when leaving a hotel always stop by the front desk to let hem know you have checked out. By doing so you help the hotel to be able to provide check in prior to 3pm.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a more compact than usual but clean and new-looking hotel in the Hampton Inn chain. The Times Square/Theater District location is perfect for Broadway shows and other sightseeing, In fact, the hotel is directly next to the Nederlander Theater where I saw a show during this stay.The room, hallways and lobby are small compared to other Hamptons due to the NYC location, but each area has a fresh, even upscale look. My 24th floor room had an appealing sliding glass door shower and gleaming chrome fixtures. Lighting was good in the bathroom and sleeping areas.The front desk and housekeeping staff are quite friendly and accommodating, remarkable vs. New York City's reputation! Kudos especially to Maria at the front desk.My only complaints were a very crowded buffet area making it difficult to access food items and find a place to sit down and eat. I rushed through my breakfast and finished part of it in my room. Also for what appeared to be a new or at least new-looking hotel, the towels and washcloths were too thin.For the price and location compared to other hotels I researched, I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at this Hotel was excellent, we had great customer service, clean quiet room, bed was very comfortable and excellent location. Breakfast was hot and well stocked, coffee in the lobby was always hot and fresh.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The complimentary breakfast exceeded our expectations. We loved the self serve coffee and tea station along with complimentary freshly baked cookies everyday. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Could not fault this hotel at the price they charge. Highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 4 day weekend with the girls in New York. Could not have picked a better hotel. Clean, comfortable, close in to Time Square without the noise and crowds!!! Could not have been better!! Would recommend to everyone!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a lovely experience it is to stay here! The lady who runs the breakfast is The Best! I wish that I had gotten her name. She keeps all items in stock all the time - no easy task when it's busy! She even took the time to offer me a much needed tray. The hotel is clean and quiet. The rooms are very comfortable. Wifi is great. The elevators, that can be very busy at peak times, have indicators showing direction and floor - very helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I cannot stress how great of an experience we had. The staff was PHENOMENAL. The rooms clean and comfy. NiNi, Hisham (sorry if spelled incorrectly) and the rest. We requested side by side rooms, but they could not do...which was totally fine...they sent up a handwritten apology...NO NEED for it, but that was a pleasant surprise but they did not have to do that. I noticed during the week MANY customers that were rude to the staff...EACH staff member handled themselves gracefully and respectfully. They were as professional as any person I have ever seen. I was totally amazed. I cannot stress this enough. They always offered water, had free coffee and tea (and cookies). For the price I paid (which was very considerably lower than MANY OTHER PLACES) for staying in New York, this was by far a very PLEASANT experience. We needed a wheelchair due to all the walking and we asked for places to rent one...within 5 minutes, one was at our room...free of charge. The breakfast staff was amazing, (ask for Geraldine). She and Mia remembered us after the first day...they made us feel like we were at home...We even gave Geraldine our phone number should she ever get to Indianapolis.
