The travel concierge, Ramone, was fabulous...had a great ride from and to the airport from him....This place is fabulous in ALL respects....I kept saying all week long, when we come back to New York, THAT IS THE PLACE WE WILL STAY....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We've stayed there three times. Hotel is clean, quiet and convenient. Breakfast is good to get you going nothing fancy or gourmet. Price for the winter months is great. Never go to New York in the summer or peak times of the year as it is too expensive.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: + : the location.- : The worst bathroom's facilities and we tried to solve it but they told us that all the rooms are alike. The bathrooms in this hotel have NO fans. We have been told that it's central and it's opened automatically but the truth is not and while I was walking across the floors, I could smell the bathrooms' smell! I have never came across any hotel with a problem like that ! Also, the toilet is not flushing properly. Last thing, the crowd in the breakfast was really annoying.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed 6 nights at this property. Staff extremely helpful & attentive, rooms very clean, bfast was fresh & hearty every morning. We stayed on the 26th floor & had a great view of the city. We easily walked to Broadway shows & caught the Subway everywhere! If you are on the go & want a clean, convenient, nice, place to stay --WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY. :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed for four nights and took in the city. The hotel was clean and modern. We loved the location being only 2-3 blocks from Times Square. Breakfast offered a variety of items and they rotated the hot food which was welcomed on a multi-day stay. We were impressed with the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff and recommend staying here! The only downside is that the double bed rooms featured full-size rather than queens and the rooms were on the smallish side but this expected in NYC, so this wasn't a big deal for us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location close to Times Square - we easily walked to most locations! The complimentary breakfast was EXCELLENT, and the hotel staff were kind and really went out of their way to help our family. The room was beautiful and we had a great view - stayed on the 17th floor. We will definitely be back !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, reasonably priced, large accommodating rooms, free breakfast what more could you ask for? Metro stop mere steps away. WolfGang Puck restaurant. Practically next door to the bus station!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay earlier this month. We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and I were so impressed with our whole stay. From the moment we arrived until 3.30am the morning we were picked up to fly home we had wonderful service from all your lovely staff. Each and everyone of them were super friendly, knowledgable and went far and beyond to make everyone's stay as perfect as possible. Even the chap on the ticket desk would shout a greeting while we awaited the lift to arrive. Such friendliness!A huge shout out must go to the lovely ladies at breakfast. These ladies are a credit to the hotel. Geraldine, Teddy and Giselle were perfect hostess at breakfast time and went above and beyond each and every day. Thank you ladies you are amazing. A huge thank you to Geraldine for her kindness and for making our stay such a treat. Also for her thoughtfulness when on the last day my husband wasn't feeling too well. Thank you Geraldine. The breakfast choice again is top notch. Great choice and plenty of food too. Hot drinks throughout the day and night are a bonus too.The rooms are super clean and efficiently cleaned without fuss too. Location is good too with Times Square 5 minutes walk away.All in all a super stay. Would highly recommend. We will be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: They greet you at the front door or front desk, depending on what time of night or day it is, with a smile!! The front desk staff is so nice and so helpful. This property is sparkly clean and has beautiful decor. I love the rooms and the beds are very comfortable. My second stay in two years and they did not disappoint. This is a great place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great stay at this beautiful Hampton. Room was considered spacious by NYC standards- nicely decorated. Bed very comfortable. Breakfast was good- lots of choices- fruit, eggs, yogurt, waffles- Location was fantastic- located just a few blocks from Times Square. Half a block from Port Authority.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I spent three nights there last weekend. We paid extra to get the view- room on the southside, floor 27 (2709), and we couldn't stop looking out the window. Worth it! We drove down from Hartford in an Alamo rental. The valet told us just to park in front of the motel while we checked in and took our bags up to the room. Then we straightaway returned the car – Alamo has an Office just two blocks away so we were able to walk back. Room was clean and plenty big for two people (if you like the person you're with :-). FitnessCenter is nicely equipped with several high-quality treadmills. Very convenient to Subway stations. The day we departed we were planning to get an Uber ride to LGA. Someone in the lobby, I believe he had the permission of Hampton, stopped us and said he had a car waiting that would take us to the airport for $55, so we did that. I believe Uber would have been a little cheaper, perhaps $45, and I'm sure the car would've been cleaner….

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is by far one of, if not THE best value for the Times Square district. Phenomenal rate for two days and the property was very well kept. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 23rd floor which was great for a view. Comfortable beds, great shower, and the complimentary breakfast was not only appreciated but delicious! I would definitely return here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 22nd floor offered a fun view. Breakfast each morning varied meat and egg selections, were fresh. Fresh fruit a nice option.Less than two blocks away from TKTS booth in Times Square. Room was quiet, street noise minimal.Comfortable bed, sheets and pillows.Only addition recommended is bathroom ventilation.Check in and check out was speedy, valet staff helpful with vehicle and pointing us in the right direction when asked.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a terrific stay. Great location, quiet, walking distance to all theaters and Times Square. Safe neighborhood. Great full breakfast. Restaurants and fast food close in the neighborhood. Staff was wonderful and helpful. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very friendly and clean hotel. Rooms are nice, not overly big but they were comfortable. For a hotel in the city I thought the rates were reasonable. Complimentary breakfast was as good as in many restaurants. Would definitely stay here again for a great value and overall experience, you will not be disappointed!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel. It's truly is 4 doors from 7th avenue and times square. The front desk is super helpful, especially Raymar Riley. Ray has gone above and beyond with me and my group. For New York the rooms are big. The hotel includes a free breakfast which is a rarity in the city. This is an excellent place to stay in the city. And I'll be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay this week was wonderful. This is a nice hotel, with great staff. Everyone was genuinely nice, and interested in how they could make our stay better. From housekeeping, to front desk, to the hospitality staff in the great breakfast, there were smiles and heartfelt greetings all around. Location is wonderful proximity to times square, port authority, and subway. Great restaurants are just a few blocks away. We happened to have tickets to a show at a theatre with the back door right across from this hotel. It could not have been a more perfect experience. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family stayed here for four nights and were very pleased! The hotel is newer and very clean. The desk, cleaning, and breakfast staff were all very professional and courteous. I remember how the lady working at breakfast was singing and was very cheerful! She made us feel so much at home. I also appreciated the complimentary bottled water. It came in very handy because I expected to have to find a place to purchase some. Great location too!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice people, very helpful, great location will definitely stay here next year. Great complimentary breakfast. Located a block from everything. In fact one of theatres , Nederlander, is right next door. They stored our bags after checkout until our flight & had an early checkin. Our trip was incredible because of this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was a new option for me in the Times Square/Theater district, which I picked in part because it was an easy walk to Penn Station, the theaters, Rockefeller Center, and subway was half a block away. Hard to beat that location. My room on the 19th floor was a wonderful surprise. It appeared to be brand new, immaculately clean, great linens, modern design, fast WiFi, and an unbelievable value given the rate. I arrived before the check-in time, and they happily stored my luggage without issue. I could not be happier with my choice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here with my young adult son. I used points for 2 nights and paid the extra 2 nights. Great price for a central location - much cheaper than other nearby hotels. Room had 2 dbl beds-perfect. I was able to choose my room prior to arrival due to Hilton status which was nice. Room was clean and served its purpose. Water pressure in shower was good and the flowed freely (not like some showers where I am standing in ankle-deep water!).Although there are 30+ floors in the hotel, it is small. Once you get off the elevator, there are probably only 10 rooms on each floor. Some rooms are DIRECTLY in front of elevator so make sure you request room at end of hall. During peak times, it may take you a few times to get an elevator that isn't packed. WiFi was ok but not great for streaming if that's what you are planning to do.Central location in Times Square but not on the noisy streets which was a PLUS. Complimentary breakfast offered from 6-10am was hearty and full of people (too bad we didn't find out about this until day 3-clerk didn't tell us at check-in).Subway station 1 block away but we walked to most places, including Central Park, NY Public Library, Theater district. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location for walking in either direction to Theater District and Garment District. The hotel was great getting us theater tickets and dinner reservations. See the hotel concierge.We will stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived to the hotel and were warmly greeted. The staff made sure our every need was met and anticipated our needs before hand. Teddy went out of her way to make sure the girls had enough to eat and drink and checked in with us daily. The hotel was ideally situated and within walking distance to all of our needs. The rooms were clean, warm, and inviting. Thank you for all of your hard word and efforts, it was sincerely apprecitated!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: we had a great stay at this hotel. took my family to NYC for spring break. was great to stay at this hotel. right next to times square and broadway. next to the 42st subway. perfect base of operations for us to explore. nice breakfast: omelette, sausage or bacon, oatmeal, 3 or 4 waffle stations, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, hard boiled eggs, muffins/pastries.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Have stayed in a few hotels in NYC over the past year on business, and this is definitely one of the better midtown options. Room was surprisingly spacious for such a central location, bed as always with Hilton properties very comfortable and the gym was well equipped. Breakfast unfortunately underwhelming - buffet full of processed food, best to stick to the fruit and yoghurt. Nevertheless, on balance I would happily stay here again and just pop out for something to eat every morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: we were only in NY for a few days and after getting dropped off at the wrong hotel ( not the hotels fault ) we got to reception and everything was perfect from then on . the staff were great . everybody from reception to the kitchen staff and the cleaners . The breakfast in the morning was the perfect way to start the day ( even though it was freezing outside ) and catered for everybody . perfectly located just a couple of minutes walk from times square and near enough to everything else or a short hop on the subway . would i stay here again or recommend this hotel ...... without a shadow of doubt . it's great . thanks to everybody who works in the hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Was in town for a girls weekend. The hotel is right in the middle of Times Square everything! Location couldn't be better. I am a diamond member and take my status seriously. I was greeted as a diamond member, thanked for my loyalty, given my goody bag and waters, was able to check-in early and all done with a smile! The front desk was very accommodating. Our two-bed room was spacious enough for the four of us (we are in Manhattan people). The cleaning crew was very aware of our needs; waited until we left each day to clean the room - and did a great job! The breakfast has all the normal Hampton Inn food-stuff. It is very busy in the morning; the breakfast staff do a fantastic job (and all with a smile). They keep people moving so that others can sit down (which has to be done because of the amount of people eating breakfast). The bell-man was more than happy to store our luggage after we checked out so that we could enjoy the rest of our day in NYC! Definitely would recommend this one! We will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a very good experience with the hotel. The staff was attentive and friendly, especially Geraldine in the kitchen area. The room was clean and the location was very close to Times Square which made it easy to access all major attractions. The breakfast had good variety and was different every day. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Awesome, central location for seeing NYC. The hotel is very clean and the staff could not have been more helpful. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel each morning. We will absolutely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a senior trip for my granddaughter graduating from high school. Everything about our stay here was first rate including the location. Staff was very friendly and helpful and answered all of our questions. The room was quiet and clean. The breakfast was very good wwith a nice variety to choose from.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a great stay! Stayed 2 nights and loved this hotel! Great location so close to all the action of Times Square! Cold weather but warm smiles from this incredible staff. Front desk agents would greet me using my name when returning to hotel throughout stay. How impressive is that? Tobo was so accommodating and so was John the Concierge! Bought tickets from John for 9/11 museum. Had nice welcome card and treats in room when we checked in which was so nice to do. Wow! The staff so friendly and smiling all the time! Great stay and highly recommend to everyone! Thank you for memorable stay in New York!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Best choice hotel with the friendliest staff! Just stayed two nights with friends. Hotel was clean, and perfectly located in Times Square. We were welcomed by Rachel at the front desk and enjoyed the company and help of Raymond and Tobo as well. Great time, great stay, rooms, hotel, location, breakfast, everything!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on March Break, for a broadway trip with my daughter and friends. The hotel is in a great location. It is very centrally located. We were easily able to walk to everything we wanted to see. It is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the middle of times square. The price of the rooms is amazing for a hotel so conveniently located. The free breakfast is a huge plus. It is a standard Hampton Inn Breakfast (waffles, eggs, bacon, juice, yogurt, pastries) but there is lots of food. You need to go before about 8:30 if you don't want to stand in line, and if you want a table. If you don't want to sit down for breakfast, they have a grab and go bad, with a bottle of water , a muffin and a granola bar. They have all day tea, coffee and hot chocolate, and at 5 they bring out hot cookies. They are great! The rooms are clean and well appointed. There is no fridge unfortunately. The rooms are a good size for a NYC hotel. I would not pay extra for cityview. My room was up on one of the highest floors, and I actually had a worse view than my friends, who were well below me. Plus, there are only 3 elevators, and you have to wait for them at times, so a lower floor, where the stairs would be an option would be good. Overall, I thought this was a great hotel, at a great price. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We need 2 rooms but couldn't get them near each other; many floors apart (something like floor 4 and 16). I called the front desk and she told me she would try to arrange it. Sure enough, not only are we on the same floor but next to each other. Looking forward to a great family weekend. THANKS!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just stayed five nights at the Hampton Inn/Times Square. This is a brand new hotel. It's clean, bright. Close to Broadway, theaters and subways. Rooms are smaller than normal, but this is New York and all hotel rooms are small. I wish they had refrigerators in the rooms, but that would take up more space. The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable. The showers are hot. Everything you need/want in a hotel room.Hampton Inns are knows for their breakfasts and this is no different. The hotel has a large seating area. It can get very busy toward the end of breakfast. But the crew does a great job of keeping the tables clean the food stocked: scrambled eggs, waffles, bacon and sausage, toast, bagels, cereal, oat meal, yogurt, fresh fruit and lots of coffee. By the way, coffee, tea and hot chocolate are available all day in the hotel lobby.The highlight of the day was interacting with the breakfast crew. Despite the large crowd, the two ladies always had a smile of the their face and often stopped to chat briefly with visitors. Who said New Yorkers weren't friendly folks?!? :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed our 3 night stay! The hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly, and in a great location (next to Subway station and within easy walking distance of Times Square/Broadway). The breakfast was nice to start the day. The breakfast staff was especially helpful and friendly (Teddy). They kept the food stations full and the tables clean. Highly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is awesome! The location is perfect for everything we wanted to do. The breakfast area is great and any hotel in NYC that has free breakfast is worth it. The staff was friendly and so helpful. When we checked in we were greeted and helped by Tobo. He was so fun and so nice to us. Loved getting to talk to him. We needed assistance with several things (room lock and needed a mini fridge), and they sent up an engineer named Raul. He should be the employee of the year!! He went above and beyond to give us the best customer service we have ever had at a hotel in NYC. This will be the place we stay for all our future visits! Thanks Hampton and Thanks Raul! You rock!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff was very friendly and welcoming. The concierge was very helpful for getting tickets to Book of Mormon and restaurant recommendations. All the front desk personnel were very helpful in giving us directions using the subways. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable and it was a nice view from the 31st floor. The breakfast was good, well stocked and kept very clean even with the large number of people using the area. The elevator wait times were not as bad as in other reviews even though the Hotel was fully booked. Thanks for a nice stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: AWESOME location. Close to train stations, to Times Square /Broadway. Stayed here for one night. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff at the front desk, (Rachelle) was THE BEST. She was not only welcoming and friendly, but a WEALTH of knowledge, that was even before check-in. The room was impeccably clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Tucked away one block south of Times Square this Hampton Inn does a very nice job. Friendly staff, beautiful lobby and generous complimentary breakfast make for a great stay if you are visiting the Big Apple. The subway is half a block away and makes for easy access to the rest of Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were here only one night moving from a conference hotel after the conference - in many ways this is a typical Hampton but that is a good thing - room was small, but this is NY and that is the way it is. The room was nicely equipped - this hotel has 20 plus floors and fortunately there were threeelevators so waiting was not a problem - we arrived before check in time but they had a room ready and let us check in early which is better than having to check one's luggage. Located in the heart of the theater district. Wi-fi was very good. Staff went out of their way to be helpful

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights, great location, clean rooms with comfortable beds, 24 hour coffee and tea bar in the lobby with cookies served in the evening. Free water bottles offered at the front counter, hot breakfast bar included, clean fitness center and most importantly extremely friendly staff everywhere! Good price for the location and quality.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Awesome location. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, and Madison Square Garden (we are typical tourists!) Hotel was still relatively new when we stayed in Nov 2015 and we would definitely stay here again! Price was reasonable especially with the daily breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had stayed in Hamptons before and liked them. The breakfast area in this Hampton seemed always overcrowded with rarely any seats available. Many people seemed to only be able to grab breakfast and take it away with them.Toilet overflowed in our room at 3AM. Close to bus terminal and subway.Has on site laundry.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean room, excellent location steps from Times Square, friendly, helpful staff. Loved the complimtary coffee/tea station in the lobby. Complimentary breakfast was very good and plentiful. Rooms were clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I usually stay at a Hampton Inn near Penn Station when I'm in New York but this trip included mostly business contacts in Midtown so I picked this location. It was very nice, room was clean, the staff friendly and courteous--and a terrific location at a reasonable price. I can strongly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived on Friday around noon, short wait and our room was ready. Four adults, carry on size luggage. Room was good size. Staff was great, breakfast was great , nice variety. No issues with noise we were on the 11th floor. Clean and safe.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Lovely staff clean rooms modern hotel central to everything highly recommended x complimentary drinks and cookies on offer in reception also the hotel has its own taxi service to jfk for a fixed rate of 70 dollars which we used and was very efficient

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall we had a great one night stay at the Hampton Inn - Times Square Central. The location is great if you want to be near times square or the bus terminal. It was nice to be close to the action, but in the middle of a side street (41st) where it was considerably more quiet than on 7th or 8th Ave.The staff was welcoming and friendly and the check in process was easy and efficient. We were appropriately recognized as Hilton Honors members and were provided with complimentary water bottles and snacks. The lobby also had free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. We had a king room on the 26th floor. The room was on the small side but very typical for a NYC hotel. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The only slight negatives were that the bath towels were worn and on the thin side and there was no refrigerator in the room. Having breakfast included is also a nice perk. It was a typical Hampton Inn breakfast with the staff working really hard to keep up with the demand. Getting down to breakfast took a while because the elevators were crowded and stopped on almost every floor. I would definitely stay here again if I needed to be in that location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton delivers on Hampton quality - clean rooms, pleasant decor, free Wi-Fi and free breakfast in a GREAT location. We had a room with two double beds - it was a bit smaller than you would get in a Hampton in a suburban area, but it was typical for a mid-town Manhattan room and was plenty for the two of us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a great experience. Great location in Times Square. Clean and comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfast buffet. Pleasant staff. The hotel was very busy a couple days during our stay but the coffee and food was always replenished quickly at the buffet. All the guests we encountered seemed to be having a good experience too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, well appointed rooms. Check-in was fast and efficient. Room was immaculately clean. Bed was comfortable, TV had plenty of channels. Room was small, with minimal space around bed. Bathroom was clean and had a stall shower. Even though I was on the top floor, the typical NY street sounds could still be heard.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is situated in a fantastic location just off of Times Square. On arrival the staff were very welcoming, friendly and gave us some complimentary snacks & drinks. Our room was spotlessly clean and quite spacious compared to other hotels we've stayed at in New York with a King size bed (which was very comfortable), towels were changed, room tidied/bed made and complimentary stuff topped up daily. The air conditioning controller allowed us to have the room at the perfect temperature regardless of the outside conditions, the only slight downside was the window didn't seem to stop traffic noise (even though we were on the 16th floor).I see that several people seem to moan about the time they had to wait for the elevators at this hotel, we waited no more than a couple of minutes the whole week.All guests receive complimentary buffet breakfast with was pretty comprehensive, there was plenty of choice and cooked (hot) food was varied daily, including eggs (boiled/scrambles/omelette), bacon, burgers, sausages. There was also a bread, bagels, muffins, cakes, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, fruit salad, yoghurts and several drinks hot and cold. There was also a complementary hot drinks station in reception 24/7. The staff were all very friendly, attentive and happy to help all week.We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is great. overall it is modern, very clean, comfortable and great location as well to the bus terminal, subway and shopping on times square. Staff is very helpful as well. Complimentary breakfast and 24/7 hot drinks station is what make this hotel even greater than others. i have now stayed in this hotel 3 or 4 times now. keep up the good work !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Convenient location - 15 mins walk away from Penn Station, few minutes from Port Authority bus station and a block or so away from Metro/subway. Convenient for Shopping and dining options also.Rooms: Compact, but comfortable for single traveler. Just enough space for one person to move around. It was not impeccably clean, but still very good. Amenities: Breakfast buffet of course is a hit with their waffle irons. Rest of the options were standard and no complaints on quality. Gets very crowded by 8:30. Elevators get very busy during morning rush hour. They had coffee/tea/water station near reception available 24/7, an internet kiosk to do research and print boarding passes, taxi hail help at the curb, a sit & work long table with high chairs at the lobby... In room - good sized TV (but DirectTV interface was lethargic and dated), coffee maker (Hamilton), a work table/chair, a single seat sofa and a wardrobe with iron board, basic bathing amenities. Bed was good, but the spreads showed signs of aging. Carpet too showed signs of aging. Though my room was at 3rd floor facing 41st street, you could hear sirens and honking, but no so loud that it wakes you up in the middle of the night. In contrast no sound proofing with corridors or neighboring rooms. Loud conversations and slamming doors can be startlingly loud.Staff: Extremely friendly. Helped with early check-in. Helped with luggage storage, breakfast staff were always smiling. Full marks to them.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My sister and I stayed here in February 2017. It was just a short walk to the theater. The hotel is very clean and very quiet-much quieter than I had expected. It was nice to get a hot breakfast-the breakfast staff were all very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I spent 2 nights here during a Broadway getaway. This hotel was perfect. I checked in early, quickly, and was in my room minutes later. It has 3 elevators so I never had to wait long. The room and bed were comfortable. The complementary breakfast was fine and changed from one day to the other. It's a great location for the theatres, Times Square, and restaurants. We had nice weather and didn't mind walking. Went into Central Park north and walked to Penn Station. Every staff member we met was as pleasant as could be. This would be my first choice when I get back to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel has a great location near subway lines and bus lines between 7th and 8th Avenues.1/2 block from the West Side Bus Terminal. The lady in the cafeteria is great. She deserves a medal for putting up with all the people and always being so nice and taking care of us. The front desk staff always courteous, professional and helpful. Although she did made us wait 30 minutes because we arrived at 2:30 and check in is at 3:00pm. Room and common areas always clean and well kept. I would stay here again and do recommend it. Great job and thank you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is on 41th street, a calm close to Times Square. The room was very clean, modern and quite big for Manhattan. The room was very quiet, although close to the elevator. The breakfast is the usual free one you get in all Hampton Inns, and you can get eggs, bacon, waffles, etc. If you have a car, unfortunately, you have to pay more than $60/day, which is not unusual for this part of the city, but you can try a public parking a a few dollars less. I will come again to this hotel every time I'm in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I loved staying here. It is very conveniently located close to subway. The staff was great and I definitely would stay again! The rooms were nice and my room had a great view. The complimentary internet was a little slow but other that everything was amazing!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Manhatten/Times Square Hampton Inn very much. Staff was awesome and our room was available to us much earlier than check-in and valet parking was great also. We stayed on the 29th floor overlooking Times Square enjoyed the city lights.The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. Breakfast was great and the breakfast staff were all very friendly and kept things nice and clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Well trained staff, very responsive and pleasant to deal with. The free breakfast goes far beyond a continental breakfast. Early check-in was a huge help for us. Couldn't be closer to the Times Square action. Request a higher floor if you are a light sleeper, it's NYC after all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was great! The rooms were very clean. The staff was super friendly. Free breakfast! It started pouring rain and the staff lended us umbrellas for the night. Check in and check out was super quick and easy. The location was great. About a 10 minute walk from Penn Station and close to the subway. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have been here multiple times. The location is fantastic and the survive is top notch. Last week during our visit we spent two hours in line waiting for Do gourmet cookie dough. We forgot it in the hotel freezer and they kept it for us to return and pick it up! Great staff who go beyond expectations to help guests!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and wonderful room. My wife and I were impressed with the size of the room having stayed in other NYC hotels in the past. Front desk was extremely helpful. Will certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Went on a short leisure trip and was extremely satisfied. Staff was great including the very helpful concierge. Great location and closeness to Times Square for the price. We would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location could not be beat - right across from subway station. The staff was so friendly and accommodating, especially the breakfast staff. I would stay here again when I travel to NYC, without question.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed with my teenage daughter and her friend for an overnight stay. Views were nice, rooms were clean. We really enjoyed the free breakfast the next morning. They do offer parking for a fee if you want to drive in. Very central to everything Times Square!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: we stayed here as a group of friends and couldn't have opted for a better hotel at the price the staff where excellent ,rooms where large and the bed was comfortable, breakfast was a welcome bonus which more than set us up for exploring our surroundings, the staff gave us as much information as we asked for and where really helpful, overall a superb place to stay for the price and excellent location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was perfect for the needs of me and my family. Close to times square was great, and there were always cabs available to take us farther away if needed. For a room so close to the hub of NYC, I had no problems with excess noise leaking into the room, and the hotel itself was pretty quiet as well. Geraldine at breakfast was amazing and super nice. She definitely made the stay that much better. I would definitely be coming back to this hotel any time I need to visit NYC. One thing I do wish the room had was a mini-fridge. I like a cold drink in the morning before breakfast and the ice bucket didn't stay cold for very long.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Comfortable beds, squeaky clean, excellent staff, great location, great breakfast, quiet and restful in the middle of Times Square! Couldn't have been happier! We were visiting New York for a stressful occasion, a check-up at Memorial Sloan Kettering. The hotel was a wonderful respite in a stressful time. By the way, we received really good news!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: i enjoyed the stay and quality, staff was very helpfull and guided us in right directions for any thing i needed to do on my trip,made it less stressfull , knowing that i could always ask the staff for help on anything i need , it was also safe and quiet ,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros: really convenient location with a subway station right in front, nice city view room with a very comfortable bed, good shower (even though water pressure could be improved), good breakfast (considering that it's included and the hotel is not a 5*) and very kind and friendly service from the concierge (John) and the ladies in the restaurant (especially Teddy). Also the free cookies, water, hot tea, coffee, hot chocolate in the lobby is a great idea (as there is no water provided in the room). Wifi is fast enough, you just need to log in every 24 hours.Cons: on weekends breakfast is like a zoo with long queues in front of the waffle machines + some extra waiting time to find a table. Unpleasant service from all the receptionists (except the nice chubby guy who checked us out) - they should learn how to smile to their guests and greet them at least. Also, guest services have no idea about telephone standards, they need training. They are not efficient either: we asked an extra towel the first day and it was never delivered. Housekeeping did not make up our room the day before our departure - we had to call to request new towels. Bed sheets had several stains and the HK staff have not attention to details at all (they don't remove hair on the shower grill and the day we checked in we found an hair in the toilet too)If you improve the logistic during breakfast and give some proper training to front desk, guest services and HK this could be an amazing mid to low budget choice to visit NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Taxi from airport to this hotel approx $68 (incl toll but no tips) with yellow cab. (Based on 4pm Sunday) 2mins walk to Times Square. Opposite is Mc Donald. Very cozy lobby. Fast check in/out. Free water, coffee/tea/hot chocolate 24/7. Some takeaway snacks on the reception for those hve no time for breakfast. Free Breakfast 6-10am, good enough for Morning. (Cereal, pancake, bread) alternating choice of egg, bacon, sausage each day. Room size is reasonable. Nice adjustable temperature in the room. Only coffee machine available in the room. Unfortunately no fridge. Water pressure a bit low but great temperature. The curtain a little short (miniskirt) so some light comes in during the day. The wall is so thin that you can constantly hear ppl slamming the door, shower, talking next door. Other than this 2 negative, overall was wonderful. On the way back we took a 'Black cab' cost us $65nett from the reception. Definitely will return. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Was visiting NYC with Family. This hotel is located right in the center of Times Square and all the Broadway theaters. The free breakfast was great. Teddy at breakfast always had a smile and was so happy. Great way to start your day with good vibes. Can get busy during 9am-10am. The rooms are small but it is NYC!. The lobby always had tea, coffee and hot chocolate available- nice for January when you have been walking the city in the cold weather. Front desk staff very friendly. The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant- BUT you walk out the door in the Epicenter of NYC and all the restaurants and bars the city has to offer. Yes a time the elevator was a little slow but nothing to stress about.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, family friendly hotel located in a superb spot - in the heart of the happenings! It's within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and the Lyric Theatre is literally directly across the street so you can even conveniently take in a Broadway Show.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This a a wonderful, clean and spacious for mid town room. The staff is fantastic especially for Hilton Honors guests. The elevators get a bit overwhelmed at rush times. The breakfast was hot, great and plentiful even for a crowd that stretched the capacity of the lobby. Our room was toward Times Square and as such got a big burst of light and noise trough the night. The window was able to block the noise and shades took care of the light but the AC was unable to provide a comfortable sleeping temperature without the window being open and the shade drawn to provide ventilation. Summer HVAC may be better as they are in AC mode but in winter, the room was too warm. Everything else about this Inn exceeds the Hampton Inn expectations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you are planing on visiting New York and stay at the best place and great food .... with all happening time square just a block away.... be here. And do not worry abour packing all essentials they got it all covered. Get a view for time square☺

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very reasonably priced and an EXCELLENT location. The free hot breakfast is very good. The hotel was very accommodating when we decided on the spur of the moment to stay an extra night. They had availability and simply extended our stay in the room we already had.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very convenient ...close to times square...staff very friendly and courteous...rooms modern and clean...had a view of the Empire State Building... breakfast buffet was a little hectic but all right for the price...only drawback was waiting for the elevators since we were on a higher floor... other than that had a wonderful experience

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great location of the hotel, very nice stay and clean indoor. Breakfast included and great availability of a coffee free of charge during the day. Staff helpful and readily available any time. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good value, close to the times square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was the nicest , cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at. I would fly to NYC just to stay here again. I only stay at Disney hotels while staying at Disney because they are always much cleaner than the hotels outside Disney, But I have to tell you , this Hampton was far nicer than any Disney hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here mainly for convenience of the location when attending an exhibition.The rate was reasonable considering it was a short distance to Times Square.The room clean with all expected amenities. There was a basic breakfast included that was enough to start the day. The staff were very attentive and helpful.A basic hotel, but well organised, no complaints.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed 2 nights. room was clean and it was just a couple blocks from all the Time Square stuff. I saw,a show called Sunset Blvd which as real good, with Glenn Close.hotel has a real good breakfast. Not just the waffle maker thing, it also had two hot items, egg and meat.my only small complaint was the remote controller for TV. I was in two different rooms and the remote was just slow to change channels. clean hotel. staff was friendly enough.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: this is surelythe best place to stay when in times square. It is so convenient with places to eat just a 3 min walk away. The main part of times square is a 4 min walk. Kris, Nina and the staff at the front desk are fantastic and always ready to help. John at the concierge knows everything there is to know about New York and will arrange tours, tickets to shows, recommend place to eat, places to see etc. The hotel has complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate 24 hours a day in the lobby. There are washing machines and dryers in the basement where you can launder your clothes for $4. There is a micro wave in the lobby that you can use. I have NEVER stayed at any hotel that is so convenient. The breakfast gets a little crowded depending on when you get there. But you can always select you food and eat in the lobby. I cannot say enough about this place

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful; the facilities are excellent. The rooms have been recently updated, and are comfortable and beautiful. Our room was extremely quiet (which is amazing given the location). The free breakfast included eggs, waffles, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, and pastries. It was well located with good access to theaters and restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at his hotel for two nights based upon a last minute change of plans. It looks brand new - rooms are very modern comfortable and efficiently designed. Tons of outlets and storage space and bright. Bathrooms compare to those at five star hotels. Service was superb / everyone on the staff could not be friendlier or more competent. I would highly recommend to anyone staying in the area. I typically wouldn't choose a Hampton Inn but was so pleasantly surprised. Special thanks to Rachelle at the front desk for all her friendly assistance

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was nice, comfortable, and clean with a very good front desk staff, but they have some serious people moving problems. Their worst problem is their elevators. It is 30 floors with 3 elevators. If you are on the top 10 floors, you may have to wait, wait, wait for an elevator that is not full (sometimes 15 minutes) Their breakfast is very good but so busy, you may not get a seat to eat. There are so many options in NYC, I don't think we will return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location to Times Square and subway! Breakfast and coffee available in the lobby was great. Rooms were on the small side, but new and clean. Elevators are slow at peak times since there are only three, but just fine 99% of the time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the hotel just for 1 day, but I have to say that everything was great: The welcoming at the front desk was very nice and sincere, the room was great and absolutely clean. The amenities were very good and the breakfast was also very gorgeous. I will stay here again. The hotel is located near times square and is highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here on business since my meeting was nearby, but this hotel is a tourist trap. Most times I returned to the lobby to find it overflowing with tourists and their luggage. Heck, it's one of the few Hamptons I've ever seen with a concierge. They know their audience, and it wasn't me. The signs in the lobby warn of the breakfast room being overrun between 8:30 and 10:00am. Luckily for me, I'm working, so a 6:45 breakfast made it serene by comparison. The location is great, and ultimately, it's a relatively quiet Hampton Inn with all the normal Hampton Inn decor you've come to expect. Just be warned that you'll be waiting for your elevators and fighting to get past the tourists to do so.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Greeted by smiles, good nature and helpfulness, the staff shines at this new hotel! We had a wonderful stay, though brief. Our family of 2 adults & 1 teen took advantage of the park and stay package for a weekend stay. The parking rates in the area were high, even with discounts, when staying overnight -- this deal beat those prices PLUS it was convenient. The rate covers 24 hours from the time you arrive (x number of days), which worked out perfect for us. We we arrived later in the day & on our departure date, left our bags with the desk when we checked out bust continued to explore the city. As will all NYC hotels, you need to call for the car 30 minutes before you need it since it is in a nearby garage. From curbside to front desk -- breakfast room to cleaning staff navigating the hotel, each and every person was happy AND happy to help. A mix up checking in... same last name as another guest-- had us land in the wrong room. The staff could not work quick enough to get us settled and wanted to make sure we were happy. The hotel is new and well kept. One of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at in NYC. New does not always mean well-kept -- this place was sparkling! We had a double on the 24th floor. Small rooms in the city, but I have seen smaller (and pricier). There were plenty of towels, extra blanket, fully stocked toiletries, and water bottles from the front desk (a Hilton Honors thing - recommend signing up). The bathroom had a sliding frosted door with wood frame which was not a great sound barrier. Attractive design but not the best for soundproofing. We were high up and had no issues with road noise. Nice view. We were across from the elevators and had absolutely NO issues with noise from the hallway. Breakfast was delicious and well stocked. Everything was clean and plentiful. The room was spacious and comfortable--TVs around but not overbearing. Tables mostly, but a little bar type seating area as well. The feature of breakfast being included in the price is only worthwhile if the food is good - and it was! Checkout was fast and everyone was eager to help. We checked our bags behind the desk so we could spend some extra time in the city. There were several staff members on hand, taking the bags, closing out the bill, etc. They seemed to enjoy working together -- that positive energy gave the entire place a "good vibe". There was never just one person helping-- staff members were always stepping forward and reaching out. Even coming back for the car, they were asking about us, our stay and making sure we were comfortable until the vehicle arrived. We are already looking forward to our next stay at this hotel. Bravo to the Hampton Inn Times Square Central team!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I love this hotel. Very convenient and central to all of Manhattan. Super efficient to get to anywhere in NYC. The place is great for business travel. All the amenities you need and helpful and courteous staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a business meeting in NYC and combined it with a brief vacation. This Hampton Inn and Suites is new and conveniently located in the Times Square section of the city. The rooms are well appointed, but as is the case with many NYC hotels, the rooms are VERY small. All expected amenities are provided and the complementary breakfast is excellent. Our only disappointment is the bedding. There is no choice of pillows as is the trend with many other hotels and they were extremely soft and offered no support. The sheets were too short as was the blanket and, therefore, our sleep experience was less than stellar. The staff is VERY friendly and accommodating, however, and overall, we enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a cool, clean, and affordable get away in New York City. It is in walking distance to the midtown attractions, restaurants, and bars. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at this hotel in August. The location is great and its a nice hotel, the price is decent and there is a breakfast buffet. The rooms are nice and modern, the staff is friendly and the lobby is a nice place to hang out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My mom and I stayed on the 27th floor overlooking 41st Street in a room with two double beds. The room and hotel were both very clean, all the surfaces looked new and had no signs of wear. The rooms were small but used the space well, the bathrooms were adequate and didn't feel cramped. I would have been nice to be able to slide the suitcase under the bed, but it did fit in the wardrobe. The beds were firm but soft enough to be comfortable - I have a back injury so it's hard to find the right balance, but these beds were great. We did have a little street noise from sirens, but this is a big city and it's to be expected. Our room was very quiet otherwise. I didn't hear the guests above, below or beside us. I know it was a slow week, but it was very quiet in our room. The elevators are quick, but you should choose a higher floor for better elevator service especially at check out time. The staff were very friendly and helpful - thank you Nini! I've always stayed at another Hilton property on W 35th, but I will be staying here from now on. The location was unbeatable and the beds are much more comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was great. Right in the middle of Times Square and central to so many amazing sites.It was clean, staff were very welcoming and friendly and the breakfasts were great. They set you up for a busy day ahead! The rooms were great and loved the huge bed. We had city views, which was brilliant.I had the best birthday in New York and some of that is down to the great staff and hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a Hampton loyalist. I love the bedding and the free breakfast. That said this is an excellent location. All of the front desk people that I chatted with were nice, upbeat, helpful and just generally great. That is not the usual. Really had a fun and friendly atmosphere. Breakfast was ok, not a standout but in the top quarter of breakfasts for selection and quality. I will try to stay here again availability permitting.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton met or exceeded all expectations. The rooms were clean and comfortable, staff was welcoming, and location, location, location! Right in the heart of Times Square. Walking distance to theaters, bars, and restaurants. We would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Came to NYC for a quick overnight trip and stayed at the Hampton. The staff went above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Hotel was clean and the location was within walking distance to everything. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very impressed with both the property and staff. Well kept, clean and well managed property. The front desk and breakfast staff was helpful, friendly, professional and courteous. Perfect location to experience NYC - steps from the action. I'll stay here again, but I normally stay in Hamptons anyway 150+ nights a year. This one was a treat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Couldn't fault anything, great location, staff friendly and helpful. 24 hour tea and coffee facilities. Rooms spacious and have everything you need. Central, 2 min walk to Times Square. Complimentary breakfast

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good location for business or pleasure. Not a quiet hotel given its proximity to Times Square - stay here for action, not quiet. Rooms are small, but typical Hampton Inn quality. Stay on an upper floor to avoid street noise - but beware the very slow elevator service. Given the vast number of hotel options in the area, will probably try others in the future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thanks to everyone at Hampton times square central for making our first time in NYC special. This property is amazingly gorgeous and the colored lights in the lobby add such aesthetic beauty! We stayed on the 26th floor and had a great room with a great view. Breakfast was good and filling! Also the property is very clean! Thanks!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here after 4 nights at the Marriott Marquis and our flights were canceled due to a snow storm. The rooms are on the smaller side but we got 2 connecting and it was great! The hotel is very new and clean and had lots of perks. Free hot chocolate and coffee all day. Fresh cookies every afternoon and the usual breakfast buffet each day. Also, plenty of complimentary water bottles (Marquis of course charges for this), great location and friendly service. Self service laundry was very reasonable and we neeed it due to the unexpected extension of our trip! ( Marquis only had expensive send-out laundry service) Hotel was packed so elevators slow but we really ended up liking this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As being a Diamond member , and now as my dear lovely father had a Cardiac arrest and he is on a life support machine in 1 of the hospitals in the city ,so i am in the hospital between 10-15 hours every day at his bed side praying and making sure that he is being treated with the most warmth and kindness , so to be close the hospital i am staying at this very outstanding special beautiful kind warm hotel . And i must express myself and point out the most 2 best of the best staff members at the front desk who they are by their lovely names ''''''' Ms LETITIA DAVILAR ''''''' and Mr KEVIN GIBLIN '''''these 2 very high honored staff members are such very smart ,kind ,warm ,passionate ,goodhearted people that me personal never ever have met in any other hotel from the HH hotels all over America !!!!!!!!!!! And they can teach and lecture to other staff members in other hotels all over how to make their hotels be so successful like this hotel , the reason y this hotel is always jam booked is because these 2 super wonderful staff members in this hotel !!!!!!!! And saying all this above i would also like to say that all all other staff members the front desk staff , and the bell man team are also super very nice and kind people who they also are a big blessing to this hotel . Israel Apter . Denver CO .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Third time staying here and have not been disappointed yet. All staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were modern and clean. Location near Port Authority was great. Over all a great experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everyone was really nice at check in and extremely helpful about closest subway. I loved the cleanliness of hotel and how fast the three elevators were in the building. Free BK in am.... no scrambled eggs (I wish) since I am lactose intolérant so I opted for the waffle w almonds, honey, & whipped cream with a cup of robust coffee. (Made own little concoction lol) Only thing I would change is the pillows. The feathers inside go flat and ended up hurting the cartilage on my ear (no I don't have piercings) I know it sounds a bit odd, but if they were fluffier it would have been better. Next time I will just pack my own pillow. :) That's all. Loved our view from corner 31st floor to see city lights and very happy it was super quiet. I'll never get sick of that view. Great for families wanting to be near timesquare.... lots of subway rides to east/west village, downtown, Brooklyn, grand central, etc. PS: For quick baked goods (patisserie) & breakfast items visit *Paris Baguette* around corner next to Wasabi. Sooo good!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I found the hotel to be in a great location of Time Sq. The cleanliness and service at the hotel was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Love the 24hr hot beverage in the lobby along with cookies in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed our 3 day stay at this convenient motel.  I have to say the NICEST person that I met in New York was a Breakfast Ambassador at this Hampton Inn by the name of Geraldine Meehan. Each morning she greeted us with a smile, asked how we were doing and inquired if there was anything she could do for us. I was very impressed with her customer service and her kindness ehancced our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square Central while in New York with my daughter to see Aladdin on Broadway. This hotel is the perfect hotel for the New Amsterdam Theater, as it is right across the street from the back of the theater. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient, got us checked in and on our way very quickly. Our room was on the 5th floor, facing 41st. The room had two double beds and although on the smaller side was fine for two. The hotel is newer and the room was clean and well maintained. The HVAC worked great, and kept the room the perfect temperature. There was occasional traffic noise, but that's hard to avoid in NYC. Breakfast was Hampton average,. The only real knock on the place is, at 25 floors and 3 elevators, there can sometimes be a wait for an elevator. Being on the 5th floor, sometimes we found it easier to take the stairs. The breakfast area was about the size of a breakfast area at a 4 or 5 story Hampton, so, with 25 floors of people, you can imagine it was packed. That being said, they do try and give you fair warning about the hotel breakfast being busy. Also, allow extra time if you valet parked your car. Sometimes they get a crush of people all wanting their cars at the same time, which can lead to delays. Took almost an hour wait for ours, so leave extra time if check out is busy. All in all a nice stay, and we would certainly come back here if staying in the area for a show!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have stayed at several Hilton/Hampton properties in Midtown and Times Square. We have come to accept cureous and sometimes abrupt employees. This hotel is definitely the exception to what we thought was the rule in NYC. These employees exceed many property's employees where we have stayed through out the country with the friendliest of employees. From curbside to check-in to passing employees in the hallway to Teddy's wonderful disposition in the breakfast room with all those people every morning we were blown away to have all friendly faces at our home base in the city for the first time ever. The connecting rooms we had were clean and comfortable, typical smaller NYC hotel rooms. Pleased to have key service to operate elevator, too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Awesome location. Awesome customer service! Strongly recommend. Few minute walk to Times Square. Close to subway entry too. Loved the tea and coffee to warm up right when we got into the lobby. Rooms are much larger than some I've stayed in before in the Times Square area. I'll stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our daughter Elizabeth wanted to visit New York City Times Square for her 21st birthday. This hotel worked out great conveniently located at one end of Time Sqaure, 7th Ave and 41st Street. We easily walked to a couple Braodway Shows, resturants, and the Shops on 5th Ave. Tobo that helped us at check-in and the lady that helped at the included breakfast were super nice, wish I could remember her name. Great Value for location and amenities.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a comfortable place for a stay in the city: small but comfortable rooms, clean and bright, good breakfast with many choices including fresh fruit and healthy choices. The location gave us easy access to theaters, taxis, subways, shopping. One drawback: rooms face the street, and it's true that the city never sleeps. We had street noise much of the night, every night. If you stay here, ask for Geraldine in the breakfast room. She's not only a great and pleasant way to begin the day, but seems also to be more knowledgeable and thoughtful than anyone else about where to go, what to see, how to get there. She was a font of information for us and helpful in a number of ways, not only related to breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, accommodating, great location, fantastic staff, good breakfast, close to all subways, felt very safe, comfortable beds, Great value for your dollar, appears newly renovated, coffee all day thank you !!january 2017

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Four of us stayed here for 6 nights over new years. Arriving at 8pm on NYE it was a struggle getting to the hotel as Times Square was closed off, we finally made it :)Arriving all excited and ready to kick off our NYE experience in NY we were unfortunately greeted by a rude young lady at reception. We asked if there were any nice local bars where we could go for a drink and was told “everything’s closed, it’s new years eve”. We then asked if the hotel had a bar and was told “no!”. Ok, so we are in New York and everything is closed, great. Fortunately one of our party had emailed Jessica, the assistant manager ahead of time. Jessica had informed us she’d leave a few notes at reception for us upon arrival with a few tips on what to do and where to go. So we asked the young lady at reception if anything had been left to which she replied “No! Nothing!”. Not what you expect when paying $700 for a single night on NYE.The lady then proceeded to take a huge £500 security deposit from my card during check in, why I’ll never know, the basic breakfast is included and there’s no bar, so not sure what they thought I’d be spending £500 on?Anyway my friend who had been in contact with Jessica emailed her immediately, Jessica instantly called us and apologised for the awful service during check in, she also suggest a few nice bar which were in fact open. We proceeded to head out to a bar Jessica recommended and had a fantastic night. Thanks Jess :)The selection at breakfast was basic, to put it politely it was like a mass free for all. People could walk in off the streets for breakfast if they wanted to, no check in in, no being seated, just stroll in and help yourself. Seating is limited so every morning people were spilling out into reception munching on their food, one family was even slumped over the iMac computer in reception eating their breakfast.Anyway all of the negatives aside, the hotel is in a fantastic location, close to everything you’d need. Rooms were cleaned every day, of a high standard and there’s unlimited coffee and water on offer in reception. We paid $1,450 for 6 nights, over new years this wasn’t too bad, but we wouldn’t pay anywhere near this during a normal time of the year.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Location was perfect... could walk to almost everything, Aladdin broadway show is right across the street. The room was a decent size, clean bathrooms and comfortable bed. All in all a good value Hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came to NYC to spend several days sightseeing and relaxing. The hotel is centrally located so we were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to go. The room was clean and not so small considering that this is a hotel in the middle of Manhattan. The bed was comfortable and the shower was spacious (though there could have been more water pressure). The best thing about the hotel is the staff. Everyone was super nice. A special shout out to Letitia who works the front desk at night. She was cheerful and helpful at all times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Close to everything in Mid-town. Easy to get to and close to subway. Hard to beat the location for the price. Clean rooms. Small, but its New York. Friendly staff, and the breakfast crew was awesome. Served everyone with smiles and a "Good Morning."

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location steps to everywhere. Warm cookies between 5 and 7 pm yummy. Breakfast was substantial. Waffles eggs or egg omelets breakfast meat , yogurt fruit assorted breads. Juice selections, cereal choices

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was in a great location we were able to walk to everything. As others have said, the elevators were difficult to deal with because of her size of the hotel, elevators were very small for the amount of people and there are only three elevators. Breakfast is crowded and we were never able to get a table. Stayed On the 6th floor, took the steps most of the time, outside noise was not s problem, except for hearing horns and sirens. Rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable, check in and out was very easy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful hotel so nice and close to theater district. Within walking distance to almost all major theaters and great restaurants. Front desk very helpful with suggestions when asked. Very helpful that breakfast is included in the price as this can get very expensive in NYC if your not careful. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We found Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Sq Central while driving around Times Square in March 2016 and ended up staying for 3 nights. What a perfect spot to be in while enjoying this part of New York City! It's located a couple of blocks from the ABC newsroom (GMA); a hop, skip and a jump away from all the broadway shows and awesome restaurants. Loved the hot/cold beverage table in the lobby as well as the cozy lounge. Friendly staff and clean lobby. The only real complaint is that our room with a king size bed was pretty small. We had regular-size luggage and it was hard to open them unless we put them on top of the bed. The size of the room compares to hotel rooms in Europe. The room was clean with modern fixtures in the bathroom; a huge window with views of old rooftops. But for the little time we spent in the room and for what we paid, it was worth it as the location of this hotel is perfect if you're there to enjoy Times Square/broadway shows/restaurants/shopping, etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I don't get the high marks, which provided the primary reason I stayed here. Even by mid-town standards the hotel is loud, over-priced, and run down. My mattress was worn out, I checked in online for a king and instead got a double, could never get the temp in the room right (too hot or too cold no matter what setting), TV is too small, closet too small, and just overall not a good choice (at least for me). Positives include location and size of the room (big by midtown standards). I've stayed at much better hotels in the area at lower rates. My mistake.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. Minutes from the theater district and to the 1, 2, and 3 subway. Also, less then a 15 minute walk to Grand Central Station. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and comfortable. You also receive a full breakfast, not just a continental breakfast like other hotels. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We love this hotel it's basically one block from Times Square. When you walk out the front door you can go through the McDonald's and your in Times Square. Yes the elevators are slow but the rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for one night with my 9 year old while on our annual pilgrimage to see a Broadway show and have a night away together. I stay at a lot of Hilton family hotels, and have stayed at several in Manhattan with family over the years. The gentleman who checked us in (Togo) was delightful. Helpful, kind, playful and handsome to boot! I liked the security the hotel had in the elevators, requiring guests to touch their room keys to a pad in order to select their floor. (I've had this on "select" floors before, but never for everyone. It was a comfort, knowing the elevators are right off the street and anyone could walk on.) We stayed in room 2409, which had a nice view south, and met all our simple needs, but was rather tiny. I reminded myself that it is Manhattan, and I wasn't paying top dollar for this room.... for what I paid, and where it was, it was perfect. The room was well maintained, and the bathroom renovated in a decor similar to the other Hilton family brands. My only gripe about Manhattan hotels (this being the 3rd in the Times Square area I've stayed at in the last 3 weeks), is the food service hours. This hotel doesn't have room service (which ended by 10pm in other hotels), but it does serve breakfast. Unfortunately the breakfast ends at 10am, and we missed it when we slept in late. Other than that, the hotel is clean, well maintained, pleasantly staffed, and only 1 block off of Times Square (41st between 7-8 Avenues), so is perfectly located near it all!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I do my homework so I knew that the rm was small but it's NYC and sometimes we need to think more like a European and less like a Texan (where I also lived). We had a king and yes, there wasn't more in the rm than that, but was there a closet, bureau, desk, chairs- yes of course - and it was clean-Mommy clean-everywhere in the hotel - Now the staff - major thanks to Jessica in the breakfast area - what a kind, sweet soul she is - my daughter was very sick this trip (urgent care sick) and I went down to get her some mint tea - Jessica saw my face (it was really bad )and asked how she could help with suggestions on teas and to get me really hot water to help my child. And every day we were there she asked - kindness ♡-we also had to stay a day later bc the docs wouldn't let my daughter fly and Elizabeth, the manager as well as the head of housekeeping (sorry, didn't get her name) were very, very accommodating. The breakfasts we did have were crowded, but the food was pleniful - Get a room away from the elevator-we were in 1404-very quiet - one elevator was broken so maybe a lower floor in case. Yes, I would stay there again -no doubts - no regrets

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just got back from our first trip to New York. I was clueless about the best location to stay, especially since when a hotel says "walking distance", it is not really what I would consider "walking distance"! This hotel was clean, with comfortable beds and pillows, on a pretty mellow street. There was a 3 level McDonalds right across from the hotel, which was a one way street. You could walk in, go all the way through and come out the other side onto a bustling street with cool lights and shops. The wax museum and Ripley's were next door to the McDonalds on that side. We walked comfortably to the theater, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, New York Public library and the MOMA. There was a Walgreens that was a 5 min walk and it was also close to the subway. The only negative was sleeping in on our last morning and trying to get to breakfast with only half an hour left. It took forever to get an elevator and there was barely standing room in the breakfast area, forget about finding a seat. Avoid that by getting to breakfast early, we had no trouble on our other mornings. We would definitely stay here again and were really pleased with our choice!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice Rooms, just wish they had a small fridge and a microwave. Awesome Staff, very helpful! The Hot Drink Station in the lobby with hot cocoa, coffee and tea is great in the winter! Delicious breakfast every morning! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel with a very friendly staff and a very central location, at a very reasonable price. We picked it for its proximity to multiple subway lines, as we ranged from the West Village downtown to Spanish Harlem way uptown during our five day stay. The room was perfect for two people (and we loved the tiled shower). The fitness center is spacious and well-equipped -- and we mostly had it to ourselves in the early morning.
