Horrible hotel:No Sound-proofing.Packed, small elevators you can never get on.Dubious customer service.Never Again!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights, Our room was spotless breakfast was lovely (a little busy about 8am) location is great, Geraldine (Irish Lady at breakfast) was so so helpful and very welcoming and full of tips about our stay in New York. refreshments in reception were an added bonus. Internet was fine (floor 21) staff were great. roof top deck is not used to its potential beautiful area would be great with a few tables for lunch or a glass of wine.We will most definitely return to this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel itself is lovely. My room was very clean, and the bed very comfortable. The shower could use more water pressure, but I loved the little bar at the bottom of the shower to use to shave your legs! Very helpful. I was even able to check in a little early at 2pm. Now the downside; and it is a fairly big one. The elevators are extremely slow. There are only 3, and the cleaning staff and crew use these elevators as well. I left my room at 9:22am and I did not get to the lobby until 9:35am. Granted, I was on the 29th floor, but I had to wait about 8 minutes for an elevator. Once on the elevator, it stopped at EVERY SINGLE FLOOR. It was extremely frustrating. I was planning to use that 10 minutes to grab breakfast- instead, I had to rush to my meeting. Not a fun way to start your day at all. The hotel really needs to have more elevators, and have the staff use a separate elevator at peak times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you are sightseeing in NYC and plan to walk as much as possible, this is a perfect location. Easy walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Broadway, and Central Park. Also very close to a subway stop and bus stop for several hop-on/off tours. The staff at the desk are so helpful and courteous. If you're there very long, the breakfast gets monotonous, but it was a nice feature to have and not have to go out for that meal. Don't pay the extra per night for the city view, you won't be there that much and they have a rooftop terrace with an amazing view. I would definitely stay here next time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is well located and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The only issue I had was the quality of the breakfast. Needs to be significantly upgraded. If you are looking for a hotel suitably located in the heart of Manhattan this is a good hotel to stay at
user_location: port of spain, Trinidad and Tobago

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is an amazing hotel to stay at. Right in the the heart of time square. Our room over looked H&M and the big Apple new years ball.This is a must stay while in new york. The staff was very professional and the dinning balcony with drinks. Perfect

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our trip to NYC was to do things on my husband's bucket list. Our two adult daughters accompanied us. We chose this hotel because of it's location. My husband is in a wheel chair and we were able to maneuver to the theatre and to restaurants. Used hotel car service (reasonable compared to others). The added plus was the staff -- they were courteous, caring and helpful. The breakfasts were great -- quite a savings. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn has the best location of the 3 midtown NYC Hampton Inns (I've stayed in them all). Very close to the Empire State Building, Macy's and 34th Street shopping. Clean, quiet and typical Hampton breakfast. I didn't like the red and black carpet in my room, but that's just a matter of taste. Our room on the 11th floor faced another building. This is often typical at NYC hotels. It is preferable to facing a noisy street. The little gym area was nice! My son and I were very comfortable and had enough space, but were cozy. If space is a concern, the rooms in the Hampton Inn North location are quite large by NYC standards.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is still in as new condition, very clean, comfortable and very close to Times Square. Would highly recommend it! The free breakfast can be crowded between 9 and 10am . Go before if possible to get a seat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Times Square Central is a wonderful place to stay when visiting NYC. Despite its central location, it is quiet and relaxing. The staff goes above and beyond, even returning a stuffed animal that we had inadvertently left behind!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I took my 6yr old and 11yr old to spend a Night in the city. I chose this hotel because of the location. I was hesitant thinking it would be to loud but was surprisingly wrong. The staff was friendly, and although I checked in early the room was ready as well. Upon check in the hotel gave us a complimentary bag filled with bottled water. Rooms were small but very very clean and I didn't really mind the size because I had no intentions of staying in the room.Great location as the subways are only around the corner. Also because it's "Times Square". We visited the wax museum, Riley's, the natural history museum, Hayden Planetarium, Central Park zoo and went to see iluminate.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I took my Granddaughter to NYC as part of our Summer trip. I chose this hotel because of the location and knew we wouldn't have to walk very far to get to the attractions we were seeing & it minimized the driving I had to do downtown.As with everything in NYC, space is precious - so there was no pool, the room set up was choppy and SMALL for 2 people even for minimal time.When driving you have to call for your car at least 30 mins prior to needing their car and I had to wait over 1 hour. So don't need your vehicle in a hurry.Hard to sleep because of the noise, you would think when they built hotel the Windows would have been a little more sound proof. Fire & Police Sirens all night long.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The htel has dirty chairs in the lobby. We reserved a King room and 2 times were put into a double. After the second room switch, we finally got the king room we reserved and then had garbage from previous guests and there was mold on the duvet. You will wait a long time for elevator service as well. The best part of the stay was the bell hops. They were efficient and friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location close to Times Square. Polite and courteous staff. Rooms are a bit small but with modern amenities and very comfortable bed. If staying with kids should opt for a bigger room. McDonalds is right in front to get a quick bite and there are so many food outlets all around the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Ideally located and very comfortable rooms. We stayed here for over a month during our deputation in New York. The hotel is walking distance to Times Square and also the Chelsea area. Which makes it apt for official as well as shopping destinations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn has very friendly staff. The rooms are clean and very nicely appointed but very compact. WiFi is free and works well. Lobby has a snack center with a microwave and frozen meals if you want a quick meal. There is also a business center in the lobby with three computers and a printer. Fax is available and free if needed. A hot breakfast is available each morning and the choices of food are very good. The only slight inconvenience with this hotel is that it is 31 floors and only has three rather small elevators so in the mornings between 7-10 AM you may have to wait as several full elevators pass before you can get on an elevator. The beds are great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have stayed at Hampton Inns Times Square South before, I was very disappointed this time. The room was on the eight floor facing the street. The amount of noise was not acceptable, my wife and I did not sleep ore than one hour. Some we cannot blame Hampton Inns on, traffic and such, but at 1:30 AM, they were putting dirty linen in the truck, very noisy. The room itself was a typical NYC hotel room. The elevators - ridiculous - from the eigth floor - we waited 20 minutes, even trying to go up to go down. Elevators either passed our floor or did not have enough room for two people, forget luggage. We ended up walking the eight flights carrying luggage. That was not recommended since I am just getting over a foot injury. I go into NYC at least 3 imes a year, I do not know if I will ever stay there again. We were told management was to contact us, still waiting.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for our daughter's birthday. Great location, pleasant staff and clean guest rooms! We could not have asked for a better room! Seating at breakfast was a little tricky to find. The rooftop could use some chairs, but overall we loved this hotel!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for one night in August, 2016. After checking in, we wished we had booked another night. We paid slightly more for a high-floor room, which we received (30th floor). The view wasn't spectacular, but definitely better and quieter than the lower floors. Things I loved about this hotel:-Friendly check-in and check-out staff-They held our bags on the day of check-in, several hours before we checked in-They held our bags after check-out, for several hours until the following evening-Nice rooms with modern touches, and a comfortable bed (and pillows)!-Great location!! So convenient.-Breakfast was very nice-Coffee available at all times

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was so happy to have booked this hotel for our 10 year anniversary getaway. It was perfectly located, new, clean, provided all our necessities (except for one, which I will mention below) and we were allowed an early check-in and check-out. The free breakfast was also a bonus and so was the 24 hour coffee, tea and water in the front entrance of the hotel. I would have to say two reasons were the reason I couldn't give this hotel a five star rating. First was that there was no fridge in our hotel room. This was our first time without a fridge in our hotel room in ages. I couldn't believe how much I missed not having one. It might not seem like a big deal, but after a whole day of sight seeing or shopping it would've been nice to chill before getting ready for dinner with a nice cold beer or glass of white wine, especially in the summer months. The second reason was a couple hours after checking-out my husband remembered he forgot his pillow in the hotel room. I went to the front desk and asked if he could locate the pillow. He called house keeping and was told by two housekeepers that managed our floor that they could not locate nor did they find a pillow in our room. The front desk personnel was great and thought to call lost and found, but we were not successful in finding the pillow. This was as we were leaving the hotel, after a great time in NYC and it left a bad taste in our mouth. I recommend anyone staying here to please remember to bring all their belongings because there is high chance you won't see them again. I'm just glad it was not our passports or money we left behind.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pricey, but not unreasonable for the middle of Manhattan. Added value from included wi-fi (slow but not terrible) and breakfast. Breakfast room was heavily used and very hard to find seats after 8 a.m. However, the staff in breakfast room worked very hard at keeping everything stocked and clean AND they were cheerful and pleasant to guests.Was convenient to be able to get everybody well fed (eggs, fruit, oatmeal, etc.) before heading out for a day of sightseeing. One of my kids also enjoyed free hot chocolate in the lobby even on hot nights.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just got back and I had to share the wonderful time we had!! I booked this hotel just by reading the reviews and couldn't be happier!! The staff was great especially Geraldine in the restaurant who was a treat and genuinely cared about each and every guest in the room! Thank you Geraldine!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located. The elevators are a challenge if you're staying on a higher floor (we were on the 24th). We were told we had a Times Square view - we had a view of other buildings and a couple of electronic billboards. The BEST part of the hotel was the staff at breakfast. Every morning I looked forward to being greeted by Geraldine. She took incredible care of my family and was an absolute pleasure!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn has only been open a year (I think) and is in good shape. The facilities were clean and inviting. The complimentary breakfast area was very nice, there were many choices from make your own waffles to fruit loops and fresh fruit or yogurt. This is not a elaborate hotel. We found everything we needed for our stay (except perhaps a larger bed), the employees were friendly and helpful and the location was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Love the location of this place,its neat and clean. Rooms are good sized, and lovely bathrooms. The room did not come with a refrigerator and needed one to keep my one year old sons food, so they provided it free of charge.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Hotel. I was there for 7 days and it was great. Excellent location. Room was spacious for a NYC hotel. Breakfast every morning was good. I must admit I was on vacation so I didn't make it too often. It was always well staffed which is a plus. Leti checked me in and was very kind and professional. Hope I spelled her name right. Would definitely stay there again. As soon as I can. Love the Hampton Inn NYC Times Square Central

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great service, best location to Times Square and they have a laundry! We had an early flight arrival and got to the hotel at 8 am and they had our room ready for us and invited us for some breakfast (not included). So we had an opportunity to shower, a short sleep, get the washing done and out exploring by lunch,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located right at the times square. Great staff, very friendly. Nice and big rooms. Very clean. You have the opportunity to wash your own cloths in the basement which is very convinient. There is a little shop next to the reception where you get almost everything you will need. Really a nice place to stay!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A nearly new hotel in a great location, breakfast is supplied and is really good as long as you go early, vey busy after 8am.Great staff, Geraldine in the mornings for breakfast was excellent, made sure we had a great time and gave us a few tips for getting the most out of New York.Johnnie looked after us on arrival and departure and was very helpful with anything we needed.Rooms very comfortable, spotless and beds so comfortable.We'll be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: American Hospitality at its best! Excellent staff, easy check-in, decent rooms size for Times Square. Located in the heart of Times Square, with a train station nearby, a concierge to help you plan your day out, unlimited supply of water & coffee, I don't think you could ask for more. Breakfast was ok, you tend to get bored of if your staying for a longer time, but haaaay, your in Times Square, walk out n you have loads n loads of options! I would totally recommend this hotel to everyone & its pretty economical as well for Times Square!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice but elevators suck and get to the free breakfast early or prepare for extremely long lines, close to the train and Times Square, simple decor, price is average for the location, staff is helpful, overall ok

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, easy access to Times Square, Broadway shows, Subway, site seeing bus stop. It was also a comfortable place to retreat after touring NYC. The staff was always Warm and Friendly. It wasn't just the front desk but the ladies in the breakfast area and the housekeeping staff. The room was clean and seemed well maintained. We were able to check in around 9:30am and check out after 2pm.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: we stayed at the Hampton Inn for a four day touristic visit to NYC. we enjoyed the very central location, clean and up to date rooms, friendly staff ... nothing more we would need for the stay. only minus is the elevator system: expect to spend 10 minutes to get to your floor or down to the lobby. further expect the elevator to be crowded by houskeeping resources talking about their bosses. overall really fair price for a good city hotel within its class.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is well-located just south of Times Square and is relatively modern. Staff for the most part is friendly, especially those in the breakfast room. Experienced major problems at check-in (rooms not even cleaned yet even though after check-in time), extremely long elevator waits at critical/peak times in morning, and breakfast room with insufficient capacity for all guests. Recommend looking at other options.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right off Times Suare. Walking distance to many attractions. Great breakfast selections. Helpful knowledgeable staff. Clean up to date rooms. Free internet. Feel safe. Nice exercise room. Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed our family stay at Hampton Inn on W 41st Street. Great location. Clean rooms, helpful, pleasant staff.Would highly recommend this hotel to visitors and family groups.Close to restaraunts, theaters and short walk to Times Square

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a New York native and wanted to take my daughter on a girls weekend to the city. She wanted to stay in the heart of Times Square! We looked for a hotel that was updated, had nearby parking and served breakfast. The Hampton in was all that and more. You cannot beat the multiple subway lines nearby and Bryant park around the corner. Be prepared to endure all the hustle, bustle and crazy number of tourists nearby but you are safely tucked on a side street (41st between 7th/8th.) Our car was valet parked which was so convenient ($53-$63/24 hrs) Breakfast was usual fair, and the service was excellent! We were even sent with to-go bags of snacks and water -> perfect for our day outside. The room was clean, bed comfy, updated and had ample space by NYC standards. It was a hi floor at in the back corner of the hotel with a peekaboo view of the Empire State Building. The elevators were minimal ( only 3) but we never waited more than 5-10 minutes, so no worries there. We left before noon checkout the next day but left our luggage at the hotel in a secured area. We returned 23.5 hrs after we arrived and by calling ahead for our car we only waited 10 minutes (otherwise it's a 30 minute wait). Our bags were safe, put into our car and we were on our way.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Chose this over the Hilton Garden Inn for the free breakfast and were very glad. Still close to Times Square, Port Authority, Bryant Park and taxis, but great free hot breakfast with eggs, sausage, waffles, doughnuts, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, coffee, etc. Even had breakfast to go if needed. Very friendly service in the breakfast area and receptionists. USA Today and good convenience shop available. Fairly large room for New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent accommodation. Staff incredibly pleasant and helpful. Hot tea and coffee in morning a huge plus. Clean bed and very clean bathroom. Didn't feel the least bit uncomfortable due to smells or bugs. No hall noises or next door room noises. Mattress was great. I appreciate the Neutrogena bath products.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel's location and accommodation was excellent for my daughters graduation trip. We could walk anywhere in Times Square. The hotel rooms were clean and when we requested anything, such as the towels or umbrella's the hotel was very accommodating.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here with my sister in may. The location is perfect just a short walk to the centre of times square and easy walking distance to Empire State and Rockefeller Center! Very stylish, modern hotel with all the amenities that you could possibly need. Friendly staff and brilliant housekeeping! The room had ample space for me and my sister and was clean, tidy and fresh! The breakfast is great, just enough to choose from. However the dining space in the breakfast hall is very small with people waiting for tables, luckily we were up early enough to get a table whilst it was quiet. Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Nice view from the rooftop. Super polite staff.Complete & tasty breakfast.I got the packages i ordered perfectly and at no extra fee. A nice gesture: The lobby guys offered us breakfast the morning we arrived.Thanks a lot.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our central hub for all our activities. We were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to see. Great restaurants well with in walking distance. Port Authority Building less than 5 min. away.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is 2 blocks from the heart of Times Square. From the front desk staff through housekeeping and the breakfast room area everyone was very professional, cheerful and extremely cordial. The rooms are very clean, like new, and the beds are very comfortable. No problem sleeping in this quiet hotel. Breakfast is included and it's your typical so so breakfast bar yet a great perk for staying there. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved the location, since I wasn't crazy about being right in the Times Square- why come all the way to New York to go to Dave & Buster's, Chevy's or Starbuck's?). Subway stations were still within easy walking distance. If I were rating it against ALL hotels in New York, it certainly wouldn't be a five-star. But considered against other, affordable chain brands operating in the area, I can't imagine doing better for the money... especially for a pretty new facility. Now... to provide some counterpoint to the few negatives I saw in other reviews before we booked:1) The elevator waits were not bad- 5-8 minutes the one time we hit it at rush hour, but otherwise 3-5 minutes. This was in early August... YMMV.2) Room got cleaned every day. One day, someone even came by to confirm as much.3) Room size was not an issue for us. We had a double-queen room with three people and, yes, we did bump into each other occasionally. But a) ALL rooms in NYC are smaller and b) We were hardly ever in our room.4) Staff were professional and courteous. Enjoy NYC and this hotel... we did!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was clean, close to Times Square to see shows & eat out & catch the Hop on-Hop off Big Bus tours! Free breakfasts were an excellent way to start the day, too! PERFECT for all our activities in NYC! Staff were excellent & big thanks to Mike, who helped with our bags, the car & providing directions! & also to John the concierge with a great sense of humor & helpful suggestions/recommendations! Definitely my hotel of choice for my next trip to NYC!!! GREAT job Hampton Inn!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I don't usually leave reviews but I can't say enough good things about this Hotel.Came over from Belfast with my Son for the Carl Frampton fight and The USPGA.Hotel is in a fabulous location, minutes from Times Square, really easy checkin, spotless room and excellent breakfast!!Kris on reception was an absolute STAR and couldn't have been more helpful.You couldn't go wrong staying here, it's honestly really good!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: PROS: The hotel has one of the best locations possible in New York City. You are literally steps from Carlo's Bakery, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and even more! Subway stations are also abundant nearby, allowing you to travel all over the city. The staff were also really friendly and knew us by our names by the second day.CONS: The breakfast gets old after a while; there was only one item change during our three-night stay (and that item was juice flavor). The only other complaint I have is that if you are staying with family, expect the rooms to be crowded. The hotel only has a two double bed or one King bed configuration available, so I'd suggest getting two rooms if you can. Unfortunately there is also no pool as well.OVERALL: The Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square Central is a great hotel with an awesome location and helpful staff, but with a few minor issues that can't be fixed; however I would stay here again sometime in the future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel provided the best location to access to everything. We were able to walk to the trains, and were less than 1 minute from Times Square. We saw the play Motown with was less than 100 feet away.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location, quiet, clean, and comfortable. Staff, especially big Mike and skinny Johnny, was exceptional. Yes, elevators are a challenge during 8-10am morning rush. Management needs to work on solutions.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were very happy that we chose this hotel. Staff were very nice and helpful. Location was a plus because it was so convenient to everything. Breakfast was good and staff would always replenish food and kept the areas cleaned at all times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I do not recommend this hotel! Don't trust the housekeeping staff! Checked in early after a red eye flight. Front desk and housekeeping both showed the room vacant and cleaned, but there was a do not disturb sign on the door and the door was locked from the inside. Employee catching up on some sleep after a late night out??? Upon check out I left my ipad in the room. I called the hotel when I reached the airport. Staff said they would check, but the ipad was never recovered. I know exactly where I left it because I checked the status of my flight right before walking out the door. Either someone from housekeeping kept it, or their search was only lip service and the next guest has my ipad.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I just stayed at this Hampton last night and it was a great stay. The room was VERY clean and tastefully furnished. Our room was at the end of the hall and we barely heard a peep from the hallway during the whole stay. The street noise is an issue , so bring a sound machine if you are a light sleeper. One employee, in particular, welcomed us warmly with efficiency and professionalism, her name is Keroll. It was SO busy at the front desk, and yet she made us feel like we were all that mattered when we checked in. She is calm and cool under pressure, and EXCEEDINGLY kind!! What a great first impression. The Hampton is lucky to have her representing the brand:)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were already in all three Hamptons in NewYork. All has their advantages, depends on what you want to see. Comfortable, friendly, price is ok. Breakfast has also everything you need, not special, but good enough.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent as it's just around the corner from Times Square.It's very easy to walk to different points of interest but there is a subway across the road when you want to go further afield. A bonus of staying in this hotel is getting breakfast in the morning. Lots of different things to eat including, cereal, fruit, eggs and they also have a waffle maker. We would like to mention Geraldine who works in the breakfast area as she was very friendly and helpful offering us lots of advice. The rooms were clean and comfy and nice and quiet considering our proximity to Times Square. There are lots of restaurants and bars close at hand so easy to pop out for a meal and a drink.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would definitely recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for two nights. The rooms and bathroom very nice and clean. The beds were terrific too! We were very comfortable! The breakfast was good with a variety of items you could choose from. The location was great as well. Just off of Times Square! I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is the main selling point; located just steps away from Times Square, Gray Line Bus Tour pickup spots, and any number of Broadway theatres. The room was spacious (for a Manhattan hotel), and very clean. The beds were comfortable, and there was complimentary wifi in the room! Breakfast was included in the cost, and there was a fairly wide variety of options, including cereal, toast and bagels. There was also complimentary coffee at all hours in the lobby!The only reason this got 4 stars instead of 5 was that using the elevators in the morning was extremely difficult. The elevators go straight to the top and pick people up on the way down, which means by the time it reaches you on the lower floors |(we were on 8), it was packed full. Staff was extremely pleasant, and really went the extra mile to make us feel welcome! Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is situated in a great location: walking distance to the theatre, shopping, and Madison Square Garden. Providing a complimentary breakfast in one of the most expensive cities in the world is an added bonus. Though small, the room was clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The lobby is a little small and it was very crowded with girls from baseball teams, but we did not mind. We enjoyed the room, the breakfast and the neighborhood.The service at breakfast was very good and courteous.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This site is in a super location. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We feel that this facility offered excellent value. The breakfasts were good with enough variety to suit most everyone's tastes. The only suggestions I can offer is for a syrup pitcher for the waffles and the addition of grits for the Southerners.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days with my husband, daughter, and 7 month old grand child. The staff are all friendly and helpful. Teddy was awesome each morning helping with the baby during breakfast. We were walking distance to everything in Times Square and less than a block from the train. The hotel was clean and well kept. The only downside was the long wait for the elevator in the morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was clean, in a good location,(just off Broadway and Times Square), had an excellent breakfast (hot and cold items), the area was safe, quiet and the staff was friendly and accommodating. My husband and I spent 5 days here and liked the hotel and the area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a half block from Broadway and 42nd st in the heart of the theater district and only a 10.00 cab ride to the Manhattan cruise terminal. Great friendly staff. Lots of restaurants around. Breakfast room is way to small and did not keep up with all of the guests but otherwise a great stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: $300+ for a Hampton Inn is tough to swallow, but it's NYC after all. Considering that I've paid close to $200 for a Holiday Inn Express out in the Plains states, I guess it's not so bad. I really don't even know how much the more upscale hotels in NYC are getting these days... We just wanted a reasonably-priced place, with a reputable brand, at which our family could crash for the night. It was only one night, and we didn't plan to do more than sleep here. And that's about all you can do, as there is minimal space beyond that occupied by the two queen-size beds and desk. The room was reasonably clean. The bathroom looked relatively up-to-date, which is more than I can say for the carpeting. There was an initially musty smell upon first walking into the room, but I have experienced that in many places and it seems to be something you get used to after a while; it is probably at least partially due to the cleaning materials used. The beds were OK, not especially comfortable, but the bedding seemed clean and fresh. The lobby carpet is a bit dirty and doesn't give a great first impression, but the large room in back where the continental breakfast is served is nice. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived too early to check in but they held our bags for us and texted us when our room was ready.Our "city view" room faced downtown, and was not much of a view to speak of.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel, sits across from McDonald's in the heart of Times Square. Lobby can use a little air fresher, but overall the rooms are not bad. Love the location, and it works! My girlfriends and I are here to celebrate my birthday, no complaints! Can't give a give start because it can use a spruce but not that bad!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I arrived after midnight looming to crash quickly. The staff got me in a room quickly and I was out. Up early and grabbed breakfast. Staff was friendly and rooms were fine. It felt a bit bigger than most NYC properties.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hotel with location near Times Square but not too loud. Watch out for rooms facing north as the higher floors may have glare at night from Times Square. Never tried breakfast but would stay again, lots of tourists but still decent for business.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My overall experience at this property was reasonably satisfied. I had terrible cellular connectivity in my room on the 25th floor. I was overcharged repeatedly for premium Internet because the system thought I had maxed my number of connections which I did not. I was too exasperated to go back to the front desk and ask them to credit me the wrong full premium charge it

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square and my daughter and I loved the location. This location is directly across from McDonald's and less than 50 steps from Red Lobster. There is a theater next to hotel .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is nice - right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Really large sleeping rooms. Lobby looks to be recently renovated. Very nice staff who was very helpful. Close to subways and buses. Clean hotel. Breakfast is included in your stay but gets very crowded unless you go down early. Did not use the gym but it is downstairs. Used the business center area. Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for just one night but was impressed. We arrived quite early and the staff had no problems getting me an open room. At other hotels in the past, I have gotten the run around when trying to check in early when I know there were rooms available. Breakfast food was typical for Hampton inn, but the staff there were great. Teddy was super friendly and greeted people with a smile and a song. They were really accommodating and helpful even with a packed house. Great visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A great place to stay if you want to be right in the heart of Times Square. Don't get a room on the street side if you want a quiet sleep. Garbage trucks out at 12:30 am and 2:30 am. I moved to the alley (on the other side of the hallway) and it was very quiet. Beds are pretty comfortable (for the price) - not as plush as the Hilton - a little more firm. Good breakfast every morning. Staff was friendly and helpful. They moved me to a quiet room without any argument. I probably won't stay there again because it is too busy right in Times Square, but would stay at another Hampton Inn - there is one closer to Central Park.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hampton Inn, travelling from Newark Airport via the Express Bus service which stopped at Port Authority station - this is literally a five min walk to your hotel. Checking in was smooth and staff were very helpful and with complimentary tea/coffee/iced water available, this was very welcome after a long journey. We had asked for a quiet room on a high floor and got exactly that with our room number 2009, rooms were clean and spacious with coffee making facilities. Fridges don't come as standard but we were able to order one for $20 for the duration of our stay.A buffet breakfast is included and this is more than satisfactory for setting you up for a day's sightseeing with a wide range of choices to suit everyone - the Breakfast Ambassadors are friendly and efficient and I would like to thank Geraldine especially for all her help and local knowledge which made our stay much more enjoyable.This is a great spot to stay - subway stations are at each end of the block, Times Square is only a step away but yet far enough not to be noisy, theatres are within walking distance and there are plenty of good places to enjoy dinner.Overall we wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hampton Inn for anyone travelling to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is nice and clean. Updated nicely. Breakfast is 't excellent but, at least OK. Staff was very kind and all but, the concierge were helpful. The rooms are too small & I felt as if I was staying in my closet and I would loved to have had a refrigerator but, the location was great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good location in Times Square. Small room, but didn't really spend much time in it and it was very clean. Breakfast was good, although very busy and hard to find seating. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in the Times Square Central hotel with my two boys, we were quite comfortable and well taken care of. The bed was amazingly comfy, the room was quiet and perfect size. We felt safe as well. Everything was walking distance.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was perfect for walking to the theater and many great eating establishments. It's very clean, the room was amazingly quiet and breakfast had choices galore. We will definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. The staff (Rachelle, Kris, and the Breakfast attendant) does an outstanding job. The housekeeping lacked a bit in providing stay over services each day, However, the Front Desk agent (Rachelle) went out of her way to ensure that we were comfortable at any given time. The hotel offers some great touches (for example : lemon water, coffee and cookies at the Front Desk), however, they could not keep up with the demand. If they had the water, they were out of cups. If they had cups, they were out of water.... The hotel does stay extremely busy and I guess it was hard for them to keep up with the demand.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights this Huly - it's in a great location just off Times square so close to everything but not in the middle of the noise ! There is a great Bar next door - good food and drink and surprisingly not full of rabble

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently spent two nights at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central, and everything was perfect--location, room, extras, and especially service! I highly recommend this hotel!I normally default to Marriott properties and had reservations for a nearby Courtyard. However, someone mentioned this Hampton, and the more I looked, the more I liked. The location was perfect--one block off Times Square on a relatively quiet street with subway access, plus they offered free breakfast, free wifi, and a better rate!Our actual stay was outstanding! We were warmly greeted by the extraordinarily helpful Maria. She quickly got us checked in, provided local knowledge to get us started on our touring, and gave me a text number if I needed anything. This was an awesome service! She texted me as soon as we got to the room to make sure everything was okay. It was a very nice room with comfortable beds and all the amenities. One unusual feature was that the sliding bathroom door was frosted glass, not solid. My son did not care for the fact that his silhouette could be seen, but it didn't bother the rest of us. The towels were plentiful and nice and soft. The wifi was responsive.The breakfast was standard Hampton fare, and it was well maintained and stocked. It did get crowded later in the service, but not crazy. There was always coffee available. They had a nice little market area off the lobby with a microwave for additional snacks. They also provided cookies. As others have noted, there were snack bags too, but I did not check those out.Two last things: On the last day our lunch at a nearby restaurant was running long. I used my handy-dandy text number, and Maria extended our check-out time a half hour and also provided options for getting to the airport for our flight. And later, at the airport, I realized we had left our Apple charger in the room. No problem. I texted Maria, and she arranged to have it mailed to my home!We loved this hotel! You should definitely consider staying here. It has everything--especially great service!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My first time in NYC and i can easily said was amazing. I travelled to New York with my mom, basically it was a quick visit cause actually I was about to move to the UAE, so we decided to enjoy sometime together because we knew we won't see each other for a long time. Hampton Inn, has a super friendly and helpful staff. Since our we arrive they were just great. The location is the best because literally you have Times square just around the corner, so you won't waste time. Central Park is just 15 min by walk, Bryant Park is just in the other side of the street. The hotel rooms are super comfy and clean. I recommend this place, for families or couples. You won't regret!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Free full breakfast, snack packs to go, great location!! Perfect for a family. We were super close to Time Square but not so close we heard everything going on. Also, on the same block as the subway terminal. Made it super easy to travel around the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: no problems at all with our first time stay at this Hampton. I t couldn't have been better! Great location,thank you to John for getting us great seats to kinky boots-very helpful! Would come here again to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located for anyone driving in from the south or west. Just through the Lincoln tunnel and super easy to find. The staff is efficient and friendly - knowledgeable too. Rooms are relatively spacious ( by NYC standards) and newly renovated. Note: all parking is valet and on Saturday morning takes up to an hour to retrieve- so plan ahead!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We so appreciate that the hotel and reservation line worked together to straighten out our reservation when we wanted to add an extra day. For the additional day, the hotel only had a room available with king-sized bed and could not use our points, but with their help my family got to stay an extra day in our same double-bed room with part points and part cash. That was a big relief! We are grateful. Exceptionally helpful and friendly front-desk and maid staff--went out of their way and made sure to get what we needed immediately--extra towels, sheets, coffee cream, etc. Enjoyed the coffee and tea bar in the lobby. Love how a well-stocked closet of linens was right on our floor for immediate use and not having to wait for someone to run to a basement. Really clean--very important to us. LOVE how you wash the bed spread after each customer too--we won't use bedspreads at other hotels, so your standards are so welcome! How can making customers share bedding be allowed by the health department? Mattresses and pillows excellent! My aches and pains I suffer from from my Sleep Number bed and various other mattress we've tried were gone by day 2 of our 6 night stay--I dreaded leaving that bed! I want to purchase your pillows! My body hasn't felt this good in a long time. Excellent location by the NY Port Authority, Theater District, Times Square. Close and safe part of town. Loved that the hotel was new and clean. Appreciate very much that breakfast went until 10 a.m. even during the week and even a little afterwards--food wasn't already swept away by the deadline like at other hotels we've been at, but was still available when we showed up at 10. Also appreciate the bagged breakfasts! I didn't realize how important that was until we had to be somewhere at 7 a.m. and feeling the 3-hour jet-lag. Very cool that they wrapped the apples in cellophane hygienically. Rooms pretty dark with black-out curtains--very important to us. We taped them to the walls and blocked the hems for even better darkness. Kevin at the desk was nice and personable and insisted on getting us our extra linens during our 3:30 a.m. check in, which was nice of him. He said it was no problem because he had a full maid staff on duty during the night--cool! Fast towel service has not been my experience at other hotels and resorts. A maid insisted on running up to the next floor to get a towel that was out of stock on my floor and was back in a flash, which was sweet of her. Another polite young man brought us a fresh bedcover very quickly our first night at 4 a.m.--ours had hair on it. Another young desk gentleman was trying to procure a map of the city at the concierge station after hours but couldn't gain access to one, so he turned on the big screen in the lobby with the map for me in trying to assist, which I appreciated. Hampton seems to have well-mannered people who are well trained in customer service and are people pleasers! :) Rooms not too small to be able to function in as a family, especially in NYC. Pretty roomy closet, big windows, decent storage in bathroom and along window shelf, better shower pressure would be appreciated, bright hallways, clean elevators and lobby. Appreciated the small quiet floors. Loved the bed and pillows! I would just lay and feel what it was like to have such a comfortable mattress. Gave my joints and muscles a break and healing time to change beds from my own.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great place to stay every thing about hotel is great only one bad thing and that is the window on top floors do open so if you have kids that could be dangerous so if you have kids stay on bottom floor other than that GREAT HOTEL!!!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a fabulous stay at the Hampton Inn while enjoying family weekend in the city. It is located within an easy walk of both MSG and the theatre district, with many restaurants to enjoy as well. It was incredibly easy to grab a cab for museum hopping across town. The staff was quite helpful and were happy to hold our bags after check out so that we could continue to walk around. Our room was impressive; clean enough to satisfy this neat freak and ridiculously large by NYC standards. It easily fit our family of 5 on two queen beds and a very comfortable pull out sofa (I thought that was an oxymoron!). The furniture and decor of the room were quite modern and not all at tired. We also particularly enjoyed the roof top deck with fabulous views of the city at night.The complimentary breakfast in the lobby kept my teenagers satisfied!We will definitely stay again on future weekends in town.Tip- Join Hilton Honors for free in room Wifi

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My mom and I stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square Central for our bucket list trip. This hotel is spotless, right in the middle of everything, and a reasonable price. The staff could not have been friendlier each day! Breakfast was great in the morning, and cookies were appreciated at night. If I ever get back to New York this is the place I'd book right away!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is newest around the theater district, and the price is fairly good. The lobby looks modern and the staffs are nice and provide good services. The room is clean and with good facility.. There is a shower room in the bathroom, which looks very nice and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for just two nights. Beds and pillows were super comfy. Decor was modern but understated. Breakfast was really good with a nice selection of choices. But I got the distinct impression that as soon as you took your last bite they wanted you out because there was someone coming to clear off the table right away. Great location for walking to Times Square and great proximity to the subway. However, had I not been sharing the room and costs with my sister I wouldn't have stayed there. A bit too pricey for my tastes but then hey, it's New York!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in a great location to see all you want to see around the City. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating --- they just did not seem to know the word "no" - nice job. Clean - fresh and welcoming lobby. The rooms were clean and fresh --- service staff was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything was great but cleaning staff was slow. Went out in the morning came back to change for a show around 1:00. She didn't seem to happy when I asked her to come back in 40 minutes. The room was clean when we returned that evening.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is fantastic! It faces the back of the theater where Aladdin was! We were just a few minutes away from Broadway, the subway, Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, food, and so much more! The staff was helpful. The breakfast was good and varied. I would stay again and will tell friends and family to check it out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was in a good location for theater. There were many good restaurants nearby. I recommend restaurant row in the upper 40's off 7th and 8th avenues. The room was clean and comfortable. The free breakfast was very good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton is sparkly clean and new. Really pretty lobby and the desk staff is super nice and very helpful - they ooze with positive energy and smiles! Luis the front doorman could not be more friendly, positive, helpful or energetic! I don't know how you have a whole staff of exceptional people worked at this hotel, but someone is doing all of the right things is hiring and managing them. The rooms are small, but very nicely decorated and super clean. The rooms were quiet to inside noise, but Times Square is a little noisy, so you might ask for a room not overlooking 41st St. I will stay there again. i highly recommend this hotel to business travels or to tourists. They really understand hospitality and they do it right! As a side not, Dino who works at the Hilton Garden across the street is a real asset as an employee -he helped me out, and he didn't have to. He came to my rescue happily and with enthusiasm! What great guys who have as employees in Luis and Dino!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were particularly pleased with the accommodations and the staff. The hotel was very clean and the staff was hospitable. I just wished that the room had a microwave and a refrigerator. Prior stays at Hampton Inns provided both.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was conveniently located. Times Square and Theater District was within walking distance. The hotel was clean and staff was professional and courteous. Rooms are small but average for New York City. Breakfast is included.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It is a nice comfortable hotel ....really I want to visit NYC again and stay in Hampton inn ....nice place near to everything...(( like tomes square...M&M world ...and many many places)) ...they served yamy break fast .. gooood service , clean rooms ... they are really collaborator with the guests...there is also a washing room (laoundry) so you can wash your clothes when ever you want.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Comfortable stay overall, though we found the room size and beds were a little too compact for our liking. Right smack at Times Square, convenient location for our travels in NYC. Buffet breakfast was a plus considering the price we paid for other hotels. Free flow of drinks at the lobby and hot chocolate was pretty amazing. Would love to be back! =)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Helpful, pleasant and engaging through out our stay. Breakfast staff were on top of refilling the food, and very pleasant while being very busy. Great suggestions when asked for ideas on where to eat and things to do!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was the first time I've ever visited New York and I have to say the hotel went above and beyond to help make my stay a great stay I was early and they were willing to help with everything I needed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Visited in late June with my best friend for a girls weekend. We arrived early around noon and were allowed to go ahead and check into our room. We were very appreciative of this gesture as we didn't have to store our luggage and were able to go ahead and begin sight seeing without worrying about having to come back later to get settled into our room. The room was well appointed, very clean, and actually larger than I expected for NYC. The front desk staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. The beds were some of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in recently and the WiFi worked well and my phone connected automatically. As others have said breakfast was crowded but the staff was always amazing and the choices were plentiful. The coffee was better than I expected. I was just thankful the hotel offered a free breakfast as many don't. On the day we checked out, we had a late afternoon flight and requested a late check out which the hotel granted without hesitation. I couldn't have asked for a better location or a better experience. Would definitely recommend. The concierge was great--we didn't use him to purchase tickets but for directions and advice. He was so much fun to talk with--a real character!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was perfect to get around to multiple things we wanted to do. The room was very clean. The breakfast had several things to choose from and was very good. We were traveling with teenagers so it was nice the Internet was included in the price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I normally stay at the Hilton Times Square literally on the other side of the street but I need a gym and they seem to have been renovating theirs for months and months. I wasn't disappointed with the gym at the Hampton Inn which was never crowded and, spacious and well equipped. The hotel is very new which was a big draw for me but due to the price point of Hampton Inns, this hotel is not ideal for business travelers since it is packed with tourists from all over the world who seek value and location.However, the staff are all very helpful and friendly and rooms are clean (not roomy though) and relatively quiet. My only complaint is that the free breakfast at peak times is like feeding time at the zoo and it is difficult to get in and out quickly when you are in a hurry. I ended up going very early before going to the gym in the mornings to avoid the onslaught. The breakfast itself is nothing exciting but everything is there and certainly plenty of it. In summary, good value, excellent location for Times Square and midtown and probably a lot more pleasant outside of peak summer vacation season if you are a business traveller.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here as a group for my daughter's dance school. The location was great, close to everything. It was clean and felt safe. The staff was friendly. It was quiet in the hotel, could not hear outside noise. Breakfast was included.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was my first trip to New York. This hotel was a great choice. It was steps away from Time Square and next door to Broadway shows yet it still managed to be very quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is located right off Times Square so price can't be beat for location. Has valet parking for a fee or you can park elsewhere on your own. Rooms are well appointed, clean, and a good size for NYC. I recommend getting a room on a lower level since during high traffic times (830-11) the elevator is insanely busy so you may wait a long time for it then hit every floor on the way down. As everyone states breakfast is a mad house. Try to get there before 9am to avoid crowds. It's typical Hampton Inn fare (waffles, eggs, juice, coffee, oatmeal, cereal, etc). What helps breakfast be more bearable is the amazing staff there. They are incredibly friendly, helpful, and attentive. Tip them if you can because they work hard! I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We will never ever stay in another hotel when we are in NY again.1) They greeted us with such enthusiasm and care; we also received a "care package" with a water, cookie and macaroon.2) beautiful rooms with a great view now matter what side you are placed3) it has access to the roof where you can view a part of Manhattan - it's amazing4) it has a guest laundry room, fitness center, complimentary breakfast (which consists of cereals, eggs with sausages and breads, bagels and muffins, as well as waffles.5) in the lobby there is complimentary coffee, hot chocolate, teas and waterWe were at the hotel on the 4th of July, and after breakfast we received complimentary Happy 4th packs with water, oat loaves and a pop tart.The vibe and friendliness of staff is amazing. Never again am I staying over in another hotel. This place rocks!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were so impressed at the cleanliness and location of this Hampton Inn. I can't say enough. And the price was very reasonable. The location was in the heart of Times Square. We could easily walk to anything. I would love to stay here anytime we're in NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has a great location less than a block away from the Ports Authority Bus terminal and in the midst of Midtown Manhattan, Times Square. Rooms are very clean the staff is very nice. The breakfast amenity can be improved, in that egg beaters ares used, instead of real eggs. The difference is quite obvious. Also, disposable silverware is used. Given the price of the hotel, real silverware should be offered. The internet service is quite slow. Finally, the Hotel maintained a double payment hold on my credit card for three (3) business days after I checked out. This is not necessary because I paid the hotel in full upon arrival and did not incur in any room charges.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently spent 3 night in NYC for a long weekend. This is our 3rd trip to the city and having stayed in other hotel in Times Square, this one is the best yet!!! When selecting a hotel one needs to consider the location of the closest subway station. There a 3 stations that supports nearly every line near this hotel, one of those stops is right across the street. Another great perk for choosing this hotel is the free breakfast, and if you have every been to NYC free is not a word you will hear often. This will be my choice to stay when we return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in June. The hotel is in a very convenient location near Times Square. We normally just need a clean room to crash in at night as we are out the whole day. On one of the days, when we returned at 8:30pm, our room had not been cleaned and the beds were not made. We complained to the front desk staff and went out again to return back at 10:30 in the night to find the room in the same state. On complaining again, the front desk was very apologetic and supplied us with fresh towels and toiletries and one night’s rent was waived off. The breakfast is pretty basic but sufficient to start your day. At 9am (peak breakfast hour), the wait time for the elevators can be 15 min. The free Wifi is quite patchy and one has to login again for every day of the stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room was new and clean. The breakfast had good variety. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They had drinks (tea, coffee, hot chocolate, lemon water) 24 hour in the lobby. They also had cookies and cup cakes in the afternoon. The location was very close to everything needed. I will definitely return again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel to stay in if you want to be close to Times Square. The location is brilliant but once inside you could be miles away. It's really quiet in the bedrooms (which are spotless) and the public areas are well maintained and have the feel of quality running through them. The free breakfast provides many choices and you can go back as many times as you want to to bulk up for the day.All of the staff are friendly, professional and engaging but special mention must be made of Geraldine Meehan, our Breakfast Ambassador. Geraldine welcomed us on our first day, showing us where everything was and even finding a table for us. She also made suggestions and gave us hints and tips for getting the best out of our visit throughout our stay. A true ambassador for both the hotel and the city.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and we will definately be staying here when we next visit New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The prices are decent and the property is brand new. Also it's located right off of Times Square proper so you're only a block and a half away from the center. All the typical tourist attractions are within walking distance. Also the staff is very friendly.Definitely worth staying here if you want to "do NYC"

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great Hampton. Clean and fresh and functional. Location, as stated by many is excellent. We did not drive, but as this is located centrally, I believe driving and parking would be very expensive. Entrance to the hotel is on the side street which makes for a quiet experience. The rooms aren't exceptionally large, but for New York, comfortable enough. Our room was a end room, and did not have a tub or separate toilet.The staff is very friendly and professional. Breakfast is standard fare, but well attended. The hotel as a much nicer ambiance than generally felt at Hamptons, so if you are looking for New. York economy, with a bit of flair, this is the place.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Hampton. Very friendly people and ultra new everything as the hotel had recently been built. Very good positioning for Broadway shows, visiting Times Square and more. Room was extremely comfortable and well designed. I would absolutely stay at this Hampton versus an overpriced full service Hilton in the City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel had an excellent location. Very accomodating staff which always ensured my satisfaction. Appreciated very much that they were able to check me in early upon my arrival. Room was spacious and very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and though the room was small, there was always a place to sit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As a new property, this hotel was very clean and the rooms were a little large than average NYC rooms. The elevators can be a little slow during peak hours and the breakfast can be crowded during those times, but you will find that at most NY hotels. I really enjoyed my stay here.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Times Square Hilton is a decent tourist class hotel and it is very well located. You are just a block or two from the heart of Times Square and that block gives you a quitter sleeping experience. Just don't expect any frills from the room. However the rooms and carpet looks ready for a little spruce up. What is nice is the bathroom, it is large enough and modern enough to be comfortable and useable. This trip we skipped the included breakfast facility but a quick walk through showed about what you would expect in a large clean looking space.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel accomadations very good. Breakfast bar would be better if pastries and bagels were from local business versus frozen prepackaged items. Staff are pleasant and attentive . View from room was wonderful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Worst breakfast experience ever. I came down for breakfast. They ran out of butter, ketchup and milk; this is what I am aware of at 7am; who knows what else would run out later in the morning. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND booking this hotel if you are planning to have breakfast. There is not adequate seating area for people, and they are recommended to eat in the lobby or take it to the room. There is one lady rushing around doing everything while the rest just walk in and out of the kitchen empty handed and do not give any help when asked.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time in New York and it couldn't have been any better. The night crew was awesome from Kerrol the supervisor. Thomas who was awesome and very friendly. Letti with her great smile. And Johnny who took care of all of our car services for us. Thomas was very warm and helpful with anything we needed. It's hard to get great service now a days but they where great would recommend staying here and will when we return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed one night at this beautiful hotel and could not have been happier with our experience. Upon check-in we were given a bag of snacks and bottled water for being HH members which was a nice touch. The staff were very nice and accommodating too.Our room was super clean, bed was comfy, and the view was great! Super close to Times Square!We'll definitely stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The third and final leg of our trip to the USA, after six days on the Upper West Side of NYC and three nights in Glastonbury, CT, we return to NYC for three nights (20th-23rd June 2016) in Times Square. Hotel is just off Times Square on 41st street just down from the corner of 7th Ave. Easy walk to Times Square. We again booked this through Expedia think we got a reasonable deal. Although splitting our trip as we did possible meant we paid a little more for this last three nights. Arrived from Grand Central (from our train journey from New Haven CT) in a yellow taxi – reception was expecting us and check-in was very easy. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful. Note this is a busy/popular hotel but still seems calm. Our room was on the 18th floor (1801) and it was lovely. Exactly what we have come to expect from a Hilton Brand (We are Hilton hhonors members). A king size bed plenty of storage space and a fabulous bathroom with nice toiletries. All was very clean and there were drinks you can make in the room – snacks can be purchased at reception but they provide complimentary hot drinks and water 24hrs a day in reception – you can also get a cookie! If you are brave there is a roof space you can go to look around (Did the top of the rock but this felt...). There is complementary breakfast provided; this is ok. Dining room is not large and gets very busy around 9am but staff cope well and try to keep things flowing. Its buffet style and served on disposable plates etc. There is a reasonable choice and hot items change each day. There is plenty of coffee and tea. There seems to be a carryout bag if you are in a hurry.We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel would come again and would recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the time I entered the lobby to check in on June 9 until I left the hotel on June 10, I had an outstanding experience at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square. The people were so courteous and helpful. The room was exquisite -- even got some ideas for redecorating my master bathroom. The food was over the top -- love the turnkey sausages and fresh fruit. The support staff reflects excellent leadership and management. To all, job well done.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Clean good sized rooms. Breakfast was wonderful many choices. Hotel is located perfect for getting all around Manhattan. Subway entrances on each corner of the block.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Proximity to the Theater district and subways and Times Square could not have been better. Close to excellent restaurants and shopping. Staff and facility were excellent though I was disappointed in the mattress and not having a refrigerator in the room. Area was safe.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel this year was beyond expectations for the location. We booked for the location expecting just to use the room/hotel to "sleep" and explore new York from. From walking into the reception area the family (4 adults) where impressed and we where all excited to see the room and everything else the hotel had to offer.. The room was spacious and very clean, a large safe to store valuables in (laptops too, that big). An iron and board neatly stored in the wardrobe and just enough hangers for our clothes. The lifts are a minor glitch and if you are on the very lower floors would be quicker to use the stairs and one of the stairs exit directly into the small canteen. Now the breakfast canteen is exactly what it is, what it isn't is a restaurant so don't be disappointed. It's where you make breakfast, toast, waffles and cereals. Scrambled egg, sausages, bacon and porridge are on offer and is topped up on a regular basis... Now the problem, seating you can find yourself waiting a long time for a seat. We tried different times for breakfast but this was really hit and miss, so if you go in and get some hot food it may be cold by the time you get a seat!! The staff in the canteen where brilliant, friendly and attentive and always had a smile (not false) Teddy and Geraldine this was refreshing. The reception area is superb, seating and the free tea/coffee 24/7 is a real touch. The little shop is priced high so plan ahead but it's convenient! There is a large monitor screen of which is interactive/touch control map of new York once again another great touch. Lastly there is a private taxi firm outside and you can book these from the man outside, beware this is very expensive to JFK $100 was the quote.. We walked up 7th Ave (outside turn right) and you can hail a taxi in seconds and is a fixed price to JFK $70!! We told this to the man this and his whole attitude to us change becoming rude and disinterested in us (I had a word regarding this, no tip!!!) All and all very impressed with this hotel central to all that new York has to offer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything in NYC is pricy, but this is moderately priced for mid-town. Close to all the action and the rooms are spacious enough and quiet. The free breakfast is a hit, but the dining room can get crowded. It is open from 8 to 10 AM - get there before 9!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family and I LOVED staying here. When we come back to New York, which will hopefully be soon, we will be staying here again. TEDDY, a lady that works in the kitchen was SOOOO SWEET. She talked to us every morning while we were eating our breakfast. GOOO TEDDY keep up the good work, You're awesome!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I just returned from a 6night stay in this hotel (non smoking, accessible with roll in shower) It is in a great location with friendly staff (Luis was very customer focused along with all of the staff we came across). Just one warning for those who are petite wheelchair users like me, the sink is at a standard height which meant: I couldn't brush my teeth, wash my face and hands properly. I informed Carlos (the manager) and he apologised and said that's the standard height in all rooms if not higher. I am lucky enough to have full use of my arms so I was able to adapt. Also the floor gets pretty wet when the shower is used (if the curtain was longer I'm sure this wouldn't be a problem). If you use a wheelchair the bathroom floor can look really dirty when your wheels get wet so ask for more towels if this bothers you to lay on the floor to soak up water when the shower is used. If you do not have any physical problems then this hotel has lovely staff and is in a great location to stay in whilst you explore New York. I would have given a higher rating had the sink been lower.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This place is top notch. The staff were some of the best I have seen. Every shift, every position, top notch! Special kudos to Geraldine in the Breakfast area! WOW. She made my mornings very comfortable. The staff at the desk were knowledgable and friendly every time I visited with them. I was on a long stay of 10 days and the housekeeping department made sure, even with my crazy work hours, that the room was clean and comfortable after returning each night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Let's face it, a clean, affordable hotel in NYC is a rare find. This hotel was in the heart of TimesSquare, very clean, great coffee & tea service 24 hrs a day, and highly convenient to many locations. The rooms were a touch small, but other than that, it was a great spot. New York can be loud, but our room was very quiet, and we were even facing the street! We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The pre-selected room was the reason we chose to stay at this hotel; view of Times Square. Upon check in, we were told that our room was no longer available and we were provided a room opposite the views that we selected and called in advance about. The front desk staff seemed annoyed to provide directions or recommendations. The Hoyle elevator didn't operate well. We would often go half way up to our room only to wind back in the lobby and try again. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This brand new hotel (as of July 2015) was perfect. Staff friendly and helpful (especially Teddie in the breakfast area), excellent location, all the amenities- including a computer area, free coffee/tea 24/7, touch-screen interactive map, etc., and fair pricing. We were given a room with a city view, as reserved, and much to my surprise, it was pretty quiet. Initially, I was a little worried being so close to the Port Authority because Fodor's stated that area can still be a little 'seedy.' My mom and I felt VERY safe around Times Square central - people abound, but all good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
