review_body: Hotel was very nice. Central location was perfect! Would definitely stay here again! Staff was very courteous and helpful. Very close to subway stations and a lot of the major attractions. Great place to stay for a family vacation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a GREAT hotel in NY! AFFORDABLE, CLEAN, SAFE, have actual bathroom doors not sliders, VERY PEACEFUL IN THE HEART OF TIMES SQUARE! Loved it! 3 night stay this month from South FL although we are NY natives. Breakfast included. Next to anything and everything (food, entertainment, shopping, and transportation). Staff is very friendly, accommodating, and welcoming. Will be our go to when in NY from now on! Thank You Hampton Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Time Square Central on West 41st St. We checked in with Thomas, who was so kind. After traveling for hours, it was so good to see a kind, helpful person who wanted to make sure we were happy and taken care of. Also at the desk, after coming and going sight-seeing, we met Chris and Carol at the front desk. They too were super, wanting to make sure our stay was comfortable. The breakfast was GREAT and the staff for the morning breakfast was excellent also. They had a great selection of breakfast items, enough to get you going for a full day. I would definitely stay here again and definitely recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square Central on West 41st st. We checked in with Thomas who was so kind. After traveling several hours it was so good to see a kind helpful person who wanted to make sure we were happy and taken care of. We also met while going in and out to sightsee, Chris and Carol at the front desk. They too were wonderful. The breakfast staff was amazing also. They made sure everything was out and ready for the guest to enjoy breakfast. There was also a great variety of things. The location was super!!! Close to alot of things, right around the corner from Times Square. Everything here was great!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This 41st location hosts a "fresh" Hampton that is nestled in a great location for whatever reason you visit the City! Easy walk to theaters, Times Square a stone's throw, close to restaurants and Subway across the street. "BlackCars" out front at your disposal when needed and easy walking distance to Penn Station. Best is the smiling front desk crew ready to help with any request and offer water on hot summer days. Rooms are good size, clean and fresh! I recommend this Hampton to anyone visiting NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for just one night on our last night in NYC. Close to everything....Times Square, subways, bus station, theaters. Our room was clean and comfortable with a great bed and free WIFI. The included breakfast has a nice variety of items and would definitely satisfy anyone. The breakfast area gets full at times and then there are no tables available but the staff will quickly clean off a table and have you seated. I really appreciated the very efficient and fast check in and check out process. We arrived early but the front desk allowed us to check in and go to our room immediately which was a big plus for me!!! I definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were decent size for New York. Just remember that you probably will not spend a lot of time in the room. So I would not recommend spending a lot of money. This hotel was around $300 which is pretty reasonable for NYC. The only thing I would change is the location. We wanted close to Times Square which it was but the crowds were crazy! Trying to walk anywhere was an obstacle course. If I had to do it again I would have gone a few more blocks away from Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Visiting New York City is as exciting as it is exhausting. This hotel is located in the thick of tourist activity, which makes accessibiltiy easier. Subway was a bit tricky to navigate, but climbing all those uncessary stairs makes that cheesecake taste much less guilty! The hotel is very clean, and employees exceptional helpful and nice. Need to be patient with the elevator at peak breakfast and check in times. There is always coffe, water and cookies in the afternoon. However, the most spectacular, special part about this hotel is the customer service at breakfast. I can not say enough nice things about Geraldine. She is a wonderful, hardworking, pleasant, and beautiful lady. Remembers to ask about your previous day, and what plans are for the current day. She helps make that breakfast room run like clockwork. Our stay would not have been the same without her. She alone, makes me want to come back. I do also want to put a shout out to Teddy. Her tireless efforts were not unnoticed. Thank you for putting out your best to start our day.Cara, Dawn and Nate

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn has everything you need to be on Times Square at an excellent rate. Location, SERVICE IS GREAT. It includes full breakfast buffet, free wi fi in room, free internet with printer at lobby with 3 computers, coffee, tea, 24 hours, a very knowledgeable Concierge service (John) and the staff makes everything to keep you happy and comfortable. Rooms are spacious, toiletries are Neutrogena, and housekeeping makes your stay an unforgettable one. After the Hotel, its location is the best. Train station right at the corner. Times Square a block away, and you are in the middle of 7th and 8th Avenue.. Nothing else to ask for. This will be my home base every time I visit NY. I have never seen such a compromised staff. From the janitor, to the doorman, and the Front Desk. In sum, my stay from June 2nd to the 6th in this property was AWESOME.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful hotel with free breakfast in the morning. Geraldine was especially helpful with accommodating us with our breakfast needs and making us feel welcome every day. She offered to freeze our water the night before so we would have cold water in our hot work environment the next day, and her friendly conversation made us feel at home.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this property is great, near Times Square and Port Authority (buses, subways). Rooms are a good size, considering NYC hotels in this price range are usually skinny (vertical) and skimp on room size. Roomy bathroom. Entire room and bath were very clean, updated decor in the recent past. Very comfortable beds & bedding. Love the complimentary wifi. Free breakfast is super-nice, but average. Staff seems to enjoy their jobs and were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was excellent, 1/2 block from the subway station. The room was clean and very contemporary looking. The front desk staff was friendly and maid service was excellent. My only criticisms are that the elevators sometimes have a mind of their own and they need a larger breakfast area. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel very well situated near Times Square and the theaters. Good breakfast and clean room. Modern and confortable room, clean bathroom. Good service by the concierge. Very helpful and kind people. Very good service in general.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really liked the modern décor in the rooms and public spaces. The staff were great. Internet was free and reliable. There was also a good business center. The self-serve laundry was very much appreciated. There was a free breakfast in a very pleasant room. Good city views from the upper floors.Upper floors are also better for elevator service - they fill up quickly on the way down in the morning. Close to theaters and restaurants in Times Square and Hell's Kitchen, and to subway and bus lines.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel and great location. The free breakfast was wonderful! The breakfast area gets full between 8-9 but they continually replace the food. The location is right outside of Times Square . The hotel staff was friendly. It was worth every penny.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Almost a year later but still worth it. I've contemplated writing a review for this hotel and so bummed that we didn't take any pictures. However for my first time visiting NYC this hotel was exactly what me and my friend needed for our BFF get away. This hotel was right in the neck of everything! The rooms are small like other reviewers stayed and just enough room for two. The breakfast was like any other complementary breakfast and we were satisfied the once or twice times we ate. A little trouble checking in because of an extra fee we had to pay but it was worked out in no time. The hotels employees were all helpful and always had a pleasant spirit. Definitely deserving of the rate and I can't wait to visit NYC again. :D :D

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton In June 10 - 12, 2016. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed comfortable. The safe actually worked. They provide breakfast which was a very convenient addition especially if travelling with kids. The staff are friendly. I loved the computer station in the lobby. Great stay in Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Most big hotels in New York are similar -- small, basic and uninspired, but who spends a lot of time in their hotel room while they are visiting NYC! So, what makes the Hampton Inn - Times Square Central so excellent:+ Location for Broadway shows and other Times Square attractions, Bryant Park, NYC Main Public Library, Grand Central (which means you can get pretty much anywhere by subway)+ The friendliest hotel staff I have encountered in a NYC hotel.+ Pretty substantial breakfast (and even a baggy snack if you don't have time for a sit-down breakfast), in-room WIFI, coffee/tea and cookies in the lobby are all included. You feel taken care of and not nickeled and dimed.+ New, modern, clean rooms with great sound-proofing. Our room was right across from the elevators and we never heard a sound. If I had to nit-pick, my negatives would be:- The shower curtain didn't quite close all the way, so we kept getting the bathroom floor wet. - And while the bathroom was huge, there was very little counter space. (Bring one of those hanging toiletry bags!)We liked the Hampton Inn - Times Square Central so much, we've booked with them again for later this year. (Note: Make sure you pick the "Central" one. There are other Hampton Inns in the area, but this is the newest one.)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just back from weeks break. Great hotel, and fab location just off Times Square close to lots of attractions and theatres. Staff all really friendly & helpful. Room was perfect base, always cleaned thoroughly and towels etc always refreshed. Great that breakfast is included and there was plenty of selection the staff in there are lovely too. Go about 7.30 to miss the 8/8.30 rush. Coffee/tea water hot choc is always available in the reception area, day and night plus cookies too. Plus there are some breakfast take out bags on reception to grab if you are in a rush. Very easy to find too, we came in on the sub and it was just one block down from 42nd. definitely recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We went for one whole week and spent a very good time in the hotel. It was just like we had expected. It was clean, very gentle staff, good breakfast and its king size bed was amazing!! If you're looking for a good hotel, you just have found it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel in an excellent location within walking distance of attractions, shows and the subway. The price is a little steep though. Elevators were hard to catch sometimes. Breakfast staff were great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location: walking distance to Broadway Shows, Time Square, Subway.Staff: friendly & helpful Front Desk Staff, loved Johnny with Valet Services, & Teddy with the Breakfast Staff was super friendly & helpful!Rooms: wonderful beds & very clean!I would choose this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was coming to town for mid morning meeting but traffic and construction made for a post midnight arrival. The greeting and check by the staff was efficient and welcoming. The room was great and the meeting the next day went very well. I hope it will mean on going business trips and I will stay at the Hampton Inn when I do.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were treated like we were the only guests at the hotel - wonderful hospitality - very accommodating and friendly staff. Breakfast was delicious and the room size was perfect. Very comfortable bed - love the Hampton bed

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had an excellent stay during our girls' trip to NYC! The hotel is very conveniently located. It's a short walk to many different tourist spots and the subways. Nearby restaurants include Schnipper's quality kitchen, carlo's bakery, and Wolfgang pucks. There is also a McDonald's (yuck) right across the street. Outside noise wasn't too bad. There were much fewer horns honking all night long from what I remember during a visit 20 years ago. The rear of the Aladdin theater is across the street, and we could hear the crowd yelling when the actors came out after the play to sign autographs. Inside noise wasn't a problem. Our room was across from the elevators, but we never heard any hall noise at night. The staff was the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. I looked forward to being greeted by Teddy in the breakfast area every morning! She made everyone feel so welcome. What a treasure she is! Breakfast was good. Typical fare. The hot dishes rotated so it's not the same every day. There are freshly baked cookies at the front desk every evening at 5, and hot coffee (or cocoa) is always available. Beds and pillows were comfortable and the rooms were clean. The only complaint I had was with our bathroom door. It was a sliding door on a rail, but pretty much the whole thing was an opaque glass panel. When my roommate got up earlier than I did, the bathroom light lit up the whole room through the glass. Very poor design choice. The rest of our group had a normal door in their room, so if you think this might be a problem, just ask. Would highly recommend!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Visited New York for Formation Tour, this hotel was perfectly located to access the subway. It was just enough away from Times Square to limit traffic, & breakfast was great. Staff was friendly, & got us checked in early. I recommend highly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice place to stay in New York, just few hundred metres from Times Square. Compact but comfortable accomodation, not much of a view despite high floor. Great reception service and reasonable breakfast included. Not particularly noisy given the location and well priced for the location. Bed quite comfortable allowing a well needed sleep after we had been travelling for more than 24hrs.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here with the family for a long weekend sightseeing trip. This hotel was WAY above my expectations - awesome, clean room, decent size for manhattan, decent breakfast, very little noise on high floors - loved it, would stay at this place again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband, son and I stayed here for 6 nights. We chose this hotel for the location and free breakfast. We were not disappointed! The location was central to many of our destinations and very close to a major subway station. We were able to walk to the 2 Broadway shows we saw as well as many wonderful restaurants and of course Times Square. There was even a Walgreens only a few blocks away which was a great place to pick up snacks and drinks. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good with a variety of both hot and cold foods. The eggs and meat selections changed daily. The most delightful service was the 24 hour ice water, coffee and hot tea along with freshly baked cookies in the lobby. Our room was clean and comfortable, though a bit small. It was adequate for our family of 3. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to any of my family members or friends. It made for a great vacation!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Love this place Teddy and manager Gerry were great Hope to be back soonGreat location and service,Can't say enough about breakfast buffet. Room was super cozy and clrean, front desk staff took care of all our needs in a speedy professional manner. Thank you again!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was wonderful! The front desk staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the elevator was amazingly fast (but you don't even feel it move!) Our room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely recommend it to everyone. The location couldn't be better and the breakfast was plentiful and fresh and delicious! I would love to stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hotel is new and its amenities are fresh. The staff really stood out during our stay. Ebony in the complimentary Breakfast area and Kevin the morning manager were delightful. Location is normally the strong point but the personnel at this Hampton Inn made our trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The greatest advantage of this property is its location. Times Square is abt 5 min walk, port authority terminal, Penn stn., Broadway theatres, cafes, super markets, gentlemen clubs, shopping malls, top attractions, all in walking distance. Check in was quick. They provided earlier check in, which is to be acknowledged. I think this chain of hotels don't provide Bell desk facility. So we managed luggages on our own. Standard Rooms were clean and spacious enough for our family of four with two boys aged 14 and 16 years. Bathrooms were also OK in size. Beds were comfy. The corridors in the floors were bit narrow for easy commutation. Our intent to visit NYC was sightseeing and hence spent least time in the room. Hence, Iam not coming up with any serious concern on rooms. The lobby had a 24 hour counter for complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate options. This was wonderful as we were able to sip and enjoy a small doses of choice after our early morning and midnight walks. The wifi was complimentary and was working fine both in the rooms and lobby. There were computer workstations and work tables in the lobby area for guest use, which is complimentary as well. Water bottles in rooms were charged. Hence, we picked up bigger cans in a grocery store nearby. The gentleman in the travel desk was supportive for guiding on local tours and reservations for Broadway shows. The breakfast was overall disappointing. 1. Limited spread and choice, 2. Space constraint, 3. Usage of paper plates and cups under the disguise of Eco preservation. ( but they provided plastic forks, knifes and spoons, which should not have been in true spirit. We don't mind paper plates, if the trumpet blowing for Eco preservation wasn't done. ) Hotel staff were courteous, willing and supportive. Cheers to them. I got a good deal for the pricing considering the Hilton brand and location. I can recommend this hotel and shall definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The employees are phenomenal!! They work with sincerity and are professional.I stayed on 8th street in December and heard too many noises. This Hampton is in a better location as it sits in between 7th and 8th. Much less noise.The breakfast that is complimentary is very satisfying. Also available to you in the lobby is coffee, tea, and water. In the evenings there are a variety of cookie choices by the check in desk.A casual walk to Times Square took 8 minutes. From my room to the desk of the Top of World Observatory was 25 minutes, and a casual walk to Saint Patricks Cathedral was right at 15 minutes.The The New York Times building is two doors away. Carlo's bakery is a 1/2 block, so is a Subway station. Generally speaking, for my family of four that includes an 18 and 15 year old, the rooms could have been larger. We had to be strategic at times to get around each other. If returning to the area, my wife and I agree, we would stay here again if only the two of us, but search for a larger room if bringing kids.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel offers the best service in for a hotel in Times Square. Every staff member goes above and beyond to help the guests. The rooms are spotless. Terrific breakfast. The decor is really fresh and bright. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Times Square/Midtown Area of NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very clean hotel that is new, The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Free breakfast is a huge plus and location is fantastic! One block from Time Square is very convenient with easy access to trains,

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a June weekend. The staff were great and friendly. We stayed on the 27th floor and the view faced downtown which was great. Everything's was clean throughout. Great rooftop view facing uptown. I would recommend and stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Room was very nice, quiet and on a high floor. everything looked new. The best thing was the staff whom we interacted with. They seemed genuinely pleased we were there. Of particular note was Johnny, who greeted us at the front door and accompanied us to the front desk, Carmen, who checked us in and John, the concierge. As far as we can see this staff really wants to make people feel comfortable. They found out it was an anniversary trip for us and when we returned to our room after a day is sightseeing in Manhattan, we found a nice hand written welcome card, signed by Carmen and Johnny, and a little bag of goodies. They DO have customer service. Other hotels could learn something from the Hampton Inn Times Square Central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Location, just off Times Square and within walking distance to most major sightseeing venues in Manhattan. Rooms were quiet, good size for Manhattan and spotlessly clean. Complimentary breakfast and free wifi were good benefits.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: stayed with family. we arrived early morning and did not expect an early check in..the staff at the reception was super friendly and helped us do an early check in by 10am which was very nice. Good clean room, great location, decent hot breakfast and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just finished a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Manhattan Central. It's a nice hotel near all the action of Times Square and Broadway. While the rooms are a tad bit small, they are completely functional, besides who comes to NYC to stay in their room anyway? Our room on the 17th floor was very clean including the bathroom, and best of all very quiet. The breakfast buffet was quite good, better than expected, and if your traveling with picky eaters, there's a McDonald's across the street. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We look forward to our next visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights and we couldn't be more please with the hotel. Service was excellent upon check-in and the offer of free bottled water was a plus. The room was a bit smaller than I would have preferred but expected with a NYC hotel. The included breakfast each morning was a huge savings and very convenient. The food varied enough each morning so we didn't get bored with it, yet the same staples of Belgian waffles and bagels were available for those who want that each time. The cookies in the lobby in the evening were also a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the heart of the city. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is good and the space is very nice. There are great restaurants, bars, shows just blocks away. All major subways and train stations are within walking distance. Bryant park, is few minutes walk, has lots of activities and good place to hang out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton by Hilton was a very nice property. Upon arrival the guest facilitated our e-check in without any problems. While the rooms were a bit tight they were clean and well appointed. The hotel's location is great. Just steps away from Times Square, shopping, good restaurants, and Broadway. The complimentary breakfast was good and the staff more than willing to provide assistance. The Roof Top provided a unique get away within the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a good experience. The room was clean and comfortable and the location was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was small and the breakfast space was cramped for the number of people, although that is expected for the location. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room was on the 26th floor and was very quiet. It was also clean and the bed was comfortable. All of the staff that I encountered were friendly and helpful.I asked about hiring a car for a play I was attending at BAM in Brooklyn. They immediately arranged for it. The car arrived early to take me to the theatre and very soon after the play was over. The price was reasonable as well.The only complaint I have is the breakfast. The food was awful and the breakfast room was too crowded to be able to sit there. I was actually glad that the dishes were paper and plastic so I could take it back to my room to eat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was a block away from Times Square, a block from the Subway, we walked from the hotel to most every spot we wanted to see. The rooms were clean, beds were so comfortable, even the bathrooms were spacious. We were expecting the breakfast to consist of muffin and a banana...Nope, I ate belguim waffles and fruit every morning, my husband had eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt...unbelievable. We ate a large breakfast which held us over until late afternoon. We even were treated to water/coffee AND warm cookies after our excursions through the city. Plus the view from the rooftop was nice.Staff were very friendly, and they held our bags for us until it was time to check in so that we could start touring the city. I booked through Priceline.com and received a really nice rate on our room.Overall - a fantastic hotel that I would highly recommend to friends and family that visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great rooms, breakfast and location. Staff was very friendly. Nice and quiet at night.John got us great theatre tickets and was a wealth of information! We look forward to staying at this location again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 41st Street seems a bit dark and I would not recommend this location to a woman traveling on her own. Other than that it is a great place to explore the Times Square are amd short walk to Macy's. The front desk staff st the Hanpton Inn is super nice and makes you feel welcomed immediately. The new look seems to be a bit much design in the lobby. Compared to that the rooms are a bit old-fashioned but also free of clutter

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location is great. Room was very small. We had a King Bed and bed took pretty much the whole room. We are use to staying at Hampton Inn's at several other cities and these rooms were the smallest. Very close to Times Square and Broadway. Everything is close including shopping and Restaurants.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As usual the Hampton Inn delivered in many areas. It was clean and quiet in the rooms with good service and hospitality. I am just getting tired of the paper plates, plastic utensils, and having to fight for a seat at breakfast (and that is the worst "orange juice" known to man I think). The location was great but the bathroom door was a sliding door with a frosted glass door that you could pretty much see through and definitely hear everything through...not good. Not all rooms have that kinds of bathroom though. I think I would try to find a smaller hotel next time that doesn't have so many people coming through at all time (we had to wait 10 minutes for an elevator a couple times).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It is only good for stay with no room facilty. Not good for money except location. Will not prefer this hotel if have choice nor will suggest to others. As I will explore more hotels with in this area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is new. Free hot breakfast in the morning. The room was small but nice. There is also a safe in the room. Has a laundry room which was very convenient. It is across the street from the subway and just off of times square. The staff was outstanding!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had a great stay at Hampton Inn Central!! Great location to Time Square and subway. The only problem was our last day being woken up at 4 something in am by the fire alarm and having to evacuate to lobby but I guess we had to leave NY with a little bit of excitement!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed in this hotel recently with my family for 5 nights. Location of this hotel is excellent as it is just few minutes walk away from Times Square - most happening place. Also it is close to the many restaurants and just 3 minutes walk to Port Authority Bus Terminal. What I liked most in this Hampton Inn Central is that very prompt and fairly elaborate spread of Break Fast in the morning.Though it looks bit crowded with guests between 8.00 to 8.30 AM, I felt the staff members are very quick and prompt in replenishing the items, when finished. also they have system of packed break fast available at reception counter for the people do not have time to sit in the restaurant. Also I appreciate their system, when I return to hotel in the evening after good hard work, some complimentary cookies and bottle of water is kept at Reception. Though they might be for HH members, but the staff were very liberal and I felt very homely. Bath rooms design is latest and looks clean and neat including the towels.  Only issue I had during my stay here is that my cell phone did not get good reception of signals.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Whilst the hotel was in a great location in the heart of Manhattan, the price was very expensive. A complementary breakfast was provided which was very basic. I arrived late on the first night & was surprised the hotel did not have a restaurant. The bedroom, however, was very comfortable

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location right at the heart of theatre district. Friendly staff, free breakfast, clean room. No complaints. Stayed for 1 night wish we had more time to enjoy area. Everybody at hotel very helpful

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is fairly new. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Although located a few blocks from Times Square, our stay at the Hampton was quiet and restful. The breakfast was adequate. The location of this hotel is close to the blue and yellow line subways.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The property is close to everything but off the beaten path. While the rooms are small they're well appointed. Great choice for a business trip into the city. Breakfast was good; a typical Hampton breakfast but again, the dining area is small. There is a McD's across the street. The staff was very friendly and professional. In fact we had a 5am fire alarm and they handled it very well. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoy staying in Hampton Inns when we travel, though in a place like New York, I usually prefer a hotel with charm as opposed to a chain. I booked this hotel, though, after reading reviews and was pleasantly surprised that it had both the charm of a boutique hotel and the comfort, great linens and breakfast that you expect from a Hampton Inn (not to mention Hilton Honors points). The lobby is really modern and attractive. Our room was not huge, but it was big enough and I have had much smaller rooms in NYC. The bathroom was very modern. You can't beat the location either. Just a block or two from Times Square but on a street that is much quieter than the ones that front Times Square. We stayed on the 29th floor and had a nice view and absolutely no street noise. I also liked that on both our floor and in lobby there was a display that showed you the location of each of the three elevators. I would stay here again without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yes, breakfast is free, but it might better if one paid for it. It was average except for the oatmeal which was generally very good. Paper cups for coffee just about ensures that you won't drink any. No refrigerator. Tiny TV screen. The location is generally reasonable although it fronts what is almost a back alley.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed two nights for a theater weekend. Location is good, and the rooms feel more spacious than similarly priced hotels due to good design and room layout. I definitely would return. My only complaint was a bit of an elevator wait, but nothing compared to others in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A surprising good find in a quiet setting near Times Square. We're Hampton Inn regulars, and were pointed to this property for availability. It's a year old (we were told), good sized rooms by local standards - and handicapped accessible, which was a priority for this trip. Busy days, so elevators were slow, but car valet was fast and breakfasts were predictable with very friendly staff. Ditto for front desk crew. Happy experience!! Exercise room looked great, but no time to use it... because I overslept on comfy beds.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you are looking for a great hotel in the Times Square area of NYC, conveniently located, safe, clean, and recently updated - this is the hotel for you!. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast food was tasty and prepared well. Breakfast area staff were great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was visiting NYC on business and needed hotel located centrally. Room: It was a last minute trip, so the room was a bit pricey, but was still below the standard price for some other hotels. I was staying on the 27th floor with a city view, which was, although noisy, as expected, very pleasant. The room was not large, but designed very well, so I did not bump into things getting around. The room and the bathroom were very clean. On the down side - the bathroom has a sliding door that does not close all the way, which may create a bit of awkwardness if traveling with a business partner. Otherwise, no complaints about the room: the bedding was clean, the air conditioner worked, and the maid even changed the pillow cases during my 2-night stay. Location: the hotel is situated conveniently on 42 street, a short walk from the port authority terminal, restaurant row and theaters. A subway station is near-by, although I have not used it this time around. We did not have any issues hailing a cab. Staff: The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, too bad I did not get their names. there is 24-7 complimentary coffee station in the lobby - which is great if you are pulling an all-nighter for work. Slight negatives: the elevator - if you are in a rush and don't mind the stairs - taken them. It might take awhile before you get into that elevator, which would most likely be very full and tight. If you are looking to see a show - go to the theater and buy your ticket there. I have dealt with broker fees before (out of laziness) but these were ridiculous. I could have bought another ticket for the fees that I have paid. Overall, it was a surprisingly pleasant experience. Nothing too posh, but just what I needed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Can't think of anything other than the breakfast room space is very limited and required a waiting time on one day. Breakfast quality could be improved, but was sufficient for the short stay. Elevator waiting time is annoying.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great value, breakfast and Internet included in room rate, a must for family or business travelers. Location was perfect for catching the Buses. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place to stay when flying. Awesome shuttle service to pick us up and then to get us back to airport. Very helpful front desk and very nice breakfast. 1 1/2 block to get to public transportation to take us to Manhattan. I would stay again if in the area!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Though the rooms are small, this should generally be expected when staying in the city. The location was fantastic - close to Times Square, Bryant Park, theaters, restaurants, shops, etc. Room was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the how clearly we could hear the city noise even with the window closed, but that is obviously something that cannot be controlled and a "consequence" of choosing a hotel in this location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great value breaky and wifi included. Brilliant location next to times square and threatre section. Everything within walking distance. Lovely staff "Teddy" in buffet area such a great lady great service!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent stay...excellent location.Tobo was super nice and all staff very helpful.Breakfast was great...lots of room and staff excellent.Not sure why elevator complaints..not an issue really..a bit of patience is all.Overall would return for sure.Location was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place close to everything,breakfast was awesome and the staffs re helpful and happy ,gym s awesome and it had everything you need,new and clean. Room is great and clean,bedding re new and comfortable. We got there early and They took ur luggages first till we checked in early. Go back for sure and highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very clean and friendly hotel. Location is very convenient to subway and Times Square. Breakfast was great and staff helpful. Only downside was lengthy wait times for the elevator - especially with luggage. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 7 nights with family. Centrally located; Friendly and helpful front desk staffs; Clean and comfortable rooms; Breakfast with very good selection; All day coffee was a plus; Laundry room made available and convenient for guests;

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What you would expect from Hampton and more! Also could not beat the location. First visit for 2 of us and 2nd visit for the other two in our party. I can't believe this hotel is this nice and the location could not have been any more perfect. Staff was overly friendly and helpful. Free Hot Breakfast and 24 hour tea/coffee/hot chocolate as well as free hot cookies every evening.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location. Hotel is very clean and staffs are very friendly. Complimentary breakfast and it has pretty good selection. We usually have omelette for breakfast when traveling. Their omelette is way better than other hotels offering breakfast. We will choose this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is the only great thing about this hotel. When we pulled up the valet was MIA. We waited a while before you showed up and took our car. The front desk staff was really warm and welcoming. Our room was so small, that it actually made our stay pretty uncomfortable for a family of 4. I realize that hotel rooms in NYC are pretty small, but I've stayed in other hotels in the same location and have had way more space. The breakfast is way too crowded to enjoy. I typically love Hampton Inns and often choose this hotel chain when I am away, but sadly this location did not live up to my expectations!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in the hotel for 6 nights. Room was very comfortable and quiet (low floor) and bed was really good. Bathroom was spacious. Wifi free and excellent and TV service was very good. Breakfast was 'complimentary' and very busy - self service with hot and cold options with everything on paper plates but that was ok. It is what it is! And the staff in the Breakfast room are so friendly and helpful. Gluten free cereals available but no bread. Lots of fruits, juices and yoghurts. Loved the take away bags for days you were in a hurry. Reception and porters were really helpful during our stay. The lifts are not as bad as the other reviews made out. Location is very good for Times Square but far enough away to be peaceful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my son (16), my sister-in-law, and nephew (16). The lobby was typical (nice) Hampton Inn. The size of the room was noticeably smaller than any other Hampton Inn, but I guess that is expected in NYC. The location was perfect! The breakfast was very good as well. My main complaint is the lack of ventilation in the bathroom. Absolutely none!! The elevator situation is also awful!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First, kudos to a friendly and helpful front desk! My experience with Hampton Inn's have been pretty consistent, however at times, some do feel a little dated, and some I've stayed at have Beach Towels the size of dish towels! BUT, this Hampton Inn, for the price compared to others in Time Square was very nice for the price, a great value. The location was perfect, close to Times Square, still walk-able to Central Park (however we took train up to 72nd and walked back through the park). Walk to Empire State/Penn area is close as well. The hotel itself, the lobby was spacious, comfortable with a lot of seating, computers for airport check in, always available coffee and tea and a beautiful and interesting wall display of NYC items and art, televisions, very nice. My 30th floor room had a great city view of a few theaters and the Thomas Reuters building. The king size bed was comfortable, the room was NYC small but you could still move around just fine (there were two of us in a king room). The bathroom was clean, and the tile was new (no mold) and the shower was spacious, another NYC perk as bathrooms can be pretty small in some hotels. The included breakfast as always was good and reliable/well stocked, the only suggestion is to make the scrambled eggs and ditch the pre-made microwaveable omelets, they are ok, but these were overcooked/dry. Everything else was fantastic, bacon, fresh fruit, oatmeal, muffins, toast, bagels with all types of toppings, and don't forget the cereal.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for one night in April, as it was the most conveniently located hotel near BB King jazz Club. This hotel is clean, adorable and very homey. The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful. Our only complaint is about the elevators, who both that night and the following morning were over loaded.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right on the heart of Times Square and walking distance to 5th Ave, Central Park and next to Broadway. Is impossible to be more central. The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms are great. For the European standards the breakfast is nothing terrible .The staff is great and the only thing we miss is a nice coffee shop to eat or drink something during after hours. There are vendor machines in the lobby !! American way . I was on business trip but the stay was perfect .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was brilliant , two down sides no bar and restaurant in the morning was always busy had to eat breakfast in the foyer, food was plentiful amazing coffee in reception especially the hazelnut flavour, just round the corner from times square and right in the middle of theatre land, legends bar was a bit of a hike Empire State just a stones throw away

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is recently tastefully remodeled. Front desk and concierge very pleasant and helpful. Great value and location. Yummy breakfast with many hot and cold items. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Girlfriend getaway that I booked through booking dot com. Couldn't beat the $135 a night price! Staff was super friendly, lobby appealing and location not to be beat. The complimentary breakfast is substantial with a cereal bar, 3 warming trays, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, pastries and a self serve waffle station with toppings. The breakfast women were warm and friendly. They balanced conversing with guests and keeping things well stocked with ease. The hours for serving are 6-11am. There are many international travelers here. USB ports are available throughout the rooms and also at a large communal table in the breakfast room. Free bottled water at the front desk and lender umbrellas. It was so good, we extended our stay through the front desk. They needed to call me right back to quote a price (maybe to check Bookings rates) and came back with the same $135 rate. Noon check out and valet available. $53 a night to park with no in and out. Well done, Hampton Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Recently stayed in NYC at the Hampton Inn. The elevators were a disaster. Only 3 elevators for 25 floors and most of every morning and afternoon, at least 2 elevators were hijacked by the housekeeping. They were simply unavailable for guests!! Horrible. We were on an upper floor so walking up was not an option. I complained several times, as did many others, about the 20 minute waits for one elevator and the desk folks just said, too bad! Nothing was done to alleviate. I will NEVER stay there again. And I'm sure many feel the same way!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the minute I stepped through the door I've disliked this experience. I was online not 1 person greeted me there were 2 ppl at the desk talking the man who helped was useless. I received two double beds this is so uncomfortable nobody was able to help get a normal room with a normal size bed. I DO NOT recommend this hotel. The location is good that's IT.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was born right in New York City, but I've recently moved to Florida. I returned to the city for a few days and opted for this Hampton Inn. Even though I booked it myself, I was still amazed when I got there just how great the location was. It is one block from Times Square, one block from the Port Authority bus station, a short walk from Penn Station (train station). Countless subways and buses are a block away as well. Theaters, restaurants, it's all there. Oh, and the hotel itself was fantastic! I had a view of the Empire State Building. The room was spacious and everything was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I had a great 2 day stay here! Staff was helpful and the buffet breakfast was quite extensive! The room was clean and even had a view. I Would come back again in a heart beat! The rooftop of hotel was really cool. I didn't discover it til right before we checked out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: After an EPIC search for a hotel for our weeks stay (we've been to NYC a few times before but wanted a different hotel) we picked Hampton Inn Times Sq Central. We are delighted that we did. Rooms were very comfortable- I stayed with my Mum so we had two double beds and the room was a great size for Manhattan. The location is superb, no other words to describe it. A lot is in walking distance (Empire State, Macy's, the Piers, Central Park) and the subway is so very close indeed. The staff were friendly, especially the staff working in the breakfast room, especially the female staff who were delightfully friendly and cheerful. Breakfast hours are long, but fairly busy at times (and we had to wait a while for a table), selection is good, always something hot but the cooked food was not as wide ranging as I thought, however not one day did we go hungry and as we stocked up most days we didn't need lunch or didn't eat until 3 or 4 pm!! To date I've not stayed anywhere that has such a good free breakfast and totally free (and good) wifi connection. Definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Room size was huge for New York. We had an awesome view from the 28th floor.!LOCATION, LOCATION (Just steps from 7th ave. restaurants & theatres.Lovely breakfast and the most amazing staff. Teddy (young lady in the breakfast room)was soooo helpful, when I came late to breakfast. A bagel with all the optionsnever tasted so good!!!Will definitely be back. Jen ( from Victoria Canada)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my second stay at this hampton inn. The breakfast is great. I like hampton inns because of the waffles, but the red skin potatoes were really delish. Every morning, Ebony greeted the guests with a bright smile and cheery welcome, and kept the dining room clean. She was proactively clearing tables. I know i wasnt the only one who appreciated her. I also saw guests greet her warmly, as if they knew her well. She made my mornings with her presence. Also, i lways left a small tip before i left my room, with a small thank you note. Imagine my surprise, when i received back in return, a sweet note that thanked me and wished me a good night. This happened every night of my stay. This also made me feel very welcome. I wil definitely stay here again if i am in the area. I hope the management does not change. Thanks for the warm welcome.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location, right in the heart of Times Square. It's your standard hotel layout; however, the bed was extremely comfortable. There was little to no noise in the hallway at night. Sometimes the elevator can get a little crowded. The hotel was close to everything my family and I wanted to do in NYC - We were able to get dinner, see a show, shop, and see the sights, without having to ever get in a taxi. Great Location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a perfect location for exploring the major city attractions and the plays on Broadway. The staff and amenities were excellent. The luggage storage from check out time until our evening flight was very convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros:- Clean rooms, gym and laundry facilities.- Close proximity to public transport.- Breakfast included in room rate.- Hot beverages in the lobby.- Wifi included in room rate.Cons - noise noise noise:- Thin walls - we could hear our neighbours talking.- Doors are constantly slamming.- Squealing hairdryers - must be a Hilton thing, we stayed at Parc 55 (also a Hilton Group hotel) in San Fran which was the same.- Loud housekeeping team - every morning.- Street noise - sirens and rubbish trucks. For some reason the windows didn't block it out very well.Note: Beds are firm. Beware for those who need a plush/pillow top type bed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I traveled to NYC for a fun weekend getaway. It was that and so muck more! The hotel is located right in the heart of Times Square. We were able to walk or the doe and experience the bright lights and city life. The staff were able to give us instructions on how to get to other parts of the city, via public transportation or car. We were on the 28th floor, and didn't have any problem with noise or slamming doors. The room was a small room but it's NY, so what do you expect? It was clean and nicely decorated with a modern flair. The breakfast is a plus! Overall we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was very nice. Staff was friendly. Breakfast is included with stay, which is always a plus. Coffee and water are served in the lobby all day. My only complaints are that the room is small (very nice, but a little on the small side and which may be the norm for NYC. This was my first time staying) and you can hear everyone's door slam shut. Beds were comfy and bathroom was clean and nice. I would recommend and stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: small rooms..but clean...staff friendly and courteous..breakfast area too small to sit and elevators very cramped...parking car was convenient since they valet at front door....good location to Times Square and all broadway shows

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time in NYC. Hotel was perfict in everything! Very clean smelling rooms. Very friendly staff. Made us feel like we were home. Complimentary breakfast and bag lunches were wonderful! Perfect location for everything.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location, close to theaters, Times Square and shopping. Would stay there again for sure. Breakfast is good, free and served 6-11. Other than slow elevators there is no complaints. Rooms are nice, typical New York size, not huge but roomy enough.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I first stayed at this hotel September 2014 since it's located one block from my office in Times Square and have repeated booked this place since. I stayed for almost a week and I couldn't have been happier with my selection. I grew up in NY so I know NY but rarely stayed at hotels in NY. It was brand new, so very clean, extremely convenient, and like many Hampton Inns, the free breakfast was a delight. Yes it gets busy with tourists and the wait for the elevator can test your patience but you're in midtown Manhattan so be realistic. My room fit all my needs as well (I asked for a high floor which was quiet and had romantic view of midtown). Clean and modern design, great big flat screen, really comfy beds. I love hotels that have well thought out bathrooms like theirs. As I was staying for business, I didn't explore amenities like gym or pool. It's a great value for a new, centrally located hotel - I will most likely always choose to stay here when I go to NY for work.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is typical NYC- small room, but clean, with a decent breakfast. The location is what makes this place a great place to stay- Times Square and Port Authority are minutes away, lots of theater, restaurants and fun people-watching!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located at Times Square with subway across the street. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is typical Hampton Inn which is good. Say hi to Teddy at breakfast...she's the BEST! Internet is OK but slow at times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: New hotel. Great staff. Perfect location. In the heart of everything that Times Square has to offer. The hotel is near several Subway locations, making it easy to navigate New York City. The hotel also offers a great breakfast with something for everyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: One of the best hotel I have ever stayed. I liked everything! The location, room, staff, breakfast was tasty, (dining room a bit overcrowded), wifi was fast, free coffee all day in the lobby etc. They also have PC with printer in the lobby when you need to print boarding pass or events tickets. And sadly this is not common in USA these days. I heard about smartphones, don't worry :) but q code doesn't work for all events so far.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our second stay at this hotel, our first being in February 2016. Service is good. Hotel is very clean and all staff acknowledged us with a "good morning, good afternoon,etc" Teddy and Ebony were both friendly and helpful!!We will be visiting this establishment again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Within walking distance to many restaurants shops and other things to do Friendly staff comfortable bed. Breakfast was adequate and a great perk. I would definitely stay here again if I went to New York City the only problem I had there working on the water at the time and had problems with the shower other than that A+

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Was a nice location that had a few extras. The complimentary breakfast was a nice addition.m, as was the wi-fi. It was a bit slow. The were not many food options in the area to my liking. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was perfect. Close to subway, timesquare, broadway and just about anything. Beds were so comfortable. Rooms are clean and modern. Breakfast had good variety. Friendly and helpful staff all over the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is location behind the New Amsterdam Theater and around the corner from Times Square. The MTA is right across the street with easy connection to Penn Station. The Port Authority was down the street which was awesome for taking the shuttle in/out of Newark Int'l Airport. Overall, the hotel was in great condition, friendly staff and decent breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location 2 blocks from Times SquareVery clean and comfortable. Room was quiet. Excellent breakfastAbout 10 mins walk from Penn Street Station & Madison Square GardenAround the corner from Port Authority Station

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, Very slow elevators, tea in lobby at night was nice. Large fitness room but i didn't use it. There was noise from what sounded like a disco from 1am to 5 am on Saturday night. Rooms nice size for nyc, air conditioner was noisy and auto didn't work. Bed was comfortable but not as comfortable as other Hampton inns that i stayed in. Breakfast was filling but average.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While the rooms are small, it is a good value for location. Complimentary breakfast was good, and concierge was always busy. Lobby is attractive and hotel is walking distance from a wide variety of desirable dining options. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and very helpful staff, from the front desk to the staff outside who hail cabs and help with storing luggage. I was on the 26th floor and it was extremely quiet. Thanks to the front desk to put me in a quiet room! See pics of the view.We had a mishap with our room that was not serviced. I discovered this on arriving back at the hotel at 11.30pm after a day of walking the city, so I was not a happy guest. Leticia (sp?) did as much as she could to address my dissatisfaction so kudos to her! One big complaint is that the breakfast area is way too small for the volume of people. There were groups of people sitting on the lobby floor in the morning eating breakfast!I'd stay here again on my next visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stay for a night in Hampton inn Room is clean Bed is comfort High speed internetBreakfast is little bet poorFront desk stuff not friendly But good value of moneyNew furniture in roomsMust try it

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent two nights. Online check in was easy. We arrived early/stayed late and they graciously held our luggage. The hotel is perfectly situated and convenient to everything within Midtown Manhattan. Broadway theaters right outside. Times Square just steps away. Not far from Restaurant Row. Close to subway stops. The hotel itself is clean, fresh, and updated. The staff are accommodating, friendly, and genuinely kind. We'll be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Got a last-minute deal on the day of travelling to the city centre, having previously stayed on the outskirts. What a nice relief. Great room, fabulous bathroom with a lovely shower, very, very clean, beautiful big beds with lovely fresh crisp sheets. Free WiFi as you'd expect, in room rather than just communal areas, and greeted with free, freshly baked (delicious!) cookies on our return from a few hours exploring. Staff most helpful and polite. Free breakfast was good...make your own waffles was a nice touch, but was busy and seating was a bit tricky...just needed to share and the other guests moving up to allow people to grab a seat would have helped but that's nothing to do with the hotel rather people being...people (sadly). Happily recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have to say, I love this hotel. It is a great value at a great location with great service. I am in the event planning business, and have done thousands of hotel site inspections over the years. Although I had never stayed at a Hampton, I have used them as "overflow" hotels for our conferences. My son and I were booking a last minute trip, and got a great deal so decided to try the Hampton Inn Manhattan. The staff were very knowledgeable (about the hotel and city) and friendly. They seemed intent on making sure everyone was having a great trip. The rooms were comfortable and very clean; the view of the city was great! They have a concierge desk, free beverages and complimentary computer stations in the lobby, as well as a complimentary free breakfast in the morning. I especially liked Sammi in the dining room, though have to say everyone was great! The hotel is a one-minute walk to Time Square a 30 second walk to a major train station. If you are looking to stay in this part of town, don't hesitate to book this property! Thanks Hampton Inn, we will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located a block and a half from the Port Authority Bus Station/Metro stop and a block and a half from the Times Square metro stop. Caught the Airporter bus in for under $20 and took just a little longer than the taxi I took back out for $65. Since you are so close to Port Authority, the bus is a great deal. Staff was super nice- I enjoyed their smiling faces every day; the breakfast state smiled all the time they faithfully restocked the breakfast buffet and cleaned the tables. Every one I met was super. Hot coffee (standard and robust) 24 hours a day in the lobby, They stocked cookies that could have been from Doubletree except that they weren't hot. All great. I came down after midnight to get some business accomplished and the night desk staff was just as accommodating. I missed my room fridge, but you can't have it all. The super convenient Times Square location really makes this place shine- I walked just 2 blocks to see the play "Beautiful" off Broadway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Whenever we stay overnight in a hotel, we stay at The Hampton Inn. It always feels like home and this one did not disappoint. We went to see a show at The B.B. King Club and Grill which is only about a 5 minute walk. That's why we chose this particular location. It's close to everything! Times Square, Madison Square Garden and tons of shopping, restaurants and movie theaters. As expected, the rooms were clean and well stocked with amenities that are needed for an overnight stay and the bed was super comfy. The staff was friendly, professional and extremely helpful. The only downside that I had on this particular visit is that I couldn't get a comfortable room temperature. One degree up, I was on fire. One degree down, I was freezing. So, I chose to be cold and used the pillows to block the air from my face and neck and used the extra blanket that was provided in the closet.I was on the 30th floor and had amazing city views. Breakfast was what you'd expect; eggs, bacon, potatoes, toast, make your own waffles, cold cereal, fruit, coffee and juice, etc. There was plenty of seating when I went down around 10am. I was very disappointed that they only offered cheese egg omelette or hard boiled eggs. I was expecting scrambled eggs.I didn't have time to shop but I'm planning another trip to do just that. I'm definitely staying here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel just opened in 2015 and looks great! The rooms are big for a Hampton in NYC. Can't beat the location right in the heart of Times Square. The breakfast area and lobby are so nice with lots of room. I was impressed.We'll definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: from pre arrival to check out the customer service was unbelievable and from a Bostonian to be able to say I Love New York you dont hear that often.. Gm was super helpful pre check in, desk staff always provided water and info and great guest service,housekeeping always took care of needs, Hotel close to times square but no noise heard at night, breakfast is your standard Hampton different items (hot daily) you will enjoy the service of Teddy there,hotel also close to sub way and bus terminals, laundry on site and fitness center,free wifi, you will enjoy your stay, the concierge is a wonderful guy and helpful but advise check what show you want to see and go direct to theater or ck the tkts booth in times sq for better rates when you get from hotel they charge the ticket master fees and you end up paying more. just as if you order ellis island tickets on line you pay more for the convenience.. loved this hotel and you will too

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location, one block from subway. Room clean, spacious, good bed. Nice service from check in to check out., from receptionist to house keeper. Good breakfast and coffee all day long. Wish we had better internet connection.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: last month I had to cxl plans to this property even though I had the reservations for over a year and it was going to be my first visit ever to NY city...Being it was a fixed rate from a year ago I knew it would not be able to be replaced but the General manager was very helpful and answered my e- mails in a timely manner and got me a good rate for another date so my very first impression was awesome. once I arrived at the property I arrived late and still got my selected room was offered a snack, soda /water(first on property impression Fantastic followed suit of the GM) my stay was wonderful, all staff helpful and accommodating, especially Teddy in the Breakfast area every person I seen her interact with was with excellent guest service and genuine caring no matter what they asked or how busy she was. all the staff were good in that area but she really stood out...this hotel is close to the bus terminals and the subway and very conveniently located to times square( no noise can be heard either)there is a concierge very helpful for info but before you order tickets check around you can prob get cheaper tickets direct at theater or at the booth in times square I ended up paying too much for my tickets well lesson learned (due t o fees I paid double the price on my tickets plus the convenience fee and ticketmaster fees)didn't realize it until got home and actually looked at the receipt and ticket) but they delivered them to hotel and the two ppl at that desk during my stay were very helpful ,friendly and knowledgeable , Breakfast is your standard Hampton Inn and it was always kept fully stocked even during busy times,you may want to walk down the stairs in the morning rush , the elevators fill up quick and you may wait a while(to be expected in ny), there is 24 hr coffee in lobby, a weight room,24 hour computers in lobby,free wifi, a small area to get snacks/asprin and other needs, with a good variety and laundry room too..you will not be disappointed with your stay at this location I highly suggest you make it your Times square stay place..My stay ended with my son being sick and the agents at the front desk allowed us an extended time in our room before departure so my son could rest before getting on the bus for a 4 hr ride. and were able to get me items I needed to make him more comfortable(sorry I did not catch the agents name)Housekeepers always checked with us and delivered what we needed.. rooms clean,,what else can I say I loved this property, staff, amenities and convenience.and I am sure you will too..there is no downfall to this property..

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service was efficient and the staff were friendly. For anyone complaining of room size, the rooms are a really good size for Manhattan. The room was well appointed and clean, we requested city view which did not disappoint. We would definitely stay again on future trips the location was perfect.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I spent a week in New York at this hotel and I had a very good experience. It is perfectly located - we walked pretty much everywhere and we took the subway a few times (nearest station was two minutes away) when needed. The 24/7 free access to coffee was popular and very much appreciated by all visitors, as well as the delicious american cookies in the afternoon. Wifi worked smoothly and the computer space in the lobby was a good place to hang out. Breakfast was great - fresh waffles, eggs, cereals, oatmeal, bagels. Only thing I missed was sliced cheese, that would be great. Also, as a vegetarian, there were not a lot of options for me. I usually just had eggs and bagels, but it would be lovely with more vegetables - maybe roasted veggies or fresh tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers or other toppings.Only other thing that could be better is that the elevators were often full in the morning, so make sure you plan ahead and try to avoid elevators between 9-11.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is your basic Hampton Inn. If you like the value of Hampton Inn, as I do, then you can't go wrong with this location, provided that you are looking for a property in this particular area of NYC.The rooms are very clean, if small, here, but the beds are predictably plush, the complimentary breakfast offers the usual wide variety of nutritious items, and the hotel is smack in the middle of Midtown, where rooms can go for several hundred dollars more per night. There are the amenities of Internet access and a fitness room. The Times Square metro station is one block, as is the heart of 42nd Street. The elevators can be a little slow and crowded at peak hours of the day, and it would be nice if the rooms were equipped with mini-fridges. Still, it is on a relatively quiet block of street with the commotion of Times Square just one short block away in either direction. My overall impression is that the hotel offers a nice, safe, and comfortable retreat at the end of a hectic Manhattan day, and is a good value for the price. This is probably the hotel I'll look to first on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located just far enough away to allow you to breath,yet close to being right back in the action. I love the buzz of New York. Newly redone and comfortable. The beds at the Hilton properties always make for a restful night's sleep.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We visited New York over spring break. The Hampton Inn Times Square central was a perfect location to walk anywhere. Right off 7th and 3 blocks from Times Square. 4-5 blocks from Hell's Kitchen and lots of restaurants. Room is small BUT it's New York. Great breakfast and friendly staff. Elevators are slow so stay on a lower floor and use the stairs.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved that this hotel was just a half mile from Penn Station, and a block from Times Square. Yet, tucked away on a side street, it was calm and the only noise was around 9:30 at night when fans waited outside the nearby theatre to meet exiting actors. Convenient, very popular hot breakfast bar, efficient (and free) business corner with 3 computers--definitely a hotel we will keep on our short list for return visits!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room good sized for NYC and very clean and quiet. Excellent location for exploring the city, one block from the heart of Times Square and walking distance to Penn Station. Perfect! Breakfast was fine for my daughter and I, better than most included breakfasts that I've had. The breakfast room was crowded and we had to wait a bit for a table but that didn't bother us. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Me and my wife stayed here for 4 nights and we enjoyed are stay here. Breakfast was good and special shout out to Teddy, she was great and made sure that i was satisfied with my breakfast choices. Also, I'd like to give a holler to Jonny the Valet, he was very knowledgeable to my questions on how to get to certain destinations in the big city. Lastly, I requested a late check out which was granted and the hotel held our luggage because are flight wasn't departing til early evening and that was awesome. Overall we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Times Square Central is within minutes from the heart of Times Square and only a few steps away from the Nederlander and New Amsterdam theatres. Rooms are neat and clean. Staff is helpful and accommodating. Free WiFi and complimentary breakfast. Overall, great place to stay in the city!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is close to Times Square and more importantly the subway. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. Wifi was mediocre but I wasn't there on business so it wasn't a big deal to me. Free coffee in the lobby was also very appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was as the review described, and I was very pleased. However, the best part was how two employees made my mother feel special. The two women: Ebony and Teddy were helpful in providing directions and suggestions for off the tourists path that were of interest. Both women knew the city and were proud "New Yorkians". I greatly appreciate their help with making my mom's bday a great success.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife, daughter and myself made a quick trip to NY so we could attend admitted students day at The New School Parsons Lang. The location is great...just a block away from Times Square. The entire hotel is kept very clean and the staff are very guest service oriented. The room was exceptional. Some reviews complain about size...well..it's NY so space is a premium. Room was well appointed and the view from the 21st floor was awesome. We used E Check in and I chose a room behind the row of three elevators. We NEVER heard any noise from them. The elevators are extremely fast taking just a few seconds to get from the lobby to the 21st floor and wait times were very short. Breakfast was great as well. Wireless worked very well. A special mention for Kris and Tobo who were saviors for our return trip to JFK. I asked about cabs and they both spoke up and said they could arrange a private car so the ride would not be like a demolition derby and our lady (Lissette Nunez) was very accommodating. This hotel is a great reflection on how Hilton properties stand above the rest and we have found a new home away from home whenever we visit NY!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
