review_body: First time at new Hampton Inn. Have stayed at nearly every Hilton in NYC. This is a great location. Very new. Decent sized rooms for NYC. Great service. Didn't get to try the breakfast but assume it's similar to other Hampton Inns. Will return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Second time staying here. Previously had stayed in July 2015 shortly after they opened. Still looks brand new. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Rooms very clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. Breakfast was your basic free Hampton Inn buffet. Space is limited where breakfast is served. If they used smaller chairs, it may help.Try to stay on a higher floor, maybe on the south side. Road noise was constant all night, and we were on the 20th floor. Last year on the 30th floor, not so bad. Also, get an end room since the elevators open directly in front of the middle rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was very well situated, just off Times Square with a subway just nearby to get to all major attractions - although we were able to walk to loads of them from the Hotel. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were clean and beds very comfy - not the biggest rooms but big enough for our needs of sleeping!Hot breakfast was a bonus with different things on offer every day - although we would have preferred metal cutlery rather than plastic disposable - which also isn't very environmentally friendly!Coffee/tea on offer in the lobby 24/7 which was good.A great bargain hotel for visiting New York.We had 2 rooms on the 17th floor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location,easy access to subway,Times Square,taxis,places to eat and also Walgreens to buy necessities. Breakfast included but could do with more tables. Staff very helpful and clean and tidy rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location right in the centre of Times Sq. Easy access to subway and trains. Perfect starting point for exploring Manhattan. Staff more than helpful. Hotel very clean. Good to get an included hot breakfast. Complimentary wifi was very handy. Kids enjoyed using computers in lobby while resting up after busy days before heading out in evening. Felt safe with them visiting lobby by themselves as staff were very attentive. They liked the free hot chocolate :) Would definitely stay again. Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you are looking for a reasonably priced property within a block of Times Square, this is a great choice. Although the rooks are small, they are well appointed, clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly, offering us a complimentary bag with bottled water upon check in. I definitely recommend this hotel as a budget conscious traveller, with champagne tastes.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited this hotel in April 2016 for one night, as I was returning to my home country via JFK and my wife and I wanted to spend a day in the city.I was very happy that upon arrival at approximately 10.30am, we were able to get a room immediately, even though the official check-in is at 3.00pm. I am a HHonours member and had digitally checked-in and selected a room in advance of arriving at the hotel.As a HHonours member, I was hoping to receive bottled water on arrival, or at least find water in our room, but this was not the case. I was able to get bottled water easily later in the day by asking at the front desk.While unpacking and changing my clothes, the door burst open and a woman came into the room. I was wearing only my underwear and she quickly apologised and exited. I am unsure whether she was a member of staff or worse yet, a random person with access to the room. She did not knock before entering and I was left feeling that the room was not 100% safe or private. Luckily we were only there for one night, so I did not have this weighing heavily on my mind for a lengthy period of time.The staff at the front desk were quire helpful in booking a black car taxi for us to get to the airport the next morning, and phoned-us when the car arrived at the hotel.The hotel lobby gets VERY busy and there are serious when there is a long wait for the elevators.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton is in a great location for visiting NYC. The hotel is updated and very clean. The staff was helpful and accommodating. Also nice to have the Hampton perk of free breakfast before taking on a day of sightseeing. We were on the 18th floor and had no issues with noise even though the hotel is so near the chaos of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent experience in general. Friendly welcome and prompt and professional service. Great location. 2 blocks to Time square and Bryant Park and library. 1/2 block to subway station & Port of Authority that takes you almost anywhere in and around Manhattan. Very good Breakfast and delicious cookies in the afternoons. Hot beverages throughout the day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is within the perfect location - just a two minute walk to Times Square. Complimentary hot drinks were offered throughout our stay, as well as a wide variety of choice for breakfast. Teddy was a particularly helpful member of staff. The hotel also has an in house concierge to assist with touristic enquiries, which was useful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very impressed with the staff and our room. Staff was very helpful and caring. Room was clean and bigger than I expected. It was a perfect size for my wife and I. It was also a great location for Broadway shows as well as seeing the sites of NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This location is perfect. Right in the middle of Times Squares. 1 block from subway station, restaurants, bus station and grand central very close. Second stay at this fairly new hotel. Convenient, respectful staff and free hot breakfast. Nice. Great value too!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location, fun, helpful, knowledgeable staff for a grandmother /granddaughter trip to explore several college campus using public transit. Appreciated well stocked coffee and tea and cookie bar in lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Took our family for Spring Break and was not disappointed ! The location is amazing ! Located in Time square but none of the noisy traffic . The staff was friendly and knowledgeable . Very clean rooms and bathrooms . The free breakfast did not disappoint either! Convient hours for early risers or if sleeping in! Would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends visiting the area!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Time Square Central made our stay so enjoyable. We arrived to NYC on an early flight. We arrived at the hotel before 9 am on a Saturday morning. The front desk staff offered to hold our luggage until check-in time at 3 pm. They offered us the restrooms to freshen up and the free hot continental breakfast. After shopping around the city for the day we arrived to check in. When we got to our room there wasn't a view, within 3 minutes someone met us with a key for a higher level floor with a view. The beds were very comfortable, especially after a day of walking the city. The free hot continental breakfast was wonderful. We did have to wait a few mornings for a table but that wasn't bad. Johnny and Kareem were kind and most helpful, especially since this was our first visit to NYC. Thank you Hampton Inn for making our first trip to NYC so pleasant. I will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had a pleasant stay here. 1 minute (or 30 seconds) walk and you are in the centre of Times Square. First impression at check-in wasn't that great however the room was brand new and well appointed. As expected for NYC the room was quite small however it more than did the job with its super comfortable bed, excellent modern features like USB charging points at the bedside, a good TV and coffee machine. Unfortunately I cant speak about many other experiences as I only stayed in the hotel for a few hours due to a very behind schedule flight into NY. Note breakfast didn't start until 6am so I was unable to enjoy because I had to leave at 5am for a flight. PRO'S:LocationNew RoomsGreat BedGreat FacilitiesFood options (McDonalds at the doorstep and plenty of street vendors nearby)CON'S:Terrible shower. Poor water pressure (maybe a high floor issue).Towels small and poor quality.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time in NYC and couldn't have picked a better hotel, very helpful staff, prime location and overall an enjoyable stay. Requested a high floor room and this request was met, the breakfast at the hotel was ideal and saved having to hunt for somewhere to go every morning!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I took my son to NYC for his first trip! This hotel was amazing...We checked in at mid-night and all employees that were there were very helpful. The room was super clean and the sheets nice and soft. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to Times Square, the Subway, Broadway and many other attractions. We stayed in 2202 and had a great view of the area, Internet worked perfectly and there was a good selection of channels on the TV (but who needs that in NYC...) Thank you all for making my sons' first time to NYC a trip to remember.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I chose the Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square Central for its location and free breakfast, and I was totally right. The room was clean and comfortable. Definetely a good choice if you are using the subway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Booked as part of BA package. Situated on 41st between 7th and 8th this hotel is just around the corner from Times Square.Rooms are reasonably sized with enough space for two. Good sized shower but no bath, no time for the tub in NYC.Breakfast is hot and cold buffet, which was well stocked with enough to go around, even at peak times.Lifts get busy at peak times, leaving you with a wait. All in all a pleasant place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and when I was leaving I forgot something in my room and I called and raymar picked up the Fone. He helped me in shipping my item back to me at home. He was so pleasant and friendly. He checkout us out make sure our car came from the valet in time even helped us with our bag. I will definitely come back here just because of the helped by him.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for five nights. We found the hotel very clean, friendly and convenient. The complimentary hot drinks in the reception area were very welcome after a long day sight seeing. We were able to use the computers to print tickets off, which we found very useful. I had informed the hotel that our trip was for my daughters 21st birthday and they had left her some goodies and birthday cards in our room and the girl on reception wished her a happy birthday when we checked in, which I thought was a lovely touch. If we visit New York again I would definitely stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In general it was an excellent stay. Great service and attitude from personnel and very well thought for a self service concept. Very clean, convenient and efficient at the rooms. Great for business. But the hotel has so many people registered that I don't think the size of the spaces and capabilities are appropriate. Business center had three terminals that are always swamped. Included breakfast restaurant have no enough places to seat and it is even difficult to walk. Lines for registration and check out are inmense.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My overall experience at this hotel was great despite the cold complimentary and our room was not ready when we arrived at the hotel and the cold complimentary breakfast. The room was very clean great view and location. For my next stay in New York I will defiantly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I just returned from a two-night stay.THE GOOD:Still "new" having opened in June/15. Right in the centre of it all - 2 min to Times' Square and the subway. I got there from LaGuardia ($2.50) via the public bus and subway in about 40 min - easy peasy. Very clean overall given the large numbers of guests passing through. My room was a really good size - strong water pressure in the bathroom, ample hot water, above-average in cleanliness, so-so bedlinens, sufficient amount of towels, soaps, toilet paper, there's a little closet with iron/board and a safe. Nice and quiet as I overlooked another building with only HVAC units between us. If you value peace and quiet and a good night's sleep over the view, get a room on the side with the -03 rooms. I did not hear anything from adjoining rooms. The windows open!!!! Above-average breakfast buffet with eggs, sausages and hot potatoes, etc.. Friendly staff who were smiling and efficient. Computers, free coffee and tea, nighttime cookies and umbrellas for guests' use are the little things that add up to make this a good choice.The BAD:NYC hotel rooms take a beating and even though this hotel has only been open for less than a year, there's some knicks and rips and dents in the walls, furniture and hallways. Nothing major, but this is they way it is in New York. Elevators cannot accommodate everyone, at times, you will wait FOREVER, - book a room on a lower floor so you can take the stairs instead. The breakfast room is far too small. Food temperature - barely warm eggs, etc - even at 6:30 when they had only been open for a 1/2 an hr.. Pillows were awful - mushy and flat.Overall, I'd stay here again, but, hopefully they will continue to maintain it, or, it might be better to look for something newer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent a long weekend here while chaperoning a small group from my son's school in New York City. This like-new hotel is an excellent choice for lodging in the heart of the theater district at an affordable price.The rooms were large by Manhattan standards (which would be average anywhere else). The beds were very comfortable. The rooms seemed to be well sound-proofed; couldn't hear much city noise from outside nor the teenage girls in our group in the room next door. One note: the bathroom door is a sliding frosted glass door that faces the room, so there is not much privacy if you find yourself sharing a room with someone who is not an immediate relative.The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was great and a big hit with our students.We often found a long wait for elevators; it is a large hotel with only three. If you find this frustrating, I would recommend asking for a room on a lower floor so you can use the stairs.Overall, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were extremly satisfied with the level of services provided. The location is close to subway and all attraction. The hot breakfast great and the staff is very helpful and pleasent. Will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is fairly new and very clean and modern. The location is great for visiting most of the city. We walked from Penn Station at arrival. It was close to Times Square, but far enough away that it was quieter. I felt very safe at all times. The front desk staff was fantastic. In fact, all the staff that we encountered was very nice. Rooms are small, but that was expected for NYC. We will definitely be back!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central hosted our Choir group in NYC. From enquiry stages I found the staff to be miles ahead of every other hotel I checked in NY and possibly every other city on our tour - which included several cities in the US and China. Chevelle and Shaaka in sales were fab, always willing to help with whatever challenge we threw their way. Reception / check-in / check-out was fast and efficient. Everyone from the restaurant to housekeeping was efficient, friendly and professional.The hotel is well-appointed, in my opinion rooms and common areas are of a 3 superior or even 4 star standard. Comfortable beds, nice modern bathrooms, good common areas, free wifi, great location.We didn't have a problem regarding space in the restaurant (we stayed for 4 nights), and the food was lovely. Food items were constantly replenished, and varied day by day. The space was kept very clean, considering the high turn over.I have to admit, I'm not a fan of plastic plates & cutlery, but I'm sure they are used for a reason.It is true the lifts can take a while - particularly in the morning. But everything else more than makes up for the wait. Our group were very happy at the Hampton Inn TSC, so much so that they wanted to thank the staff the best way they knew - singing!And, no doubt, I will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Friendly and courteous staff, hearty breakfast buffet, clean room, comfortable bed, and best of all a great location! We drove into the city and getting to the hotel was a breeze! Definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The upside is the hotel is new, nice rooms, friendly staff, and has reasonable rates for the Times Square area. The downside is the hotel has only 3 elevators for 30 floors which leads to unacceptable wait times during morning and evening periods. Additionally, the small breakfast room is not sufficient to accommodate large weekend crowds.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were on the 20th Floor which reduced the street noise, and we were away from the elevator. The front desk graciously stored our bags at no charge both before we checked in (we were early) and after we checked out. The hotel is clean and well maintained, the staff is friendly and competent. It's the usual, excellent, Hampton Inn experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 5 minutes to Timeq Square. 10 Minutes to Grand Central. 2 Minutes to Penn Station. Subway right across the street. Checkin was smooth and efficient. Rooms are small but newly redecorated. Good place to stay if you are in the area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is perfectly up to Hampton standards which is why we stay at them. This review if for the staff especially Mike the bellhop who guided us in with our vehicle and got us all set after a very nerve racking drive though New York City! I can!t say enough about the help from Mike and the warm welcome at reception. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The complimentary breakfast, including waffles, :) is amazing! What a deal. The view from the window was amazing. The staff was very helpful, the lobby nice and so cheerful. The rooms were quiet. We loved the location! We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had never stayed in Times Square before but we wanted a to try it and we found the perfect place. We took the Mega Bus from Baltimore and arrived around 10 am. Our room wasn't ready, but they invited us to check our bags and have breakfast. Our room was on the 26th floor and very clean and quiet considering the location. I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms.met with my family from Ireland for two days as they performed at st Patrick's cathedral. The choir left with a farewell performance in the hotel lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a nice hotel in Times Square. We had mixed feelings about staying here. Pros: comfortable king size bed with nice size flat screen tv- free HBO channels and lots of viewing options, free wifi and free hot breakfastCons: strange sliding bathroom door that doesn't close completely so lack of privacy, room cleanliness was ok but not the best I've seen and wifi did not stay connected very well

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed here in January 2016 for four nights. Check in was swift at midnight in the middle of times square whilst the area was buzzing. We were on the 25th floor meaning we didn't have any 'road noise' and far enough from the elevator for it not to disturb us.Friends has warned up that hotel rooms in the city would be small so we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and bathroom which was clean, up to date and the shower was nice and powerful. The room has satellite TV and plenty of plug sockets including USB charging for phones/cameras etc. The breakfasts were hearty. Due to jet lag we went to breakfast at roughly 7,30am and at no point had to wait for a lift even though we were high up. We never had to wait to get a table and the few hot dishes, bacon, eggs, hash browns etc were plentiful as were the waffle maker, bagels, cereals, coffee and juices. Reception were always helpful when needed and there was an internet area with free printing, perfect for Knicks tickets purchased online! Highly recommend this place and will be back in due course due to it's proximity to the subway to get around NYC (The ONLY way to get around NYC!) and many other sights!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited New York March 6-8th and stayed at a super hotel with a great location... Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square. I found every staff member to be helpful, kind and friendly. I especially appreciated the friendliness and warmth of Ebony and Teddy who worked in the breakfast room. Both of these ladies had great smiles and created a warm, inviting atmosphere in a big city where excitement and rush, rush, rush often take over and the human element is forgotten. Thank you Ebony and Teddy and staff members! I truly enjoyed my visit and will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: hotel staff very helpful and friendly. great location elevators may become full and take a while to get one at certain times of day but have found that in most hotels in new York. breakfast was good had good choices of items. overall great experience

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Compared to my last stay at SOHO this time is great, but there're still some issues that are somewhat problematic to malice the outlets near my bed son't work at all and the noise in the hallway.... other than that it's not too bad

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and absolutely wonderful hotel. You can tell that this is a new hotel. Everything appears to be state of the art. Overall great value. Staff is very focus on the client's needs. Continental breakfast is more than just bagels and coffee.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was very clean. Rooms look recently redone. Bed was quite comfortable. Breakfast was good and there was a young lady Teddy, who met and greeted everyone with a very big smile as you came in. She is a real asset to the hotel with her eagerness to help.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is very clean and well run. The employees are professional, competent, and friendly. I had an issue and it was given immediate attention (thank you Rachel). Breakfast was a step above the usual Hampton Inn fare, and ran longer than the posted time.Above all I value cleanliness. This inn was as well kept as they come. Even when I went down to the laundry room to toss a pair of jeans in the dryer, the room was immaculate, not a spec of lint anywhere.It was hard to believe that this gem is 1/2 block off Times Square and 1/2 block from The Port Authority.Thank you to all of the employees involved on making our weekend stay feel special.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great experience at this hotel. Rooms were clean and new, staff was really friendly. A hot breakfast was provided and the location is fantastic! If I were to return, would consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived early for our check in and surprisingly our room was ready which was a BIG plus.Front desk was very quick ,easy and informative.The room was spacious by New York standards. The bath room was spacious and spotless.Location is ideal for all the hustle and bustle of the city,yet quiet enough.The free breakfast was great. Eggs,bacon and all the fixings.Can't say a bad thing. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nothing bad to say. Everything is just as is should be....except for the fact that there is no fan in the bathroom and that is where the sink is too. Good breakfast, comfy bed, staff was fantastic. Only two elevators, but that did the trick

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was very disappointed in my stay at the Hampton Inn. Normally, this is my hotel chain of choice but this one left a lot to be desired. The majority of the front desk staff were not very friendly. They lived up to the false stereotypical New Yorker by being rude, impolite or impatient. Of course not all of them - two were the exception. Concierge was non-existent even during business hours, the one time he was there, I just waited while he carried on a private conversation. The bedding was not clean and we had to change it ourselves the first night. And request new comforters the next morning. Stacked trash neatly on table because trash cans were full and housekeeping left it neatly there on the table after 'cleaning' the room. TV did not work for the first two days. Internet access was terrible. The good thing is the location was great - right at Times Square! There are people on the street who are so willing to help you get to where you need to go, because for the most part, the front desk couldn't.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is new and nicely decorated. Comfortable and quiet and convenient to many sites and theaters. Great location. Free coffee 24 hours and cookies in the evening. Buffet breakfast included in room rate makes this an even greater value. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall I was pleased with my stay. The room and bathroon were clean. They had free coffee all day long in the lobby. The staff was friendly. I would stay again. The location is great and very convenient.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I really like the hotel the location is great it is near everything you can go to a broadway play and them go back to alero without moving a lot ! There is an underground station near !!! They have a lot of food for the breakfast and cookies st night !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent and friendly service on check-in, check-out, free breakfast, valet parking and checking bags. Kudos to Kareem and his staff, especially Marie at the front desk and the valet and concierge crew. Stay here to be near Times Square, theatres, and much more.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything was perfect from the room condition to the hotel stuff. The only thing negative might be the sliding door of the toilet in the room. Which is always semi open. You might face embarassing moments when you're in the toilet if your significant other is in the room

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. Great location. Looked like new or newly renovated. Perfect for going to the theater. Roof top view. Don't use the uber drivers waiting outside the hotel. Taxi is much cheaper. Went to battery park. They wanted 45 but the taxi was only 19.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a fantastic new hotel in a perfect location close to all attractions and subway stop. The rooms here are spotless as was the breakfast area, the staff were really friendly and always willing to help. The rooms were a little small but this is expected in New York. This is one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My teen daughters and I stayed here last night and we were extremely happy. We were spending 36 hr in the city to see two shows, do some shopping and explore the high line. First, if you are heading into the theatre/Times Square area this is a perfect location. It's right next door to the Nederlander Theatre on 41st street. And we were fortunate to have great weather so the walk to the high line entrance on 30th St was very pleasant. The hotel itself is fairly new and has nice modern decor and very helpful friendly staff. I don't like heights so I requested as low a floor as possible and our room was on the third floor which for me was perfect. The room had two beds and a decent amount of space around them with a desk/chair and tv/dresser. Bathroom was adequate size with standard fixtures and travel size shampoo, etc was provided. There was a coffee maker in room plus a coffe/tea area in the hotel lobby. Buffet breakfast was included and we all found the choices very satisfying - there was fruit, cereal (hot and cold) , eggs, potatoes , waffles, bagels, English muffins, toast, pastries, yogurt, juice, milk and coffee/tea. We had a lot planned on our checkout day and the hotel held our bags til 10 pm when we were ready to leave the city. Overall it was an excellent night stay and I will absolutely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved this hotel for its location, staff, cleanliness and breakfast.It was a very busy hotel and sometimes you had a long wait for the elevator, we used the stairs quite a few times just to save the wait. Breakfast was a great set up for the day and they even had little baggies you could take with you, not sure if they were for the people who didn't have time for breakfast or for anyone who needed a little midmorning snack. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating was because of some plumbing issues we had either above our room or in the wall beside. We thought it was our toilet having a gush of water every now and then but realised it was not coming from our room.Would recommend this hotel for sure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room is not real big but who stays in their room in NYC! It was a wonderful experience. The staff is remarkable & the breakfast was great! We will definitely stay here again. And actually have become huge fans of the Hampton Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I just love this hotel. I was here on a second visit in 3 months. The rooms are nice and comfy, the location is just right, and the free breakfast was great. It was also great to have a self washer and dryer on premise so I didn't have to log back lots of dirty clothes. Neutrogena toiletries are also a plus. Room was cleaned and stocked everyday with no problems.The hotel staff went above and beyond to accommodate my husband and I. Bellman Mike(the Chalmettian) was a wealth of info on restaurants and travel. And the breakfast buffet group (Teddy and Ebony) went out of their way to greet everyone and to offer any assistance they could to make the breakfast an enjoyable one. Any special request were met with a smile and a "yes, I can get that for you" Those two are keepers.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Impressed with the location to keep things somewhat quiet for being in the city. Close to everything. Clean refreshed rooms, courteous staff, short waits for the elevator, and plenty of spacious room around the dining area. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel had a great location- near theaters, times square and subway but not noisy. The bed was comfortable and I liked the complimentary hot drinks. The price was very good. The room was a standard Hampton Inn room- which for New York City is pretty roomy. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Was great very comfortable in great location very friendly staff affordable warm welcoming and good breakfast great fresh coffee complementary all day close to almost everything walked hug distance to a lot of great places depends where you need to go anyways

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a whirlwind 3 night trip for my daughter's birthday. While the rooms in this hotel are small, it was fine for 2 people. The staff were all helpful and pleasant. John at the concierge desk was particularly helpful. We would stay here again. The breakfast is a real bonus.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excelent option near Times Square! Excelent beds, services and rooms! New accommodations. I strongly recomend this place for your next travel to New York! The staff offer free coffee, tea, chocolate and cookies when you arrive. Is a good place to feel well attended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is fab! I haven't got a single bad thing to say about it. Location is perfect, hotel is clean, beds are super comfy, breakfast was lovely, plenty to eat and you can take a snack box out with you, The staff at breakfast are very helpful, but Teddy was extra nice, friendly and very helpful! Reception staff are very helpful and polite! I would go back to this hotel tomorrow if I had the chance and will definitely visit here again and recommend it to anyone. There a free wifi all around the hotel, a gym and a self service laundry at a cost. The hotel is very tall, we stayed on level 6 and it was noisy at times with traffic but after a day out sight seeing nothing kept me awake. There are 3 lifts but it can take a while to get up and down if you are high up as there are 30 floors. Our view was onto the main road which wasn't great but we only went back to sleep so no big deal for us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a 30-floor Hampton Inn located right near Times Square. It was quite clean and the "New York small" King room was still pretty big. Everything seems new and well cared for and the free breakfast added to the value. It's right near the subway, offers valet parking, and I will definitely stay again. I stayed two nights. My only gripe was the elevators--there are only 3 of the which makes a long wait. The staff seem to use them, too, for carts and things which places an additional load on them. Apart from that relatively minor problem, it was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a big fan of the Hampton brand and this hotel as well. Located steps away from Times Square and the Port Authority Terminal, you are in the perfect location for some of the most popular spots in NYC including the Broadway plays. On the downside, there can be a wait for the elevators, especially at peak times. Also, housekeeping service was a little slow. We would sometimes return to our room at 4PM and it still have not been serviced. Still, I will be returning to NYC next month and I have reserved my room at this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you are on a tight business budget (or paying yourself), I would recommend the Hampton Inn/Times Square Central. 9 blocks from Penn Station, great location for business meetings in mid-town and Times Square. While the hustle and bustle and mediocre restaurants abound, you can find some gems.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has a wonderful location, great staff and the breakfast is superb! When the subways were being serviced on the Saturday that my party of nine had to get back to JFK airport, the staff arranged for transportation on a very short notice. They went above and beyond.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a new Hampton Inn right in the heart of Times Square. You can walk in either direction for nightlife, food, shopping, theater, etc. The decor is beautiful and the rooms, although small, do not feel cramped. Our room had a wonderful clean smell upon entering and the staff were friendly and helpful. For the amenities and location I would expect to pay 3 times what I actually did. I will definitely be back here every time I am visiting New York....in fact I will plan my visits for when this hotel has availability...which you do have to book in advance. (Appears to be sold out most nights) (Picture is the view from our room)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Hotel ,, Clean and Big Room with Nice City View ,, Friendly Staff and Helpful and Welcoming Receptionists ,, Perfect Location ,, Good Price ,, Good Breakfast and Yummy Waffles ,, For Sure I'm Going To Stay Again In This Hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If your staying in NYC to go to the theater, this is the place! Perfect location (we walked everywhere including from and to Penn Station), clean and modern, super helpful and friendly staff, and very nice hot breakfast. I was offered the opportunity to check-in on line the day before our arrival, and what a super benefit! Check-in took all of 1 minute and we were up in our room to relax from our travel. Will definitely stay here on our next trip. Kudos to the management and Hilton for providing such a great property.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hotel is perfectly located right at Time Square. The room was very inviting and clean, so was the bathroom. The mattress was very comfortable. Even though located in the heart of town with all the traffic the room was very quite. The breakfast had a good choice of breakfast items.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was a bit worried about staying here as it's a new hotel. But this hotel is great.2helpful receptionist. Drinks available in reception, computer area, lifts never had to wait longer then 5 min, breakfast room plenty of seats and good selection. Freindly staff, don't forget to tip as there are no jars. Room was a average size, king size bed and good size bathroom. No complaints and would stay again .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I travel to The Big Apple for business or pleasure several times a year. I loved-loved-loved this hotel. It’s just one block from Time Square and a half block from the Red Line Subway 1-2-3, if you exit at 41st Street and 7th Ave. I arrived at Newark Airport, took the train to Penn Station, and then the subway one stop to Times Square. When I returned to the Airport, I skipped the subway altogether, and just walked the six blocks down 7th Ave. to Penn Station.There’s a back entrance to the 42nd Street McDonald’s on 41st, right across the street from the hotel, and on the corner there’s a Red Lobster. I saw two shows; Phantom of the Opera and Les Miserables and walked to both theaters in less than ten minutes.The hotel is very new and modern and my King Room was small but perfectly laid out with adequate storage. Nice lobby and the staff was very accommodating.When I return in July with my wife, I’ll definitely book this hotel again if I can get a similar rate. Great hotel and great location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If your going on a reasonable budget break to Manhattan then you should look no further than the Hampton inns.....although we only stayed at the Times Square Central hotel in the chain, they would appear to be of the same standard.The situation is in the name....if you want to walk to a few of the sights, then this is good starting point. It's 31 floors, there are four lifts which reasonably quick. We found ourselves on the tenth...no issues what so ever. The size of the room was large, considering the city and the situation! You have tea and coffee facilities that all Of us Brits like....on top of this the reception has 24/7 tea and coffee and hot chocolate with biscuits and muffins. Staff were always smiling and helpful. On a few of the days breakfast was a problem, too many people and too little space....but you manage. John the concierge is extremely amicable go too guy for show tickets, taxis etc.To get to New York we used for the first time,,Norwegian airlines, price was good, seat very spacious for the price, downside you have to pay for everything, I.e. 25$ for each bag each way, 25$ for booking your seats, 25$ for a hot meal.....you actually get one hot meal and them later a goodie bag as you get a little nearer. Flight was good, but oh! customs...it took us the thick end of 2 hrs, really really ridiculous......there is security and then there is security sheesh!One point I'm sure most people will be aware of the New York Pass, this I think is essential. We paid $199/person for a three day pass....it sounds a lot but you can go in to about eighty venues for free.......including all the ones you want to see. Most of these sight/events are in the $35 to $75 entrance. If you pay for this before you go it doesn't seem too bad!! Oh, and bye the way you can get two full days tickets for the hop on hop off bus...these have guides all day on them. So, just go and enjoy yourself la la la laa la la laa la laa.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Anytime you are staying in midtown Manhattan you can expect smaller rooms with fewer services at a higher cost. The Hampton Inn / Times Square Central balances this very well.This new hotel is wedged between the largest bus terminal (Port Authority) in the U.S. and the center of the world (Times Square) however surprisingly kept the noise and activities of the city outside of the hotel. Located on the 15th of 25+ floors, I rarely heard the hustle and bustle of the city during my stay, (with exception to New York's Cleanest, (NYC Sanitation) picking up the garbage. Walls between rooms also appear very solid since I did not hear any neighbors.The main room and bathroom were very clean and nicely designed. The bathroom however did not have any heat lamp or fan so if you take a hot shower, prepare for a Roman Steambath. Some may think the rooms are 'tight' with two beds, but that would come with just about any hotel room in a major city.No issues with the front desk. Cookies and coffee waiting for the taking.Wifi and HD TV worked fine without issues. Room included a safe that could hold a few laptops. Limited closet space since the iron board and safe are located within as well as limited space in the room for your luggage if you have a lot of bags.Breakfast was a typical Hampton fanfare. What makes this typical fanfare a much better breakfast is that it's much less expensive than any other NYC breakfast, (Free).Although the lobby is limited in size they gave that space to the breakfast which I think was the better choice, especially if you have a morning rush of guest.Overall a great option for midtown guest requirements.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel location is very convenient. The staff were helpful. The best part for me was 24X7 availability of tea and coffee at the lobby. The hotel can possibly provide microwave facility in room and also provision for tea also.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The front desk was very nice and the location of the hotel was great. The room was not that bad. That is about the only thing I can say was good with the hotel. There was a guy in the lobby trying to sale tourist package at about 1 1/2 times the price. I left a bag of clothes in the room and contacted the hotel about it. House keeping stated that nothing was in the room even though I told them right were it was.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Hotel, Free Breakfast and packed lunch. Complimentary tea / coffee / hot chocolate (and sometimes cookies). Friendly staff. Not overbearing, or 'tip hungry' like most other NYC hotels, but very helpful when needed.Room was big for NYC and heating control was superb (in the -17 degree celsius weather). Coffee machine in room. Lots of entertainment channels. Free, easy printing of boarding passes etc... Free WIFI. Sorted a fixed-fare ride to the airport for us. ATM in the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited here last week with a group of friends we travelled from Ireland. This was a great hotel would not hesitate to recommend it. rooms were lovely, clean, and beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast next morning was a blessing it had great variety something for everyone. it is so central to times square and all the attractions , subway just opposite what more can you ask for .Would definitely return again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We arrived and were given a really warm greeting. The staff at the check in desk were so helpful. Our room was a great size, beautifully decorated and had everything you could need.The free breakfast was a real money saver. The breakfast room does have busy periods, but once you get a seat there are no issues. The selection is super and they really accommodate for everyone.The breakfast team are superb, there was one lady in particular, who's name I can't recall (sorry) (she was wearing bit red heart glasses on Valentines day). She was fantastic. She was so attentive, friendly and super with the children. On my daughters birthday she gave her a cake, a card, a voucher and got the whole room to sing to her. Money can't buy this level of service.One morning we were in a hurry and were given grab bags (they had fruit, muffins, water and tissues), these were so handy.There is free WiFi throughout the hotel and computers in the lobby if needed. Also free printing which was handy for boarding cards. There is free tea, coffee and hot chocolate all day in the lobby and some evenings there was cookies. On our departure day checkout wasn't until 12. Our bags were stored and the hotel arranged a car to take us to the airport.I'd highly recommend this hotel. The money alone you save with free WiFi and breakfast is worth it. The location is so central and the staff are amazing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of Time Square in a great location by the theaters, restaurants, subways and shopping. It's brand new with very comfortable guest rooms and clean bathrooms. Lobby was a little cluttered but overall I'd stay again and highly recommend it. If you go for breakfast go early or late not prime time as it gets very crowded and hard to find a place to sit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: New building, super clean, nice size rooms for NYC, standard Hapmton breakfast, very helpful staff, excellent location. Just a block off Time Square and close to theaters. Port Authority is one block away and an excellent location for taxis and public transportation. We had 2 rooms - one had a regular bathroom door and the other a frosted glass sliding door. Kiss My Pizza - great NY style - is around the corner.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently took our children to Times Square and had a phenomenal experience at this hotel. Very affordable, great customer service, very clean and well maintained. A big extra is the included hot breakfast! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay close to Times Square without being directly in the madness!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn lives up to the professional standards of the Hilton Hotel chain. Our stay was excellent. The personnel were friendly and knowledgeable. The room was clean. The hotel lobby was clean and pleasant to look at. The breakfast was acceptable and clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We get to NYC about once a year and this is our first time at this hotel. The room was nice sized and clean. Buffet was good and constantly being restocked. Workers in restaurant were super along with front desk personnel. Always helpful throughout hotel. Will be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: New hotel, very clean. Free breakfast is typical of a Hampton Inn, which is very good. There was coffee/tea/hot chocolate available in the lobby 24/7. When we checked in a large tour group from Europe jammed the lobby, but the friendly staff handled the chaos quickly and efficiently. The concierge (can't remember his name) was awesome, very friendly and knowledgable; my wife and I drove him crazy looking for cheap show tickets, but he did not even hint at loosing his cool! The rooms are on the small side, but my family of four was comfortable. Room was spotless, 50-inch HDTV with DirecTV. Free WiFi signal was strong and every electrical outlet had a USB charging port. Only two blocks from Times Square. I only rated the hotel a 4 vice 5 because, unfortunately, the entire area around Times Square has turned into a cesspool of scumbag scammers, pushy ticket hawkers and crappy costumed characters assaulting unsuspecting tourists.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is as advertised- a cool lobby, with coffee and tea, fast elevators, nice rooms, and a good breakfast. Great location for all times square activities and right on the subway lines. Room size is as expected for the city. Staff are very nice and helpful. Breakfast is crowded if you go at peak times, but there is no place that it isn't. They keep the food stocked and do their best to clear tables. Overall, a great stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay was great and all the staff was very happy to help. The room was clean albeit a bit small. The price was $299 per night. The location to Time Square and the Convention Center was the reason we picked this Hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was hesitant to book this hotel, given its location in Times Square. I thought the traffic noise would be terrible but my teenage daughters really wanted to stay in the thick of things. We were on the 6th floor facing 41st Street and were not bothered by traffic noise. Now, it is important to remember that there will be traffic noise in any hotel in the middle of a big city but we were surprised by the relative quiet of our room.This hotel is located in a prime area of the Theater District/Times Square. The Broadway Theaters were a short walk away, as were many restaurants and sightseeing opportunities. John, one of the hotel concierge, was very friendly and helpful. Whether looking for theater tickets, sightseeing tour suggestions/tickets or restaurant suggestions/reservations, he was the man. The rest of the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful as well.Some have been critical of how busy breakfast was and while it could be quite crowded, it was no more crowded than any other hotel I've stayed in that offered this amenity (suburban or urban). We look forward to staying here again on our next visit to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were surprised at the room price, expecting to pay more to stay in Manhattan, but the rates are very reasonable in the off-season. This property was very clean and well maintained; the staff was very courteous and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was good, decent selections. We especially loved that they offered 24 hour availability of coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby area - a great amenity in winter - and especially the free cookies for guests.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved our stay. A very nice hotel at a very nice price. Great hospitality, the staff are very helpful and friendly. Cleanliness is outstanding and beds and pillows are very comfortable. And location, location, location folks!!! We definitely recommend this hotel and will most definitely stay here when we're in New York again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent Valentine's Day night here, staff is very friendly room was very nice. My only complaint would be the windows need to be thicker, our room was on the 25th floor and could still the sirens and some type of banging, other then that our stay was wonderful will definitely be back!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We originally booked an apartment on AirBNB and it was horrid so we booked this place last minute and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a perfect location, a short walk from Times Square and a subway station. We got breakfast included which was a good start to the day.The rooms were good size (especially compared to the apartment we were originally staying in), clean and modern. The bed was super comfy. And the rooms have free wifi.The staff were friendly and greeted us every time we came in. the first few days we stayed weren't busy, however the day before we were leaving a large group checked in so the next morning was very busy.Was a great price for the location and the facilities and would definitely stay here next time we come to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice, clean, new rooms and friendly staff but... We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on West 54 this summer and loved it. The actual rooms and staff were similar but this hotel has problems. I understand that it is cold in New York in February. It's actually colder where I live so I'm ready but it was so cold In the lobby you could see your breath. This was because the way the hotel was designed. This would not be troublesome but they told us to call for our car 30 minutes ahead of time. We called them 45 minutes ahead - it took them an hour and 15 minutes to get us the car. Meanwhile we are waiting in the frigid lobby. Also the elevators were very slow. The breakfast bar also took place down here. All this means spending a good deal of time in the cold, cold lobby. How bout a revolving door? The front desk staff were wearing coats. At least treat your staff better!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in a fabulous location! You are steps from Time Square, subway entrances across the street, and Port Authority a half a block away. The hotel faces the back of the theater of Aladdin! The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and comfortable, but not as large as others that I have reviewed. The breakfast is great and included in the room rate! The room was very affordable too! I would definitely stay here again! Again, the location is fabulous!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is new, opened June 2015. It's in a very good location just a few blocks from Times Square. The rooms are typical NY - very small. Thankfully I was alone because I think my husband and I would have killed each other if we had to be cramped together in such tight quarters. The furniture and decor is all new and therefore in good shape. However, the sheets and towels could really use a quality upgrade. The sheets were scratchy and rough, low thread count and probably not cotton. The towels were rough and not all that big. I asked for a room on a high floor when I made my reservation online as a Hilton Honors member but they didn't honor my request. There are 31 floors and I was given a room on the 6th floor and was told they were completely booked and there was nothing else available. I had no view :( The elevators were small and got filled quickly so you had to wait awhile for one where you could fit especially during busy times. The gym in the basement was good with high quality equipment and a full set of free weights. Breakfast is your typical Hampton Inn complimentary breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean rooms, friendly staff, and great location! Walking distance to EVERYTHING. I would love to stay here again the next time I am in New York City. Also, one of the better continental breakfasts I have had in the United States.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had an excellent 5 night stay. The hotel is perfectly located near Times Square and Subway stations just across the street. The rooms were clean, modern, but a little on the smaller size. The breakfast was a perfect start to your day. A good selection of food....Eggs, sausage, breakfast potatoes, french toast, and waffles. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from the front desk, to the concierge, to the bell hops. The only reason Im not giving a 5/5 is due to the elevators. During the morning hours the elevators were slow, and crowded, it made for a bit of an inconvenience, but a minor one in my opinion. Would definitely stay here on a return visit to NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent stay over four nights, conveniently situated near times square. Back street hotel could put some people off but don't be deceived. Spacious room with large tv and great views over 16th floor of new york skyline. Coffee making facilities needed getting use to but more coffee in the foyer. Rooms by elevator could be a bit noisy and the lift themselves were annoying when busy for breakfast. Excellent staff through out complex always happy to help. Building sways a lot especially if sensitive to movement. Breakfast was ok a variety of different things each day try the waffles. Breakfast time could get a little busy and finding a clean table was hard and the later you leave going to breakfast the chance of missing some dishes if not replaced by staff. Sheets on bed didn't seem to fresh but we didn't ask for a change and air conditioning/heating was noisy when on. All in all a very pleasant hotel in the circumstances we would probably book a place outside of times square now we have done there. Attractions and show tickets can be purchased in the hotel but we did see better offers in the streets but convenient in the hotel if not prepared to go looking.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My 5 year old daughter and I spent 2 nights here this week and could not have had a better experience. The purpose of our trip was to see Aladdin on Broadway, so the location was ideal, since the theater was one block over. Every staff member was friendly and professional, and the highlight of our hotel experience was meeting Tobo, the bellman. He was warm and welcoming when we arrived. He even recommended that we take a short-cut through McDonald’s (across the street) to get to the theater entrance instead of walking around the block. When we checked out, we saw him again and he remembered my daughter’s name and asked her how she liked Aladdin. He is an asset to this property!The entire hotel is immaculate, and although the room was "NY compact", it was also immaculate, modern and cozy, with all the regular amenities and comforts. We were on the 23rd floor with a view of the Empire State Building. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quiet since we were so high up.The breakfast was fantastic, and even though it was rather crowded both mornings, the traffic flowed, the staff was attentive and all the food was tasty and plentiful. Another perk is the cookies and hot beverages available in the lobby. We loved our hot chocolate and cookie ritual each night when we came in from the cold.We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn was in a great location right at Times Square. The concierge and staff at breakfast were very friendly and welcoming. Definitely big perks of the hotel. Breakfast was standard for a Hampton Inn, always enjoy it being free but nothing to write home about. The elevators and bed made me reconsider if I would ever stay at the hotel again though. It seemed to take forever to get an elevator regardless of the time and they were very small and crowded non-stop. Elevators would fill up then stop at every floor on the way down from the 25th. Add 10 minutes to travel time just to get to the lobby from your room. I don't mind walking stairs but it's a bit different when you're talking 20+ stories. The bed was also probably the least comfortable I've ever slept on and had a huge crest in the middle of the mattress so if I rolled slightly to the side I was practically falling off. Overall a decent experience and you can't beat the location but could definitely use new mattresses, they were hard as a rock.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very warm, very clean. in the heart of Time Square. Walked to everything and enjoy every minute of it. The staff were very friendly and will to stop and help with ours needs at all times. Will visit again. Can't wait to make my next reservation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is new and offers a very good experience. It is 1 block form Times Square, normally well price rooms with free breakfast and internet. Rooms are decent size for Manhattan and bathrooms are finished in modern fashion. Breakfast variety is very good as is quality.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Two Broadway shows, two outstanding museum experiences, lots of sightseeing, in three wonderful days in NYC! All within easy walking distance of our great 'home-away-from-home' the Hampton Inn-Times Square. I could not find a thing to complain about in this modern, attractive, comfortable hotel! The digital check-in the day before arrival allowed us to choose the room we wished and the chip-based room key was waiting for us when we walked up to the desk. They even accommodated our request for early check-in! Rooms were spotless and tastefully decorated with good lighting and seating. Service throughout was top notch. The complimentary breakfasts high quality and had something for every taste. And they lasted until 11:00 AM so you could sleep-in and still stoke up for the day. The Concierge was knowledgeable and very helpful in checking out events and best means of getting to them.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Less than a block from Port Authority, easy access to so many wonderful places. So clean, friendly and reasonable for all that is provided. John the concierge obviously loves his job and enjoys helping out of towners maximize their experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited NYC to celebrate my birthday with some friends..We booked at the Hampton Inn in Times Square because it is a central location to everywhere, the price was affordable and they offered a breakfast buffet which was great! We had a beautiful city view from our room the 28th floor which the rooms were very clean! The complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate offered 24 hrs definitely was plus! My most memorable experience I will have from this hotel was the excellent customer service given to us during breakfast! The morning of my birthday, breakfast attendant, Ebony Langhorne warmly welcomed and promised us that we would be quite happy after having breakfast! After telling her it was my birthday, she excitedly wished me a happy birthday with a warm hug! After sitting down to eat breakfast, Ebony came over to our table singing happy birthday with a cupcake, chocolates and a birthday card. Ebony truly made me feel special as well as provided us with the best customer service. Her personality was quite welcoming and you can tell that she loves her job! Her superb service definitely deserves a raise we will definitely be back to the Hampton Inn Times Square Central soon!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Flew in from Miami, FL for a leisurely stay in the city. While staying at this hotel my group and I experienced great customer service! Our room had an amazing view of the city with snow-capped roof tops. We were greeted by the sweetest staff during breakfast. Mrs. Ebony was so sweet and accommodating. She greeted my friend on her birthday and sung to her with her breakfast staff as we had breakfast. I thought her kindness was the sweetest gesture.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. It has complimentary breakfast which is big in New York to save a lot of money since everything is expensive. The room was a little small, but so are most rooms in New York. We did not spend much tim in the room for our one night stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I had a wonderful weekend at the Hampton. There was complimentary WiFi and breakfast. It was walking distance from Time Square, Broadway theaters, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. It was also closeby to the subway station, where we took it to visit the 9/11 memorial and museum. Rooms were nice and clean and staff so very friendly! The day of our check out, we were able to store our luggage with them until we had to leave for the airport in which they helped hail a taxi for us. They do have a private van to the airport for a flat rate of $60. Taxi cab ride was about $40 to LaGuardia airport.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay was really good, it's a great location right by Times Square and lots of bars and restaurants nearby. The room was big, huge bed and a really big shower. TV in the room as well as hairdryer and ironing board, everything you need for a weekend get away. The breakfast has a great choice from cereal and fruit to waffles and some cooked options too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room in particular here are excellent. Super stylish love the color scheme or darks and the berry pinks. Some tasty treats for diamonds upon checkin. Far better than Hampton Inn Times Square North. Lifts are fast despite being a tall hotel. Easy access to 42nd street without all the hustle and bustle as its on 41st. Nice and painless checkin. I'll definitely come back I like !! (A lot!)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed overnight for dinner and a show with a group of friends. The hotel valet parked the car was convenient but typical NYC expensive parking. The room was small, but very clean and comfy. Everything was new which was nice.The hotel is in a great location for a Broadway show. The staff were friendly and nice.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: So love that I can always book a last minute business trip with Hilton and still get the best rate. This hotel was perfect location. Close to bus terminal and right behind the theater where Aladdin is playing. Great restaurants and close to metro stops. Walking distance to so many restaurants. Comfortable rooms, free hot breakfast and business center. Great stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Starying 2 long weekends in a row for business and pleasure near Times Square. Truly a Hampton dependable hotel - comfortable beds, way above average breakfast facility, near to TS offices and great restaraunts - but it's the staff that sets this one apart. Concierge Jonathon is definitely in the right job. How could he know everyone that walks in the door?! That's his attititude - everyone is a persona friend. Got us reservatons at great restauants, great seats for broadway shows and more. And us Texas folks sure got a kick out of his genuine New Yahk accent (well, at least an accent to us). We'll never stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I chose the hotel primarily for the location and the breakfast included in the rate, and also gained a great service by all the staff, which by the way is very clean and organized, fast lifts and breakfast satisfatório.recomendo all that quiram a quality hotel and very close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn, like most, was clean, comfortable and staffed with helpful people. We chose a "city view" room and it was well worth it. I called in advance and asked for a good view and we were given a 30th floor room. We loved both our night and morning views of the Empire State Building and other skyscrapers. Bedding was very comfy.  I could hear the elevator nearby, but it was not loud. Still, if that's the kind of thing that bothers you, you should ask for a room away from the elevator or bring earplugs or -- as we do -- bring an ipod programed with nature sounds -- best white noise ever. The breakfast in this hotel -- like most Hamptons -- was great. Lots of fresh fruit, good coffee, many options. There is a concierge in the lobby -- might be helpful if you're looking for Broadway ticket specials. We already had our tickets, so unnecessary. Plus, there seems to be a lack of knowledge of the kind I would find helpful. I was directed to some expensive restaurants. I found a terrific one on my own -- Urbo -- just a couple blocks away -- and it has an upstairs room with fabulous views of Times Square. But this was a perfect hotel for our Broadway trip. I felt comfortable at night in the neighorhood with my daughter -- and I'm 64 years old and she has Down SyndormeFinally, I have to thank Carmen, who helped me out when the snowstorm threatened and we needed to change our check-out day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I hate to rate this hotel because I would love it if the prices stayed the same. It was a great place to stay in NYC Time Square area. Clean, free breakfast, great staff, close to EVERYTHING I needed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room is small but NOT as small as the Waldorf Astoria which is where we stayed last time. It was clean - and although the first room we were in DID have a leaky ceiling, they moved us and the new room had a way better view. The breakfast was amazing and FREE which saved us a TON of money for 4 people. We were comfortable and the staff was great. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Don't have much to say, which is a good thing. Met and exceeded expectations. Only when something is WRONG do I typically take notice of it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, with decent hot food.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a fun weekend in the blizzard last week. It's a regular Hampton Inn in terms of what to expect with very nice decor. We had a King room and no space was wasted. Loved the sliding (barn style) door for the bathroom. Lacks privacy but looks nice. The staff was excellent and valet service was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I just went to NYC for Musical Theater College Auditions. This Hampton was in the perfect location for our auditions. It was two blocks from Times Square, a couple of blocks from the theaters, and we absolutely loved everything about our stay. Beds were comfortable, staff was great, our view was pretty good as they put us on the 26th floor because I asked for a view. Having a free breakfast was great and saved us some money for a show. Will stay here again for sure and hope the price doesn't go up too much!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My friend and went were on a leisure trip to see NYC. The hotel was absolutely wonderful! The room was so quiet you could hear a pin drop; complimentary breakfast provided almost anything you could want and was plentiful. the location was amazing in that you were on Times Square in a matter of a couple minutes. If you want to be close to the glitter and have a comfortable stay, this is the place to stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this Hampton Inn during the blizzard weekend in New York City. The staff was very helpful and made my stay memorable. The location is incredible. Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. A new hotel with very clean rooms. I recommend getting a city view room. Worth the extra charge.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Travelled to NYC in Sep15 with my husband and two kids. This is a new hotel so everything is clean and new. We booked a high level apartment and was able to view the colour changing spire of the Empire State Building from our bed. We did have a room next to the elevators, but we did not hear them at all. There is a little street noise, and more on the weekends, but you are blocks away from Times Square, so it was to be expected. We either walked or caught the subway everywhere. There are laundry facilities which makes travelling so much easier. Also a basic buffet breakfast was included.* Best part about the hotel was Vince. Amazing customer service!* Downside to the hotel was the wait for a lift in the mornings. * Family Friendly Restaurant close by - Olive Garden* Quick Meal on the Run - Kiss My Pizza

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a new-ish property of the Hilton group and is located very conveniently, indeed. Half a block to the Port Authority terminus & a stone's throw away from Times Square. The former is important for me since when in NYC, I do a few trips to NJ and back. The rooms are well, very New York-ish - compact and functional. The bed is comfortable and the heating exemplary. The bathroom is well stocked and spacious. There is an iron+ironing board and a safe in the room as well. Wifi is free and good. The reception is warm and check-ins are in a jiffy. The breakfast spread is typical of an NYC hotel - just right. The gym is fairly well equipped and comfortable. All in all, a very comfortable stay for the 5 nights I was there.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Most everything about my visit was very good. The location, for me on business, was excellent as I could walk to Javitts (15 minutes) and also walk to Times Square (5 minutes) in really cold weather. The lobby and rooms were pretty spotless and new with all brand new furniture, fixtures, etc. The wit-fi worked very well. The only negative is that the elevators were small and many times over crowded - if you hit the elevators the same time as the high school band that occupied most of the floors during gym visit! Outside of these hours (during band transfer) elevator wait times did not seem out of the ordinary. Staff was friendly and courteous and there is a ticket concierge on-site to help with show seats if that is your desire.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff went through 4 different sets of bed linens to find some not stained/soiled. Wasted so much time dealing with this during my stay - and can I say yuck? Location is good, breakfast is good. Rooms are tiny and three feet from the elevator bank.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was in the perfect spot for our theater going weekend. Everything was in a few blocks of walking from the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel provided breakfast which was more than enough for us! The available coffee and tea was a nice bonus to have when coming in from the cold!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is very clean, centrally located, modern and has a wonderful, complimentary buffet breakfast. With the exception of one very rude female at the front desk during the evening, who apparently did not want to be bothered with our request for additional bath towels, the staff is quite professional. Nice touch having tea, coffee and hot chocolate free and available from the lobby 24/7.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Hampton Inn Times Square and have come away with mixed thoughts about this hotel. Firstly the pro's - great location on 41st street between 7th & 8th especially if you want to be near Time Square- Hotel is relatively new and the rooms were clean-0n-site guest laundry- Consierg on site, seem to be helpful, although we did not use.Now the negatives- we arrived by taxi with a large amount of luggage, no valet was around, we loaded bags on the trolley ourselves and pushed them inside, to find that the valets were inside talking to the receptionist. No offer of assistance to help us with the bags was forthcoming.-service whilst it was polite was not overly friendly or engaging - they just seemed to be doing there job, which is very different to the experience we have had at other Hampton Inns were staff have all been friendly and engaging.-breakfast is included in room rate, more staff appear to be needed to keep items refilled and keep the tables clean and to keep on top of mess left in the area where the food is laid out by guests.-the room was small, we had a double room, which was supposed to have 2 double beds in - they were more like the size of 2 king singles and there is no way that 4 people could share that room. No space for suitcases to be laid out, and no fridge in room.So overall a very mixed experience, an ok stay for a couple of days at a reasonable price in a good location, but not up to the normal Hampton standard.
