hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent two nights in room 2307. Avoid that room like the plague. When the heater hits the set temp, it makes a loud banging noise just before cycling off. So I turned off the heater for the night, but heard two others (one in room below me, one in room next to me). A co-worker was on same floor, other side of building, and had a quiet night. Otherwise, the hotel is brand new, rooms are very nice but small (it's NY, so no surprise). Hotel was crowded and we had no delays with elevators. Breakfast was crowded the first morning, but the food was well stocked and I did find a seat. Second day not too crowded. Typical HI food choices.Great location, not too far of a walk to Javits Center, Times Square and Penn Station. Closest bar we found was across the street at the Hilton. Plenty of good food choices all around.Would I stay again? Sure, but I'd definitely complain earlier and switch room, even in the middle of the night, to avoid the noise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Manhattan Central is in a perfect location to enjoy the sights and sounds of NYC. Being a new property the accommodations are top grade, and being next door to Nederlander Theater & the theater district, literally entertainment is less than 30 feet away!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My fiancee and I stayed here while in NYC for our 10 year anniversary and we couldn't have picked a better hotel! The room, while not huge, had plenty of space. We stayed in a king room on the 28th floor with a city view and it was beautiful! The bathroom/shower was very clean and nice and the bed was super comfortable. The rooms were very quiet. You couldn't hear much noise outside or from the hallway except for the occasional door closing. The free breakfast was great and had a lot of options and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an inexpensive stay in a beautiful hotel, close to everything. We will definitely be back next time we're in the city!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central with my daughter for 3 nights (Jan 8-11). Since our flight was so early, we arrived at the hotel at 9am. Front desk was very kind and held our luggage so we could explore the city. The location of this hotel is excellent, it's so close to everything, but not too close. A 2-3 minute walk to get to Times Square. We walked to the north end of Central Park one day and it only took 1 hour. The hotel itself, is new and clean. Our room with two double beds was a great size. Bathroom had plenty of room to store all necessities. The free breakfast was a nice perk and it was good. It was busy, but we always managed to find a place to sit. As for the elevators, we didn't find them slow at all. We were on the 20th floor and didn't have a problem. The free coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby was a bonus. Staff were always super friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to come back one day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: this hotel was amazing, my room was in 29th floor as i remember, wide and overlooking the tall closeby buildings, it worth every penny i paidthe hotel location is more than wonderful, McDonald is just cross the street, Red Lobster is around the corner, Hop on-Of buses are closeby, times square is two minutes walking and all the theaters are around the hoteli just want to warn that don't try to come before the check in time written on your checking voucher becasue you won't receive your room since the hotel is really busy and fulli really enjoyed my stay and strongly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved the location. It made an awesome hub to get out and see the city. Only downfall was how loud it was on Saturday night- loud music all night, we couldn't even use our white noise app to block it out. Otherwise it was great free breakfast, clean room, helpful and friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Close to all the action in Times Sq. and to transportation (Port Authority). A great bargain for an excellent hotel. Located on 41st, not the most scenic block but so close to everything that more than makes up for it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed here while in town to see Les Miserable at the Imperial. The Hotel was very clean and the staff that I dealt with were very friendly. Breakfast was your typical Hampton. Yes the rooms are on the small size, but it is the city. Very close to times square and a 15 min. walk to Grand Central. The only hiccup was during check in (this has nothing to do with the hotel, I believe, just the HH program). I had E checked in the day before and was able to pick my room on the south side of the building. After leaving the front desks en route to the elevator I checked my print out and In deed the rooms were different. I then went back to ask about the room I had requested. The lady said that had a stay over and that room was not available. Maybe Hilton/Hotel could send something (email/text) when this happens so you don't have to go through this

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel Is in a great location in the Times Square area. It is within reasonable walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Madison Square Garden, Broadway Theaters, etc. Staff was friendly, the king bed room was small (to be expected in NYC), clean and modern. The valet parking was worth it. Taking an elevator to the ground floor could sometimes take awhile since all 3 elevators are small and there are 31 floors for the elevator stop at. Next time, I would request a low floor so taking the stairs is an option. The breakfast area could be hectic, but after all, breakfast was free. I would definitely book another room here.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was awesome to stay in to attend the parade. Room was just what I would expect from a new Hampton. Most of the staff were wonderful, a couple lived up to the perception of NYC. Only gripe: had to file charge dispute over incidental charge I was told was refunded.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hilton/Hampton line was recommended by some friends so I thought it time I tried one of your hotels. The entire staff was extremely courteous and helpful and the location perfect. My son wasn't feeling well (a cold perhaps) the next AM and a member of your dining staff took him aside and got him some OJ and ginger ale to settle his tummy. They then checked back a couple of times to make sure he was OK. My only quibbles were that the only person at check-in was reading something as we arrived and did not look up to see us for a few minutes. The TV was messed up by someone prior to us and I had to summon a maintenance person to reset it back to normal. Overall our stay was fabulous, apart from the weather, and I will definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends! The hotel is spotless and the rooms perfect in all regards. The decor is contemporary and in keeping with the city surroundings. My son especially loved the breakfast each morning which is an added bonus in NYC. We're looking forward to our next trip and will look to stay at a Hilton Hotel. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn has been recently renovated and had clean, quiet rooms, nice hot breakfast (complimentary), cookies in the lobby, and free internet in the rooms. It is located just off of Times Square so it is central to many activities. Great value overall.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall we enjoyed staying at this hotel as it was a convenient location to Times Square, the subway was across the street, the Port Authority Bus was one block away (bus to Met Life Stadium and the Giants Football Game). However, our Check-In did not go smoothly. We arrived at on a red eye 6 am at the airport and had requested an early check in, however because it was the Saturday and the night previously had been sold out our room was not ready when we got to the hotel at 7:30 am. So we checked in our bags at the bell desk and did some shopping and had a meal before my wife got real tired and wanted to just wait for our room at the hotel. She inquired again for check in and was told that there were no rooms available. To make sure the front desk knew she was there, my wife sat near the front desk. During the 2 hour wait she saw at least 2 other parties get their rooms and one guest was even nice enough to say to the attendant gesturing to my wife, "oh she was here first" as the attendant proceeded to check him in. We finally were able to get our rooms about 2 pm which was still before the normal check in time of 3 pm but just wondered about the priority for available rooms for early check in. We are diamond members of HHonors and stayed on reward points so I am not sure we were on a lower priority because we were on points. There were some other small problems that have been described in other reviews including slow elevators and small rooms with a very small bathroom vanity. And housekeeping did not refill our amenities such as soap, shampoo, shower gel, lotion, and decaf coffee but corrected with a call. However, the pluses outweighed the negatives and we really enjoyed this hotel. We really enjoyed having a full breakfast every morning and having coffee available 24/7 in the lobby with cookies set out in the evening. The weather was in the 30's so it was nice to arrive and leave the hotel with hot coffee. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and would stay again. We also stayed at the W at Times Square during this trip and we preferred this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved everything about this hotel - the friendly staff, John at the concierge desk, Nini and Ebony who made sure we had what we needed for breakfast. The breakfast selections each day was fantastic! The beds were very comfy. Location was GREAT! We will definitely be back! We had a fantastic room also!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: i had no issues with the room whatsoever, my reason to give this hotel a 4/5 only because the front desk messed up my account they continuously removed money from my account for no reason, when i brought it to their notice they immediately returned my money. Overall my stay was excellent, excellent location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great staff, great room and excellent location. Travelled with a child and the total experience was great. The breakfast was also really good and the fitness center useful after a good day of travelling in New York. Easy access from the Lincoln tunnel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is a block from times square, and in the middle of 2 subway stops. This absolutely worked for me as I was site seeing & having the metro near is a must. Hotel super clean, newly renovated, bed was very comfortable. Does not have a tub but shower is ok too. The room is modern, flat TV, seems everything is new. I only heard noise from a screaming child and coversation next door once, so walls are not very sound proof. There are 3 small elevators and it's quite a wait during breakfast cause by the time it get to your floor it's jammed. but I was given a low floor (8th) so i took the stairs to get down, did not have to wait to get up to the room. Not much space to sit at breakfast so get there early before 8am or late after 10am when there is less people, they serve until 11am so that's good if you want to sleep more. Free coffee, tea & cookies in the lobby. My flight was in the afternoon and check out was as 12 so they offered holding my luggage free so i could keep walking though the city without the hassle of my bags. I would definitely book again this hotel when going to NYC. Would recommend if you are tourist and want to be at T. Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here one night right after the New Year. The free coffee in the lobby is a great treasure for a coffee addict like myself. Free breakfast is a huge bonus in Time square but be prepared to wait and you may not find a place to sit. (We did but we went down early). The rooms are small but very clean. It took a while for hot water to kick in for a shower but once it did all was well. The higher the floor you stay on the less noise but the elevators get full and you end up waiting for one with room. It is very close to the center of time square we walked everywhere we wanted to go.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I don't see how this hotel could have been better, especially for the price. Alright, It does not have a quiet dark little bar with delicious and inexpensive drinks and a beautiful piano player but there is such a place down the street. It was just an excellent value in every respect.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros*Location of property is amazing. Right on a side street off of Times Square. Not even 1/10th of a mile from the action. *Hotel is spotless. Not sure how old it is, but I would venture to guess that it's still newer.*Breakfast is included. Now this is a HUGE perk for anyone who's ever been to Times Square. To be able to eat breakfast for free is not the norm in the heart of the city. The area is jammed, but the options are plentiful. Good stuff. Cons*Grossly mismanaged. True story. Cannot make this up. Woke up at 5:00am to go to the gym for a run. Stopped in the lobby for a tea and a newspaper. Looked out the front door and saw a car that looked just like mine. Laughed. Thought nothing of it. Went to the gym. Later on, I came back for breakfast and went to the front desk to get valet to get my car. To which they tell me that my car is out front. Yes. The very same car I saw at 5:00am was still out there at 10:00am. To make among story short, valet pulled our car accidentally AT MIDNIGHT. Instead of bringing the car back to the garage, they let it parked out in front of a narrow Times Square side street for the next 10 hours. Oh...and I paid for valet when checking out. Manager offered to reimburse me for valet. I said what valet? I didn't even use the garage. Regardless, I called corporate Hilton once home and they made it right as they always do. However, the Management on site are useless and the employees are obviously even worse based on the car situation. It's too bad because this a great hotel in an even better location. I'll never return though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is very close to Times Square and can be a bit hectic and noisy.The only parking option the hotel offers is their valet about $60 for all day. The staff were very unfriendly and unaccommodating. Room was clean and good size. Shower water pressure can be improved and the hot water took a bit to come on. Bathroom and toilet very clean. I highly liked the non smoking policy of the hotels in New York. Breakfast is OK. A chiller in the room would be an improvement.They offered complimentary coffee, tea and hot cocoa in the lobby but every time we tried to take advantage they were out of something and we had to wait for a refill, hot cocoa packets (twice), hot water, tea and cup lids. Overall the hotel is a good value. It's a small operation, the staff should not wait until guests tell them that something is missing, routine checks would take care of that. Simple 2 star hotel staff know this.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really enjoyed our experience in Hampton Inn Times Square hotel. Staff was very nice, helpfull and flexible. breakfeast very good and diversified, room and bathroom very clean, good price, pretty room. We recommand it !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here Dec 24th-26th. We really enjoyed our stay! The hotel is close to everything. We walked to Times Square, Rockefeller center, and 5th Ave because it was just so close. Other than location, the hotel itself is great. The included breakfast definitely surpassed my expectations. It was a full hot breakfast, with waffle maker included. It did get VERY crowded since we were there for Christmas and went later in the morning, so there was barely enough room to sit and the actual breakfast line took about 15 minutes to get through (again-waffle maker). I think if the layout was different somehow, or the waffles were freshly made without people having to stand there to make it themselves, it would save a lot of time for the guests and help with the flow of people coming in. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. The room was a bit small, as others have said. But I know this is New York City, and for the price we paid-it was a great deal. The only thing that really was a disappointment was the checking out process. The actual checkout went smoothly but getting our car took about an hour and a half! We were told to call 30 minutes prior to checkout to make sure the Valet gets our car in time for us. We did so, and then went to check out. No car. So we waited another 15 minutes. We then went to the front desk and asked about it and they had to call the Valet and give them all of the info again, so another 45 minutes pass before we get our car! I'm not sure if this was a slip on someone's part or if it's because it was a busy weekend with Christmas and all, but it was definitely a disappointment. Make sure you give yourself plenty of time if you drive there and sue their Valet service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Like this hotel - room, location, amenities are all great. Good breakfast with varieties though limited seatings/space (or too many people on the week of new year eve?) Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are always there for you at lobby. I spent only one night here but false fire alarm kept ringing from 1am to 2am. It might be uncommon or just a coincidence. Apart from this one, it is a good choice if you want to be right in Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our group of 2 adults and four children stayed here in two rooms from December 25-29. We requested rooms close together and were given rooms right next door to each other, which made us very happy. The rooms were clean and had plenty of space, comfortable beds, and a very clean bathroom. The rooms are slightly smaller than your typical Hampton Inn room, however, I feel that for being in the heart of Time Square, the size was more than appropriate. The included breakfast was very good. We enjoyed the fresh fruit, eggs, pastries, yogurts, cereals, waffle maker, and more. There is always coffee and tea in the lobby, and most of the time you can grab a freshly baked cookie from the front desk of the lobby. Another nice feature of the breakfast area is that they leave the room unlocked all day and allow guests to bring meals in there to eat. We picked up pizza one evening and ate it in that area which made for a quick, convenient meal for us.Location: there is a subway station almost directly across the street, super convenient for hotel guests. It is on a fairly quiet side street right in between 7 & 8th Avenue, and is VERY close to Time Square. It is a 3 minute walk to Time Square, and a convenient walk to most every theater. We walked to the Imperial Theater for Les Mis in less than 10-15 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance - I highly recommend John's Pizza (two locals told us it was the best in NYC and we agreed) and Carmine's (family style Italian) which were both on 44th St, an easy walk from the hotel. If you are ok with a 15-20 minute walk, from the hotel you can get to the Rockefeller Center, Saks 5th Avenue (on 5th Avenue) and Tiffany's. If you want to be near TIme Square, this location is excellent! If you want a prettier part of town, it may not be the hotel for you.The staff was friendly and the hotel was a good value. The only negative I'll mention is one that you may see in other reviews - and that is the elevator issue. There are three elevators in a tall building. If you try to get an elevator at a busy time (between 9 and 10 during breakfast hours) you will wait a while for a ride. If you get up early, this won't be an issue. There is also not a service elevator for employees, so as housekeeping is cleaning rooms, you may have a wait as they use the elevators for their equipment and to get garbage downstairs.Is the elevator issue enough to not stay in this hotel? In my opinion, no. Just know you may need extra time waiting for an elevator during peak time, and enjoy the value and proximity to theaters and Time Square. We would stay here again happily.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Happy New Year, I love this hotel. Perfect location just off Time Square, blocks from all the fun tour buses, shows, and fun Time Square stuff! My room was small but perfect size for me, I wouldn't recommend room #7 on any floor for 2 people. One small issue, the heat when it shut down made an amazingly loud sound, and you could hear other rooms heat turn off too. Keep the temp on the cool side, it will scare you at 2 am!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived New Year's Day. Corner room was good on 15th floor. New hotel room was clean. They seem to have a lot of trouble with elevators being down. Breakfast was ok. Get there early gets crazy. I left my hat by mistake in lobby and they had it for me at desk. Great location in the thick of all the action. Recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel exceeded our expectations.The room was clean and big enough ,we had a corner room..01. The staff was super attentive, The elevators werent so bad an issue and breakfast was great.We definitely will come back, because besides all of hat,the location is fantastic

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As a longtime guest at Hilton properties, I know what to expect when I stay at one of their properties. So, I wasn't expecting the red carpet at the Hampton Inn, but friendly and efficient service is their trademark - especially amongst the front desk staff. At check-in it was clear that this Hampton Inn was a bit unlike others I've stayed at across the country (and in New York City). When I arrived, there were no guests waiting to check in and two front desk agents - one on the phone, the other away from the desk. The one who walked up to the desk looked directly at me and walked away into the lobby without saying a word to me - to help someone get hot chocolate. It would have been nice if she'd said something like, "I'll be right back to help you" or even just "hello." She proceeded through the process without: being very friendly, providing wifi info, giving breakfast information or reviewing my rate - which I thought included valet parking. I had reserved a room online, but wasn't sure if they were all the same. She was able to tell me that they were: all the same size, couldn't recommend one over another and that some faced "this side" and the others were "that way." It would have been nice to have some depth to her answer (like, you can see ______ from these rooms on ____ street or you may want to stay on ____ floor if ____). I had to ask her to check my rate. She confirmed it included parking and proceeded to stare at me as if I should walk away. After asking her what to do with the car, I was glad to be done with checking in and hoped for better going forward. While unpacking the car, I was pleasantly surprised to have an employee come up to take the car keys (the front desk agent asked me to bring them back to her). Finally, a positive experience! We usually stay downtown or near Greenwich Village when in NYC visiting my daughter at NYU, so this was a nice change. It is close to a lot of the lights and action of Time Square, but not too close to the noise. It was an easy walk to Bryant Park, and about 15 minutes walk to Rockefeller Center. Another positive! RECOMMENDATION: There is a long wait for elevators, so if your group is fit enough, stay on a lower floor and take the stairs. Staying on a lower floor with folks who cannot take the stairs may be a mistake since the elevator fills on its way down from the top and many people who were waiting for the elevator on floors 7 and down often had to wait or split their group to descend. The room was a standard double. Not much to say about it other than it had a nice view of the street and a peak at some of the billboards in Times Square. It was on the 19th floor, and if I had known (hello, front desk agent!) how difficult it is to get an elevator in this hotel, I would have choose one on a lower floor to use the stairs. The bathroom was very clean and nicely decorated. It wasn't tiny for me and my two teenagers, but it Bedtime was a bit of a challenge as a fire alarm blared around 1am. It went off for about 10 minutes, stopped and then about 5 minutes later, an intercom voice informed the hotel that it was a false alarm. Not so great, but not the hotels doing. One huge problem: there was no refrigerator. The breakfast area was small relative to the number of guests. It was very crowded and there was nowhere to sit in the seating area adjacent to the food. There were seats in the lobby. The array of food was typical of Hampton Inn and the staff worked hard to keep it stocked, the area clean and to answer guest concerns/respond to their needs. I would definitely give Andre, the young lady working with him, and the team in the kitchen area an excellent rating. I noticed that about 15 minutes after my son and I arrived, a long line for food started to form. RECOMMENDATION: ask the front desk staff what the typical busy times are and plan accordingly and there is a long, pub height table off the lobby that has atleast 10 comfortable stools - eat there instead of the noisy breakfast room. I forgot toothpaste so had to make another trip to the front desk. I had very low expectations, but was surprised to receive a pleasant, friendly greeting. I relayed my very different experience from just 12 hours before and the person, I think her name was Keryll, turned out to be a manager. She apologized for the experience and stated that there would be some retraining in the evening agent's future. She offered 10,000 Hilton Honors points for the bad check-in experience (they haven't appeared on my statement yet). Overall, I am not sure I would return to this location. I've stayed at the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Time Square (excellent) and two Marriott properties (Courtyard Chelsea and a Residence Inn Times Square) that have exceeded expectations and delivered amazing service with better and bigger rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There are lots of pluses and minuses to staying in the heart of Times Square, but the most notable was the street level noise! At 1:00am it was difficult to fall asleep even on the 19th floor with all the noise outside. I wish I had waited for a room on the 30th! The room itself, though, was great: fully equipped, clean, and actually roomier (by NYC standards) than expected.Breakfast was a mob scene with long waits to serve ourselves, wait for refills, find a table.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in Dec and the stay was wonderful . The location is just perfect , right on Times Square and the staff is very friendly . Special mention to Maria, on front desk , who really took good care of us . Just a suggestion to add a few vegetarian options in breakfast . Would definitely recommend this place in the heart of New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staying here between Port Authority and Time Square was awesome! The price and newness was refreshing. The staff was very pleasant. We stayed on the 27th floor facing the street for the quietness, but the large digital bright screens on the buildings across the street can make it difficult to sleep. I propped up books and a bag to seal out any light on the curtains. Maybe try facing the back of the hotel away from the elevators? The three car elevators were always being used by the many people staying in this 250+ room hotel, including the maid service. Plan to wait at least 5-10 minutes using these small elevators. If you stay below the 10th floor, I might suggest using the stairs as we will do if we stay here again. The breakfast was good, but after 8am, it is too crowded, you wait in line and no where to sit, it's not relaxing at all. But hey, this is New York! If we stay here again, I will know what to expect and adjust to my comfort. It really is a nice new hotel, only 5 months old.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have two rooms for the family. Location was superb and the staff were permanently at hand to help during our 6 days. Breakfast was good but a little crowded at certain peak periods. Rooms were great but one of our rooms was next to lift so we encountered an unfortunate wining noise otherwise I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
user_location: Hampton Inn Time Square New York, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! Greeted/Welcomed by Vince!? What a gent he remembered all our names Very helpful and went out of his way for us We stayed from Wed 9th- Mon 14th Dec 15.The lifts and Breakfast busyness didn't bother us you just get on with it Fab location!!Comfortable/Clean rooms (could do with a fridge) We stayed in room 2603! Fantastic View! Wish we stayed longer! Definitely will be back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent our Wedding night here, & it was a fabulous stay. Great room. Very clean. Large sized bathroom & very elegant. Comfortable bed & pillows. Right in Times Square. Had an amazing view of Times Square from Floor 27. Free breakfast was fantastic - you can even make your own waffles. On arrival, staff were great. Hot drinks were also available for yourself to make. The lift visited every floor on the way down at breakfast time - that took awhile - especially when the lift was already full after going down 4 floors. But overall, we were very impressed with this hotel & will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was very clean, free breakfast was delicious, and the staff was awesome! They were so helpful with questions we had about the city and arranged our taxi back to Newark when it was time to fly home. Hotel is new and location is great for sightseeing ....would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Walked to: Time Square, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller and Madison Square Garden. Lots to do in the hotel area. Big bonus: complimentary hot breakfast (eggs, waffles, sausage,oatmeal and more) with cereal, fruit and pastries too. Service desk was friendly. Housekeeping was great--rooms were always clean looking and smelled fresh too. Will likely stay here again on next trip!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As most precious reviewers stated before me, this hotel really gives give you all you should need for a visit to New York. Excellent location, a few min walk from times square, Briant park, port authority and so much more.The hotel is brand new and so is also everything in the room. Good bed, excellent shower and an awesome view.This hotel did lose half a star due to one pain point which many NYC hotels suffers from, not having the common areas and amenities fit the amount of people. The three elevators, although new and fast, are just not enough to serve more than 30 floors of hotel rooms and long waits can happen. Also, the breakfast area is to small, and during rush hour, it can be hard to find a spot.Bottom line, great hotel and great value for NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location! Two blocks from Broadway and the center of Times Square. Room was a bit small but we weren't there to stay in the room so it fulfilled our need. The breakfast was very good. Every employee that we encountered was polite, helpful and very friendly. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here from December 17-19. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and roomy enough for the four of us - queen beds would have been nice but we managed just fine with doubles. Sliding door on the bathroom surprised us but after the first day we got used to it. Breakfast was quite good and had lots of choices. Only negative was on the last day we were there (Saturday before Christmas) - it was packed!! It took quite a while to get an elevator and breakfast was a little more difficult to enjoy. None of this was the hotel's fault - there were just a lot of people and not everyone is considerate. The breakfast staff kept everything stocked well.All in all I would definitely stay here again. Just a couple blocks to the theater, lots of places to eat nearby (Schnippers is on the corner) - Times Square was a couple of blocks in the other direction.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was very clean. The front desk was very polite and helpful. The elevators were not a problem like I have read in other reviews. The breakfast was amazing. The location was convenient. Thanks to all:) Will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is your typical Hampton, done NYC style. The hotel's location is great; about 5 minutes to Time Square. The room is small but has everything you need. In room safe, good linens, nicely renovated bathroom. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights whilst staying in NY. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel had great location. Was only one road away from Times Square. A free breakfast was provided everyday along with free wifi. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms had a tv as well. I'd happily stay here again if I was to stay in NY again for tge great location and the cheap price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has only been open 180 days and you can tell - everything was in great condition and the staff was very friendly! They had complimentary coffee/tea/water in the lobby and one night there were cookies as we returned from the theater. The rooms had built in ports for charging in several places and the beds were comfy. My husband thought it was a great hotel for the price.The free breakfast was standard Hampton fare but, good.The only negative was limited counter space in the bathroom.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff here go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I was acknowledged by everyone I came in contact with. The breakfast buffet had a good selection, and the food was ok. I highly recommend this hotel!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I took my niece and two nephews the hotel was new and it looked it the rooms were lovely and comfortable spanning 31 floors close enough to Time Square and all the sites without being on Times Square, breakfast was included in the price with a side variety for any picky family of eaters like mine, buffet go up as many times as you want everything fresh. The staff were brilliant thanks Vince and the rest of the staff for making it a home away from home, we will be coming back, in fact my 13 year old nephew didn't want to leave, free complementary tea, coffee, egg nog and cookies in reception too. A real find. Can't wait to go back! I've stayed at others in New York but this is the best

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Many day tripsThis was the first time staying overnight. Stayed for five days. Almost everything in walking distance. Subway right at the corner. Times Square around the corner. Staff every helpful and knowledgeable. Elevators slow just as other reviews mention but knowing ahead of time made the delay easier to take in stride. Facilities are clean. Breakfast part of the reservations. Decent food. Good waffle bar. Very convenient. In the middle of 41st street... A quiet street in the middle of the city.Would highly recommend staying here. Very reasonably priced for location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent 5 days & had a wonderful time. Ebony & Lucy made the breakfasts delightful. Breakfasts were quite good - scrambled eggs one day, omelettes another day. They always had waffles, cereal, yogurt, etc. The room was small but clean & nice, although there was no refrigerator. The location is quite convenient to several subway stops.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here when in town for a few days to see some shows. Very conveniently located close to Times Square and Broadway. Surrounded by numerous great restaurants. Arrived early in the morning after a "red eye" flight. The staff was very accommodating and found us a room to check in early at no additional charge. Unfortunately, we were on a lower level, so not much of a view. I understand that the higher floors have great views. The hotel appears to be brand new and in excellent condition. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All the way around, this hotel was EXCELLENT! The location was perfect, being just steps from Times Square with a host of places to eat and shop. It was also very close to the Subway station, but this location was great to just walk to your activities. The rooms were good in size with a large bathroom, and they were very clean. There was never an issue with the cleanliness or restocking of the room each day. The heat/air worked perfectly and was quite. We had a city view room, and room noise was very minimal. Breakfast each morning was outstanding, with different hot choices each morning and it was always very well stocked and clean. Fresh cookies were available each evening, and the front desk staff were exceptional. I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely return when visiting NYC! If you want to stay in the Times Square area, definitely check this one out, rates are very reasonable and you will get a free hot breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Awesome NEW hotel with amazing employees, amenities and location. Close to subways, broadway, food. Clean comfortable rooms, lawless internet access, good breakfast selection from cereals to eggs, breads, fruits and juices plus a decent gym to boot. Breakfast area can get busy but it's NY! get used to it... I will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had the best stay. Coffee and breakfast were awesome and all the friendly staff ready to help with everything were amazing. Super close to everything we had scheduled for the week. Beds were uber comfy. I will be back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. We arrived early and they stored our luggage, hailed us a cab, and called when our room was ready. It didn't stop there--they offered us water, a soft drink and a snack. Fresh cookies awaited us at the front desk when we got back from sightseeing in the evening. And even when the breakfast area is crowded in the morning, tables turn over fairly quickly and the staff is constantly replenishing the food. This Hampton is situated in a great location in Times Square--close to everything! Radio City. Bryant Park. All the Broadway Shows. A great value. Our room was quiet, comfortable and a decent size for a NYC hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, well appointed, friendly staff, excellent hot breakfast each day, coffee in lobby, as well as 'general store' items. To-Go breakfast bags available to take with you for sightseeing. Comfortable bed, top of the line bathroom fixtures, in room safe. Excellent hidden gem. Close to 42nd Street Subway, Air Train. We unknowingly were in NYC the same time as Pope Francis and rooms were hard to come by, we found this gem by happenstance. Will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was in an excellent location, people were very friendly and knowledgeable, room was very clean, excellent. I would not hesitate in staying there again while in New York! Everyone at the hotel was willing to help, easy access to everywhere! Clean, new, nice!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Quick and friendly check in. The room was quite large for NYC standards and very clean. From our room on the 26th floor we had a beautiful view of the city.The heat/ac unit in my room wasn't working but luckily I figured that out right away so they were able to move us to a new room. They were very attentive during that process and stated that they had been having ongoing issues with the units since they opened, which I appreciated for them how frustrating it must be. The beds and pillows were very very comfortable and the towels were fluffy and soft.Wifi connection was decent for browsing, email, etc.Coffee, tea and hot chocolate was always available in the lobby and there were computers and printers to use. The breakfast buffet gave decent options and wasn't too busy (though I was there by 8am)Location was very close to transportation and many tourist destinations. Perfect location if you have tickets to a Broadway show. Would 100% stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I reserved a double room to take my parents to NYC. Upon arrival a very friendly lady told us we would get a room away from elevators, perfect! Then we went to the room and it had only one bed, so I left the backpacks on the room and went down to check again. This took around 15 minutes since we had to wait for the 3rd elevator due to queue. Once again on the lobby, the early friendly lady went all serious when I told her I had reserved a double room but got a single one. So she was like "did you use the bedroom at all?" hello! I just saw one bed and went out. Anyway, I got the feeling she would have charged for the room even when it was her mistake for giving me a room I did not reserved. She gave me another room, another cards and so we left.We got a room on 20th floor, right in front on the elevator door. I was expecting it to be noisy but I must say the elevator was not a problem.Double Room was good, it was small as all the rooms in NYC but we were able to put our stuff and for 3 ppl it was good. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom was good and functional. Breakfast was average and really crowded (it was thanksgiving weekend)Hotel location is excellent, in the middle of the city and just steps away from subway station were you have 7+ different lines to move which is convenient when you want to wander the city.Even when I did not found this at the website, this hotel has FREE LUGGAGE STORAGE which comes really handy when arriving early and leaving late!!What I did not like about the room: Noise from outside. Staying just around the corner of times square is noisy, and even at floor 20 we heard plenty of street noise. There is a small gap (maybe less than an inch) between the curtain-end and the window base and at bedtime it looks HUGE with all the shinning you get from outside. It would've been nice to make the curtains longer to get a really dark room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Beautiful hotel and helpful staff but - as someone else noted - these cheap Amana AC sensor systems led me to check out after a couple of hours. The first one sounded like a bomb went off when it kicked on. In the second room, the heat never, ever came on as the temperate dropped and dropped. It's a shame they installed these. I've seen these before in cheaper hotels but expected a better working system from Hampton. The rooms are really well done though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As usual, Hampton Inn is always the best place to stay. This is right next to everything we wanted to do. Hampton Inn has the best beds and the most friendly and helpful staff of any place we stay. The rooms are very nice and the breakfast has plenty of choices for everyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Easy to get to any subway. Price for location was great. Rooms are small but that is the norm in NYC. Very clean and probably the best breakfast selection of any of the Hampton Inns I've stayed at. Definitely book this one.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel has a great location The room was clean and while not large, was a decent size for New York City. Despite the central location, it was quiet. The decor and overall feel is that of a really nice motel. It's not the lap of luxury, but it's good value for the money. If you are on a high floor expect to wait 5-10 minutes to get up and down. The elevators are small and there is no freight elevator which means one elevator was often being used by the staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was the perfect location. Very clean, new hotel. We'd stay here's again in a heartbeat. Room was small, but that's expected in New York. Also no mini fridge in room. Very convenient to all locations and the subway was only a few steps away.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a 5 day stay here from the 5/11/15 family of 4. Our room had 2 double beds with the best pillows! 1 firm 1softer. The room had TV,dresser and a work station. It has a hot drinks machine with complimentary tea,coffee, etc. It has a small wardrobe with safe deposit, iron & full ironing board. Bathroom was well equipped with over bath shower and plenty of lovely fluffy white towels and complimentary toiletries refilled daily and hair dryer. Basically all your needs covered. The room was warm and house keeping did a great job. We had breakfast included which was great everything from eggs,bacon ,sausage on alternative days and everyday there was fresh fruit,muffins,toast bagels (toaster machine) A waffle machine which was very popular.cereals tea coffee hot chocolate n flavoured syrups. The staff did a fantastic job in here and all were extremely happy to greet us very early on a morning well done to them after all it was 6am. Every day in reception there were grab bags which had a bottle of water piece of fruit n muffin or cereal bar. On an evening they also provided free cookies which the kids loved n so did we while we enjoyed a tea or coffee which is also provided free in reception. There is also a work area with 3 pc which was well used kids like to keep up with social media n free wifi. There were stool type seating in reception which is my only gripe as they not that comfy while resting and waiting for others to venture out on another sight seeing day. This hotel is in a great location only minutes from times sq and theatres. Over all I'm pleased we picked this hotel and would definitely use again. Every member of staff we met was great and gave us great customer service.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in a very good location, just minutes away from Times Square. The room was adequate in size and service was very good. Ebony in the breakfast room brought a smile to our faces each morning and Johnny who provided baggage service was a great help also.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros: The rooms were clean and a decent size; staff was friendly and check-in quick and easy; the location is central to Times Square and Penn Station.Cons: It's not the greatest street to be on - across from the Port Authority (intermittent bus/truck noise from the street); the elevator took forever to arrive in the morning; the bathroom pipes from above got noisy; thermostat was wonky; the free breakfast was a zoo.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for seven days earlier this month and we had a Great time! All the staff were very polite, courteous and helpful: Tom, Vince, Kareem, Maria at the front desk, Ebony in the breakfast staff, the housekeeping staff. The location is great for anyone visiting New York for the first time. You're close to everything. I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, price was high, but for every hotel that is more decent in NY you'll pay quite a lot. We asked for a quieter room on an upper floor and we were given a room on the last floor, nice views and quiet as there were only 4 rooms in total on the last floor. The only problem was the air conditioning system which was way too noisy. The first 2 days it was really hot in NY so we needed air conditioning to be able to sleep at night, but the noise made it almost impossible to sleep, so we turned it off in the middle of the night, but the room became so hot that it was impossible to sleep anyway..Thankfully it cooled down the last 2 nights when we were in NY so we didn't need any air conditioning and we could sleep a bit better than previous nights. The breakfast is ok, not great, but we liked the fact that you have unlimited teas and coffees anytime of day. The best thing about the hotel is the location (that if you like Times Square-which I'm not a massive fan as it's way too crowded for my liking). They left a little present of chocolates for us in the room as it was our anniversary, so that was such a lovely gesture :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: New hotel in a great location would almost be enough for this place but add free breakfast and wifi and the value increases!!The true value and pleasure in staying here is the staff...starting with Ebony!! She assists in the breakfast area and if you stay here and don't meet her, you have missed one of this hotel's greatest ambassadors!! When she found out it was my daughter's birthday....she got together a handwritten birthday card and some Lindt Chocolates....and the got the entire breakfast area to sign her "Happy Birthday!!" That is creating wonderful memories in guests, who will return!! Besides, we promised her some Texas BBQ!Johnny, the bellman, was also friendly and helpful!!The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Coffee is always available.The only frustrating thing is the elevator situation during peak morning check out time. May want to just ask for a lower floor so that you can take the stairs. Since the hotel has 30 floors and just three medium sized elevators, by the time it arrived at 12...many times was already full.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed one night after attending a concert a MSG. The hotel is brand new. The room, although small, was clean and comfy. There wasn't anything lacking. Very much like a standard Hampton, except for the room size. It's walking distance to many theatres and restaurants. The subway and port authority are also less than 1 block away. The only trouble is the 3 elevators are slow and not sure if there enough to service the entire hotel when fully booked. The front desk and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central (don´t mix up with North and South) is located really good. If you come by Bus from Newark, it´s just a 100 meters walk from the Port Authority Bus Station. But also the Times Square subway station is just around the corner. Btw, The New York Times, which gave the name to Times Square is now just a two buildings next. The room is pretty large compared to what I so far have experienced in Manhattan and it is equipped with all you need including TV, coffee maker and - most essential - a good bed. The breakfast is included in the price and it is really good, you can even prepare your own fresh waffels, you´ll find vegetables and a good variety. What I - as a european - disliked is that all the dishes are paper and plastic, which get thrown away after usage. Frmom my point of view that gives a cheapfast food image and is not environmental friendly. But that is american...The breakfast room is very crowded in peak times, beeing alone you can find a place, beeing a group of 4 or more it might become really difficult. Nevertheless, the breakfast is a big plus.Another really positive experience was the fitness room which is open 24 hours, large and well equipped. I really enjoyed this.The staff at reception was always friendly and the room was cleaned well. The only negative point was that one day the Wireeless Lan was broken - the other day it worked well and fast, free as well. By the way, they also offer free coffee in the lobby all day long.The have a rooftop terrace from which you could have a nice view over New York - if it is open. When I tried, it was not.So why not 5 Stars from me? Well, all the apperance, not only in the breakfast room was a bit "cheap" and that did not correspond to the > 300 USD per night for me.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn for my early birthday celebration last week. The location is wonderful for heading to the theaters! Our room was clean, and the service by the staff was exceptional! Their breakfast bar is a wonderful way to start the day! We can't wait to visit there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Time Square Central. The breakfast was awesome. I especially like the variety of food items served each day. The staff was very attentive to keeping the serving and eating areas clean. There was coffee, tea, apple cider and cookies available each day. The staff was nice and approachable. Our room was clean. The amenities and towels were replenished daily. I am very satisfied with my stay. Occasional noisey due to Hampton Inn's close proximity of Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Ideal location for all NY attractions and great value for money. Breakfast good, staff excellent. Need any help ask Ebony in dining room.The hotel enhanced our first trip to New York. We have already recommended the hotel to friends.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for the NYC Marathon 2015 and arrived on Halloween. Prior to my stay, I phoned to ensure that our online check-in was all set. Rochelle was very helpful and when I asked her for recommendations of a good restaurant for pasta (carb loading prior to the race), she not only had some suggestions, but she also phoned and got us a reservation. When I arrived, there was an envelope waiting for me with a print out of the reservation as well as additional helpful tips regarding navigating the city on race day. Our room was a corner one that was amazingly spacious for NYC! And the bathroom was very modern and chic. The hotel itself seems new and the decor is inviting, modern and comfortable. Although this is a Hampton Inn, it seems more upscale and the quality and service level is higher than any Hampton Inn I've visited previously. The breakfast the next morning was awesome, and the hotel even provided bananas and fruit early in the morning for all the race participants to be able to fuel up prior to the race. The location is excellent too, as its near the NY Times building, with a Ruby Tuesday and Red Lobster less than 1 block away. Would recommend that you self park at One Parking, 136 W. 40th Street. It's one block away, and Day rates are around $45. The hotel is at the "start" of Time Square, so not too crowded (you have some breathing room) but just 2 blocks to get to the thick of things (Good morning America building, shops, Rockefeller Center, etc). Also quick walk to Bryant Park. Overall this was such a fantastic stay that I'm planning to return to this property with my kids to sightsee in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our hotel was centrally located to subways, Port Authority and Times Square for transportation. The hotel was quite new and very clean. The room was a decent size and bathroom was good also. All employees were very polite and helpful. Rachelle who was at the front desk was especially helpful to us. The breakfast was delicious and some mornings quite crowded, but the staff did a great job. We were between 7 & 8th street right near Times Square - not far from Rockfeller Center, Central Park- Only a quick subway ride to One World Observatory. We would definitely stay here again. I can certainly recommend this.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms were very nice. Well maintained and new.Breakfast was very good. Seating was a little tough because it was very crowded. Elevators were a little slow and crowded at times but the staff was all very friendly and nice. Would return there...location was great. Short walk to the subway.A big shout out to the front desk rep Letitia who took the time to look for my daughter's ring and sent it back to her...thank you so much!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very convenient to Times Square, Broadway theaters, sight seeing busses, etc. newly remodeled so it seems nice and newElevators are s l o w and more than once we gave up and walked (11 floors). The breakfast area is soooo crowded but the workers are friendly Same Hampton food. Not gourmet but it's filling Front desk is great Vince made us feel right at home and remembered our names throughout the stayHeard a loud concert type sound (low bass) outside the hotel last night starting after midnight. Very loud music. Other than that it has been very quiet. Coffee maker in the room - niceDaily maid service was very goodNice hotel. Would return. But would select a room on a low floor

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's always a good experience staying in a new hotel as everything seemed to smell good! The size is typical of any NYC hotel but we didn't feel cramped. The interior design is modern. The lobby is inviting and with unique decorations. A few steps then you're at the Times Square subway stop. The hop-on, hop-off bus stop is also by the corner. Lots of restaurants nearby including a McDonalds across the street (but you can go inside though the back of the restaurant). We can view the Madame Tussard signage by our window. The theatres are just a few steps away. There's free breakfast and free wifi. Just be reminded to get the breakfast early enough to avoid the huge crowd and to get a table. There's free coffee 24/7 by the lobby. The only downside is the difficulty of getting a cab going to the airport. We were forced to take a private vehicle (through the hotel) that charged us $70 to the LGA. We thought that it's a fixed rate but the driver who is also the car owner even asked for a tip. Some of the front desk staff that I dealt with lack warmth and sincerity in the manner that they talk to guests. If you want to check out late, they charge 50% of the room rate and you get to stay until 4PM only. If you extended your stay by 10 minutes, somebody will come knocking by the door to kick you out. Overall, a great place to stay if you want to be close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have tried to search for your email address several sites but in vain everywhere. Kindly advise your email address as i have been overcharged on my card.. If any one else can assist will appreciate as well.Thanks

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice hotel. Rooms were nice and spacious. Staff was nice and helpful. Good free WiFi. My room's window didn't have a great outside view, but, all in all, it was a nice hotel as far as the room goes. Not much of vegetarian food available though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived early, our luggage was placed on their storage for safekeeping. Someone helped us unloaded our luggage from the taxi . Location is great, just walking distance to Time Square & subways.We had our first night on the 6th flr, requested if we can have an upper level to see a little view of NY. There wasnt available that night but were told to check on the following day. So i did, before we left the hotel, we packed our things just in case & left my cell number to call me if there is availsble. And they did & even asked permission to bring our bags to the 16th floor. When we arrived that night, our bags were already on our new room. Both rooms were clean & brand new but I think being in NY the room size is quite small. Bathroom was cleaned. . Cleanliness is the first thing that I look in a hotel room. There is a coffee maker. But I wish they have a ref just like some of the Hsmpton Inn that I stayed before. We used their laundry facility in the basement & it's ok. And glad that that we dont need to look for one outside the hotel. On all 3 days we were there we had a good breakfast. Had cold & hot breakfast & other choices. There's fresh fruits & make your own waffle maker. I think what stand out for us is the personnels that work there, from the receptionists to the breakfast crews. They were helpful & courteous. I couldnt remember all their names but you guys did a good job & made our stay comfortable. Definitely, will recommend & stay again if I go back to NY. By the way, there's a lot of Hampton Inn in NY & i am happy I choose the one in Time square Central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed one night but it was a great stay at the Hampton Inn. Was greeted by Vince at the front desk. Was celebrating our 50th annv. and was sent a goody bag up to the room and a card signed by the front desk people. The room was very nice and the breakfast was plentiful and very good. I would stay here again, the location is central to all you desire. Walking distance to Times Square. Theatre district is walkable too.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here one night while sight seeing in New York. Found the staff very helpful, able to have valet parking quickly. Room was small, but I am told that is very common in NewYork, but very clean. The view was of the Empire State Building and other buildings. Beds were super comfortable, shower was large and great water pressure. In room coffee maker. Room was on 25 floor and very quite. Heard no noise front hall. And very little from street. Their breakfast was very good, not made to order, but you do not leave hungry. They also have bag holding if needed, as we had booked a site seeing tour and needed to leave the luggage there after we had checked out our room, had no trouble getting it later that afternoon. Would diffently stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was just off Times square,perfect location. Friendly staff,very clean,lovely breakfast,hot or cold whatever you feel like and can cater for large numbers as whilst we were there the marathon runners were in the restaurant.Staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble,the concierge got us tickets for the basketball game which was amazing. Room very comfortable,clean,warm,lovely bathroom with warm shower.would recommend this hotel to anybody as it was everything and more that we wanted. Perfect haven.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A new property very close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the major theatres. Can walk to many other points of interest and the bus tours. Large, bright and modern rooms (for NYC standards). Free hot breakfast - can get crowed and messy - because it's free. Staff try their best but more frequent cleaning of breakfast area highly recommend. The only negative I found was the lack of family friendly restaurants - unless you like pizza and food made on a griddle each day. It's a bit like staying close Trafalgar SQ - close to major attractions but not much else. Took Uber on occasions - easily accessible.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff were all very professional and friendly. I stayed here for 1 night on business. Started on the 2?th floor, entered into a room that smelled... odd. I can only describe it as a urine that had attempted to be covered up. I think they had tried to clean it with chemicals too, bc my throat became scratchy and aching while waiting for the new room key to be delivered. The second room on 15th floor was clean, quiet and perfect (except for the dresser drawers that were OPEN in the morning). I travel often and never never never use, let alone OPEN, dresser drawers. A little "oddity" of open drawers inside of my locked non-joining room, I can deal with... even 3 days before Halloween. The location and staff are too perfect to let a weird thing like that ruin it for me. I walked the .8 miles to/from Penn Station using 7th (since I was using the LIRR), use 8th if using Amtrak. Chain restaurants were very close (but they can be pricier than you expect, from what a local told me). Left too early to see the hotel's breakfast options.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Fresh and new hotel (summer 2015). Perfect, centralized spot for Times Square access and the Theater district and one block behind the New Year's Eve ball. Easy walk to restaurants and double decker tour buses. Routine cab routes at the front door if needed. Especially friendly staff and quite flexible for holding bags prior to check in and offer no charge late check out. Convenient business center with both PC and Mac for printing boarding passes. Concierge onsite, too. Fast elevators to 31 floors though can be a little busy during breakfast hours. Pleasant Hampton breakfast, but seating fills fast between 8 and 9 as one would expect. McDonalds nearby if you prefer. HIGHLY recommend and if booked soon enough you can get reasonable rates (for NYC).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was in NYC and for the first time I tried a new hotel. What a awesome experience I had from the time I arrived at the curb. I was greeted by a bellman at the curb with a warm hello, a hand shake and all the assistance I ever needed to get two people out of a cab. We were escorted into the lobby and directed to the front desk. The desk associate, a lady and the other fellow, possibly even a member of management, both greeted us and welcomed us to NYC and they Hampton Inn. Quickly she had us to our room and of know fault of theirs, I went back to the desk and stated the couple in the room next to us was having a bit of a fight, so rather then take a chance, she quickly changed the room to avoid any future nose from the angry couple. She was very apologetic and I told her it was not the hotels fault at all, but she went out of her way to take care of us all the same.Our room was perfect, we controlled the temperature, roomy shower and bathroom, great layout to the room and very functional. The room was so clean I had to ask if the hotel was brand new. All this and we still had the Hampton Complimentary Free Breakfast. The area was busy, but so well staffed and a crew that seems like they have done it so often that by the time we had our food, they had us a table. Great breakfast, great staff and warm smiles and morning greeting, I felt I was back home in South Carolina! It was 4 days and three great night all wrapped up with the perfect place to stay. I will be back and I have two friends that have booked since I told them about the hotel.When your get tired of getting nickeled and dimed at your current hotel, checkout this hotel and find Paradise Island a few steps off Broadway!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I paid a little more to enjoy the city view. It's worth it. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom is spacious. Can't be happier.Moreover, there is a laundry area and I manage to wash & dry my clothes on my last day in NY. Brought home the clean clothes :) More important, hotel is so centralised. All major subway lines are just 2 mins. I would pick the hotel again if I go back the next time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms are new and well decorated. Decorated more contemporary but tasteful and comfortable. Great hot breakfast. Prime location for Broadway shows, shopping, transportation. Staff very friendly and helpful. We'll stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was centrally located and the staff and facility was nice and new, the rooms were very small.My recommendation would be to have a refrigerator in the room for more convenience.The online check in did save a little time and the breakfast in the morning was a nice touch even though it was very busy.Our room was not Times Square view more like the back of a building view but it got us through.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was very pleased with my stay at this particular Hampton Inn. It is convenient to Times Square, but enough away from it to avoid a lot of the noise. The front desk staff was very attentive and knowledgeable about the area (concierge was off duty when I checked in). Breakfast was included, but breakfast area was extremely crowded. This was a weekend stay, so maybe not so bad during the week. Nothing spectacular about the breakfast, but it was certainly adequate and the staff in the breakfast area very efficient and kept area very clean. Housekeeping seemed to have a problem differentiating between queen sized and king sized top sheets. The top sheet on my king bed did not cover the bed. It was quickly changed the next morning at my request. The bathroom lighting was not adequate for makeup, so had to open drapes and do makeup by the window. :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has only been open about 4 months. It is really well located. There are only a few rooms per floor but with some 30 floors the 3 elevators can be pretty busy during peak times. The breakfast area is large for a Hampton but it is crowded during the breakfast rush. Don't be in a hurry for your room to be made up. It is a slow process, even for a HHonors Diamond member. The front desk told us with a shrug that the cleaning staff have until 6:00 pm to clean rooms. All in all, it is a worthwhile place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Found this brand new, 4-month-old hotel as I was searching to use my HH points near Time Square. The location is incredible - Time Square is right under your nose. In addition to Time Square, it is also conveniently located near broadway shows, major NYC attractions and transportation hub (Penn Station and Port Authority Bus Terminal), which means you're not too far from anything. Service was friendly, professional and helpful. When we arrived to check-in, the front desk was experiencing computer slowness. She was courteous and informative of the situation, and suggested that we help ourselves to the 24 hour coffee and tea in the lobby while she completed our check-in. Since this hotel is new, nothing to complain about in the room. We stayed on the 21st floor looking out towards the Empire State building (although you can barely see it behind all the other high rises). Although our room was right next to the elevator (shared wall), we didn't hear much noise throughout the night, except for the occasional slamming of the doors by other residents on the floor. Because our room was right next to the elevator, it has a sizable foyer (depth of the elevator), thus I think making it slightly bigger and less claustrophobia than the other rooms (I didn't get to see the other rooms' floor plan). The complimentary breakfast was very convenient and efficient. Nothing fancy - make-your-own waffles, eggs, sausages, french toast, bacon, cereal, yogurt, fruit, milk, coffee, tea, etc. Overall, very pleasant and satisfied experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: what a brilliant hotel everything from the staff to the room . Nothing was a bother to the staff.and they were friendly and polite at all times.The room was excellent and very comfortable and spotlessly clean.could not fault any part of our stay A special thank you to Domingo your concierge (sorry if I have his name wrong).He arranged tickets to see a basketball game and my 18year old son had a brilliant time.We didn't see him after the game to thank him.This was our first trip to New York but hopefully not our last .and we would not hesitate to stay at your hotel again and I would certainly recommend you to family and friends.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel's location is wonderful. If traveling by bus or subway, you are just 1/2 block away from the bus terminal and main subway station.It is not on a dark alley and it's located right between two busy streets so yes you will hear some of the commotion at nighttime in the room. I was on the 28th floor but if you're in midtown, you need to understand the circumstances and expect it.We requested a city view room which is located on the higher floors. The room smelled very clean and the view was satisfactory, not a view of Times Square itself. The room is small, which is also expected because of the city. The king bed is extremely comfortable along with the pillows and sheets. The bathroom is a decent size with a beautiful walk-in shower. Plenty of towels for two occupants. Breakfast was very good. Plenty to choose from: bagels, fruit, muffins, coffee crumb cakes, waffles, kielbasa, eggs (I don't recommend this if you're going salt-free, they don't taste like anything), and french toast sticks. Coffee, OJ, Milk, and Apple Juice for beverages. Very filling and it's all-you-care-to-eat. The dining area is spacious. However, I was a guest to complimentary breakfast on a Wednesday morning at 9:30am. If this were a weekend, I would definitely have gotten down there earlier since there were quite a bit of people.Checkout was quick and easy and they kept our bags in a secure room while we did some sightseeing for the day. I will definitely return to this hotel. The price was very reasonable for the location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location for sightseeing in NY City. Short walks to buses for hop-on and hop-off tours. Great for shopping in all different kinds of shops. Many kinds of restaurants near by. Limousine service to the Airports at competitive rates.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We noticed and enjoyed the tasteful colors of the reception hall right away, and were happily surprised by this 300-room brand new hotel with nice and clean rooms and good bathrooms. We were very thankful for the great team of the young and good willing staff who made our stay honestly very pleasant. Smile + efficiency is the type of cocktail I always pay attention to. And wasn't disappointed at all at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central. BUT somebody in that hotel murdered the central institution of any decent hotel in America: the breakfast experience. Plastic forks, spoons and knives, paper plates, modest buffet with little space to move around, boring presentation, two do-it-yourself waffle molds and a tasteless dough (yes, enriched by fresh red fruit)No ham, no cheese, usual premixed scrambled eggs with bacon. PLEASE Mr. General Manager, raise the level of your breakfast buffet, use regular china, push a couple of walls to make more place to fit all those guests in this nice 300-room property. Your mission: Saving Private Breakfast!Thank you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good service. Newer hotel so everything seemed new. Staff very very helpful. Only problem was we were on 20th floor towards end of 7th avenue. A noisy nightclub's bass was blaring into wee hours and heard into room, so sleep was intermittent. Turn room fan on and seems to dampen a bit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There are not too many brand new hotels one can find in Manhatten. This is a new addition to the Hilton family, with great locating near the times square, with easy access to the subway and Broadway theatre district.They offer free fairly good breakfast, free internet, and Free coffee and tea in the lobby. The room size isn't big, but comparing to other Manhatten hotels is reasonable and comfortable. The hotel was fully booked and still the team were friendly and managed to allow us late checkout for extra fee.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here with my son. This was the 4th time that I've been to NYC and the first time that I didn't stay in the financial district. If you want the full Times Square/NYC experience, this is the place to do it. Centrally located, easy to get to the subways and shops, etc. Very impressed with the hotel - clean rooms and beds, decent size room (for NYC), reasonable price and good staff. Even though we were on the 16th floor, it was a bit loud at times (from street noise). However, that should be expected given the location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very good experience and hope stay next time. near subway and the room is very clean and comfortable, room service is also good and have free coffee and breakfast. Staff in lobby is nice and help the guest on everything, even provide the umbrella.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
