review_body: We decided to make this trip to New York (our first) on the back of a conference we had to attend in Dallas and because it was one of our 'bucket-list' destinations we wanted to make the most of it.Finding good value accommodation in Manhattan seemed to be a real problem made only worse by the fact that our dollar for dollar exchange rate sucked against the USD at the time.We decided on this location due to two main reasons - the fact that it was relatively new and that it had received pretty favourable reviews. To be honest, because of the currency issue it was a bit above what we'd anticipated spending.However, from the first day we arrived until the moment we left we had a blast - the hotel had everything we needed to make our stay a great one. Good room, good facilities, great location and excellent staff who were particularly friendly and helpful - none more so than Vince at the front desk who was incredibly helpful and is a credit to his profession.Easy walk to Times Square (shows, shops, bars, etc), Hells' Kitchen restaurants and the subway - also at the western end of the block there is a bike-share station.I would highly recommend this hotel for whatever reason you need to be in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service is good and staff is friendly; especially the morning breakfast staff. I would say that the staff serving breakfast makes my day. Despite breakfast lacks variety, the cheerfulness and kindnesses of staff is so much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location! Walk to all shops & restuarants in Times Square easy walk to subway, great breakfast! Clean room, comfortable beds. Rooms are small, very little closet space but your not there for the room. Not a main steet, a little difficult to get taxi, Uber is perfect.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Conveniently located just a few blocks from major theaters and lots of restaurants. Rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable, with the normal Hampton Inn amenities. Street noise can be loud, if room windows are over the street. Beds are quite comfortable. Best of all is it's location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed in Hampton Inn Times Square Central with a small group of friends for a couple of nights, and were truly pleased with the stay. We have chosen the hotel for the sake of its location and value price, but as it turned out, it has well exceeded our expectations. The location was even better than we have dreamed of, the hotel was very comfortable and new, the staff was very kind, and the breakfast was quite ok. We were even served to-go packs during our check-out for a very early morning flight. The coffee and tea is served gratis on the house, with kettles available in each room. House service was efficient, the overall cleanliness was very satisfying. We would most definitely stay there on our coming trips. Absolutely recommended!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and me stayed in this hotel on 20 Sep. 2015 in a king room for 4 nights.The hotel is new, very nice and comfortable room in a great location.The front desk staff was very helpfull and nice.The price we paid was very reasonable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Party of four just back from a fabulous 6-day trip to NYC, celebrating two milestone birthdays and a golden wedding anniversary. Our visit was made extra special by our stay at the Hampton Inn on West 41st Street. Both rooms were located on the 24th floor and were beautifully clean and modern. The hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel very welcome - they even arranged signed cards and drinks to be delivered to our rooms later on the first day. With fresh towels and bed linen every day, the room was always immaculate on our return. We particularly enjoyed the complementary breakfast & coffee facilities on the ground floor. Cannot rate this hotel highly enough!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms are large and new, since the hotel was built vertically in a small area near Times Square. What a find in Manhattan while there for business. Complimentary breakfast is not something you expect in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was visiting New York for the first time for my 40th birthday and the staff was so nice and helpful. They had a card(signed by the staff working that day) candy, balloon, and bottle of wine waiting in my room when we checked it. Our room was very clean. Never waited long on the elevators. We arrived before check in and they stored our bags so we could being our day. When we checked out they stored our bags again until we were ready to leave that evening. Very convenient location. We will defiantly be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location near Times Square, but on a quiet street. The staff were incredibly friendly and always accommodating. The rooms are quite clean and the beds are really comfortable. The breakfast had a great variety and the staff were amazing. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was not your ordinary Hampton Inn - it was awesome! Honestly, we were expecting a very small room, packed into a off main street type location, with a tiny breakfast area, etc. We were really wrong!! While a little pricer than we hoped to find in NYC, we had little complaints after we arrived. This was a great location for being able to walk to various Times Square area venues and beyond. We flew into Newark airport and took the bus to the transit station just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Wheeling our luggage was no problem. Check in was no problem. Finding our room was larger than we thought was a nice surprise and very quiet. (There seemed to be only a dozen rooms per floor that we could tell.) Comfortable beds and pillows. Wifi was not always great in the room, better down in the lobby. But it was free. Cell coverage (we have AT&T) in the room was fine, but in the lobby was not great - had to sometimes walk outside to make a call. (There was scaffolding over the sidewalk at the next property by the lobby entrance and wondered if that interfered.) The breakfast offerings were much better than expected and replenished often by the staff as needed. Nice variety of proteins along with the waffle, pastries, cereals, fruits, etc. There were restaurants all around this hotel's area, you don't have to go far for meals, pastries or coffee. And metro stops not far away. Would stay there again when we visit the city. I never knew Hampton Inns could be that great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed in this Hampton Inn during a visit to New York for the US Open. Very convenient access to Times Square subway station and #7 train to tournament. Hotel is near Times Square, but far enough away from the crowds. Rooms were clean and incredibly quiet. Reasonable price by NY standards.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location and helpful staff. But very bad breakfast, foods is not so good, cutlery and disposable plates and the place too small . In my room, housekeeping was not so good, to offset, ammenities aand bed linen are good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Don't overlook this hotel just because it's tucked away (although right next to Wolfgang Puck's restaurant). The rooms are small, but very clean and tidy. And really, you're in New York. You shouldn't be spending time in your room anyway! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fresh and delicious, and the staff working the breakfast (a thankless job when you think about it) were always chipper and friendly.The beds were amazingly comfortable and we slept extremely well every night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would definitely stay here again. The customer service was fantastic. They went out of their way to help, whether it was getting you a cab or any question you had for them. It is a great location with subway access across the street, Port Authority and cabs right around corner. A great variety for the free breakfast. The location is just off a side street from Times Square so it was a little loud on Sat night. but I did stay on a lower floor. I have stayed other places in NY and you do hear noise at night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great little hotel. I'm a hilton diamond member and usually stay at the NY Hilton. This hotel is very near the tunnel for an easy in and out. Front desk is awesome. Bellman was awesome. We valet parked and he had the car ready for us when we requested. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was great! And the price was even better!!I will stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As the title says. Its new and quite clean. It had been open about 4 week when I visited with my nephew in summer 2015. Great location in Time Square. Super friendly staff. The few issues we had were related to mechanical problems. The AC did not work at first and we had no hot water for a few hours. Apparently these are bugs being worked out. The staff was quite helpful and friendly when issues cropped up.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am usually tolerant of things like waiting for an elevator now and then, but the three elevators that serve this hotel are completely inadequate. Add to the fact that either there was no service elevator, or it was down during our visit, and it's just that much worse. No, I certainly do NOT mind sharing an elevator with someone from room service. It's just that the use of the passenger elevators by room service made a bad situation worse. When you are on the 22nd floor, taking the stairs is just not a realistic alternative. The room was clean and small and the facilities were, too. Pretty much the bare minimum. The location near Times Square and access to the Subway was ideal, but not premium.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I came in late after a long day of meetings greeted by a smiling and attentive front desk staff! I found the entire staff both very courteous and helpful !Also, the beds were extremely comfortable! I highly recommend it!I'll be back !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros were clean comfortable modern rooms and great location. Cons were security concerns in this day and age, as anyone could walk in off the street and go right up the elevator to guest rooms! Breakfast area too small and crowded and staff unable to keep up quantity/quality of food items. Charged for parking even though we did not have a car. Front desk claimed to remove charges and subsequently charged to cc anyway. Staff seems young and inexperienced though friendly. No refrigerator, even for Hilton diamond members. Wifi unreliable. Not likely to stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was in New York, only for a night. As a frequent business traveler, I have the opportunity to stay at hotels that hold the prestige in name, and everything in between. Please don't let the name fool you. This hotel is not only a great value for the money, but you can't beat the staff experience and location. Pros:Central Times Square - right off of all the action in either direction.Breakfast - great selection of on the go food, or sit down and eat such as make your own waffle, potatoes, and omelets.Free Wi-Fi - Although I'm a HHonors member, the Wi-Fi here was still free.Common areas - very nice common area with power to work if you didn't want to sit in your room.Upgraded accommodations - as you can see from the pictures, the hotel is updated and has a great contemporary feel in a very comfy setting.Staff - By far some of the most helpful and friendliest staff I've met in my travels. Tey take their time, and don't make you feel like you're a burden. Kudos!Cons:View - had a city view room, but not really a city view. More industrial. But hey, it's NY with tall buildings. Not really a letdown for me.If you can stay in a hotel with this much upside, no matter the name. Do it! Please keep in mind that this is a value hotel that provides a great stay. You will not see room service, and things of the like. But, if that's what you are searching for, that also comes at a price. Overall, awesome stay. I will return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel due to the location and the reviews. The front desk & breakfast staff was very friendly & a lot of fun The room was quiet & the bed was comfortable. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel in Times Square area, just around the corner from all of the craziness. Perfect location, a couple of subway lines just a stones throw away...and a short walk from everything you could want. Staff are top notch, Vince was awesome at the front desk. He was so friendly and helpful, even printing out a subway map for us. He is what customer service is all about. We were on the 20th floor, very quiet, no problem with the elevators like others complained of, our room was very clean as well with everything we needed and expected from a Hampton. Breakfast was good although some mornings a little chaotic but no big deal..I will be returning in future to nyc and will definetly stay here again, we always prefer a Hampton inn and this one is another reason why...top notch all the way:))

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Check in staff was courteous. Room clean. Not enough elevators and very slow. In shower when problem occurred in hotel with no cold water. While I was stuck in shower with soapy hair and no cold water, had husband contact front desk, several times. No answer. Brought it to their attention when checking out and all I got was, 'oh, we know about it'...did not honor 100% satisfaction or your money back. Even after completing online survey and receiving email from Hampton Inn and me responding with the same concern....no 100% satisfaction or your money back. Would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Highly recommend the Hampton Times Square Central. We stayed from August 1-7, 2015. The newly constructed hotel, which opened in late June 2015, was in excellent condition and the staff was outstanding. The room size is what you would expect in New York, but space is used very efficiently. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was well sealed, but it took one night to acclimate to city noise despite being on the 23rd floor. A business center included two PCs and one Mac connected to a common printer. The location is outstanding as the hotel is almost directly across the street from the Times Square subway station and one-half block from Times Square. Our only somewhat negative comment is that during our stay, the hotel's outside towel service did not supply sufficient wash clothes and hand towels. The hotel staff was apologetic and did everything they could to address the issue. I hope ownership will maintain this fine facility - we can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is great. It's located right in Times Square and is very clean and comfortable! I would not hesitate to stay at this property again!! The rooms are small but most of the rooms in NYC are small. I would recommend!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just checked in. The staff is fantastic! Vince at the front desk was so amazingly accommodating. Breakfast staff was so kind, they took the time to help with making a waffle. Luis was great with parking and checking our bags. Location is great, right near the heart of Times Square. This place is awesome, thanks!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This one is different and it is different because the staff is spectacular! Hotels can be very similar, beds and bathrooms. It is the people that make one stand out from the others. Each person that I interacted with: front desk, housekeeping, breakfast, management; all seemed to care that my visit was enjoyable. I have to give special thanks to Brittany, in the breakfast area. She has a joyful attitude that cannot be taught and made each morning wonderful.Thank you, Hampton.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cons: No fridge in the room, no room service, a tad expensive. Pros: Location is beyond excellent. It is very, very clean. The staff is very helpful and forthcoming and always smiling. Most importantly, the bed was very comfortable. In a nutshell, I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughters and I made our first trip to New York and were lucky enough to stay in the Hampton Inn Times Square. We had a very nice room, great breakfasts, clean and comfortable beds and were right in Times Square. An amazing trip and a great place to crash after all our busy, interesting days.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here about a month after they opened. Rooms were very nice and clean. Still a few mix-ups with service (my room wasn't cleaned until I complained in the evening after 8 p.m., and I heard another case of this happening at the front desk. Didn't get my check in gift bag for being a Gold member of HHonors. One of the 2 stairwells is a little confusing to figure out how to get out into the lobby (there should be better signage), although getting out to the street in an emergency would not have been a problem (that was marked sufficiently). A little worried about those stairwells also because some of the emergency reflective tape was either coming up or just not applied in what I would say was a consistent manner. Could also use one more elevator (waits could be a little long). But I loved the breakfast setup here compared to other Hampton's I've stayed at. Friendly front desk staff. Front door/concierge staff were all good too (arranged what I needed, patient, etc....). Really great location very near Times Square but just enough off to be quiet. Room was very quiet, nicely appointed, small (but normal for Manhattan), and I was able to use a reasonable number of points to get two rooms for 2 nights. Even with the glitches, I liked the place (just that small concern about the stairwells and that reflective tape)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our primary reason for being in NYC was to attend a play. The theater for the play we attended was literally right next door to the Hampton Inn. Our room was a bit tight but immaculate. Also our Hampton's breakfast experience has been good in the past and was a factor in me choosing the Hampton Inn for this stay and we were not disappointed. We also traveled quite a bit by the NYC subway system. The Hampton's personnel was very helpful in printing out travel routes for us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice comfortable beds. Adequate buffet style breakfast. Cereals, cooked food and Tea/Coffee/Juices all available. Plus plenty for the sweet-tooth as well. On our visit two of the three elevators were out of action temporarily. Not long been a Hilton and having a few teething problems.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has been opened since June and it is wonderful. Spacious rooms for NY standards and reasonable prices. Just a few blocks from Times Square. Plenty of food places nearby from nice restaurants to pizza and fast food and everything in between. The hotel breakfast that is free is pretty good with hot and cold items. We stayed here one night before a cruise and it was the perfect location. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed twice at this new Hampton Inn. Great experience. Location is excellent, hotel is well maintained and the staff are great. Some reviewers have complained of the hotel elevators, but I did not fine this to be a distraction. The breakfast served was more than adequate. A great experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a very accommodating hotel for our family girls trip. It was two blocks from Time Square and about 10 blocks from the Theatre district. Great location! Breakfast was included and was really good. Each day they changed up some of the items they offered which was a wonderful variety. Coffee was available all day! Staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time staying at this Hampton in the city and we like to try other brands and areas. The hotel is conveniently located next to port authority and subways yet not on 8th ave where it is too congested. They provide a complimentary breakfast which i was not aware of but came in quite handy for a pre-race NYRR run. we plan to stay again soon

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently took our family vacation, and 4 of the nights we spent in NYC. This hotel was hands down, the best! The hotel was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing! Kerroll and Vince at the front desk were great! They took a few minutes every morning before we left to make sure we knew exactly where we were going and how to get there, often times printing off subway instructions for us! Kerroll gave us her card, in case we every got lost! But thanks to their help, we never needed it! Starting our morning off with a warm breakfast (that was different each morning) was a great addition to our morning. It was made even better by Ebony. Her friendly personality and cheerfulness was infectious! If we ever return to NYC, this is where we will stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here for 7 nights whilst visiting NYC for the US Open tennis. The hotel has many good things going for it: - the location is great - just a block from Times Square; rooms are modern, clean and of a good size; included breakfast is a pretty good self-service affair with hot food and waffles and friendly staff (although can get busy). For me the only real downside is the lifts - only 3 for 31 floors and so I found that some times I had to wait up to 5 mins - no big deal as long as you allow for it. I would definitely consider staying here again when next in NY - the HHonors rate I got through the Hilton website was very good - so all-in-all a pleasant experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel and I would give it 5 stars except we were put in a room with loud squealing pipes that went on all night long. We tried multiple times to call the front desk but the calls went unanswered. We suffered through the first night with next to no sleep and they happily moved us the next day. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The elevators were busy but never ridiculous as others mentioned. The breakfast was always good but we beat the 10 am rush as much as we could and never had issues finding seats and the food was good. This hotel is in a perfect location just off Times Square. It was between two busy avenues and was quieter because of this.Great stay and I would highly recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Surprised at quality of property. Recently updated, very clean, modern. I do not usually expect this close to Times Square. Front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. A little pricey, but a busy week in NY. OK breakfast for a buffet. Clean and fresh.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great sized room for two people with a king-bed. The bathroom was really nice too and the staff were so friendly & genuine. However, we were in room 907 and we could hear the air ventilator from outside but it wasn't too much of a problem.We had breakfast included which served basic pastries, cereals, coffees, teas and fruits. You can also make your own waffles using the waffle machine! It is great value for money and is within walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, Empire State, Macy's etc. I will definitely be booking to stay here in the near future!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We went to New York to celebrate our Anniversary. We wanted to save money by staying at a hotel that included breakfast. Breakfast did not disappoint! We began our day with a hot meal every morning. Every employee greeted us with a smile. Upon hearing that it was our anniversary we were greeted at our door with a balloon and signed card. The front desk was amazing. We were helped with finding a place to eat, a taxi, and even toothpaste when we ran out.Pros:Customer serviceFree Coffee/tea in lobbyHot breakfast buffet includedSoooooo close to subwayNear Broadway!Free wifiCons:Rooms are very smallElevators can take foreverIn a very busy part of town

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The front desk service was excellent. The rooms are small. The WiFi was inconsistent. The breakfast was good. The room was quiet. We had to call for cleaning service on Sunday because the beds were not made and towels were not changed. We did not get our in room coffee replaced daily without going to the front desk to ask for it. All in all just average service, small rooms. The front desk service was outstanding.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have stayed at a lot of Hampton Inns and this was a disappointment. We arrived at 3 and no room. "Come back in 5 minutes." Still, no room. When we pushed, a room appeared. Elevators are awful. No service elevator and only three elevators for the 31 floors. Employees were up and down all day cleaning rooms. Some guests waited 45 minutes for the elevator. We walked down 18 floors after waiting 10 minutes which you can do without luggage. No refrigerator in the room but the worst is the door on the bathroom. Sliding outside door -- not pocket door -- which has a several inches gap from the frame so the bathroom is not private. May be fine if you're a couple. Breakfast is a disaster. The breakfast room is too small, too few employees, tables were never cleaned while we were there. Food offerings were not replenished. If they doubled the number of employees, it might be better. I have been at Hamptons when the breakfast staff helped the guests but here you had to seek them. No bananas?? Rather basic for breakfast. Room was a decent size, location was great. With all the reviews about elevator and breakfast problems, why hasn't there been improvement. Designating an express elevator for 18 through 31 would help.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Visited New York for the US Open, and stayed at this hotel. The location was perfect for taking the 7 subway to the US Open, as the subway stop was less than a block away. The location was also great for visiting other sites in New York, I took the subway downtown to the 9/11 Memorial and One World Trade Center. I also walked from the hotel to Central Park, for a run around central park, with the walk to and from the hotel, serving as my warm up and cool down.The hotel itself has a perfect layout for a small footprint, and I think Hampton/Hilton have hit on a great formula. I stayed on the 28th floor, and had a great view, which made the room seem bigger. Being a new hotel, everything was nice and clean.I would definately recommend this place to friends and family, and would stay here again. I actually, tried to book a stay for next year over labor day weekend again but the website says no rooms are available. Bummer!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All of the Hampton Inn staff were the best!! Vince was on duty during our stay and he took GREAT care of our family. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful. The location was excellent for what we wanted to do in New York City We will definitely be back to this Hampton INN!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been in New York for business over the past few weeks and while I don't expect perfection, I DO expect a certain minimum level of comfort - given the nightly expense . This week I had the misfortune to be booked in at this hotel - same price range as others I've stayed at - but woefully lacking in amenities. First I was dismayed to find out that there was no fridge in the room. I drink copious amounts of water and want to be able to purchase it at Duane Ready or wherever and store in my room. This hotel also has no restaurant or bar so, equally, I'd like to bring in wine if I feel like it and have somewhere cold to store it. Fortunately, following an inquiry to the Front Desk, I was told I could have a fridge delivered for a $20 fee.. Not bad and an equitable resolution to my concern.Next, however, I realize that there are only paper cups in the rooms. I requested a water glass only to be told that they have NO glassware in this place? And that even their breakfast juices/hot coffees are served in paper cups? How GHETTO is that - let alone ecologically abusive! I guess this location is great if you are a tourist and just want to see some shows, be in the middle of Times Square but, business travelers beware..... so lacking in rudimentary conveniences, I certainly will avoid this hotel in future.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is new and just opened in July 2015, so it was nice to stay in a place that was clean and close to Times Square. We walked almost everywhere so it very close to shopping, restaurants and the play we saw. The staff was very helpful and breakfast is included.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have stayed in many Hampton Inns and also many hotels in NYC. This hotel is spotless, the staff extremely helpful and the breakfast buffet excellent. I was greeted with a smile from every employee ...Ebony, breakfast hostess, to the maids in the hall, bellmen, and concierge. The lobby is user friendly and location excellent for theater, times square, convenience to subway. I would stay here for every visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here from Saturday to Wednesday of last week. Great location, quiet room (we were on the 28th floor), comfy beds, breakfast if you wanted, nice staff. The elevators in the mornings are slow going down as they stop on just about every other floor. They do not have a separate freight elevator so you share with the cleaning carts. There are three elevators though and other than peak morning times, they were fine. Plan accordingly if you are on a schedule. We chose this hotel due to it's location and the fact that it had only opened a couple of weeks before we arrived. It was perfect for us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Times Square central on Aug 29. The room is an ok room, nothing special about it. They give a complimentary hot breakfast, dining room was a bit crowded. As many did point out the elevators during peak hours are slow, people said they walked up 20 floors rather than wait. My biggest disappointment was when I tried to book the hotel for a future stay, the website and the people I spoke with were not knowledgeable, I was transferred around between the same people multiple times. I ended with no satisfaction. The lack of customer service (spending almost 2 hours on calls or internet) makes it where I do not know if I will ever stay at a Hampton Inn or Hilton again, the experience was that bad.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights recently. The location was perfect for walking to theatre district, Times Square and many of the other attractions in Midtown. We were treated wonderfully from the minute we arrived. This is a newer hotel, to the rooms are in great shape- but the friendly and extremely helpful staff was the highlight.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September 2015. Check in was good, made to feel welcome. Complimentary bottled water on arrival. Staff friendly and helpful. Our room was really nice, quite modern with great views of the skyscrapers. Nice toiletries in the bathroom. Breakfast was OK, but items weren't replenished quickly enough which meant there wasn't enough to go around. Overall, a good hotel for the location. Would consider staying again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is excellent and the hotel is quiet. It is located at Times Square but around the corner and quiets. The staff was friendly, beds comfortable and plenty of hot water. The morning breakfast changed each morning we were there ( stayed three nights).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yes the lifts can be a pain but what a great hotel...stayed here for a family vacation to NYC and couldn't fault it...just a few minutes from the craziness of Times Sq it's perfectly situated for access to all NYC's attractions. Of particular note were the staff who went over and above to make the trip special...before arriving I'd explained that the 2 eldest were celebrating their 18th birthdays and on check-in they were called out as VIP's and were given cards, balloons & candies by the staff...Bravo & thank you!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time to attend the US Open, stayed right in Times Square and from our first step into NYC til our last it was fabulous. The staff greeted us, answered all our questions, stored our bags until check in, and just provided assistance to make our stay comfortable. The hot breakfast in the morning was great, and if we could not stop to eat there were prepared take away bags for those on the go. The subway #7 that takes you straight to the US Open and Mets stadium was 1/2 block away. Finally the hotel staff answered all our questions and helped us set up wifi. When we were to depart NYC we were able to store our luggage during the day until our departure time. So helpful. Thank you Vince and the rest of the staff at the Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights from Aug 23 to 25th. We were looking for something that was not too expensive but nice at the same time. NYC Hotel prices can be astronomical. We got a good deal with the AAA rate. Others have complained that the rooms are small but I saw no difference between this and the Hilton I stayed at in Florida. It was clean, modern and everything was up to date. The business center had 3 computers that came in Handy for some documents I needed. The hot complimentary breakfast is a huge plus, it is served right up till 11 am so one can get a decent's morning's sleep and still catch the breakfast which has all sort of variety probably coming close to an IHOP style meal, it is also close to everything including Time square. My only negatives are no fridge in the rooms and there was construction going on right outside my window. I Couldn't believe it when I looked outside, this interrupted our sleep both mornings and put a damper on things. But I will stay there again next time.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel excellent location We enjoyed the trip and beautiful place but lacks the appropriate parking, take a long time to return the car the Internet is fast , but there are options to choosewhen you connect, they will charge you if you did not choose free Excellent eating in free breakfast, but you must go early to find a table, especially in the week end

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location with great service. Staff was top notch, very friendly and free breakfast was plentiful. All and all a great hotel. FYI if this your first visit to NYC understand the rooms are about half the size of other hotels and very few have swimming pools.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Booked this hotel because of its location and I was very happy with my choice! Brand new hotel (which I am sure helped) so everything was very clean and in great condition. Free WiFi and breakfast was included in our rate which was excellent for a complimentary hotel breakfast. Our first day they had omelettes, potatoes, sausage (in addition to the waffles, cereal, fruits, pastries they have everyday); second day was eggs, potatoes and sausage links; and the third day was French toast sticks and bacon and potatoes. For our family of three, this had to save us $35+ each morning by having this included in rate.I also want to mention they have installed bars in the shower for women to shave their legs - very helpful and I have never seen this in a hotel before.Rooms are small, but have everything you need except a refrigerator to keep a beverage cold. But this is a small inconvenience compared to all you receive.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location...steps from Port Authority, where NYCAirporter bus stops. Also steps from Times Square, plays, etc. This hotel was just two months old when we stayed. It was very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and there was a delicious breakfast every morning. There was coffee in the room plus coffee and tea in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this property based on cheapest rate in mid town manhattan. I am a hilton diamond member with about 120 nights a year in Hilton properties. First,Takes FOREVER to get up and down to your room during peak times. Not enough room to sit down and eat in the mornings at breakfast. I left headphones in my room and called 3 hours after checking out but they were not found. Took 3 phone calls and 3 promises to call me back to find that out. After booking for 3 nights discovered they billed me for 4 nights. Took 4 more calls and promises to call me back to get that corrected. Despite what the recorded message says while on hold- your call is NOT important.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We checked into the Hampton on 8/23/2015. I do business often in the city and this time my wife and two daughters came along. When checking in the attendant was very friendly and made sure to come around the counter to shake my daughters hands as well as my wife and I. He gave us some suggestions on things to do and showed us to our room. The room was of adequate size for NYC, it was clean and well kept. The breakfast which was included was ample and again the staff was friendly and came around to check on each table. Later in the day while I was working my wife and kids received directions to the American Girl Doll store and the bellman checked the bags and took the time to learn the names of my daughters and more impressively their dolls. By the time they returned from a full day of shopping I was waiting for them in the Bellhop area and as they arrived back to the hotel the Bellman greeted each by name including the dolls. They loaded our bags in the car gave us directions but before we could leave the bellman had to say goodby to my daughters and their dolls. I can't reccomend this place enough! I wish all Hampton's would send their staff here for training!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have always had good luck staying at Hampton Hotels. However, this one was amazing. It was a great value and literally in the middle of Times Square. The hotel was very clean, great location, the hotel staff was very nice, overall great experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: hotel very clean, (very important) staff very friendly, location fantastic (one minute walk to Time Square, five minutes to Bryant Park), hotel within walking distance (for good walkers) to Central Park, Greenwich Village, Highline....), valet parking efficient even though it is a bit costly (53$/day), breakfast buffet is a nice way to start the day even though the cafeteria area is a bit small and crowded.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I travel on business with an office in the area, and like to stay in hilton properties. This was my first stay at this property.Problem 1: After arriving at 1am on the first night, i went immediately to sleep. When I arrived home from work the next afternoon, I found the room not made up at all.Problem 2: After continuing to review the unmade room, I noticed a large stain on the sheets (photo attached)Problem 3: After calling to the front desk to have this correctly, nothing was done for 45 minutes. It took a total of 90 minutes and 3 calls/I trip down to the lobby to get this corrected.Problem 4: The manager, who was helpful and comped a night, promised reward points which were never postedProblem 5: I left a battery pack in the room. When I called the night of my checkout, the person at the front desk seemed disinterested in even looking for it. She said she would check lost and found and call me back. 3 days later and no phone call. I had to order another one as I need it for travel. The hotel should be paying for it.I won't be staying at this hotel again. For a recently renovated/built property, it is woefully underwhelming.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My stay at the Hampton Inn was very fantastic apart from the breakfast which was very crappie. The hotel is nicely located in Times Square and close to virtually everywhere. There was a McDonald right across the hotel my daughter loved that and Madame Tussaud right next to it as well. The hotel has nice facilities apart from no fridge in the room instead they have ice machines on every other floor with ice buckets in the room. They have very well mannered staff who are willing to the extra mile especially Vince and Tobo always willing to assist

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is good for a solo or couples trip to NYC. I traveled from New Orleans and it was only my 2nd time in NY and from the first visit, I knew that I would love to stay in the heart of Manhattan. The property is in a great area near ALL Times Square attractions.The rooms are a nice size but the hallways are cozy. When I arrived at the hotel, the front desk agent, Kareem was very welcoming and down-to-earth. He really made me feel comfortable about staying at the hotel by myself. He quickly checked me in and gave me a high floor room with a city-view that I loved. The only bad thing is that the elevators took long. Breakfast was a complete serving of hot and cold food items. It was pretty filling and the breakfast attendants were on point! On my last night, I arrived pretty late(4am) to the hotel and the doorman there kept an eye on me as I stood outside for a smoke before going to my room. He was pleasant and I was very satisfied with his kind help. I hope to stay at this hotel again because the location is the best and the staff was great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for two nights while up to see Aladdin. Theatre was just a block away. Convenient location for all attractions near Times Square. Very nice hotel with a helpful staff. Room were a good size for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I considered this hotel because of the price and availability to use my Hilton Honors points. Definitely expected better. Looks like my complaint is similar to many others. I am a Hilton Honors member and received complimentary water and snacks for the first night but when I had asked for complimentary water and snacks for the second night of our stay, I was literally scolded for asking for such. I did however receive a bottle of water after voicing my complaint. Stayed on the 22nd floor. Street noise can still be heard and is annoying at all hours of the night. The air conditioner rattled throughout the night. No sense in complaining about anything because management is far to busy to take care of you. I used points and cash for this stay and still feel as though I was ripped off for the experiences. A very low budget hotel. Again, I agree with other guests, cold water would be more appreciated that the hot coffee that is offered free of charge all day long. The breakfast was sub-par and we opted to eat out because it was cold and not tasty. Elevators are slow and small. This is a very small hotel with tight quarters, small hallways, small elevators and a small lobby. No thrills with this NYC hotel. The only plus to this hotel is the location to Times Square, just a few minute walk to the hustle and bustle of the city. The old saying...you get what you pay for...applies to this stay. I expected better and was very disappointed with our stay. Definitely needs better management and customer service. I attempted several times to speak to someone and to get a room change after our first night, only to stand and wait in line as others complained about lost vehicles, unexplained charges and what not.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is ideally located to Times square and subway. Location was great! Vince our concierge was amazing, he made our stay enjoyable and his advice on city attractions and things to do was very helpful. My wife and kids really connected with him from day one.In all the service was great and I would go back to this hotel any time!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I typically gravitate towards a specific chain for perks and points. Though I first scour through a list of Tripadvisor offerings looking for a deal. I stumbled upon this property and boy, was I thankful I did. After reading the reviews, I decided to go for it... a 2 night stay for a business trip. The lobby has a hip, mid-century modern vibe...smallish but not crowded. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The room was new and clean, and a pretty decent size by NYC standards. It was located next to theaters, and a block away from Times Square, 2 movie theaters, restaurants, and Starbucks. The hotel seemed family friendly. But as such, the rooms were still nice and quiet.My only complaints: 3 elevators for a large hotel. It took a good 5+ minutes to get an elevator in the am. And the free wifi is slow. Neither of these are a deal breaker for me. All in all, this was a pleasant surprise and I would definitely recommend the Hampton Inn Time Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: No one went out of their way to make us feel welcome with the exception of Vince at the front desk. Vince, YOU ROCK!!! Thanks so much for making our visit a better one! Just a suggestion...while the complimentary coffee is a nice perk, when it's 100 degrees with 100% humidity, maybe some ice water would be a better choice? The breakfast was pretty much a free for all...grab anything that you could.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed in New York two nights in late July/early August, the first night was at an older hotel and the second night was at the brand new Hampton Inn. There is nothing like a brand new hotel in NY. We arrived late in the evening after a baseball game and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room, with two doubles, was clean, the bathroom / shower had finishes that made me feel at home, and it was light years from the other hotel I had stayed at the previous night. Breakfast was very busy, so we just grabbed a few quick things and started our morning. The lobby has a number of spaces to stop, computers for airline check in, etc., and a very neat giant touch video screen map on the wall. I can't wait to bring my family back and stay here over Labor Day, as it is literally steps from a Subway stop, less than a block from Times Square, and a lot quieter than being in the middle of all the craziness (it is on the street behind the McDonald's and Times Square Hilton main entrances, next to the Nederlander Theater). I'll definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.Rob Thomson

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel on a three-day visit to NYC. The location was very convenient to Times Square, and overall the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and comfortable, although a little bit small. There was coffee available 24 hours in the lobby. My biggest concern was that the breakfast buffet room was hectic, and they were out of both milk and juice on our first day. Still, it was a great place to stay, and I would go back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First off, I usually stay at the Hilton Garden Inn and had the opportunity to do so when traveling on business but I decided to give the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central a try. Here are my observations / experience:The check in: Although I E-Checked in, my room was not ready. With arrival around 2:30 PM and 3:00 PM check in, I was offered another room on the 10th floor of which I reluctantly accepted due to the fact that I have "lower floor" listed in my Hilton Honors profileThe Room: I was given the key to was an OCCUPIED room. Upon entering, I saw assorted valuables and jewelry strewn about but no occupant. Had I not been a honest man where I hold integrity and transparency as my watchwords, I would’ve helped myself to all sorts of “goodies” and Hampton Inn would’ve been to blame. Even worse, imagine if the occupant had been a woman or would’ve walked into an embarrassing situation, how does one explain something like this? I returned to the front desk and instead of immediately trying to resolve the issue, the counter representative just tried to justify with her co-worker that the computer reflected the room was “ready.” So I was given a room on the 16th floor..which was even higher. Once I settled into the room, about 30 minutes passed when I received an apologetically-explanatory call. It was then I was offered “another” room on the lower floor. What? You mean there was actually “another” room I could’ve received on a LOWER floor and it had to take an incident to make this happen so you can offer it to me? I was too tired, frustrated, and flustered over the whole thing to repack and move and decided to stick it out in the 16th floor. Although as apologetic she was and wanted to make me “comfortable” the damage had been done. Additional stress: In my attempt to calm down over the whole affair, I decided to pull out a beverage I was saving so as to relax in my room. So out to the ice machine I went. The closest one was on the 17th floor, and wouldn’t you know it? It was broken. I had to get ice from the 22nd floor thanks to the housekeeper who gave me good guidance on where to find ice. And speaking of housekeeping- the next day as i returned from my official duties, when I entered the room, i saw that although the bed was made, my towels nor coffee packs were not replaced. After much embarrassment and inconvenience where ALL of these incidents could’ve been handled in a much better way worthy of the Hilton Modus Operandi, I won’t be doing the Hampton Inn anywhere I go. And being that the nature of these incidents could’ve taken a turn for the worse, I believe that not only apologies would be in order but some restitution would be in order. Honors Member#242131264

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is new I believe. The only complaint that I have is that the shower makes a weird noise when it is cut in, like the water is having trouble to come out. We stayed in room 2008. Right off of the elevator. The breakfast was ok, but the location was awesome!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Booked this hotel after extensive researching as New York hotels always incredibly expensive during August! This Hampton inn was offering excellent rates and I have stayed in various Hampton inn's in the USA on various occasions and have always been satisfied.I was really pleased with everything about the hotel, it was brand new, I think only been open a few weeks and was perfect, the rooms were very good size (for Manhattan) and being brand new were very clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. Free wifi was also included!The breakfast which was included in the rate was quite extensive with all of the hot and cold variations you would expect, and was an excellent start to the day, there was also free coffee available in the lobby 24/7 which I found very useful.All of the staff I encountered were very helpful and friendly, from front desk to bellman.The location is perfect, literally a few steps from the centre of Times Square!Would definitely stay here again next time I visit New York and would highly recommend to colleagues and friendship!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. First visit to NYC and this hotel seemed perfect. It is a short walk to the chaos of Times Square, however the hotel is located on a quiet (NY standards) street. As soon as we drove up we were met by a Bellman (believe Louis) who made arrangements to valet the car ($55 a night) and walked us to the front desk. The front desk staff was friendly. Later asked Louis for subway directions and he ran inside and printed off just what we needed...great service. The hotel is new or at least everything seems new. Room seemed to be a good size and clean. Breakfast was great. WiFi worked. At certain times you will have to wait for an elevator and the breakfast room does get busy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Everything was awesome. Rachelle at the front desk was particularly helpful & kind. The location & breakfast were great too. Very clean. Even the WiFi was smooth & fast. I'm hoping to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel for a quick overnight in NYC to see Broadway shows. We arrived at 1:30 and the front desk was very accommodating and stored our bags, so that we could begin our adventure. We returned at 4:30, got our bags and quickly were given our room on the 28th floor. The room was spotless, and perfect! After a late show, we returned, slept very well and had breakfast and checked out. We had no problems with elevators, but we weren't traveling at peak times. In fact, we noticed how fast the elevators were moving. The breakfast was fine for Hampton Inn standards. We do want to recognize Vince at the front desk. He was great as we checked out in the morning. He helped us get a cab to Penn Station and was very friendly. Thank you for a great stay!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This new hotel sits in a perfect spot for those wanting to spend a lot of time at Times Square or see some Broadway shows. The hotel is next door to the theatre where Amazing Grace is playing. My only complaint is that the elevators are a bit slow but it is a very busy hotel. This hotel is incredibly modern for the Hampton Inn brand. I was very comfortable during my entire trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is absolutely beautiful inside! Super modern and clean. We had everything that we needed in our room- plus free breakfast! They had a lot of options in the morning for breakfast plus a coffee bar throughout the day. The staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and super friendly. Of course it is in a prime location for a touristic visit to NYC being right near Broadway and Times Square. The Subway was also super close. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone who wants a super enjoyable stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've only been to NYC once before so when it came time to choose a hotel for our family vacation I was a little nervous. I had stayed at a great Hilton in Herald Square, but couldn't find a deal for this one. Then a new Hampton Inn opened right in Times Square at a great price so we took a chance. It was a great decision!The hotel offers free, reliable wifi (we were on 30th floor and had no issues). It also offers a free cooked breakfast with eggs, waffles, bagels, fruit and yogurt etc. There's also dry cereal. My oldest child has a peanut allergy and so he stuck to the yogurt until we discovered Lucy.We were very impressed with Lucy in the breakfast area. She went out of her way to be kind to us, making my son waffles in the kitchen that were peanut free each morning. We made sure to sent her and the manager a note about her exemplary customer service.The rooms are clean and nice. The beds were fine. Let's not forget space is always at a premium in NYC. We did fine for a family of 4 there. The area is perfect. A block to Hard Rock and Carlos Bakery, across the street from Alladin and McDonald's this is the best possible location with no street noise.Yip: choose a high floor with city view. We were on 30 of 31 floors and never had trouble getting out with luggage.We highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: An almost new hotel, which is always nice. Good size room for NYC. Excellent location - central to the city and close to Times Square. On a more low key street which was nice. Great staff with a nice breakfast service. The doormen were very friendly and helpful. Recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location! Very nice and safe! I'm use to staying at Hampton Inn & SUITES. Since this location didn't have the word "suites" I thought it wouldn't be as nice, but I was wrong! I would recommend this location to all my friends! Very good breakfast and excellent service just like my other experiences have been at Hampton Inn & Suites!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at the Hampton Inn at Times Square Central this past week for 1 night and had a great stay. The location for this hotel is excellent. Conveniently located on 41st between 7th and 8th, you are literally only 2 minutes away from times square. The Port Authority bus terminal was only a block away. You also had the 42 street subway station right next to the hotel (literally!) which gave direct service to Grand Central and you had the NQR and 123 subway lines right there which can bring you around New York City! Aside from the prime location, the hotel was very clean and modern seeing that it is fairly new. The windows must have been pretty good seeing that I could barley hear the street traffic (was on 15th floor). The breakfast was your typical continental breakfast but it was not too busy which was great. The only issue I had was one of the agents at the front desk had a little attitude at check in. I would definitely stay here again for the price I paid.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Still has it's brand new feel. Very clean and for a hotel in the heart of Times Square the room was a good size. The staff is exceptional. Vince greeted us at check in and made every effort to ensure that he got to know my family members, what we were interested in seeing and overall making sure our stay would be one of a kind. He really started the trip off on the right foot! A free breakfast and free WIFI were included in our stay. The breakfast was good with a varied selection. My only complaint was the elevators ... They were extremely slow and we had to let 4 elevators go by and then had to hop on one going up to secure a spot. Otherwise, a great stay and would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have recently stayed at Hampton Inn Time Square central. Our family vacation was wonderful, especially for the fact we stayed at this Hotel. Great location, wonderfully kept. Starting with the Service desk, the people who serve you were very helpful, and kind. Everyday , breakfast was free, good, and wide variety. The people who prepared breakfast were great. A big thank you to Ebony, who always had a smile, and was eager to help in anyway. Brittany also very helpful always smiling. The staff at this hotel was picked very well, because I have nothing but nice things to think about. The rooms were spacious enough, considering you were right in time square. Sleeping was comfortable. The rooms wereclean. Free coffee, tea, hot chocolate 24 hours. One day front desk baked cookies for visitors, another day we had a goodie bag made up of water,apple,muffin, and energy bar on the go. I would highly recommend this hotel. To upper management, your staff need to be thanked for there complete loyalty to there job with Hampton Inn Central. Cant wait to go back again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great brand new hotel in the perfect location - walking distance to everything! We were in NY for a Broadway play And really loved being able to walk be two bo kd to he theater. Room was spacious and clean, lobby was pleasant and breakfast is served every morning until 10. Full breakfast with waffles, on letters, cd and hot cereal, sausage and fruit - something for everyone. Hotel is also right in the heart of Times Square and walking distance to Bryant Park and high end stores in Fifth. Great staff - all friendly and helpful from front desk attendants to the valet. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is nicer than most and is incredibly convenient to Times Square and Theater and Mid-town Business district. Out of the main congestion but close for access. Very large breakfast room for dining. Staff was very service oriented and went above and beyond to take care of us. Rooms were quiet despite the

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location. Like everyone said this weekend, elevators were a major issue. However we had no problem at all when we checked in on Thursday, I think it became an issue as more guests arrived. Engineering told us today the elevator company has been called to service it. Also the washer and dryer were not working, this is something I was counting on using but staff gave me an excellent option a few blocks away, at 525 Ninth Ave. Front desk said engineering need to fix the problem, a bit strange given the hotel has only been open a couple of weeks. All hotel staff that I interacted with were super. Once the elevator and washer/dryer are fixed I'm sure they will get a five star rating.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved the free wifi, the location to times square, the comfy beds and the nice hotel clerk Vince who helped us check in. I HATED the long waits for elevator!! Upon checkout we had to descend 9 flights of stairs because each time the elevator finally stopped they were full and there were already others waiting before us to get on the elevator. Hotel was very clean, rooms were smaller than last one I stayed at, but nothing bad there and the free breakfast was acceptable. I asked for a higher floor when I made reservations and was told that they would give me one the next day but I never got that call, again, no big deal because we didn't spend that much time in rooms anyway other than to sleep but the effort would have been nice or at least a call to say why they couldn't accommodate me. All in all stay was ok but elevator system should have been planned out better.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: New hotel on south end of theater district. Small but comfortably laid out room. Helpful staff. Valet parking slow, but very reasonable for area. Nice free breakfast. Very convenient to Times Square, Bryant Park, Theaters, and area resturants.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Being a brand new hotel with free Wi-Fi and breakfast included and smacked right on Times Square surrounded by subway stations, it is definitely a great value for the money we spent per NYC standard. We have done a lot of research on hotels in NYC prior to booking and most hotels actually charge breakfast and in room Wi-Fi which I thought was absurd. My husband and I drove from NC and after being lost in Brooklyn at 11 PM at night, we finally checked in at close to midnight. I did not experience the “check-in chaos” that other guest experienced but then with just us in the lobby, it took quite a while for the front desk staff to get us situated. Our room was on the 4th floor with an old ugly office building view, which was fine and the room was really small. However, the room was very modern, clean and my husband actually liked it a lot. It did not have a mini bar/refrigerator. Luckily we brought a cooler with us. The bathroom was very tiny but it was really nice. Now, here comes the interesting part – parking! We opted for self-parking because my husband didn’t feel comfortable for someone else to drive his brand new pick up. The front desk staff provided us the address of the ICON Parking Garage which according to her, it is a 15 minute walk which was not an issue. Also, the parking garage had an agreement with the hotel so has better rate. We put the address in the GPS and drove to the location.. guess what, no parking garage! It was just a door in the building, a regular door for people. However, there was a parking garage 15 feet away but it did not have an “agreement” with the hotel. It was $16/night more expensive. We drove and drove to try to search and still could not find. The other parking garage attendant advised us the address given to us “is not a parking garage” My husband and I were confused and we called the hotel and they insisted the address is right and the hotel staff (a different person) advised us that “he is new and not sure what is what” and suggested that we may want to park closer to the hotel and offered a different parking garage. Then he added that the garage may not be able to accommodate a pick up. That kind of upset us and we decided to park at this garage 15 feet away from the “non-existent garage” We walked for 20 minutes at 1 AM back to our hotel. Mind you, this was our first NYC trip so we’re trying to navigate without getting lost. With no manager to speak to at that hour, I decided to email the management and their corporate office about our experience at 2:30 AM and yes I was pretty upset. I expressed my two cents about the importance of verifying the validity of any piece of information/instruction/direction prior to sharing with your client and guest. The next day while we were out, their management tried to get hold of us to discuss about what happened and hats off to her for trying to make it up to us with every option available to her. Now back to reviewing the rest of the hotel: We woke up to construction noise outside our window but it is no biggie and when it’s time to head downstairs for breakfast, we were glad we stayed on the 4th floor. Like everyone said, the elevators, three of them, took forever and they were tiny. We took the stairs. The breakfast lounge is always full in the morning if you decide to eat after 8:30 AM. The room and seating was just not enough to accommodate the guest of the hotel at full capacity. Long lines to fill your plate and two waffle makers were not really enough. Pretty good variety of food available and I must say it is great for FREE breakfast! You can have the option to grab a to-go box and fill it up to eat in your room. Not every floor has an ice machine. You will need to check your info binder for the location of the ice machine. There were three Mac computers and a printer in the lobby and I thought it was convenient for guests to be able to print tickets that were bought online for shows, entrance fees and cruises. The cellphone signal is pretty spotty in the building. We have AT&T and 90% of the time we had “No Service” and thank goodness for their fast Wi-Fi. Finally, I would recommend this hotel for its value and for its effort in making sure the guest is satisfied. We had a good stay with them and would come back despite the parking blunder.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've been traveling back and forth to NYC for work pretty often lately. This hotel takes the cake. It's a pretty typical Hampton Inn, which is why I love it so much. A few things that are keeping this from getting five stars: the staff is slow. They don't have enough desk agents to handle the volume of check ins during peak times. Also--the elevators are so slow that I took the stairs most of the time. The breakfast room is very busy and there aren't enough seats for the volume of guests they have.But--like every other Hampton Inn, the rooms are super clean, comfortable and spacious. The Wi-Fi is free and fast and the breakfast is tasty. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and I'd definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn is quite new and it's prices are somewhat reasonable considering the area. If you are coming in for business, expect this place to be filled with tourists. You'll run into kids, people going to shows everywhere. There are only three elevators and over 30 floors. You can find yourself waiting a long time for one at peak times (especially in the morning). The breakfast was included but it wasn't great, but that's to be expected as well. You'll find the breakfast area is total chaos with people everywhere. Your best bet is to grab one of the grab and go bags on the lobby counter and make a run for it. The location is awesome if you plan on seeing shows or hanging out doing touristy stuff in Times Square. There is not much of a view though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful experience at this new hotel. The rooms were large for NYC and comfortable for 2 adults and 1 teen. Breakfast was the pretty standard Hampton Inn fare, but there was good space in the area and made it feel less crowded. Lots of room in the lobby, there were several groups of 4-6 and no one was on top of one another. The best experience by far were the staff. The entire front desk crew was delightful, and super friendly. When the concierge got suddenly slammed, they came out to assist - making sure no one was waiting unnecessarily. The breakfast staff was friendly as well as efficient. Everyone we encountered seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had a positive experience. We will certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good clean hotel, very new. Very convenient location to access Broadway and Time Square. But, and this is a HUGE BUT don't expect to get anything done quickly! Elevators take five minutes to come. Getting the car back from the valet? Almost an hour. Getting someone to answer the front desk telephone when you call? I had to dial the outside sales line, and that person had to leave her desk in the basement to go upstairs to the front desk, just to get someone on the phone!If the management decides to work out the kinks, this could be a great place to stay! If not, I'd avoid it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hanpton Inn exceeded my expectations with their great friendly staff, great location and very clean rooms. Elevators were a bit slow and breakfast was crowded but plenty of food and the staff friendliness made up for any delays. Met manager in lobby when I arrived and he welcomed me and I saw him again when I check out. Will definitely stay again in the future…

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at Hampton Inn on 41st Street at Times Square. This has been one of the absolute best hotel experiences I have had. The customer service is top notch. People at the front desk were professional, friendly, and superior at their job. Ebony from the breakfast room was as well. They all acted like they enjoyed their jobs and wanted to make the guest experience phenomenal which they did. The room was clean and the breakfast was good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros: the hotel is all new! Opened 3 weeks ago. The location is good also, close to Times Square. The breakfast is ok and there is free wifi. Cons: extremely small room with extremely small bathroom. The bath room has a bathtub, but it is all so small!!!My bed had an iron part that was supposwd to hold the mattress that hurted my leg very bed. Also I called the hotel brfore my checkin and asked if they charge for receiving some shop bought on Amazon website. They told me that no charge would be applied. So I bought and sent ir to the hotel 3 or 4 days before I checked in. When Inarrived at the hotel , the hotel wanted to charge me 10 dolars per package per day. A lot of stress went on because of this.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for one night last week, and were very pleased. Great location, clean room and bathroom. Beds were very comfortable. Having a complimentary breakfast was an added bonus, and offered a wide variety of items.If I could make one suggestion, I would request having more than one person at the front desk during the morning check-out process. The woman that was there was answering the phone, checking guests out, and retrieving luggage from the storage room. Maybe they were short-handed that day, but it seemed like a lot for one person to handle.Other than that, very happy with our visit, and would definitely recommend this hotel and we will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a nice brand new hotel with nice rooms, comfortable beds and helpful staff. The location is very convenient for theatres. However, I have three negatives to highlight, maybe too many for a new hotel like this: the breakfast rooms is too small for the number of guests and this can make it difficult to find a place and move around; the three elevators are painfully slow (they stop even when they are full); on the last night of my staying, a Friday night, the noise from the street (limited until then) turned out to be too much even on the 19th floor....Maybe one of these three issues can be fixed but the other two are likely to stay (the breakfast room won't grow up, the noise won't diminish). They should have been taken care before opening... Only recommendation if you think of going, ask for a high floor!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: That hotel has a great location near the theatres, few blocks away from Times Square, very good breakfast. It was totally refurbished recently. There is no refrigerator and micro wave oven in the rooms. The frontdesk team is very friendly, specially Vince, Rachelle and Carmen.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice staff, new property - very helpful staff. Wonderful stay. very quiet, minutes off of Times Square and Broadway and Subway.. Breakfast is plus.Valet parking worked great, very close to Lincoln tunnel as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As a tourist I was overwhelmed by the choices I had in NYC. We decided on this hotel, and I couldn't be more pleased. What stood out the most was the staff. I was overwhelmed by this city, but this staff made me feel as though I was in the rural Midwest. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was good, and location was perfect for being a tourist, meaning access tours, broadway, and the lights of times square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was nice and clean and the complimentary breakfast was a definite plus. On my arrival I asked for feathers to be removed from my room because of allergies and it was done promptly. We encountered a problem with our bathroom, the bath tub was blocked, the water was not running out. Four of us needed to take showers before our 8 p.m show. Maintenance came quickly but we were still late for the show, disappointing. Both the housekeeper and maintenance guys, Paul and Mike were quite courteous and helpful. Upon check out I reported the problem in the bathroom to Letitia and Vince who were very apologetic. Vince gave me some bottled waters for my journey and asked Thobore (bell man) to call me a cab. Thobore helped to put my luggage in the cab. I was also awarded HH points for the inconvenience. I was very grateful for the special treatment from all the staff members I encountered.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I "accidentally" chose this hotel because it was a Hampton Inn, and I choose them as often as possible. I didn't know it was brand new and I didn't know it was so conveniently located (they all say they are, but...). Being brand new (they still didn't even have all of the rooms finished), everything was pristine and the rooms are nice size (for Manhattan). There were plenty of places to plug stuff in - yay! Most Hampton Inns have refrigerators and microwaves, though I have not seen them in Manhattan Hampton Inns on previous stays. This one did not have either. I even asked if they could bring one in (most hotels have them upon request and subject to availability), and I was told they didn't have any. On my third day (of 4), I was told they do have them. Grrrr. Anyway, please request that they put them in the rooms, because if enough people request that, it may happen. People were always waiting, sometimes for 5 minutes or more, for one of the 3 elevators (for 300 rooms) but the good news is that on each floor, you could see what floor each of them were at, so it made the waiting not so bad. At least they were moving, etc. Breakfast was very good. The breakfast room is large, but it was crowded when I went most days and it was hard to find a place to sit. There is a community table/bar, and people were friendly, so that was a good option. The staff, especially front desk staff, were all very helpful and each had a great attitude.
