Overall, my whole stay was an excellent experience! As with most Manhattan hotels, it's not cheap! But go before everyone else discovers it and it gets hard to get into!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We visited NYC for the first time in July 2015. Since this was our first trip there, I wanted it to be special. I had originally planned to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn, since I am a Hilton member, but they did not have the accommodations that I was looking for. So, the reservationist referred us to this Hampton, assuring us that it was in the "middle" of Times Square. It's actually on 41st Street, which is one block over....on a pretty dark ally. Upon arriving, we were generously welcomed by the manager. I asked for a room with a city view, and it was a decent view...not the view of Times Square that I had hoped for. The room was EXCEPTIONALLY clean! I honestly don't think I could have found a cleaner room in NYC. The bed was very comfortable, with your choice of pillows. The air conditioner was perfect, and the bathroom was as well. They are not too generous with towels, but I guess that's to be expected. On our first morning there, we slept in. We left our hotel room at 9:30 to get breakfast in the breakfast room. Breakfast ends at 10, so 30 minutes should be plenty, right??? Well, the elevator took at least 10 minutes. When we arrived at breakfast, there was a LONG line. Everyone must sleep in and then want breakfast around 9:30. We stood in the line, which moved very slowly due to the waffle maker. I noticed several people ahead of me looking into the warmers and closing them. They ran out of food!!!! When I asked the worker, she said breakfast is over at 10:00. I explained that I had been waiting in line for the last 20 minutes and was there before 10:00. Her reply was, "Oh no, I haven't seen a line." Are you kidding me? So.....to my disappointment, I had to eat a waffle for breakfast. I am not fond of hotel waffle machines. First, I don't like sweets for breakfast, and second, those waffles taste like cardboard. Fast forward to morning number two..... SAME THING, except I was there earlier....long line and no food. I even had a worker come over to me and say, "I noticed that you're upset. You tend to sleep late, and we will save you a plate if you need us to." While that was a kind gesture, I explained that it appeared their clientele preferred to eat breakfast around 9:30 and maybe they should extend their breakfast time. We were two of around 75 people that got to breakfast at that time. Needless to say, for the next few mornings, we walked across the street to McDonalds. If you plan to stay here, please don't count on the breakfast. They use that as a selling point to "save" you money. Unless you are a very early riser, which most people are not when they stay out late in NYC, then don't count on the breakfast. Please be advised that there is also no concierge to assist you...or at least one that I could find. In asking about Broadway theaters, two different representatives had no idea of the location of Gershwin Theater. When it's your first time in NYC, you need a little assistance.When we checked out, I asked for a copy of our bill. The gentleman at the desk said they email receipts, so I would receive it in the next 24 hours. I did receive it 2 days later, and there was a charge on my account for $53 for valet parking. I didn't even have a car with me. So obviously, they are not careful about room charges. I called one evening to get this charge reversed; I was put on hold 4 times as no manager was there to assist me. Finally, they took my number and said a manager would call me the next morning. I waited until after noon and called back to the hotel. The assistant manager then listened and went to "investigate" the charge. She called back and reversed the charge. At no time...check out or on the phone with the manager, did anyone inquire about my satisfaction in my stay. I honestly feel that I should be credited for the breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Times square is located in the central area in Times Square.Newly opened and very nice and clean. Great beds.  Spent a week there and the only thing I got upset with was the very very very annoying elevetors that took forever. The breakfast was very nice, and the staff working at the breakfast where very kind and helpful,Waffles and bagels, fresh fruit and yogurt, so it was great. Could be good to have some non - dairy products too for the people that are allergic to milk or cant digiest lactose. But super plus for the breakfast staff.Rooms are nice and clean. Plus for the big bathrooms and the very big shower. Great with free wifi, great with helpful staff. if you get a room in the lower deck the noise from the street will be annoying. Up at floor 20, it was better.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location, close to time square! Employees so helpful . Best staff and bellmen! I Will stay here every time I visit New York! New hotel and totally spotless. Free breakfast was great! I just loved this place!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a room with two double beds which was fine for three people, maybe a bit crowded for 4. But, as NYC rooms go, this was good sized. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were on the 5th floor out of 31 facing another building and close to elevators, but with AC on it was quiet.There were only 3 elevators and that made for some long waits! Ended up walking down 5 flights to check out.Only ding I could give this hotel was the breakfast. They ran out of everything fairly early on a Monday morning and the breakfast room looked like locusts had hit. I wish there 24/7 coffee stand offered real half & half rather than horrid non-dairy stuff.But those were the only faults worth mentioning.I would gladly stay here again and the location is very good for theatre goers or those who want to be close tp port authority bus station.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel open several weeks ago and is either poorly designed or not functioning properly. Very long wait at the elevators - more than five minutes. The free breakfast had a line out into the lobby and clearly not enough space to accommodate the size of the hotel. No grab and Go bags available. No water at check in for diamond members. Rooms are on the small side but otherwise functional. Probably my worst hotel experience in several years. On the bright side the hotel employees seem to be handling the stress well. I complained to one of them in the elevator and later got a call from the Front desk supervisor who apologized and offered appropriate compensation for my dissatisfaction.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel had been open for only 2 weeks. Everything was very fresh and clean. I have stayed in hotels in NYC before where the rooms have been extremely small. The rooms at The Hampton, while not large, were very comfortable and roomy. The only drawback was the complimentary breakfast area. At 8 am, it was extremely crowded and people hovered over tables waiting for a vacancy. This does not make for an enjoyable breakfast experience. However this would not deter me from staying again. Loved the location and the friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Having travelled to New York for business and leisure on numerous occasions. This is far and away the best hotel I have stayed at and is amazing value. The hotel itself is very comfortable and the rooms (Manhattan) are a very good size. This hotel offers a buffet style breakfast, it is good quality and varies day to day. The waffle makers are a great touch too. The only slight negative is that the breakfast room can be a little busy....although we never had an issue with getting seating. The location is perfect for the whole of Manhattan. It is right next to times square and is off a quiet street so is still quite peaceful. It's proximity to all the key subway lines was great and meant that you could easily get the metro across the whole city. All of the staff were amazing. They could not do enough to help and seemed quite proud to be working for such a new hotel. I have to explicitly mention a chap called Vince who was super helpful whilst we were there. When originally booking I was a bit nervous as the hotel was only 2 days old without many reviews. I am glad I did book it as it was fantastic and I'd whole heartedly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were in New York to see the Musical play of Amazing Grace which is next to the Nederlander Theater. The hotel was very convenient to stay at. The hotel is very clean, the staff friendly and informative. The breakfast crew were excellent in replenishing food as quickly as it ran out. Our room was very clean with soft pillows and very clean sheets. The bathroom was clean also.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A very convenient hotel for Broadway Theatres. very efficient valet parking. Sound insulation of room was excellent, and the complimentary breakfast had a good range of hot and cold dishes. Our room, though not large, was well furnished and clean and bed was excellent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was told that the hotel has only been open a few weeks but it was everything that I have come to expect from Hampton. Quick access to everything, the staff is super friendly and it seemed like there were staff members around every corner. It was crowded when I was there but it is Time Square so I guess that is to be expected. I checked-in before the rush so the business really didn't impact my experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were in NYC for a TWIN Event and the hotel was fantastic along with the staff. Great rate for all the twins and family who came in for the event. Very Nice hotel and we had a great stay. We will stay here again when we come back to NYC. Great location, friendly staff, nice rooms and lobby and all around a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is new so everything was clean. Room size was not bad at all. In the heart of the theatre district and only two blocks from Times Square. Breakfast was definitely an asset to get a busy day started. Only complaint was the wait time for the elevators. Seemed as though housekeeping was constantly occupying them, and also housekeeping entered our room without knocking. But other than these small issues an overall excellent hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would recommend Hampton Inn Times Square Central. The staff were great, hotel is in a great location, steps from Times Square. Great continental breakfast. Hotel is brand new, only two weeks old, therefore in great condition, clean, fresh. We were on a group rate for a special event, so the value was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really happy with our room. Very modern, clean.this hotel recently opened. Has a very comfortable lobby. Comfortable bed, great tv & incredible TV selection. Donna at front desk was great. Right in the heart of the theatre district. Awesome place for the money!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Outstanding service , room and breakfast and for the the Hotel to in in Manhattan it was great to see that Hampton IN had valet service very important or that can be a real inconvenience. The only issue was the pillows the room should always have firm pillows for some reason they never do.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Took my family to NYC July of 2015 for the weekend and stayed at the Hampton Inn. This Hotel just opened but I give it a rating of 10 out of 10. The staff members (ALL) were the greatest! Great location just off Time Square! I will be back definetly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Breakfast is extensive - eggs, omelets, cereal, muffins, bagels, waffles, fruit, bacon, sausages, yogurt. Ebony helped get breakfast for me, as I have a broken foot, and was very cheerful and showed exceptional hospitality. Hats off!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Hampton Inn, Times Sq. central. Only opened one week ago, the staff was really helpful and everything was in good shape. The breakfast was great and they allowed me to take the food up to my room and supplied the necessary plastic. The only negative was there was no TV guide in the room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I'm a devoted fan of Hampton Inns and I was delighted to discover that this venue was opening just in time for my trip to NYC!I'm pretty sure I was the first person to occupy #1909, and I, too, had trepidations about being the guinea-pig at a new property--but it was fantastic experience. As others have mentioned, the staff are truly outstanding! Every single Hampton Inn employee that we encountered went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. In particular, I am indebted to the kindness of Donna and Keroll.While the view from my 19th floor room on the backside of the hotel was nothing special...the room was very quiet and after an arduous day of traveling and walking all over Midtown, we slept peacefully. (The rooftop viewing area made up for the room, however.)The room was typically NYC compact, but the furnishings, décor, and wonderful bed were spot on. The breakfast was a notch or two above the Hampton Inn norm.I cannot say enough about how great the location is--and particularly when utilizing the McDonald's pass through to 42nd street. So convenient to the theatre district, but removed enough from the Times Square spectacle to be a peaceful respite.This will definitely be my first choice of hotel for future NYC trips!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel about a block off of Times square, which is about as close as one would want to stay to Times square. Hotel was impeccably clean, seemed to be either new or recently remodeled and well maintained. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was much better than average and overall it's location made it a breeze to go uptown/downtown/or take a boat cruise around the island. Keroll at the front desk did everything she could to make sure we enjoyed our short stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just steps away from Times Square and in the heart of the theatre district, this hotel is a gem. The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. Vince at the Front Desk is a SUPERSTAR! The King Room I booked is well-appointed, clean and modern. While on the small side, it is normal for NYC and it is well laid-out. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel opened the day before I arrived. I was prepared for issues but pleasantly surprised.The staff was excellent-they all very friendly and willing to help in any way. Our room was small but standard for Times Square. Comfortable bedding,very clean and everything was in order.I choose this hotel for it's location and amenities(free breakfast). This is an excellent choice as it's around the corner from madness of Times Square and very accessible to subway. I felt the value was well worth it. This was my best trip to NYC. If I return to Times Square area I will definitely stay here
